description: WASHINGTONWhat will the 1985 car modelsmade in Detroit to requirements set in Washingtonlook like?

title: Quake Strikes Philippines
description: MANILA, Oct. 9 (Reuters)A fairly strong earthquake hit the northern Philippines today. There were no immediate reports of damage. The Geophysical Observatory in Manila said the quake struck ?? 5:06 A.M. Its epicenter was in the Babuyan Islands group, about 325 miles north of here.

title: Age Is No Bar To the World Of Learning
description: TWO mornings a week, 62yearold Estelle Feggeler takes a bus from her home in Nutley to Rutgers University in Newark, where she attends a class in world politics.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: The Visions Of Esmaree

title: 35 SELECTED AS MEMBERS OF SPACE HALL OF FAME
description: ALAMAGORDO, Oct. 9 (AP)The first 35 members of the International Space Hall of Fame range from the astronauts who left earth to theoreticians who made the journeys possible.

title: PEOPLE
description: A former Red Bank High School football star is the new director of the Emergency Department at Bayshore Community Hospital in Holmdel. He is 37yearold Dr. Angelo T. Scottl, who was captain and quarterback of the Red Bank team before obtaining a psychology degree from Harvard and a doctorate from the University of Pennsylvania Medical School. Dr. Scotti, who lives in Colts Neck with his wife, Geraldine, and their three sons, interned at Philadelphia General Hospital, served his residency at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn., and worked with the United States Public Health Service's National Center for Disease Control in Atlanta. For five years, he had a private practice in Pittsfield, Mass. Bayshore Hospital's emergency facility handles about 25,000 patient visits a year.

title: Strimer Retires From Post
description: DELAWARE, Ohio Oct. 9 (AP)Dr. Robert Strimer, athletic director at Ohio Wesleyan University since 1955, will retire from that position July 1 after 36 years at the school. Strimer also has served the school as head basketball and golf coach and as an assistant in football.

title: Connecticut Transportation Unit Links Train Wreck to Speeding
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Oct. 9The crowded commuter train that crashed here on July 13, killing two passengers and injuring 97 others, was traveling at more than twice the legal speed, limit, according to a report on the accident made public this week by the Connecticut. Department of Transportation.

title: $80,000 Awarded in Sex Case
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 8. (UPI)A Cook County Circuit Court jury has awarded $80,000 in damages to a woman who accused a Des Plaines physician of injecting her with male hormones and then sexually assaulting her in an examination. The 11man, onewoman jury deliberated four hours yesterday before deciding to award the money to Lynn Nelson, 29 years old, of Matthews, N.C., aaginst Dr. James C: Middleton, 50. Mrs. Nelson charged that she had unknowingly been injected with male hormones and other drugs to increase her sexual desire.

title: Around the Nation
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 9 (UPI)Viking 2, more successful in moving a Martian rock the second time around, will scoop protected soil from under the rock Monday for another experiment in the search for life on the red planet.

title: Death trip, by Anthony Burgess
description: In modern literature dying seems the last frontier. I don't mean this as an Irish bull or a Sam Goldwynism; rather that as a subject matter for artistic treatment it's the only one left veiled and mysterious enough to solicit the over  informed modern imagination. The 19th century gave us Tolstoy's moving explorations of the deathstruck consciousness of Anna Karenina and Ivan Ilych and of a race horse who had more in common with lovely Anna than with pitiful Ivan. Lawrence followed Tolstoy in his portrayal of Gerald Crich's snow death at the end of Women in Love. More recently the poetsNabokov in Canto In of Pale Fire, Sylvia Plath in Lady Lazarus, and the late L. E. Sissman in Dying: an Introductionhave tried to examine this onetoacustomer experience only one of whose dimensions is believed by the religious to be physical. Who can measure their success? This conclusion appears unavoidable, however; no contemporary writer is really very good at eschatology. I can think of no readable living poet who carries sufficient theological weaponry to say with Donne, Death thou art dead! and mean it. Did Donne mean it? That is another question.

title: Teacher Who Underwent Sex Change Loses His Job for a Second Time
description: EMERYVILLE, Calif., Oct. 9 (UPI)A highschool physical education teacher who became a man in a sexchange operation has lost his job again after being reinstated.

title: Unmaking of a Reds' Fan
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 9The only baseball club on earth that has spent a century winning two and a half pennants lives here in William Penn's greenecountrie towne. For the first time in 26 years, for the second time in 61 and for the third time since man learned to walk on his hind legs, the Phillies have something to do in October besides shoot quail, pool and the breeze. One of several reasons why this team is a halfchampion of the National League is a Cincinnati fan turned square, a comely tower of gristle named Michael Schmidt, who hits more balls farther than anyone else in the game. His 38 home runs this season topped the majors for the third time in a row. His 107 runs batted in gave him third place behind Cincinnati's George Foster and Joe Morgan among the league's most productive batsmen. On defense he covers more ground and throws out more runners than any other third baseman in the league. Now, awaiting the first playoff game with the Reds, he reviewed the championship season.

title: HIGH COURT ACCUSED OF DOUBLE STANDARD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The Supreme Court was accused by a group of law school deans and professors today of adopting a double standard under which it makes the Federal courts available to causes and groups that it favors but denies access to those it disfavors, such as the poor.

title: Mr. Murphy Takes the Blame
description: The business community really has done next to nothing to persuade the publicand much less the professor and student or the lawmaker, the lawwriter, and the lawkeeperthat the marketplace rather than the government is almost always a better regulator. Judging from results, we certainly haven't communicated enough to the people who were urging and enacting government regulation. And we still aren't.

title: Memorial Services
description: GLEESONWilliam F. 16 October 1961. Low mass of requiem offered in Latin by a Father of the Society of Jesus.

title: New Jersey Tenants Get TruthinRenting Data
description: New Jersey's landlords are telling their tenants that they may withhold rents if vital facilities have not been repaired, that their possessions may not be kept for nonpayment of rent and that security deposits must yield annual interest.

title: British Decline to Comment
description: LONDON, Oct. 9 (Reuters)A British Foreign Office spokesman declined to comment today on the demands of Mr. Nkomo and Mr. Mugabe pending a close study of their statement.

title: Sarah C. Massengale, White House Aide, Plans Marriage to George D. Billock Jr.
description: Sarah Choate Massengale, an assistant director of the Domestic Council at the White House, and George Donald Billock Jr., an associate with the law firm of Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay of Pittsburgh and Washington, will be married next month in Noroton, Conn.

title: THE BREZHNEV BAND: STUDY IN PATRONAGE
description: The recent promotion of an old associate of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist Party leader, to a position in line to succeed Aleksei N. Kosygin as Prime Minister has focused attention on the role played by patronage in the Soviet political hierarchy.

title: The Joffrey Finds a Home
description: Rushing to the first rehearsal of the day, Robert Joffrey ignored the ladders and dozens of halfempty paint cans that gave the City Center 55th Street Theater premises the look of a building in transition. The obstacles cluttering the hallways were minor inconveniences to a man whose compang spent its first 20 years working in conditions that he describes as no better than squalid. As he neared the door of the practice room, Joffrey was grinning. After all this time, he exclaimed, we have a home.

title: Rhodesians Doubtful of Success
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Oct. 9A Rhodesian Government spokesman declared tonight that the conditions for the Geneva conference posed by Joshua Nkomo and Robert Mugabe did not appear to augur well for success.

title: McCarthy Tells Whom He Would Choose for Cabinet
description: MADISON, Wis., Oct. 9Eugene J. McCarthy, who has made unorthodox politics into a recognized art form, announced today the names of five men he would appoint to a reorganized Cabinet if his independent campaign for the Presidency should prove successful.

title: Lauda Hopes to Clinch Title Today
description: Clay Regazzoni, who already has been told that he will not be rehired by the Ferrari racing team next season, says that he will do everything in his power to help Niki Lauda, his teammate, win the world driving championship.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: WHEN gathering the past among the gravestones of Jersey City, one is bound to be confronted by a curious onlooker who challenges, What're you doin' there? and then, Why? My answers vary. Just looking. It's a hobby. Making some rubbings. Somebody I knew is buried here someplace. The onlooker usually accepts them, shakes his head with the credulous sympathy a sane person offers to one suspected of lunacy and goes on his way.

title: Good News in Falling Lire
description: ROME, Oct. 9 (UPI)  A small plane scattered hundreds of banknotes over Rome's Piazza Venezia today. Motorists raced out of their cars in a mass scramble for the banknotes. The police said they had no idea why the banknotes, ranging in value up to $12, were dropped.

title: POINTS OF VIEW
description: For too long this country has trodden the primrose path and borrowed money from abroad to maintain standards of living, instead of grappling with the fundamental problems of British industry. Governments of both parties have failed to ignite the fires of industrial growth in the ways that Germany, France and Japan, with their different political and economic policies have done.

title: JURY SELECTION COMPLETE IN GOLD MURDER TRIAL
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Oct. 9 (AP)The final jurors were selected yesterday for the second murder trial of Murray Gold, which is scheduled to begin Tuesday at 10 A.M. in Superior Court here.

title: Monmouth Racing
description: OCEANPORT, N.J.

title: Design
description: Ben Thompson never does just one thing at a time. Prolific architect, planner, tastemaker (he founded Design Research) and restaurateur, he has brought all his talents to bear on both the design and the development of Boston's revived Quincy Market, which opened August 26, the building's 150th birthday. This first act in the extravaganza known collectively as Faneuil Hall Marketplace will be followed in 197778 when the two flanking historic landmarks, North and South Markets, will also come alive again, as aggregations of quality specialty shops, galleries, offices. The spotlight will always be on center stage, however, on the massive Greek Revival temple now rededicated to the good life of food and the senses. Thompson seems to have succeeded so far in making a way of life happen.

title: A Few Nosegays Among the Fall Season's Weeds
description: Maybe the box is only big enough to contain one personality at a time. Or maybe this generalization, like most others about television, is merely desperate. Michael Arlen, in his fine new book of essays The View from Highway 1, says that for the time being, the bulk of American television production lacks sufficient substance (even as melodrama!) to warrant a sustained discussion on its own merits. . . , It is not a question, then, of a critic dutifully seeking out the scarce wildflowers in a meadow; it is a matter of his wandering about in a garden which the gardener himself has painstakingly planted with weeds.

title: Oops!
description: Just as in their first debate on domestic policy, Gerald Ford and Jimmy Carter had the same general strategic intent in their debate on foreign policy last week: Each was trying to denigrate the leadership capacities of the other. But the result was opposite from the first time. It was Mr. Carter, and not the Presidentdespite his presumed advantage in the subject matter whose tactics, style and selfpossession predominated.

title: In Morristown, Play's the Thing
description: MORRISTOWN COLE PORTER. Mary Chase. George Abbott, Richard Adler and Jerry Ross. Stacia Zabusky, Susan Morrison and Gary Glickman.

title: Grand Prix Qualifying Rained Out
description: WATKINS GLEN, Oct. 9The worst weather in the 18year history of the United States Grand Prixthree days and nights of chilling rain and fog, and some floodingwashed out today's schedule of qualifying, practice and supporting events.

title: Post Gains 9th in Row In 310 Rout
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Oct. 9Despite 40mileanhour winds and driving rain all part of the tornado warning that spoiled their last home game of the season  C. W. Post had no trouble overcoming Wagner, 310, at Hickox Field today.

title: Costlier Than Installations on Land Planned Prison Ship in Maryland
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 3 (AP)The proposed prison ship for Baltimore Harbor, which will serve as a minimumsecurity institution, will cost the state more than the normal such institution, according to corrections department documents.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: VicePresidential candidates just clutter up the campaign. We should not ask the country to make two judgments. Everyone knows Vice Presidents have no influence on Presidents, once elected. Presidents' wives have much more influence. Perhaps we should have the candidates' wives debate.Eugene J. McCarthy, independent Presidential candidate. [42:5.]

title: Yes, But What's the Yield on Cheddar?
description: Talk about banks diversifying. A California savings bank markets Wisconsin cheese at a discount to depositors. A New York bank offers unmarried savers a special package of financial and social extras.

title: Not All Fight Winners Win
description: There were some, but not many, who could truly empathize with Ken Norton in Yankee Stadium 12 days ago. I was one of the few. Others might have included Harold Johnson Jr., Billy Graham, Joey Archer and Joe Walcott. I've included myself in this group of fighters not for reasons of comparison, but to show something of the nature of our sport or, more accurately, our business.

title: Julian Grenfell
description: At the end of the 19th and the beginning of the 20th century, the British social world was still rigidly divided into upper, middle and lower classes; and the movements of fashionable persons were followed with eager interestenvious, censorious or bothby readers of the newspapers. The upper class itself was subdivided into sharply different categories, among them the Marlborough House Set, friends and boon companions of the Prince of Wales, who were fast, horsey and cardplaying, and gladly welcomed foreign parvenus like the German financier Sir Ernest Cassel; and the distinguished splintergroup, whose standards were exclusive and whose pursuits were often literary, and who after dinner, despising bridge and baccarat, played intellectual games.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Although some photographers may not realize it, there are some distinct differences between taking a photograph and creating one. Understanding some of these differences could open up a whole new world of ideas for photographic subjects.

title: Two sports novels
description: Sports is still a frontier for novelists, a dimly  perceived continent ripe for imaginative speculation. While journalism has settled and stripmined politics, war and sex, it has yet to provide consistent coverage of the athletic arena as a place in all our lives. The boxscore maniacs among sportswriters outnumber the sociologists.

title: Caddy Buffs Reaping Riches From Ragtops
description: The last Americanmade convertible a white Bicentennial Cadillac Eldoradorolled off the assembly line in April and since then, the value of the 14,000 Cadillac convertibles made in that final year has begun to skyrocket. Collectors, speculators and just plain convertible lovers are scouring the country in search of one of the treasured ragtops.

title: Turkey Asking Common Market for Concessions on Aid, Products and Movement of Its Workers
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 3Turkey is demanding drastic improvements in its relations with the European Economic Community, with the two sides still in disagreement on such major issues as movement of Turkish workers, preferences for Turkish farm products and financial aid.

title: C. S. Morrison, Jane L. Palmer Married on L.I.
description: St. John's of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, L. I., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Jane Lewis Palmer, daughter of Edward Lewis Palmer, chairman of the executive committee of Citibank, and Mrs. Palmer, to Craig Stephen Morrison, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Morrison of Denver and Andover, N. J. The Rev. Charles G. Newbery performed the ceremony. A reception was held at the Palmer home in Mill Neck, L. I.

title: Old Sparky's Ready
description: COLUMBIA, Tenn.The Rev. Joe Ingle quietly refused a menu here the other morning, when a waitress proffered it in the dining room of the Holiday Inn.

title: Economic Hope for Bangladesh
description: DACCA, BangladeshWhich Asian country last year achieved doubledigit economic growth? It was certainly not Japan, which is still staggering out of recession and was thankful to turn in a positive 2 percent growth after a 1.2 percent shrinkage in 1974. Nor was it Singapore or Malaysia or any of the other traditional highflyers which were also blown off course by adverse world conditions. Nor was it India, with its muchvaunted improved discipline.

title: Labor Department Expanding Its Programs for Apprentices
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 (AP)  The Labor Department announced today a program to expand apprentice training programs beyond the construction industry is an effort to open up now job opportunities.

title: Paris Tells Bonn Troops' Pullout Won't Weaken Remaining Units
description: BONN, Oct. 9The West German Government has been assured by the French Defense Ministry that its plans to withdraw 10,000 troops from this country by the end of next year will not reduce the combateffectiveness of those who remain, a Government spokesman said yesterday.

title: The World
description: The narrow margin of Chancellor Helmut Schmidt's victory over Helmut Kohl in last weekend's West German parliamentary elections has at least three important implications: (1) that West Germany has joined some other Western European nations in ending a leftward trend of more than two decades: (2) that many voters want Mr. Schmidt to keep focussing on the country's economic troubles; and (3) that Mr. Schmidt's ruling coalition will have to draw its plans carefully because of a greatly strengthened parliamentary opposition.

title: A Sure Cure for Bad Hot Air
description: PRINCETON ONCE upon a time, the public looked up to us scientists. We were asked to visit the moonwhich we didand to control the weather, which we did not. As a result, we lost our exalted status and matching Federal funds. Both hurt.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 9 (AP) The Irish Republican Army began a propaganda campaign today against the women's peace movement, but thousands of Protestants and Roman Catholics continued peace rallies here, in the Irish Republic and in England.

title: Princeton: Fear Over Virus Tests
description: IT began as a routine lah,experiment on adeno virus, a respiratory ailment particularly common among Army recruits. But by the time Dr. Arnold S. Levine of Princeton University halted his experiments, researchers at the 231yearold institution found themselves facing the same questions that have triggered a worldwide scientific controversy about the methods and ethics of advanced genetic research.

title: Alain ResnaisThe Man Who Makes Movies of the Mind
description: PARIS Even at midnight, the temperature seems tropical inside the ancient, stuffy Joinville Studios where Alain Resnais is shooting Providence, his first movie in English. Fans whirr between takes and tempers fray. Dirk Bogarde snaps disdainfully at anyone he doesn't recognize. David Warner, wearing a heavy fisherman's sweater and a ghastly headwoundcourtesy of makeup slumps dejectedly on a sofa. Ellen Burstyn smiles patiently and yearns aloud for a Popsicle.

title: It's DDay For the Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD IF ALL goes well, at 1:02 this afternoon, as they start to introduce the players on the field, the 78,000 people with tickets for the GiantsDallas football game will be in their seats for the opening of the new stadium in the Sports Complex here.

title: Moynihan Urges Welfare Reform as Buckley Cites Conservation Work
description: Daniel P. Moynihan called yesterday for toptobottom reform of the welfare system while Senator James L. Buckley told in a lengthy statement of his efforts to protect the environment during his six years in Washington.

title: COURT IN ALBANY IS ASKED TO BAR A COURSE ON MAN
description: ALBANY, Oct. 9 (AP)A $2.5 million suit has been fined in United States District Court here in a move to prevent the use of a controversial social studies course in New York public schools.

title: His Party Is West Germany's Strongest
description: BONNHelmut Schmidt came out of the West German elections as Chancellor again, but the man to watch in the future is the state governor who came close to defeating him: Helmut Kohl.

title: A Pampered Record Can Live to Be 100
description: Record collectors feel about their favorite disks almost as they do about their closest friends. They think of them as cherished companions, as sources of comfort and pleasure over the years, perhaps with a wistful expectation of growing old together. For unlike a live performance, which vanishes with its own sound, recorded music offers the promise of permanence, of endlessly repeatable delights.

title: More Women Are Buying Cars on Credit, And Lenders Cite Good Payment Records
description: More women than ever are buying cars today in their own names and with their own credit.

title: Breach of Contract Suit Against Ali Is Denied
description: BOSTON, Oct. 9 (UPI)United States District Court Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. has denied a motion by a Massachusetts fight promoter to freeze the money Muhammad Ali won in his title bout with Ken Norton. Helyn C. Hall, who filed a suit against Ali alleging breach of contract, said she already had an agreement to stage the fight in Boston when Ali's handlers announced it would be held in Yankee Stadium.

title: The View From Highway 1
description: The title of Michael J. Arlen's second collection of pieces on televisionthey appeared in The New Yorker from the fall of 1974 through 1975refers to the road that linked the eastern part of South Vietnam to Saigon, but the title also suggests a broader image: that of television as the main highway in American life, a freeway that connects each section of the country, and each side of its usually shapeless personality, to every other. Speeding along, one covers a lot of ground, but one sees everything in fragments; you fill out the picture for yourself, or you miss the landscape. Whether or not this is the image Arlen means his title to convey, he writes as if it were; he offers an investigation of TV as a crucial version of the life he shares with most other Americans. Last year Arlen published Passage to Ararat, his magnificent study of the history of Armenia and of his attempt to connect himself to that history; The View From Highway 1 is an attempt to make sense of the connections TV has forged between us.

title: Maryland Blue Cross Rates Up
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 9 (AP) Maryland nongroup subscribers to Blue Cross will be paying higher premiums under rate increases granted by Edward J. Birrane, State Insurance Commissioner. The new rates approved this week will increase rates by an average of 18.6 percent for Blue Cross's 63,500 nongroup subscribers, They will raise monthly payments by $1.46 to $8.44.

title: Dr. W. E. Williams Marries Mary Parr
description: Mary Elizabeth Wright Parr of Maplewood, N. J., was married at noon yesterday to Dr, William E. Williams, a pediatrician of Rutherford, N. J.

title: GARDENING
description: FEW things are more refreshing than a pot of tulips, hyacinths or daffodils on the windowsill against a background of midwinter Long Island snow. Members of the North Country Garden Club know this from their own experience in forcing these bulbs.

title: Major League Averages
description: Final 1976 Season Records

title: Nancy Nelson Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. C. Roger Nelson of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Nelson, to Dennis Walker, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth P. Walker of Freeport, L.J. Miss Nelson and her fianc graduates of Union College, plan to be married in February.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: Spurned by a woman friend after she learned that he was married, Burton N. Pugach, a Bronx lawyer, hired three thugs to blind her in a lye attack in 1959 so that no one else will want you. He was convicted, disbarred and Served 14 years in prison.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Talk about Fun, excitement, noise and action! That's the name of the game when you play Pachinko... Japan's answer to our pinball machine, with all the appeal of the most expensive PennyArcade game, Pachinko is a total amusement center for your home at a price you can afford. Zing! Zing!Ping Ping!Just flip the lever and hundreds of shiny steel balls leap, spin and bounce around like paranoid popcorn... a quick eye... fast reflexes you'll hit the jackpot! Lights flashBells ringYou're the lucky winner! Hundreds of game styles to choose from with more different designs than ordinary pinball. Pachinko, balls 1.99 @ 1.00.

title: Tokyo Premier Gains Support
description: TOKYO, Oct. 9 (Reuters)Voter support for the Government of Prime Minister Takeo Miki has jumped to 35 percent, up 9 percent in the last seven months, according to an opinion poll published today. During that time, Mr. Miki has been under intense pressure In the ruling LiberalDemocratic Party to resign over the Lockheed payoff scandal.

title: All The Way, an Extroverted Bulldog, Captures Cheers From the Ringsiders
description: Not even the rain could dampen the enthusiasm of ringsiders at the Radnor Hunt Club in Whitehorse, Pa., last weekend, when Bob Graham was judging the final of Devon's 64th annual fixture. For it was one of the strongest groups to be assembled at many a show. All six dogs previously had taken top awards and they had a total of 118 among them. The crowd's favorite was a red and white bulldog from Richfield, Minn., Ch.Marinebull's All The Way, and when Graham pointed to him, there was a tremendous cheer. Goober, as the extroverted sourmug is called, promptly responded, leaping up and down joyfully. He's owned by Karl and Joyce Dingman. Karl who has an auto body shop, does the handling. Joyce, a school bus driver, leads the applause.

title: Is L.A. the Rock Capital?
description: Jackson Browne is poised to descend on us in two forms this month, with two concerts on Friday at the Capitol Theater in Passaic, N. J., and four on Saturday and next Sunday at the Palladium on 14th Street, and with his eagerly awaited new record, The Pretender, due out in a couple of weeks.

title: Penn and Cornell Score First Victories in Upsets
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Oct. 9Pennsylvania capitalized on its best opportunity in an errorplagued football game and upset previously unbeaten Brown, 76, today on a wet and windy field.

title: FluVaccine Programs
description: THE Nassau and Suffolk County health departments are ready to begin programs to immunize about 1.5 million residents of the two counties against swine flu. Health officials said they were prepared to innoculate all eligible residents as soon as the vaccines are received from the State Health Department, probably in mid or late October.

title: Hackley Wins, Stuyvesant Loses and Flushing Ties
description: Earl Leach showed disdain for the adverse weather conditions yesterday as he scored a season high of three touchdowns in undefeated Hackley's 29.0 rout of St. Luke's on the loser's field. Leach, a junior halfback, got off two long scoring runs83 and 58 yards and a short one4 yards. He carried the ball only 7 times for 139 yards as Hacklev won its fourth game.

title: Another Look at The 'Realities' of School Financing
description: I FOUND Chancellor Theodore Black's commentary, We Get the Education We Deserve [Opinion Page Sept. 19] quite disheartening, not only for Its generally abysmal thrust, but also for its specious underlying argument.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Theater

title: G.O.P. Ethnic Group Urges Defeat of Ford
description: DENVER, Oct. 9 (AP)A group of Colorado Republicans said today that. President Ford was unfit for the Presidency and urged voters not to cast their ballots for him.

title: Robert Petronelli Weds Linnea Wikoff in Weston
description: Cinnea Olin Wikoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Everett Norris Wikoff of Weston, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Robert Petronelli, sort of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Petronelli of Easton, Conn. The Rev. Robert Greene peiformed the ceremony at the Norfield Congregational Church.

title: TEACHERS IN NEW YORK DISPUTE PENALTY TAX
description: A dispute has developed between the New York City Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers over the issue of who must pay the taxes on last year's teacherstrike penalties.

title: The violence of just sitting
description: Three hours northwest of New York City in the Catskills, 40 miles from Grossinger's and not much farther from Woodstock, markers indicate the private road into the monastery. Following a stream, the road climbs two miles through heavy forest, opens onto a cemetery they call Sangha Meadow, then suddenly veers to cross a woodplank bridge which resounds beneath my car like gunfire. In fact, the monasterycalled International Dai Bosatsu Zendo comes into view precisely as the gunfire sounds. A touch melodramatic perhaps, but Zen Buddhism has never had an argument with melodrama. During my stay here, I will often be reminded of this bridge, for crossing it is not unlike driving into ambush. No great Zen master designed it like this, but ambush is, for me at least, not an unreasonable introduction to Zen monastic life.

title: A Will Provides Funds To Buy Chinning Bars
description: TREASURE ISLAND, Fla. Oct. (UPI)Children in 10 cities in five states will soon have chinning bars to play on in public parks, as a result of provisions in the will of an 80yearold physical fitness enthusiast.

title: Rumanians Are Seeking Contacts With Lost 4 Million in the Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9The Rumanian Government has advised Western and independent powers with which it is friendly that it is seeking, for the first time in more than 30 years, to establish contacts with the 4 million ethnic Rumanians living in the Soviet Union.

title: Notes: Foliage Forecast
description: Because of an unusual latesummer frost, the brilliant colors of fall came early this year to parts of the Northeast. There is, however, still a little time left to observe the annual foliage spectacular, which in some regions is more variegated than usual, with an abundance of purples and golds.

title: Italy Acts to Shield Reporters
description: ROME, Oct. 9 (Reuters)The Italian Cabinet has approved a bill that would allow journalists to refuse to testify in court about the sources of their information, There has not been a definitive rule for courts to follow in the past and some reporters have been sent to prison for refusing to reveal surceso.

title: Evelyn Nesbit and Stanford White
description: On the night of June 25, 1906, in the Roof Garden Theater of the Old Madison Square Garden, an insane millionaire from Pittsburgh named Harry K. Thaw shot New York's leading architect, Stanford White, in the head and killed him. Thaw's motive for the murder was his allegation that White ruined innocent virgins including, several years earlier, Thaw's wife, a former actress and model named Evelyn Nesbit. But you knew all that.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: AS a historian with a hardearned Ph.D. (much devaluated in these parlous times, alas) I must admit dismay with the fact that Robert A. Caro won my guild's Francis Parkman Prize in 1974 for his The Power Broker: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York. I charitably grant the former Newsday reporter the Pulitzer Prize (which he also won) for all the interviewing and writing that went into a fascinating and hefty (1,162 pages of text) piece of investigative journalism.

title: From Coast to Coast, The Black Audience Grows
description: CHICAGO The streams of black people pouring out of Loop movie houses sometimes mix with those leaving the Shubert and Auditorium theaters, but the two groups are easily distinguishable. The moviegoers are youthful, playful and animated, mimicking the kung fu kicks they have seenor repeating the obscenities they have heardin one or another of the many black exploitation films in town, as they head for their buses trains. The palygoers, on the other hand, are older and more conservatively dressed and are hardly audible compared to the younger set, as they walk to nearby parking garages to pick up their latemodel cars.

title: Card of Thanks
description: ARKOWITZMrs. Jacob. Deeply appreciates and gratefully acknowledges your kind expressions of sympathy on the loss of my dearly beloved husband Judge Jacob Markowitz.

title: Amazonian prescriptions and proscriptions
description: That model scholar, the sociologist Gunnar Myrdal, referred to women as the first Negroes of the human race. In their struggle for selfhood, radical feminists, like many blacks, have sometimes resorted to mythologizing their history. Black nationalisti conjured Arcadian visions of great civilizations that flourished in peace and prosperity before the white man came to sow strife among them. Feminists have glossed anthropology to exalt a prepatriarchal Eden in which we had full control of our bodies and our destiny. Whatever struggle one is waging, Utopianism comes before analysis, the Fouriers precede the Marxes. Although a major task of both movements has been to demythologize attributes of character (blacks are lazy, women are irrational), idealization of the past seems to be an early stage of any struggle for decolonization. It is a form of adolescence that the colonized group must pass through before it can attain a new phase of pride and of selfconfidence.

title: The Cops Continue To Act Tough
description: There has been a serious escalation in the nature of the argument policemen are conducting with New York City over wages and working conditions. For a brief time last week, offduty policemen advanced threateningly on a station house where four of their number had been taken after their arrest in street demonstrations.

title: Home Style
description: The famed pink and lime green furniture is gone. So is the cabbage rose wallpaper and the framed pictures of weeping clowns. The dour desk clerks have disappeared, too.

title: Grand Prix Drivers' Standing
ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: GIANCARLO MENOTTI wrote an opera called The Telephone. I don't remember it too well, except that I enjoyed it and that it was short. And that last thing was all wrong. Nothing connected with the telephone can he short. Of all the instruments in your normally turbulent suburban home, it is the one that is used longest.

title: Coup Driving Leftist Leaders in Thailand Into Hiding
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 9Scores of leftwing students, intellectuals, professors and politicians have gone into hiding in the wake of Wednesday's coup by a group of rightwing military officers in Thailand.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: SEATTLEThis company is in a mess. That's how Ronald F. Cosgrave, its newly named chairman, summed up the plight of Alaska Airlines in 1972.

title: PEKING WALL POSTERS REPORT HUA IS NAMED AS PARTY'S CHAIRMAN
description: HONG KONG, Sunday, Oct. 10Wall posters appeared in Peking yesterday saying Prime Minister Hua Kuofeng had been chosen chairman of the Communist Party, succeeding Mao Tsetung, but there was no official confirmation of the action.

title: Hollywood Has Gone Car Crazy
description: Los Angeles Sam Gelfman is a sad, slight, softspoken man behind the stylish aviator glasses everyone wears out here. He's actually a New Yorker, a former literary agent who came West to produce Cannonball, a lowbudget picture about an illegal transcontinental auto race which is a current boxoffice hit. Surprisingly, he scorns the elevation of cars to cult objects in Southern California.

title: Around Vineyards, It's Getting Crowded
description: In 1948, Santa Clara County, California, at the southern end of San Francisco Bay, had 8,000 acres of wine grapes in production. Today, because of urban sprawl, there are less than 2,000.

title: Susan Floyd Bride Of Thomas Levine
description: Susan Todd Floyd, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William West Floyd of Pittsburgh, was married there last evening to Thomas Mark Levine, a lawyer with the Pittsburgh firm of Berkman, Ruslander Pohl Lieber & Engel.

title: DINING OUT
description: AS we finished our aperitifs (Kir, Lillet, sherry) and began the first course at L'Endroit, we thought we might detect three stars twinkling in the firmament. Alas, by the end of the meal, one of them had dimmed, the result of some annoying inconsistencies in food and service and an outrageous wine list.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Attempting to give some indication of the geographical distribution of intensity of religious belief in the. United States, a geographer at the University of Kansas has prepared a countybycounty map of Christian church membership as of 1971, the last year for which reliable data are available.

title: Rebecca Bushnell Is Bride
description: Rebecca Weld Bushnell and John David Toner, graduates of Swarthmore College, were married yesterday afternoon in Princeton, N. J., where the Rev. Kenneth H. Hollenbaugh, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's father, Douglas. F. Bushnell. The bride, who will retain her maiden name is the daughter also of the late Mrs. Bushnell. She is continuing her studies at the Bryn Mawr Graduate School of Arts and Sciences. Her husband, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald L. Toner of Doylestown, Pa., is a law student.

title: The First Casualty
description: MINEOLA WHEN Raymond Graber, Hempstead Town's deputy commissioner of conservation and waterways, was convicted last week of lying to a grand jury, it was only the beginning of court appearances in the government investigation into charges that Nassau County Republicans have forced municipal employees to kick back 1 percent of their salaries to the party.

title: It Is Easier in Some Communist Countries Than Others to Be a Catholic
description: ROMEIf you are a Roman Catholic who must live under Communism in Eastern Europe, a Vatican expert said, then you probably are better off in Poland. If you live in Czechoslovakia, however, you have serious difficulties in practicing the faith. In Albania forget it.

title: Grim Future for Clammers
description: POINT PLEASANT AN OFFSHORE phenomenon that resembled an underwater lawn hundreds of square miles in size blossomed off the North Jersey coast last spring and stayed throughout the summer. Slowly moving down the coast, it killed marine life wherever it went.

title: The Old School Tie, Corporate Style
description: Ten years ago you couldn't even give them away. Everybody was in a hate mood in the 60's. Nobody wanted to wear a tie with a company logo.

title: Gregorek Is Outrunning The Odds and the Fields
description: At St. Anthony's in Smithtown, L.I., there are dances where the girls outnumber the boys by 3 to 1. John Gregorek, a St. Anthony's student, says, That's great!

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: U.S. Troops in west Germany Test New Tactics of Flank Attacks by Small Groups on Soviet Invaders
description: FRIEDBURG, West GermanyUnits of the United States Seventh Army and the 101st Airborne Division have completed field exercises that tested the newly adopted tactics of opposing invaders with small battle groups armed with sophisticated weapons.

title: Casino Security: Plan for the Future?
description: NASSAU THERE are many nautical miles between Atlantic City and Paradise Island. One of the most popular stopovers on the Bahamian tourist frail.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Increasing investor concern over the slowing economy and fear of a possible increase in oil prices sent stock prices lower last week in slower trading.

title: A City Terrace Makes All the Difference
description: When I first moved from the suburbs to the city, I hated the city. The country was surrounded by grass and greenery. The city backdrop was cement grey and concrete white. In the country, I was able to walk in privacy out the door to fresh air. The city required dressing properly for the trip down and up the elevator.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: THEATER

title: LIFE OF A NATION IS PONDEROUS EVENT
description: While other groups waved the flag to celebrate the Bicentennial, philosophers pondered what it all meant.

title: Divvying Up Salomon's Megabucks
description: We happened to be at the right place, at the right time, doing the right kind of business, William R. Salomon, managing partner of Salomon Brothers, said last Wednesday after the investment banking firm announced its estimated earnings for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30.

title: The Yankee revolution
description: It was, after all, so simple. All that the. New York Yankees needed was something wonderfully vulgar, something triumphantly myopic, something ierribly unYankee: They needed to ignore the lessons of the past. That's what got them back among the champions this yearthey're in the American League playoffs this weekendafter more than a decade in which they were unswervingly traditionbound (It was like a country club around here, says Yankee president Gabe, Paul), and unetwervingly futile, Moreover, the sudden Yankee success this year has sent up signals all through baseball that, in an environment dramatically changing, tho Yankees may be setting a precedent as important as any in the past: The old Yankees were born and bred; this team was bought.

title: Education
description: Of the many slogans that swept through the nation's schools during the last decade, one of the few that gives promise of becoming more than mere rhetoric is the term accountability. Under this program, questions are asked about what youngsters are learning, how efficiently the schools are being operated and whether the expenses are justified. In recent weeks, studies have been authorized on these questions in Albany and Trenton.

title: 4Car Families, Coast to Coast
description: SUMMIT, N.J.During the gasoline shortage of 1974, Christine Gilmartin spent her afternoons shuttling three family cars to and from a local service station.

title: Islanders Top Hawks, 21
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 9Bobby Orr has raised the energy level of the usually deadpan Chicago Black Hawks. But the Hawks still played too conservatively to beat the New York Islanders tonight, losing, 21, in New York's home opener before a sellout crowd of 14,865 in the Nassau Coliseum.

title: The View From a Canoe
description: GREENPORT IF Austin Burt and his son, Steven, had their way, the canoe would once more become a major vehicle for transportation on the Island, just as it was centuries ago when Indians dominated the scene. As realists though, they will settle for seeing the canoe become a major recreational vehicle on the Island's remaining waterways.

title: Randi Tangen Loftsgaarden Is Engaged To Rev. Richard Cosnotti of Brick Church.
description: Mr. and Mrs. Beldin H. Loftsgaarden of St. Paul and Phoenix have announced the engagement of their daughter, Randi Tangen Loftsgaarden, to the Rev. Richard Louis Cosnotti. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank P. Cosnotti of Oakmont, Pa.

title: Suffolk's Spuds Now Pommes de Terre
description: FOR the first time in the memory of farm experts here and on Long Island, massive quantities of Suffolk County potatoes are being exported to Western Europe.

title: LicenseFree Drinks at Yale Mixers
description: NEW HAVENAfter sober reflection, Yale University's social committees have come up with a new way of dispensing liquor without a license at student mixersand happy hours on campus are now happier than ever.

title: Vanessa Merton Wed to John Carroll, Actor
description: Vanessa H. Merton, a clinical instructor of criminal law at the New York University School of Law, was married yesterday afternoon to John K. Carroll, an actor. The Rev. Joseph Kane, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in Hastings, N. Y., at the home of Mrs. Robert K. Merton, the bride's mother.

title: TV VIEW
description: The new season for public television, according to a spokesperson, is being eased into an official opening this week. Among the firstrun entries is Madame Bovary, which begins a fourepisode presentation this evening on Masterpiece Theater, showcase for British imports. Gustave Flaubert's romantic heroine (I would like to be married at midnight by the light of flaming torches) is realized beautifully by Francesca Annis, but the production is a hit too successful in reflecting the unimaginative bleakness surrounding Emma Bovary. Still, for authenticity, it beats the old Jennifer Jones movie. Also on tap this week: the Long Wharf Theater's charming production of O'Neill's Ah, Wilderness!, launching a new Great Performances series this Wednesday at 9.

title: Newark Center Awaits Holiday Parade
description: NEWARK WHEN the Columbus Day parade here steps off today, the largest contingent probably will be from the North Ward Educational and Cultural Center.

title: I Want the Met to be Home For Our Best Singers
description: I Want the Met to be Home For Our Best SingersThe Metropolitan Opera must not only survive, says Maestro James Levine, it's got to be the most exciting operatic institution in the world. Tomorrow night the company opens its 92d season, and it will be the 33yearold Cincinnatiborn conductor's first as music director. On Friday, Levine con ducts the revival of Puccini's Il Trittico; later in the season he will preside over Verdi'ss La Forza del Destino, Giordano'ss Andrea Chenier, the new production of Wagner'ss Lohengrin, and the longdelayed house premiere of Alban Berg'ss Lulu. Levine'ss more than 150 past appearances on the Met podium are a guarantee of a high level of musical quality when he is in charge, so interest now centers on what he and his partners in the current troika managementAnthony A. Bliss (executive director) and John Dexter (director of productions)want to make of the company.

title: Claire de Maille Smith Bride Of Richard Gross, Bank Aide
description: Claira de Maille Smith, daughter of Mr. a?? ??rs. C. Edgar Smith Jr. of Baltimore, was married yesterday to Richard Barry Gross, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Newton Gross of Shaker Heights, by the Rev David Crosley in formed by the Rev. David Crosley in St. David's Episcopal Church in Roland Park. Md.

title: Brainy Computers Aiding Technology
description: DETROITThe use of computers in the design, manufacture and operation of cars Is growing constantly.

title: CHESS
description: New York won its Telex match with London 8 to 4. Teh New York teem played at the Manhattan Chess Club, 155 East 55th Street, and the London team at the Bloomsbury Center Hotel in London. Lloyds Bank, the American Chess Foundation and Western Union match placed some of the strongest representatives of each city on the first six boards, featured woman against woman on Board 7, and paired the International shared sponsorship.

title: Complications Snag
description: AS state officials wrestle with the problem of how to handle propertytax rebates tied to the new income tax, they are learning that the failure to achieve a 100 percent assessment rate has complicated the refund process.

title: SHOP TALK
description: NEEDLEPOINT, oil paintings and photographs are all enhanced when they are placed in frames like the ones available at Frame Art in Maplewood. There are hundreds of types of frames, ranging from starkly modern ones of stainless steel and plexiglass to goldleaf reproductions of antiques.

title: Marie Wemyss Bride Of William Richards, Recording Engineer
description: Marie Frances Wemyss, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Francis Wemyss of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L. I., was married yesterday at noon to William Larimer Richards, son of Mrs. George E. Harrison of Palm Beach, Fla., and Ralph S. Richards Jr. of Sewickley, Pa.

title: CONGRESSMEN CALL CITY AID UNPOPULAR
description: WASHINGTON. Oct 9An 11tern Representative from Toledo, Ohio, was encountered recently in New York City, where, he said, he had coma to attend a fundraising event

title: East
description: Massachusetts 33, Boston U. 6

title: FORD PRESSES DRIVE TO GAIN TEXAS VOTES
description: DALLAS, Oct. 9  President Ford, standing in his opentop limousine, rode in a parade today through downtown Dallas in the first Presidential motorcade through the city since President Kennedy was assassinated almost 13 years ago.

title: Multiple Cars: Not Just for Tycoons
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 16In California, it is drive or die, says Phoebe Van Laanean, a housewife and mother in Studio City, Calif. Without a car, a person might as well be on a desert island.

title: The Nation
description: Last week's economic reports contained some bad news for President Ford, who has been campaigning on the demonstrable fact that his program for recovery from the recession has brought inflation down. In September, wholesale prices increased by ninetenths of 1 percent, their largest rise in nearly a year, and that can be a sign inflation is making a comeback.

title: Ford, in Appeal to Evangelists, Stresses His Religious Beliefs
description: Some of President Ford's supporters are fond of saying that Jimmy Carter wears his religion on his sleeve but Jerry Ford wears it in his heart.

title: NEW COPYRIGHT LAW HELD A BOON FOR U.S.
description: GENEVAThe first major revision of the archaic American copyright law of 1909, which President Ford is expected to sign this month, can make the United States eligible for full membership in the Bern Union, the most important international copyright agreement in existence. Up to now the United States has only been permitted observer status.

title: Investigation Hollywood!
description: I am sitting in my officewith my fedora pushed back on my noggin and a Lucky Strike with an inch of ash dangling out of the corner of my kisser and a twoday growth of stubble on my puss, because what I have been doing for the past 48 is perusing two tomes by shamuses with the monickers of Fred Otash and Jay J. Armes. The Otash book being dubbed on the cover the files of scandaland's TOP PRIVATE DETECTIVE, and the Armes epic being tagged the story of The World's Most Successful Private Eye, I figure neither one of these jokers will ever succumb to a fatal dose of modesty.

title: Spain's Two Socialist Rivals Meet
description: LISBON, Oct. 9The leaders of the two main rival Socialist parties in Spain met here today in a move toward reconciliation.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE EASTER PARADE, by Richard Yates. (Delacorte Press, $7.95.) A spare and unsparing tale of two sister, who choose different roads to futility.

title: Homeowner's Guide To Insulation
description: Most homeowners are by now well aware of the need for adequate insulation to keep heating and air conditioning costs down, and to make their house a more comfortable place in which to live all year round. However, many are still confused about the amount of insulation they should have, and about the types that are most suitable for different parts of the house.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Last weekend was a total washout for gardeners. Even the golfers had to stay home because of the continuing rain and dampness. Delays in the autumn gardening, when the winter chill is close on the heels of every planter, put a time element on things.

title: Deaths
description: Baer, Harry L.

title: Susan Hinrichs Married to Peter Thomas Jr.
description: Susan Hinrichs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stuart W. Hinrichs, was married yesterday to Peter Addenbrooke Thomas Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas. Both families are of Greenwich, Conn., where the Rev. Richard Van Wely performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Long Beach and Elmont Weather Foes and Elements
description: A number of teams had trouble in the rain and mud that washed out most of the Nassau and Suffolk football schedule yesterday, but none of them had a harder time than Plainview Kennedy. Kennedy failed to gain a first down and lost a net 37 yards in dropping a 290 verdict to Long Beach in Nassau Conference IV.

title: Colombia's Labor Minister Quits As Nation's State of Siege Goes On
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Oct, 9 (Reuters)Colombia's Labor Minister, Maria Elena de Crovo resigned tonight, two days after the Government imposed a nationwide state of seige.

title: Fashion
description: Maybe this suit isn't really better made than the ones made by women's manufacturers, but it cer?? seems like it is. The woman speaking was in a Fifth Avenue de??ment store in an area newly ?? to clothing for women made ?? wear manufacturers, and ?? did what an impressive number women across the country are ?? She bought the suit (which ?? with pants). We can't keep ?? in stock, a salesclerk re?? We're selling them as fast ?? put them on the floor.

title: Tenure And the 3 R's
description: TRENTON MANY parents and some educators say that teacher tenure is why so many New Jersey children spend years in public school without learning how to read. They say that teachers with tenurecontracts that prevent them from being dismisseddo not have the needed drive in all instances to make sure that children learn.

title: PEOPLE
description: Ever wonder what happens to people voted most outstanding in their class? Back in 1961 at Hofstra, George G. Dempster was voted Outstanding Senior Male. He was captain of the varsity football and baseball teams, and graduated with a degree in business administration. George Dempster is 37 years old now, and the president of Transleisure Corporation, which enables him to get around a bit, since one of its assets is a concern called Island Helicopters. Mr. Dempster, who makes his home in Woodbury, has just been reelected chairman of Hofstra's board of trustees. It seems that, the electorate judged him right in 1961. Also reelected to trustees posts are Emil V. Cianculli of Flower Hill, vice chairman; Mrs. C. Payson Coleman of Cedarhurst chairman of the academic affairs committee, and Norman R. Tengtsrom of West Islip, secretary.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: The jokes are legion about George Gershwin's egocentricityhe was an egocentric, of course, of the most generous sort, being perfectly willing to play his tunes for anybody, any place, any timebut the joke, in the end, is on us, on music, err opera, on the world he took by the tail and snapped to his bidding. For it is his very arrogance, supreme confidence, relentless selfassertion that leave us with an actual opera, Porgy and Bess, today.

title: Hotchkiss Backfield Is Army's Secret Weapon
description: With a recruiting assist from the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the United States Army, three young athletes are undergoing a year of prep school basic training, getting ready for a fouryear stint with West Point's football team.

title: New Milford High Students Find Cutting Class Can Be Very Costly
description: NEW MILFORD, Conn.An attendance policy that lowers students' grades by five points for unapproved absences from class has been instituted at New Milford High School this year.

title: The President Slipped in Front of Just the Wrong Audience
description: Driven from their Eastern European homelands by economic privation early in the 20th century and by Communist oppression 50 years later, Czechs and Poles, Hungarians and Bohemians, Slovaks and Lithuanians came by the hundreds of thousands to America. They settled in and near the great industrial cities of the Norththe northwest side of Chicago, the bluecollar enclave of Hamtramck within the city of Detroit, the cosmo wards of Clevelandand in small clusters elsewhere. Set incongruously in the cornfields of Nebraska, for example, is the almost entirely CzechAmerican settlement of Wilmer, and that state's junior Senator, Roman L. Hruska, is of Bohemian descent.

title: SCIENCE BODY PLANS MORE ACTIVIST ROLE
description: The American Association for the Advancement of Science, often criticized for its reluctance to actively promote a better public understanding of science and for its abovethebattle attitude toward controversial scientific questions, is preparing to assume a more activist role in American society.

title: FACTIONS IN LEBANON REPORT TRUCE GAIN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 9Military officers of Lebanon, Syria and the Palestine Liberation Organization, meeting in Chtaura in the Syrianoccupied eastern part of Lebanon, agreed today on a wide range of technical details for a general ceasefire in Lebanon, according to the Arab League's mediator in the conflict, Dr. Hassan Sabry elKholy.

title: Physicists Hoping to Build 30Mile Atom Device to Explore Matter
description: In a major effort to break through the mists that shroud the true nature of the most basic components of matter and the laws that govern them, physicists from the United States, the Soviet Union and other countries are considering construction of a world machine that would dwarf any now in existence.

title: AMTRAK BLAMES U.S. FOR DELAY IN REPAIRS
description: Amtrak charged yesterday that an entire construction season had been lost in starting the $1.9 billion rehabilitation of the longneglected Northeast rail corridor because of planning delays and squabbling in Washington.

title: FOOD
description: FOR Isadore Seltzer, a commercial artist with this studio in his home, cooking is a way of taking a break from painting while still keeping the creative process going. Baking bread is tailormade to this patterns.

title: TWO POLICE OFFICERS REMAIN SUSPENDED
description: The New York City Police Department refused yesterday to lift the suspension of two police officers who have been charged with disorderly conduct and using force against their superiors during demonstrations by offduty policemen last week to protest deferred pay raises and longer work schedules.

title: A. C. L. U. Calls Klan Obnoxious But Defends Its Right to Organize
description: DENVER, Oct. 9 (AP)The American Civil Liberties Union says the Ku Klux Klan is obnoxious, but it is rallying to the white supremacist organization's side against what it calls threats by District Attorney Dale Tooley of Denver.

title: Faith Supports a Bookstore
description: EABLY this fall, a small group of Princeton residents met to celebrate the first anniversary of the nonprofit Christian book store that they operate on a shaky bank account and strong faith.

title: Computer Helps Housing Court Reduce Delays
description: A major effort to use computer technology to stem housing decay in New York City is under way with the installation of a system that will give Housing Court judges and hearing officers a virtually instant and total profile of a deteriorating building.

title: Gayliss Robinson, Lawyer, Is Married To Chester Ward Jr.
description: Gayliss Harding Robinson was married yesterday noon in Washington to Chester Dudley Ward Jr. The ceremony was performed in the Great Choir of the Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul by Bishop William F. Creighton of the District of Columbia. He was assisted by retired Bishop Thomas H. Wright of East Carolina.

title: In Memoriam: A Law on Highway Deaths
description: ENGLEWOOD RITA ROSEN'S crusade really began in 1973, in that September season when families trek to campuses in New England and elsewhere to share in the joyful excitement, as well as the logistics, of the new college year.

title: YankeesRoyals Scoring
2d Seminar Is Slated at Immaculata
description: Immaculate College may be celebrated for the outstanding reputation of its Mighty Macs basketball squad, but the Pennsylvania school is also recognized as a leader in the advancement of women's athletics. Immaculata is now preparing to play host to a second conference on women in sports, to be held Nov. 11 and 12 at its campus in Immaculata. Pa.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Outlet for Aggressiveness
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONFrom a personal point of view, says Patrick J. Delaney, it was a crazy situation.

title: Racial Remarks Loom as Factor In '76 Black Vote
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 9In the bars in black workingclass neighborhoods here, from Cedar Avenue to the Glenville and Mount Pleasant sections. and in the names of middleclass blacks in such suburbs as Shaker Heights and Cleveland Heights, the jokes this week have been cynical takeoffs on the antiblack joke told by Earl L. Butz.

title: Dock Accord Reached On Workers' Handling Of Containerized Goods
description: Longshoremen in New York and five other Atlantic ports have reached an agreement with shipindustry employers on the handling by dockworkers of certain kinds of containerized goods.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Miss Spelman Wed To George Doty Jr.
description: Leellen Spelman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund C. Spelman of WestOrange, N. J., was married yesterday morning to George E. Doty Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Doty of Rye, N.Y. His father is the partner in charge of administration at Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bankers. Mr. Spelman, a lawyer, is with the New Jersey Manufacturers Insurance Company in Trenton.

title: Meadowlands
After 53 Years, a Visitor to the Kurfurstendamm Finds WellFed Berliners and an Air of Gloom
description: WEST BERLIN  The only legal places for converting foreign currency into marks were the Government exchange offices, but it was impossible for a foreigner to get within a block of them.

title: Dr. Coles Named Head of Board Of Medical Center of N.Y.U.
description: Dr. Jerome S. Coles, board chairman of the Philip A. Hunt Chemical Corporation, has been elected chairman of the board of the New York University Medical Center. He succeeds Howard W. McCall Jr., who had been the board's executive vice chairman and also had been acting chairman since 1974.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Cooling

title: GARDENING
description: WHEN nature brings her autumn paintbrush into New Jersey, she turns large parts of the state into the most brilliant area along the Atlantic Seaboard. Therd is color, color everywhere.

title: Mount Vernon Police Officer Not Guilty on Bribery Charge
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 9 (UPI)Thomas Gherardi, the Mount Vernon Police Department's mostdecorated police officer, was found not guilty Friday night on charges of taking payoffs.

title: The United States as villain
description: William Appleman Williams and Gabriel Kolko are at the forefront of revisionist historians of the modern United States active during the last quarter century. They are prolific, influential, controversial. Williams, the older, began his work a decade earlier, but Kolko has equalled him in volume and surpassed him in the vitriol of his rhetoric and the complexity of his analysis.

title: Reading Voters' Minds
description: POLITICIANS and election aficionados follow polls the way coaches and baseball fans follow earnedrun averages. Neither statistic will tell them for sure who will win the pennant or the election, but both are good indicators of how the season is going. And for those who like the respective games, both are fun to keep track of and talk about.

title: Albany Agency Criticized on Bronx Hospital Staffing
description: The State Health Department's offer to certify North Central Bronx Hospital if it draws its medical staff from Misericordia Hospital, was attacked yesterday by critics who charged that the state was attempting to scrimp on operating costs at the expense of the poor people whom the new $100 million hospital was built to serve.

title: Feminine Approach To the Tradition Of Tree Planting
description: Thousands of words have been written explaining in detail how to plant a tree, and equal thousands written on how and where to buy a tree. My attitude ignores all those mechanics for a more feminine approach.

title: POLITICS
description: MOST Long Island politicians will take every vote they can get. Democrats, therefore, routinely accept Liberal Party endorsementwhich is of marginal value in most districts in Nassau and Suffolkwhile Republicans bargain for Conservative endorsementwhich can make the difference between victory and defeat in some districts.

title: TEAMSTERS WON'T ENDORSE A PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 9 (UPI)The International Brotherhood of Teamsters will not endorse a Presidential candidate this year, although Jimmy Carter beat President Ford by a 2 to 1 margin in a national poll of union members.

title: Anne B. Galvin Sets Wedding
description: The engagement of Anne Bartley Galvin to Robert Flinn Ottaway has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Don Thaddeus Galvin Jr. of Grosse Pointe Farms, Mich., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Dr. and Mrs. John P. Ottaway, also of Grosse Pointe Farms.

title: Units of City Council Set Public Hearings
description: The following public hearings will be held by New York City Council committees this week:

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Ten years ago last month one of America's more unlikely dreams in dance became a reality. The dream was a Repertory Dance Theater in Utah, and it was dreamed by Virginia Tanner, a Salt Lake City dance teacher, who had once danced. with Doris Humphrey. It was brought into being by the Rockefeller Foundation, which in the early years of the company nut more than a million dollars into it.

title: Caso Presents His Brief
description: NASSAU COUNTY should not have to plead bankruptcy before we can say we cannot afford an unconscionable raise, said Ralph G. Caso, the Nassau County Executive, reiterating his vehement opposition for a raise for the county police.

title: 3DCLASS MAIL MONOPOLY CHALLENGED IN LAWSUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP)A former Postmaster General is leading a legal attack against the Postal Service that could cost the financially ailing mail agency millions of dollars a year.

title: A frigid hat, a dead architect and two smart dicks
description: Richard Brautigan inspired some foolish praise in his time, a time that ended almost as soon as it began, but he never angled for it and that is to his credit. He is a serious writer, certainly, but the mark of his seriousness is in his craft, especially as a stylist; he is not pretentious. Thus his 1971 novel, The Abortion, is dedicated to someone named Frank, apparently a slow reader: come on in /read novel/it's on the table/in front room. I'll be back/in about/2 hours. And the protagonist of his new book is identified as a very wellknown American humorist. Not novelist or poet, not even writer  just humorist.

title: Balloonist Is Safe, Coast Guard Reports
description: Fears that the balloonist Ed Yost would be unable to maintain enough altitude in his attempt to be the first man to cross the Atlantic by balloon were allayed yesterday when the Coast Guard in New York reported that he was not in distress.

title: Farmer
description: An idea that fixed him in one spot was that life was a death dance and that he had quickly passed through the spring and summer of his life and was half way through the fall. He had to do a better job on the fall because everyone on earth knew what the winter was like.

title: Woolly Rhino Fossils Found
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 9 (Reuters)The 20,000yearold fossilized skeleton of a prehistoric woolly rhinoceros has been discovered by schoolboys near the Aldan River in eastern Siberia, the press agency Tass has reported. It was only the fourth time that remains of the woolly rhino have been found.

title: Instead of Which Both Candidates...
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Debates between Presidential candidates are not intellectual performances. They are attempts to reach voters. Even so, the foreignpolicy debate was deplorable. Never has the gap between the realities of world affairs and the alleged necessities of domestic politics been deeper. Never has the perennial difficulty of reconciling, as one must, the democratic process and the process of foreign policy been more glaring.

title: Sadat Again Proclaims Egypt Will Go to War If Peace Efforts Lag
description: CAIRO, Oct, 8Should peaceful efforts to solve the ArabIsraeli conflict fail, President Anwar elSadat said this week, Egypt will again seek a military solution. American diplomats here feel, however, that given the occasionthe anniversary of the attack against Israeli forcesit was an extraordinarily mild comment.

title: Belmont Racing
description: RESULTS

title: A Dark Corner In Livingston
description: SO who needs women's lib? Not Livingston, New Jersey. Here in this suburban Essex County town of 33,000, without benefit of ERA demonstrations or a personal visit from Gloria Steinem, the townspeople have chosen a woman as mayor, selected a woman to direct their symphony orchestra and listen to sermons delivered by a Presbyterian clergywoman. How's that for equal opportunity?

title: Skunks Invade a Town in Nebraska
description: SIDNEY, Neb., Oct. 8  Lee Ellen Matzke, a City Council member, was perplexed earlier this summer when a citizen called and demanded to know how Sidney was solving the skunk problem. What skunk problem?

title: Cowboys First Guest Of Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 9After 51 years and six preseason and four regularseason games this year, the Giants go home tomorrow, to New Jersey.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Final city approval has been given for the proposed Albee Square Mall, a $16 million development of SO shops and a 500car garage off the planned Fulton Street pedestrian arcade in downtown Brooklyn.

title: ENCOUNTER:
description: Ravenna is a town of benign deceits. It is a city disguised as a small town that conveniently straddles the wellheeled tourist track between Venice and Florence, yet it is rarely part of the harried tourist's itinerary. On the surface, Ravenna is a town of dull, drab, centuriesworn medieval brick, but hidden just inside her crypts, basilica and baptistry is the most dazzling explosion of vibrant mosaics west of Constantinople. And it was to satisfy my passion for that glistening treasure that I entered Ravenna on a dismally chilled October afternoon.

title: JOBS IN PRIVATE SECTOR SHOW A SLIGHT INCREASE
description: Employment in the private sector showed a modest rise for the first time in almost three years in the 18county New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area, according to Federal figures released Friday.

title: BOOK EXCHANGE9700
ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: For years, I have been a closet Egyptologist. A ritual part of my childhood was the walk through the mastaba of Pernebi at the entrance to the Metropolitan's Egyptian galleries, leading to a dimlylit clutter of mummy cases, stones, shards and statuaryas fascinating as it was fusty. In those days you came by way of a far less soign Great Hall, where the odd knight on horseback pointed his lance to treasures beyond. Turn right for Egypt; turn left for Assyria and Mesopotamia.

title: Music: Mahler With 2 Singers
description: The Mahler Month continued Friday night in Carnegie Hall with James Levine using the services of two singers. For the first half of the program, Maria Ewing made her debut with the New York Philharmonic in selections from Des Knaben Wunderhorn and the Ruckert Songs. Then, for the last movement of the Fourth Symphony, the popular Judith Blegen sang the soprano solo.

title: Fun Cars Are Back
description: A few years from now, automotive savants will view the 1977 model year as a turning point, the moment when the domestic carmakers climbed out of the bunker and reaffirmed their commitment to cars that run well, handle well and are good lookingin short, fun cars for the enthusiast market.

title: A RISE IN CONTRACEPTION FOUND IN FEDERAL STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP)  More American married couples than ever before are practicing contraception, the Government says, and the proportion using the birth control pill, intrauterine devices or surgical sterilization has nearly doubled in the last 10 years.

title: Brower's Runs Help Livingston Rout Columbia
description: Wet weather and a field laced with puddles didn't prevent a strong Livingston team from picking up 348 yards and a 448 triumph against Columbia yesterday in South Orange.

title: The Record Doesn't Support the Democratic Candidate
description: WASHINGTONIn the Presidential foreign policy debate last week, Jimmy Carter declared that if the Arab countries ever again declare an embargo against our nation on oil, I would consider that not a military but an economic declaration of war and I would respond instantly and in kind.

title: Ann E. Freedman Wed to Rand E. Rosenblatt
description: Ann Elizabeth Freedman and Rand E. Rosenblatt, lawyers who live in Philadelphia, were married yesterday afternoon at the Alverthorpe Manor in Jenkintown, Pa. Although not Quakers, they received licenses for the Quaker ceremony, witnessed according to the manner of the Society of Friends.

title: 2 RHODESIAN BLACKS ASK DELAY IN TALKS
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Oct. 9The leaders of two important Rhodesian nationalist movements said today that they would send a joint delegation to the Britishsponsored conference on Rhodesia but asked that it be delayed two weeks and demanded that it deal with the total and immediate transfer of power to a black government.

title: Campbell Won't Suspend Orr in Rebuff to Bruins
description: Clarence Campbell, president of the National Hockey League, refused yesterday to suspend Bobby Orr after considering a request by the Boston Bruins for such action.

title: Pitt Defeats Louisville
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 9 (UPI)  Pittsburgh relied on its defense today to preserve a 276 victory over Louisville after Matt Cavanaugh, the qaurterback, broke his left leg in the first half, leaving the Panther offense floundering.

title: Martin's Needle Pierces Gura and Brett on Field
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 9Billy Martin continued his feud with Larry Gura and started another with George Brett today during the New York Yankees' 41 victory over the Kansas City Royals in the opener of the American League championship series.

title: Priscilla Hill And a Broker Are Married
description: In Christ Episcopal Church in Short Hills, N.J., yesterday afternoon, Priscilla Baker Hill, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Serge Jerome Hill of Bridgehampton, L.I., and Short Hills, became the bride of DeWitt Loomis Alexandre Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexandre of Far Hills. N.J.

title: Caracas Still Hunts American 7 Months After His Abduction
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Oct. 9A Venezuelan Government spokesman said today that the police had no new leads to the whereabouts of an American businessman kidnapped by guerrillas over seven months ago.

title: Gambling Panel Critical Of Taxes on Wagering
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9 (AP)  The National Gambling Commission opposes legalized wagering on individual sports events such as football, baseball and basketball games.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Because most performances by professional child actors are dopey adult idealizations of how children should behave, childhood remains the cinema's last dark continent, the one remaining territory of experience to be explored and charted by moviemakers with the sort of obsessive seriousness they have recently devoted to freaks of nature in disaster films and to sex in pornographic films. It's not that children haven't been underfoot, metaphorically speaking, ever since the silent days of movies. Mary Pickford held off her majority until she was almost an old lady. Shirley Temple taptaptapdanced her way into our hearts for far longer than many of us care to remember, Margaret O'Brien, it was reported breathlessly in Silver Screen or some such publication, could cry large, salty, certifiably real tears on cue simply by thinking of something sad, like the loss of a puppy or the possibility that MGM wouldn't pick up her option.

title: Conteh Beats Lopez To Retain Ring Title
description: COPENHAGEN, Oct. 9 (UPI)John Conteh, of England, the World Boxing Council's lightheavyweight champion, successfully defended his tile tonight with a unanimous decision over Alvaro Lopez of Stockton, Calif., in a 15round bout.

title: Riverhead Says Come to the Fair
description: RIVERHEAD AT 11 A.M. today (weather permitting), a consciousnessraising event will begin here. To the casual observer, it will look like a big oldtime county fair with hayrides, livestock, farm equipment, homemade pies, jams and jellies, contests, blueribbon produce, sack races, arts and crafts, square dancing and marching bands.

title: Trumbull's Goal Line Remains Uncrossed
description: Trumbull, Connecticut's No. 3ranked scholastic football team, remained unscored upon in four victories yesterday, defeating previously unbeaten Wilton, 230. Most other games in Fairfield County were postponed and were rescheduled for tomorrow.

title: MUSEUM VIEW
description: When the Metropolitan Museum has completed its new Egyptian installations, and when the Temple of Dendur is on view in the new wing which is now being built for the purpose, we shall have in New York City just about as much of ancient Egypt as can be seen anywhere outside of Egypt itself, where the Cairo Museum is incomparable.

title: President Proclaims Limit On Beef Imports in Move To Aid Nation's Cattlemen
description: DALLAS, Oct. 9 (AP)President Ford signed a proclamation today imposing restrictions on the amount of foreign beef that the United States can import this year. His action long sought by American cattlemen, followed by a day the President's pledge to deal effectively with falling domestic beef prices.

title: 12 Americans Reach Top of Everest
