description: Morning

title: Andree GrosDaillon Bride Of Capt. Paul M. Severance
description: Andre Vronique GrosDaillon, daughter of Mrs. Andr Franois GrosDallion of Northport, L. I., and the late Mr. GrosDaillon, was married there yesterday to Capt. Paul Michael Severance, U. S. A., son of Col. Paul Vernon Severance, U. S. A., retired, and Mrs. Severance of Nashua, N. H.

title: 5 North Koreans Died on Cuban Jet
description: TOKYO, Oct. 10 (UPI)Five members of a North Korean delegation that had been visiting Guyana died in the crash of a Cuban airliner off Barbados last Wednesday, North Korea's official press agency said today.

title: Some L.I. and Westchester Homes Still Without Power After Storm
description: Thousands of homes in Westchester and on Long Island remained without electricity yesterday, and some faced the prospect of continuing power loss until late today as a result of Saturday's unexpectedly sweeping winds and heavy rains.

title: Liquor Industry Converts to Metric System
description: Some time later this month should you happen to wander into your local liquor store and ask for a halfgallon of Scotch, you may be surprised to learn that the halfgallon has shrunk by almost 5 ounces to 1.75 liters. But don't worry. There should be a similar decrease in price, too.

title: Bridge:
description: A player in a sensible contract who suddenly finds himself faced by an appalling trump split is often in a state of shock, and does not make the most of his opportunities. The first step should be to search for a line of play that may bring home the contract. The second step should be to look for a better one.

title: A Battle of Ballots Before Election
description: Because a State Supreme Court justice held court yesterday in a downtown loft over the rhythmic clatter of a printing press, the FordCarter Presidential election mightjust mighttake place on time in New York City.

title: Buckley Accuses Moynihan of Shading His Positions; Moynihan Depicts Buckley as Casting Harmful Votes
description: James L. Buckley accused Daniel P. Moynihan of constantly shading his positions on issues.

title: Commodities: Copper Price Drop Hits Futures
description: The decision by two major copper refiners to cut their price by 4 cents a pound, to 70 cents, after last Wednesday's market close should not have surprised metal futures traders, but apparently it did, to judge by the declines in the last two sessions.

title: Card of Thanks
description: MARKOWITZMrs. Jacob deeply appreclates and gratefully acknowledges your kind expressions of sympathy on the loss of her dearly beloved husband Judge Jacob Markowitz.

title: 133YearOdl Church Restored; Faith and Ecumenism Get Credit
description: ZION, Oct. 10  When fire ruined the First Mount Zion United Methodist Church on March 2, 1975, it seemed dubious that the then 132yearold church could survive. Damage was estimated at 520,000. The church was down to nine members, who had operated on an annual budget of $1,500. Insurance on the building came to $5,000.

title: OnceCelebrated Moon Rocks Are HasBeens
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 8They were rock celebrities five years ago. People traveled hundreds of miles to see them. Politicans cozied up to be photographed beside them. Volumes were written ahout them. They were studied, oohed, analyzed and aahed.

title: Church Council Rejects Demand For Ouster of Archbishop Trifa
description: The governing board of the National Council of Churches ruled yesterday that it had no power to remove one of its members who had been accused of World War II crimes.

title: Deaths
description: BELKINSally. Devoted aunt of Lillian and Maurice Glucher, Leonore Kellrman and Ethel Marrow. Devoted mother of Eva Bronnor, and Harry. Dear sister of Albina Nassenteld. Sisterinlaw of Sadie Nassenfeld and adored grandmother. Services Monday, 1:30 P.M., at Schwartz Brothers Forest Park Chapels, Queens Blvd. and 76 Road, Forest Hills.

title: Stage: Long Ride on Streetcar
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Tennessee Williams has described Blanche Du Bois as both a moth and a tiger. Clearly, she is a doubleedged creature; she is flying headlong toward her destruction and at the same time she is desperately clawing for survival.

title: Saudi King in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Oct.10 (Reuters)King Khalid of Saudi Arabia today began a sixday state visit to Pakistan that Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto hopes will result in increased Saudi financial aid for his country. This is the King's first visit to this Moslem nation of 72 million people.

title: South's Colleges Rising to Parity, Studies Indicate
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 10Fifteen years ago, a blueribbon commission of Southern educators and public leaders compared the colleges and universities of their region with those elsewhere in the country and concluded that the hour is late, the gap to be overcome is substantial.

title: TV: Kia Stuff
description: With a mixture of new domestic series and British imports, public television is once again expanding the boundaries of quality television programming for young audiences.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 10 (AP)An angry mob punched, kicked and pulled the hair of the two top leaders of the women's peace movement here today, knocking one of them unconscious for a few minutes.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: REAGAN ADS FOR G.O.P. SET FOR TELEVISION
description: WASHINGTON. Oct, 9Ronald Reagan is to return to the television airwaves Monday in a new round of the earnest, slashing, silkysmooth campaigning that nearly denied President Ford the Republican nomination last summer.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Around the Nation
description: DETROIT, Oct. 10 (UPI)  Skilled tradesmen in the largest United Automobile Workers local voted today against a tentative contract with the Ford Motor Company, threatening to cancel the agreement that would end the 26dayold strike.

title: G.O.P. Congressman Say Colleagues Accepted Many Golf Invitations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (UPI)Representative Guy Vander Jagt of Michigan, the Republican Congressional campaign chairman, said today that he thinks all but a half dozen members of Congress have accepted corporate golfing invitations such as those taken by President Ford.

title: Hunt Takes U.S. Grand Prix With Lauda Third
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y.. Oct. 10James Hunt, the most flambuoyant English race driver since Stirling Moss came on the scene in the 1950's, dashed from behind today and won the 18th United States Grand Prix in characteristic style.

title: Colts Set Back Dolphins Behind Passes of Jones
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 10Bert Jones, the Colts' impressive young quarterback now enjoying his fourth season in pro football, fired the pigskin through the eye of the needle against the Miami defense today and led Baltimore to a 2814 victory over the Dolphins, who seem to be running out of steam and out of healthy players.

title: BEAME IS PREPARING DRASTIC CUTBACKS IN CITY'S SPENDING
description: Amid fears that its worst budget crises are yet to come, the Beame administration is refining a harsh new program of drastic cuts and other steps to produce nearly $500 million in savingsbeyond those achieved alreadyfor the year beginning next July 1.

title: Article 1  No Title
Reds Down Phils Again for 20 Lead
description: this time. Twice their outfielders threw to the wrong bases, twice they walked Joe Morgan intentionally to load the bases and pitch to Tony Perezat a total cost of three runs. But the big play of the game came after the first walk to Morgan in the sixth inning when Perez lashed a line drive that caromed high off Dick Allen's glove base.

title: RedsPhillies Scoring
Barman Slain in Jukebox Dispute
description: MARSEILLES, France, Oct. 10 (Reuters) A bartender who refused to turn down the jukebox was shot to death here today by an irate neighbor who burst into the bar and killed him with a shotgun, police said.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: BRUSSELSThere we were, economy class and soaring 40,000 feet above sea level, en route to Belgium, when the stewardess came to ask, May I serve you a cocktail?

title: Diane Mardinly Married To James Francis Jester
description: Diane Elyse Mardinly, daughter of Mrs. John Mardinly of Leonia, N. J., and the late Mr. Mardinly, was married yesterday afternoon to James Francis Jester, son of William J. Jester, also of Leonia, and the late Anna Mae Jester.

title: Kenneth Kay Weds Barbara J. Carroll
description: Barbara Jean Carroll, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Carroll of Hartsdale, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Kenneth L. Kay, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sol Kay of Philadelphia. The civil ceremony was performed at the Kay home.

title: Jet Crashes in Test; Pilots Safe
description: HOPE, N.M., Oct 10 (UPI)  An F111D jet aircraft on a test flight over southeastern New Mexico crashed and burned today on the eastbound lane of U.S. Route 82. The two crewmen ejected themselves safely.

title: Competition by Big Board With Amex Is Intensifying
description: Even as the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange study a possible merger, competition between the nation's two largest and most powerful securities exchanges is intensifying.

title: South's Colleges Rising to Parity, Studies Indicate
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 10Fifteen years ago, a blueribbon commission of Southern educators and public leaders compared the colleges and universities of their region with those elsewhere in the country and concluded that the hour is late, the gap to be overcome is substantial.

title: Spanish Unions Protest Curbs
description: MADRID, Oct 10 (Reuters)Spain's main illegal trade unions today denounced austerity measures announced by the Government on Friday and warned of possible strikes and demonstrations. The Communistled Workers Commissions said the measures, which would limit wage increases and allow employers greater freedom to dismiss workers, were an attempt by the Government to make the workers bear the cost of ending the country's economic crisis.

title: Noel Cheryl Bickford Wed To Peter Ely, Restaurateur
description: Noel Cheryl Bickford, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Frederick Bickford of Brooklyn and Ormond Beach, Fla., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Boris Ely, son of Mrs. Leopold Opper of Kew Gardens, Queens, and the late Wolfgang D. Ely. The Rev. Franklin Goldwaithe Sherrill of Grace Episcopal Church in Brooklyn performed the ceremony at the Box Tree Restaurant in Purdys, N. Y.

title: Scoring and Statistics of N.F.L. Games
description: AT ST. LOUIS

title: Maj. Gen. Charles Gerhardt, 81, Commanded 29th Infantry at DDay
description: WINTER PARK, Fla., Oct. 10 (AP)Maj. Gen. Charles H. Gerhardt, who commanded the landing of the 29th Infantry Division in Normandy on DDay, died of a heart attack here yesterday. He was 81 years old.

title: SOVIET CIVIL DEFENSE A CONCERN FOR NATO
description: LONDON, Oct. 7intelligence analysts in North Atlantic alliance governments have reported an expansion of the Soviet Union's ability to conduct and survive a nuclear war with the United States.

title: Labor: Arbitration Is Now Facing Trouble on Several Key Fronts
description: Arbitration, which has tripled in popularity in the last decade as a civilized method for resolving labormanagement disputes, is running into trouble on several important fronts.

title: Father of the Modern Submarine Commemorated by New Gravestone
description: TOTOWA, Oct. 10Never to receive proper recognition for his invention during his lifetime, John P. Holland, the father of the modern submarine, died here in 1914 in relative obscurity.

title: Laird Predicts That Ford Will Win Because of East Europe Remark
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 (UPI)Melvin R. Laird, one of President Ford's top campaign advisers, predicted today that the Ford mistake in saying Eastern Europe was not dominated by the Soviet Union would win the election for him.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLUMENTHALMimi, your birthday dear Mimi. Forever in my heart and thoughts with everlasting love, Shirley.

title: Bicentennial Schlock Spoofs Tradition
description: BUFFALO  Lest the Bicentennial glow too brightly in memory, Prof. Jesse Lemisch, a historian, has just created his monument to that interstate commerce, entitled Bicentennial Schlock.

title: Steelers Beaten by Browns, 1816, For Their Fourth Loss of Season
description: We've had our share of good luck over the last few years, and now it's going the other way, said Coach Chuck Noll of the Pittsburgh Steelers after an 1816 loss yesterday to the Browns at Municipal Stadium in Cleveland. The defeat was the fourth in five games for the Steelers, the Super Bowl champions in the last two National Football League seasons.

title: Cincinnati Goes 2 Up With FourRun 6th
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 10The Cincinnati Reds moved to within one game of their second straight pennant today when they overtook the Philadelphia Phillies in the late innings and mauled them, 62, for their second victory in two days in the National League playoff.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: U.S. and the E.E.C. Are Again Sparring Over Trade Grudges
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10The long smoldering trade dispute between the United States and the ninenation European Common Market over brandy and turkeys is in danger of flaring up again during the closing weeks of the Presidential campaign.

title: Presidential Mystique
description: LOS ANGELESThe day after the debate, President Ford spoke at the University of Southern California. The crowd was large and mostly friendly, and Mr. Ford was goodnatured with the students. When they gave him a football letterman's jacket, he put it on and said, I played so long ago that the hall was still round.

title: Fashion As Art: Canvas Is Silk
description: She came in on the wave of tiedyed fashions around 1970. Not that she made sloppy Tshirts or anything like that. Reiko's silk scarfs and accessories were little delicacies that reflected her art training. She followed them with custom dresses that brought her a larger circle of fans.

title: Sadaharu Oh Ties Ruth at 714
description: TOKYO, Oct. 10Sadaharu Oh, the handsome son of a Chinese noodle merchant, tied Babe Ruth's career home run record of 714 today with a 300foot shot over the rightfield fence in Korakuen Stadium here.

title: More Bangladeshis Eligible to Vote
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Oct. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)Bangladesh's new electoral rolls recorded more than 38 million eligible voters in the country today, an increase of 8.6 million since March 1973, when Parliamentary elections were first held.

title: APPOINTMENT OF HUA STILL UNCONFIRMED
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 10Prime Minister Hua Kuofeng appears to have been chosen chairman of the Chinese Communist Party to succeed Mao Tsetung, but there were signs of confusion and possible conflict in Peking today over his appointment and there was still no official announcement confirming it.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Scrantons Stage Coup With Country Elegance
description: DALTON, Pa., Oct. 9Secretary General Kurt Waldheim and the President of the Security Council, Iqbal Akhund of Pakistan, had a long serious chat on the couch as the other guests swirled around just out of hearing. Peter Florin of East Germany listened to the strolling musicians. Pearl Bailey, a regular adjunct to the United States mission to the United Nations, played with the children.

title: Article 2  No Title
Both Minish and Poekel Predict Victory in House Race
description: WEST ORANGE, Oct. 10The 11th Congressional District race pits a 28yearold Republican lawyer against a severterm Democratic veteran of the House of Representatives. But Charles Axel Poekel of Essex Fells is confident that he will unseat the popular Joseph G. Minish.

title: SecondGuessers Chip Away at Martin Over His Strategy
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 10Billy Martin blew kisses to the Royals fans razzing him from behind the Yankees dugout tonight, and some secondguessers thought the Yankee manager had also blown the game by not removing two lefthanded hitters, Carlos May and Oscar Gamble, against Paul Splittorff, a lefthanded reliever.

title: PolishAmericans Cheer As Carter Vows to Back Freedom for East Europe
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 10Jimmy Carter was hailed here tonight by PolishAmericans as he pledged to speak up for freedom in Eastern Europe if he is elected President.

title: Kibbee Is Planning to Restructure Administration of City University
description: Reorganization of the central administration of the City University of New York is being planned by the chancellor, Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, to meet criticism that his office has been too involved in daytoday operations and has not provided sufficient leadership.

title: Phillies' Box Score
description: ??Allen DP Cincianati 2 LOBCincinnati 5, Philadelphia 10 HRLuz?? (1) SBGriffry, SBoone, Lonborg, SPPerez

title: ABRAM SALOMON, 64; WAS ZIONIST LEADER
description: Abram Salomon, Zionist leader and executive vice president and administrative head of the Jewish National Fund of America, died of a heart attack Saturday night in his home at 165 East 66th Street. He was 64 years old.

title: Lebanon's Far South Hit by Artillery Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 10 (Reuters) Artillery exchanges were reported today from Lebanon's far south, so far barely touched by the country's protracted civil war.

title: Opponents of Martial Law Clash With Manila Police
description: MANILA, Oct. 10 (Reuters)Thousands of demonstrators led by militant Roman Catholic priests and nuns clashed with clubswinging policemen today in a protest over martial law in the Philippines.

title: Jets Win, Jolting Bills On a Kick
description: Big deal. All the Jets did yesterday was force the American Football Conference's leading passer to the bench, embarrass O. J. Simpson to the point where he hardly saw the ball the second half, and employ a hunch of new people who suddenly looked like superstars.

title: University of Mississippi Seeking Image as School for All People
description: OXFORD, Miss., Oct 10Of all the Southern colleges and universities torn by racial turmoil in the 1960's, none suffered through its intransigence so severely as the University of Mississippi.

title: Black Rhodesia Students Say Whites Can't Backtrack Now
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Oct. 10For Moses Zinyemba, who is president of the student council of the University of Rhodesia, the present bickering over the scheduled Geneva conference to give Rhodesia its first black majority government is interesting but not very important.

title: Robber Bridegroom Sparkles at Biltmore
description: One of the surprise Off Broadway hits of last season has now arrived on Broadway. It is a bright and lively musical, a sort of country and western fairytale called The Robber Bridegroom, which opened last night at the Biltmore Theater.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sergeants Balking At City Police Pact
description: Delegates of the Sergeants Benevolent Association, apparently uncertain about a proposed new work chart under which New York City would require police sergeants to work an additional 10 days a year, refused yesterday to ratify a tentative settlement that their leaders had reached with the Beame administration last Friday.

title: Thai Reversal; Firm Decisions
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 10The problem with Thailand for the past three years is that you never could get a decision, a longtime American businessman remarked here the other night, two days after Thailand's military authorities over threw the civilian Government. Now maybe we'll gel some decisions, he said. It would appear, from the early hours of Thailand's new military Government, that many decisions are being made.

title: Columbus Day
description: Today is Columbus Day, the 484th anniversary of the discovery of the New World. Schools, colleges, banks, post offices, courts and other New York City, state and Federal offices will be closed. There will be no regular sanitation pickups.

title: The Neutral Arab in Lebanon
description: CAIRO, Oct. 10Dr. Hassan Sabry alKholy, the Arab League mediator in Lebanon, said a few days ago that he was optimistic about the talks that began yesterday in Chtaura on the Lebanese civil war. Dr. Kholy is almost always otticiaily optimistic about the chances for peace, though the countless ceasefires he has arranged seldom last longer than the time it takes the warring parties to reload their weapons.

title: Pirates' Moose Killed in Crash On 29th Birthday
description: MARTINS FERRY, Ohio, Oct, 10 (AP) Bob Moose, a pitcher for the Pittsburgh Pirates, was killed here in a twocar accident last night on his 29th birthday.

title: NEWTON P. BEVIN
description: Newton P. Bevin, New York City architect who played a major role in the restoration of the town of Washington Depot, Conn., following the 1955 flood, died Saturday at Waterbury Hospital, Waterbury, Conn. He was 81 years old and lived in Southbury, Conn.

title: RATE DROP EXPECTED ON U. S. SECURITIES
description: There almost certainly will be no magic 8's this quarter, the First Pennsylvania Corporation predicted last week as it surveyed the Federal Government's financing needs for the next three months. Investors, who lined up to buy 8 percent notes and bonds as recently as August, will likely have to settle for lower interest rates when new Treasury securities are offered for sale this quarter, First Pennsylvania and other credit market analysts now believe.

title: Pastor of Largest Baptist Church Hails Ford and Denounces Carter
description: DALLAS, Oct. 10President Ford sat today in the congregation of the nation's largest Baptist Church and heard its influential pastor denounce the activities and words of Jimmy Carter, in what amounted to an endorsement of the Republican President.

title: 1,000 Evacuated at Ammonia Leak
description: EXETER, Calif., Oct. 10 (AP)About 1,000 people who gathered here last night for a fall festival and a football game had to leave the area when ammonia gas leaked from a nearby coldstorage line, officials said. Three firemen who helped repair the leak suffered lung irritation and were treated at a hospital and released.

title: MSGR. CYRIL COWDEROY
description: WEST MALLING, England, Oct 10, (Reuters)Msgr. Cyril Cowderoy, Roman Catholic Archbishop of Southwark, London, collapsed and died tonight shortly after celebrating mass here. He was 71. An acknowledged authority on canon law, he was ordained a priest in 1931, made a bishop in 1949, and archbishop in 1965.

title: Doctors Find Ford and Carter in Good Health, and Running Mates, Too, Though Less So
description: Physicians who have examined President Ford and Jimmy Carter have declared the candidates in good health for men of their age.

title: The U.N. Today
Spanish King to Visit Colombia
description: MADRID, Oct. 10 (Reuters)King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia left Spain for Colombia today to commemorate the 484th anniversary on Tuesday of the discovery of the New World by Christopher Columbus.

title: People and Business
description: As a first step toward economic recovery for Portugal, the Portuguese Government must carry out a substantial devaluation of the escudoa step the Government has repeatedly pledged It will not take.

title: New York City Officials Resume Talks With P.B.A. And the Sergeants' Union
description: City officials met separately yesterday with the leaders of the unions representing police officers and sergeants in yet another attempt to resolve differences over work schedules and other matters.

title: The Man o' War Stakes
Rumsfeld Cancels Coast Trip To Avoid Link With Ford Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (AP)Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld has canceled plans for trips to California and several other states to avoid the appearance of political activity, Pentagon officials said today.

title: Music Project Plays Concert at Marymount
description: The Music Project, which performed Sunday night at the attractive Marymount Manhattan Theater, is an ensemble of nine young musicians now in its second season of subscription concerts. As each member of the group plays a different instrument, it has set out to explore deserving but seldomheard works for unorthodox instrumental combinations. The idea makes good sense, but its execution Sunday left something to be desiredthough the playing wasn't bad, it wasn't very good, either.

title: New York City Aid Is a Key Issue In AlbanyArea State Senate Race
description: More than 140 miles of Hudson River separate New York City and Albany, but New York and its troubles have emerged as a major issue in a State Senate pace in the Albany arcs that is one of the most hotly contested legislative campaigns in the state.

title: East German Flees to the West After Swimming 18 Hours in Sea
description: LUEBECK, West Germany, Oct. 11 (UPI)An East German doctor fled to the West yesterday after swimming in the Baltic Sea for 18 hours, the West German border police said today.

title: PROFITS DROP 21.3% AT SAFE WAY STORES
description: Safeway Stores Inc., the nation's largest supermarket chain, reported yesterday its third successive quarterly decline in earnrings, while sales continued to reach record levels. Profits for the latest period were down 21.3 percent, bringing the drop for the nine months to 25.2 percent.

title: DORCAS OAKLEY CUMMINGS
description: Dorcas Oakley Cummings, an active Long Island conservationist, died Sunday night after a short illness of Columbia Presbyterian Hospital. She was 62 years old and lived on Laurel Hollow, SeyosL.I.

title: Columbus March Brings Out the Candidates
description: Politics marched along with the paraders yesterday as thousandsincluding President Ford's son Stephen and the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, Walter F. Mondalestepped up Fifth Avenue in bright, snappy weather to celebrate Columbus Day.

title: Policeman's Assailant Held
description: HADDONFIELD, Oct. 11 (UPI)  A Gloucester City man was held in the Camden County Jail today pending a hearing Oct. 20 on charges of trying to strangle a police officer with a shirt. The man, John D. Houser, 24 years old, was arrested yesterday outside a nude burlesque theater after he allegedly tried to strangle Haddon Township Patrolman Charles Gooley Jr., 34, of the Hadden Township force after the officer questioned him.

title: Hanley Awarded Auto Race
description: TRENTON, Oct. 11 (UPI)Joe Ruttman of Westland, Mich., finished first in the 150mile national latemodel championship stock car race today, but was dropped to last when his fuel cell was found to be 1.5 gallons over allowed capacity. Junior Hanley of Burlington, Ontario, won the $4.000 first prize and Ruttman collected $150.

title: Satyajit Ray's The Middleman Seen as His Most Sorrowful Work
description: Satyajit Ray's The Middleman, which will he shown at the New York Film Festival tonight at 9:30 and tomorrow at 6:15 P.M.. may well turn out to be the most sorrowful chapter in this extraordinary director's ongoing body of work about life in contemporary India.

title: Confident of Winning ReElection, Rodino Will Campaign for Carter
description: NEWARK, Oct. 11  Representative P??ter W. Rodino Jr. of the 10th Congressional District will be campaigning in the weeks ahead in Ohio, Illinois, Pennsylva?? and Massachusetts.

title: Accounting Board Proposes Rules For Companies in Computing Taxes
description: In a push for uniformity, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, the private sector's top rulemaking body on accounting, proposed detailed directions yesterday for companies to follow in computing incometax expense in quarterly reports.

title: Soviet Failure In Middle East
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 11The Soviet Union's failure so far to bring about a disengagement of its warring clients in Lebanon reflects the extent of the paralysis that is afflicting Soviet policy in the Middle East. In seeking to restrall a Syrian expeditionary force from decimating the Palestinians with Sovietsupplied arms, the Kremlin has found its influence in the region at its lowest point in many years. Even its recent call for a new Geneva peace conference on the Middle East has not noticeably improved its image.

title: ED WALLACE, NEWSMAN, FEATURE WRITER, DEAD
description: Ed Wallace, a feature writer for the old New York WorldTelegram and later for The WorldTelegram and Sun for 25 years and for The Daily News for nearly s decade, died of a heart attack on Sunday at the New York Veterans Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 5101 39th Avenue in Long Island City, Queens.

title: A Couple of Giants on the Spot: Arnsparger and Morton
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 11Andy Robustelli said again today that there was no thought at the moment of replacing Bill Arnsparger.

title: Newspapers Honored This Week
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (AP)President Ford today proclaimed Oct. 1016 as National Newspaper Week. He also set Oct. 16 as National Newspaper Carrier Day to salute newspaper deliverers.

title: Bar Reports Pressure by City Hall For Approval of Bench Candidate
description: Key members of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York feel that the Mayor's office is putting unusual pressures on them to approve a candidate for a Criminal Court appointment whom they have twice judged not qualified for the post.

title: Sadlowski, Rebel in Steel Union, Names Slate for February Election
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 11Edward Sadlowski, the rebel candidate for the presidency of the United Steelworkers union, named his slate today for the February election against that supported by the union's leadership.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: Bond Markets Remain Steady in Quiet Trading
description: The credit markets, mostly shut down for Columbus Day, remained stable yesterday in quiet trading. As traders waited for more normal activity to resume today, most seemed optimistic that interest rates would continue to decline

title: The President's Golf Partner
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11The recent disclosures about President Ford's golfing outings with lobbyist friends seem to have been pushed into the background as a political issue by the onrush of new campaign developments. But two problems raised by those disclosures remain unresolved. One is the ethical question of the acceptance of paid hospitality and other favors from lobbyists by public servants. The second problembroader and more subtle but at least as importantinvolves access to power.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Those Real Grievances
description: When the city's dissident police officers staged rowdy demonstrations or blocked traffic in recent days, they explained their behavior by saying that they had real grievances. At Yankee Stadium, on the evening of the Muhammad Ali fight, some of the police appeared to ignore or even encourage marauding teenagers whom they ordinarily, and quite properly, consider the enemy to be pursued and brought to justice. The members of those youth gangs, of course, also plead quite regularly that they have real grievances, and so they undoubtedly do

title: Turkish Coalition Performs Political Miracle: Surviving
description: ANKARA, TurkeyA Turkish official was asked recently to name his Government's main achievements during 18 months in office. Our first achievement was to last, he laughed, despite very pessimistic predictions.

title: Article 3  No Title
News Summary
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 12, 1976

title: PAUL LEVITAN
description: Paul Levitan, former director of special events for the CBS Television Network, died Oct. 1 in Roosevelt Hospital a week after undergoing heart surgery. He was 60 years old and lived at 1785 215th Street. Bayside, Queens.

title: 55 Arabs From the Gaza Strip Are Accused of Being Guerrillas
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 11 (AP)Israeli troops have detained 55 Arabs from the occupied Gaza Strip, accusing them of belonging to Palestinian guerrilla groups, the military command said today.

title: U.S. STEEL SIGNS ACCORD TO CURB PLANT'S FUMES
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 11  The United States Steel Corporation and state and county environmental agencies reached an agreement today to bring the Clairton Coke Works the world's largest, into compliance with pollution control laws.

title: Theater: Wheelbarrow C losers
description: Louis La Russo's new play Wheelbarrow Closers, which opened at the Bijou Theater last night, is a melodrama about the death of a salesman who has no particular wish to die. It is crudely written, obviously platted, but has a certain raw strength. But not enough.

title: Another 14Hour Day in the Life Of Buckley's Campaign Manager
description: It is 9:02 A.M. and Leonard Saffir turns to Liz Doyle. Is everybody gathered? he asks.

title: Study on Ethnic Neighborhoods To Be Made in Newark by U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (UPI)Newark is one of four cities in the country where the National Center for Ethnic Affairs will conduct research on how to develop ethnic neighborhoods, according to Federal officials.

title: Carter Seeks Ecologists' Support
description: ATLANTAThe Ford campaign is vague on environmental issues as a tactical weapon. But Carter strategists are using them as a relatively new device for corralling Republicans' votes.

title: 2d Trial of Rubin Carter Opens Today Amid Complications
description: Almost 10 years to the day after Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis were arrested for a triple murder, their second trial begins today in Jersey City amid speculation that more surprises will be produced in an already tangled legal and human drama.

title: Panel Backs Suffolk Policeman In Dispute on Psychiatric Visits
description: Alex Wasilewski, an East Hampton, L.I., policeman who was suspended because of questions regarding his consultations with a psychiatrist, has been cleared by the Suffolk County Civil Service Commission.

title: CHARLES BURR
description: Charles Burr, an editor at Columbia Records of the Columbia Broadcasting System, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 194 Riverside Drive.

title: Arab League Aide In Beirut Reports A New Agreement
description: CHTAURA, Lebanon, Oct. 11 (AP)Middlelevel talks among Lebanese, Palestinian and Syrian representatives led today to a new agreement for a ceasefire in the Lebanese civil war, the Arab League mediator, Dr. Hassan Sabry alKholy said.

title: Satoh Surveys Catfish and Ages
description: Best pitchers I ever saw, Satchel Paige was saying, was Slim Jones, Bob Feller, Dizzy Dean  people forget how hard Dizzy could throw.

title: Philippines Rice: a Promise for Tomorrow
description: LOS BANOS, The Philippines This lush, emeraldgreen agricultural center some 50 miles southeast of Manila is one of the three national attractions that this hospitable nation constantly recommends to visitors. The other two are the majestic new cultural  convention center on Manila Bay and the vibrant summerresort city of Bagulo in the north. The scenery alone of this impressive municipality at the base of Mount Makiling is one asset. The region also provides such features as medicinal hot springs, a vast agricultural branch of the University of the Philippines with a number of important research facilities, magnificent botanic gardens and the famed International Rice Research Institute.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Repair crews from the Consolidated Edison Company, augmented by specialized workmen from the New York State Electric and Gas Company, were concentrated in Westchester County to restore electricity in the remaining areas affected by Saturday's wind and rain.

title: STUDY IS UNDER WAY ON SCHOOL LUNCHES
description: A new effort is under way to improve the taste and quality of New York City school lunches as well as the efficiency of the muchcriticized multimilliondollar operation.

title: Callaghan Defends Economic Plan Amid Signs of More Pain to Come
description: LONDON, Oct. 11Britain's embattled Labor Government launched a major defense of its economic policies today amid indications that it was preparing further painful measures to reduce inflationary pressures.

title: Connee Boswell Is Dead at 68; Long a Popular Singer and Actress
description: Connee Boswell, one of the brightest stars in popular American music, died yesterday of cancer at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived at 101 Central Park West.

title: Brown & Williamson Raises Prices About 2c on Its Cigarette Brands
description: An increase of 75 cents per 1,000 in the list price of its Viceroy, Kool, Raleigh and Belair cigarette brands, effective tomorrow, was announced yesterday by the Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation.

title: Youth Held in Death of L.I. Baby
description: PATCHOGUE, L.I., Oct. 11 (AP)A 15yearold boy has been arrested here in connection with the death of a 19monthold infant, who was fatally beaten during the weekend, according to the Suffolk County police. The dead baby was identified as Angela Austin of Patchogue. The arrested youth, described as the boyfriend of infant's mother, Edith Harris, 21, was charged as a juvenile with firstdegree manslaughter.

title: Blunders, Mud and Similarity
description: Even as Gerald Ford was making his seemingly incredible pronouncements on Eastern Europe in his second debate with Jimmy Carter, it was not hard for a thoughtful listener to decipher what Mr. Ford meant to say. He wanted voters of Eastern European origins to know, in the spirit of Captive Nations Day, that as long as he was President he would never accept the domination of Eastern Europe by the Soviet Union as an irreversible fact, or as an organic relationship.

title: Soviet Factories Press the Industrialization of Agriculture
description: DUBOSSARI, U.S.S.R.On the distant horizon, across the lush, flowing Moldavian fields, a factorylike complex of barns, scaffolds and water towers rises up like the ungainly superstructure of a cargo ship. This is Zhivprom, the name given to a pragmatic innovation in Soviet farming. Zhivprom complex was created five two Russian words meaning livestock industry, is one of more than 6,000 enterprises that have been created across the country to consolidate, specialize and industrialize agriculture, an effort aimed at reducing the waste and inefficiency that have plagued Soviet farming for decades.

title: Wall Street Remains Optimistic Despite StockMarket Downturn
description: Although the stock market, as measured by the Dow Jones Industrial Average, plunged again yesterday, Wall Street professionals continued to speak optimistically about the future.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: 130 DEMOCRATS ARE GIVEN FUNDS FOR HOUSE RACES
description: WASHINGTON. Oct 11 (AP)The House Democratic leader, Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., has distributed $66,500 to help 130 Democrats try to win tough House election races, records show.

title: People in Sports
description: Fans of mayhem, who had been looking forward eagerly to the return of Dave Schultz to Philadelphia's Spectrum in the uniform of the Los Angeles Kings, were not disappointed Sunday night.

title: U.S. Decides to Sell Some Arms To Israel That It Blocked in Past
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11  President Ford has agreed to a longstanding Israeli request to lift the ban on the sale of some sophisticated American military equipment and to speed up the delivery of other equipment already approved, Administration and Israeli officials said today.

title: Bank to Be New York's Pay Agent
description: Not quite a year ago several hundred embittered holders of New York City notes lined up in the Comptroller's office to collect interest payments. They saw themselves as victims of the city's fiscal crisis and legislation that had mandated a moratorium on note redemption. They bemoaned their fate.

title: Youth Wins $1,000 a Week for Life In First New York Instant Lottery
description: A 19yearold, $60aweek gas station attendant from Watertown, N. Y., last night became the first winner of the $1,000aweekforlife top prize in the New York State Instant Lottery.

title: Mexicans Dedicating $24 Million Shrine to Indian Virgin
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 11In a country where the Government is formally atheist and the church has frequently been persecuted, the inauguration of a new Basilica of Guadalupe here tomorrow is evidence of the continued strength of Catholicism and, in particular, of the cult of the Virgin Mary.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board is considering a proposal for a accounting change on troublesome hank loans, Page 51.

title: Bridge:
description: About two decades ago, Roger Trezel, a great French playerwriter and former world champion, wrote a series of monographs on different areas of play with a collection of fine illustrative deals. These have now been translated and updated by Terence Reese, with publication here by Frederick Fell. The quality is high, but so unfortunately is the price. Even allowing for the current inflation in publishing costs, $2.95 for a 60page paperback is hard to stomach. A nickel for each page of text is a record.

title: U.S. Decides to Sell Some Arms To Israel That It Blocked in Past
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11  President Ford has agreed to a longstanding Israeli request to lift the ban on the sale of some sophisticated American military equipment and to speed up the delivery of other equipment already approved, Administration and Israeli officials said today.

title: Car of Thanks
description: KUPPERFred. Mr. and Mrs. Irving Kuper, parents of the late Fred Kuper. wish to sincerely thank their many friends and relatives for their very Generous and kind expressions of sympathy in their recent bereavement.

title: Jimmies For All Occasions
description: Ladies and gentlemen, our guests today are Jimmy Carter, the Democratic candidates for President. I cannot help but observe, Mr. Carter, that there are three of you. Would you please introduce yourselves to the audience?

title: Books of The Times
description: ADOLF HITLER. By John Toland 1,035 pages. Illustrated. Doubleday. $14.95.

title: Vietnamese Workers Party Sets Fourth Congress, First Since 1961
description: HANOI, Vietnam, Oct. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)The fourth congress of the Vietnamese Workers Party will be hold in Hanoi from Dec. 11 to Dec. 20, the party's central committee has announced. The last party congress was in 1961.

title: Jersey's Second Nuclear Plant Scheduled for a Test This Fall
description: NEWARK, Oct. 11 (UPI)  New Jersey's second nuclear power plant, now under construction at Hope Creek, will be tested this fall by the Public Service Electric and Gas Company.

title: ECONOMISTS' GROUP FORESEES INCREASE OF 4.8% IN THE G.N.P.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 11Despite a slowdown in the economy in recent months, business economists meeting here this week predicted in their annual forecast a steady expansion in the economy through the middle of next year.

title: Burma and Cuba Establish Ties
description: RANGOON, Burma, Oct. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)Burma has established diplomatic relations with Cuba, it was announced here today.

title: The Tories Close Ranks
description: Britain's Conservative Party has finally bridged the gap threatening its election prospects and tarnishing its credibility. Former Prime Minister Edward Heath has declared his complete confidence in the capacity of Margaret Thatcherwho supplanted him as Conservative leader 20 months agoto take the difficult decisions necessary for rejuvenating the British economy.

title: David Storey's The Farm Is Family Play About Forces That Hold People Together
description: David Storey's The Farm, which opened Sunday at the Circle Repertory Company, is a family play. With deep understanding send affection, it illuminates the forces beyond love that hold people together. The family, as one of the characters describes it, is an enormous corporeal presence, supplying for each of the characters a certain sustenance, support or excuse for inertia.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Oct. 11, 1976

title: JACK POSER
description: Jack Poser, a fur merchant for 64 years, died Sunday at University Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at the Hampshire House, 150 Central Park South.

title: MixedSports Rule Tightened in Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 12Eight white rugby players participated with 22 blacks in a club match yesterday, and the Government threatened to prosecute them.

title: Junta in Thailand Orders Purges in Civilian and Military Ranks, and Forms Panel to Write New Constitution
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 11Thailand's new military junta today ordered a series of purges of civilian ministries and the military establishment itself. The purges are expected to have farreaching consequences for the way Thailand is governed.

title: All 95 Aboard Die as Indian Airliner Crashes on Takeoff From Bombay
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, Oct. 12 (AP)An Indian Airlines Caravelle jet en route to Madras crashed just after takeoff from Bombay's Santa Cruz Airport early today, killing all 89 passengers and six crew members, India's national news agency Camacher reported.

title: COL. ROLLIN B. DURBIN
description: Col. Rollin B. Durbin, U.S.A. retired, who at one time was commanding officer of Fort Hamilton in Brooklyn, died Sunday at Bay Pines Hospital, St. Petersburg, Fla. He was 63 years old and a resident of St. Petersburg.

title: ARKANSAS GOVERNOR TO CURB STATE'S AID
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 11Gov. David H. Pryor proposed today a massive shift of responsibility from state to local governments in Arkansas.

title: Connecticut Candidates on Own, With No Bandwagons or Coattails
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 7Connecticut politicans feel they are more or less on their own in their election campaigns this year. The Presidential race is not exactly a rollicking one. There are no bandwagons moving fast enough to hr worth ?? onto, no national figures unpopular enough to hurl abuse at for very log.

title: Royals Name Hassler for Game 3 Here
description: Twelve years to the day after they last played a postseason game at Yankee Stadium, the Yankees match their throwin against the Kansas City Royals' throwaway tonight in the third and perhaps pivotal game of the American League playoffs.

title: MAN ARRESTED IN KILLING OF HIS FIANCEE ON OCT. 4
description: A 25yearold Brooklyn man was arrested last night and charged with having slashed the throat of his fiance, killing her, on the night of Oct. 4.

title: Belmont Racing
Trouble  Shooting Is Zuccotti's Forte
description: I have absolutely the highest respect for him in every way, said Howard Moss, the director of communications of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, the other day.

title: Dividends
FORD CAMPAIGN UNIT CALLS CARTER MEAN
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11A group of President Ford's political counselors accused Jimmy Carter today of intemperate and overly aggressive behavior in the Presidential campaign. Some of them left the impression they hoped Mr. Ford would show increased aggressiveness himself.

title: Help Hospitals to Help
description: The private, nonprofit memberhospitals of the United Hospital Fund of New York still serve the public with highquality care. In its 98th annual campaign, the fund is asking the public to show how much they care about the work being done by these hospitals by generously supporting the appeal, which is the only one of its type specifically for hospitals. Money is distributed to the 52 member hospitals of the fund on the basis of their community services. Smaller amounts are allocated to specific hospital projects that seek better methods of delivering patient care. Give generously to the United Hospital Fund. 3 East 54th Street, New York, N. Y. 10022.

title: Michigan Wins First New York Canoe Cup
description: MINISINK FORD, N.Y., Oct. 11Shaking with exhaustion and shivering with cold after capsizing in the icy Delaware River rapids, a twoman canoe team from Michigan today was the first to cross the finish line here in the first of what is hoped to he a major annual professional whitewater race.

title: Dr. Sussman Given a Well Done At a Health Group's First Roast
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, Oct. 11Dr. Oscar B. Sussman, the director of the state's Consumer Health Services, was roasted tonight at the Westmount Country Club in West Paterson in the first such event sponsored by the New Jersey Environmental Health Association.

title: Chamber Orchestra Organized For Soviet Refugees in U.S.
description: An ensemble of 15 players to be known as the New Russian Chamber Orchestra has been organized under the direction of Joel Spiegelman. Most of the musicians in the group are Soviet Jews who have recently emigrated to this country, and the purpose of the ensemble is to maintain a unit that continues the Russian stringplaying tradition.

title: From Dancing Clouds and Little Frogs to Life at Stage Center
description: As she has every fall for more than half a century, Anita Zahn opened dance classes this year, once again encouraging her students to move like frogs, fog, rain, snow and other images she has used to get two or three generations of students dancing. Oh, I remember cloud, said Mary King, who was her student 32 years ago and whose daughter Ellie, age 5, was having her tirst lesson. I had a white scarf. You could be a dark, gray cloud, a storm cloud and have a gray scarf.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The White Motor Company of Cleveland said yesterday that its board's audit committee had found an additional $128,000 in questionable payments in connection with obtaining foreign government business.

title: LLOYD COE DIES AT 77; ILLUSTRATOR AND PAINTER
description: Lloyd Coe, an illustrator, painter and cartoonist, died Sunday of a heart attack at the Addison Gilbert Hospital in Gloucester, Mass. He was 77 years old and lived in Rockport. Mass.

title: Columbus March Brings Out the Candidates
description: Politics marched along with the paraders yesterday as thousandsincluding President Ford's son Stephen and the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, Walter F. Mondalestepped up Fifth Avenue in bright, snappy weather to celebrate Columbus Day.

title: BRITAIN IS CONFIDENT ON RHODESIA PARLEY
description: LONDON, Oct. 11British officials expressed optimism today that the planned conference to set of up transition government in Rhodesia remained on track despite demands by blacks for a postponement of the meeting and immediate transfer to black majority rule.

title: PAUL SORVINO TO REPLACE TOPOL IN BAKER'S WIFE
description: The show, now midway through a stand at the Kennedy Center, is scheduled to open in New York at the Martin Beck Theater on Nov. 21.

title: Meadowlands
First Japan Woman Minister Dies
description: OSAKA, Japan, Oct. 11 (Reuters)Masa Nakayama, the first woman cabinet minister in Japan, died of cancer today at the age of 85. She was Welfare Minister from July to December 1960.

title: FRENCH NOW FAVOR IMPROVED CONTROL OF NUCLEAR SPREAD
description: PARIS, Oct. 11France announced major changes today in its attitude toward the export of nuclear facilities for peaceful purposes, indicating a new willingness to cooperate with the United States in seeking to prevent the use of such equipment for the making of atomic weapons.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT An opportunity exists today to see how a major American painter developed; how he moved from painting people (as in his The Dispossessed of 1940), to painting lines (as in his Composition I of 1945), to painting splashes of color (as in his Arrival and Departure of 1963).

title: MANDEL TRIAL TOLD OF RACETRACK DEAL
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 11Federal prosecutors began today the second phase of their case against Gov. Marvin Mandel in Federal District Court here, seeking to show how political associates of the Governor had benefited by his official actions.

title: $12.5 Million Was Spent on Drive To Win the Nomination for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (UPI)President Ford's effort to win the Republican nomination cost his campaign $12.5 million through the end of last month, with some bills still outstanding.

title: Dollar and Gold Rise in European Trading
description: LONDON, Oct. 11 (AP)The dollar rose on most European money markets today, hitting its highest level in nearly two months in Paris, where it closed at 4.9715 francs against 4.95625 Friday. Gold prices edged up in London and Zurich, the main bullion centers, to $114.875 an ounce from $114.125 on Friday.

title: State Studies Find No Major Impact
description: A law that went into effect in New York late last January aimed at preventing compliance with the Arab boycott against Israel by companies in the state apparently has had little effect on industry and trade in the state and New York City.

title: Eastern Europe Reconsidered
description: The recent exchange between President Ford and Governor Carter on the subject of Eastern Europe will have had some use if it encourages Americans to take a serious look at the actual situation in that complex area. By coincidence the present political furor comes exactly 20 years after the series of convulsions in Eastern Europe that threatened Soviet hegemony.

title: MOYNIHAN EXAMINES STATEMENT BY FORD
description: Daniel P. ??ynihan, the DemocraticLiberal candi??e for United States Senator from New York, said yesterday that President Ford's widely heard comment that the Soviet Union does not dominate Eastern Europe was not a mistake but an unwitting revelation by the President of what is in fact the guiding principle of AmericanSoviet relations.

title: BUILDING SUPERINTENDENT FELLS RAPIST WITH KARATE
description: A 33yearold Queens woman who was slashed and raped by a knifewielding attacker in her Forest Hills apartment house late Sunday night may owe her life to a karate kick with which the building's superintendent put the intruder to flight, the police reported yesterday.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Oct. 11A decision already seems to have been made to allow glass manufacturers and utilities in South Jersey to continue to burn highsulfur fuel oil until next summer.

title: Attendance Mark Set in Baseball Is Deceptive
description: Major league baseball attendance in the 1976 regular season reached a record total of 31,320,592, about 1,200,000 above the previous high set in 1973.

title: Indeterminate Sentences May Be Yielding to Fixed Terms as Faith in the Prison Reform System Wanes
description: Indeterminate prison sentences, the kind that range from, perhaps five years to life for a criminal conviction, may be losing ground to a new trend in penology, the fixed sentence.

title: A Thinker's Thinker Is Honored Belatedly
description: MILFORD, Pa., Oct. 10  In a moving act of piety, a busload of philosophers came here today to honor Charles Sanders Peirce (18391914), one of the most original and versatile thinkers ever produced in the Americas.

title: Nancy Trask Wed to Keith Highet, a Lawyer
description: The marriage of Nancy Blair Trask, an interior designer, to Keith Highet, a partner in the New York law firm of Curtis, MalletPrevost, Colt & Mosle, took place in Englewood, N.J., yesterday afternoon. The Rev. John W. Van Zanten performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church.

title: Borg Beats Laver, 63, 75; Miss Goolagong Is Victor
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Oct. 11 (AP)Evonne Goolagong and Bjorn Borg advanced to the singles semifinals of the World Invitational tennis tournament today

title: Children Supply Roar of Crowd at Track
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Oct. 11Come on come on, the young voices screamed at the Meadowlands Racetruck this morning Come on, come on.

title: Trotskyists See Party as Force In '76 Election
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 11More than a century after the Liberty and Free Soil Parties were active, Peter Camejo sees himself as the political heir of their abolitionist candidates: They knew they couldn't win the office, but they posed the issue of slavery in a way the other parties could no longer ignore.

title: A 241 Shot Captures Man o' War
description: Whatever odds Christopher Columbus faced, they couldn't have been much longer than those on the top finishers in yesterday's $112,500 Man o' War Stakes at Belmont Park.

title: Nets Beaten by Sonics
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 11 (AP)The New York Nets, still without Julius Erving, lost to the Seattle SuperSonics, 10398, last night in a National Basketball Association exhibition game.

title: Met Opens 92d Season With Crowds and Splendor
description: The Metropolitan Opera returned in splendor last night, opening its 92d season with TI Trovatore, celebrated people in the audience and the kind of glamour that occasionally attends culture in New York.

title: Beame Trouble Shooter Hits Bull'sEye
description: I have absolutely the highest respect for him in every way, said Howard Moss, the director of communications of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, the other day.

title: Week's Steel Output Drops 2.2 Percent
description: Domestic steel production for the week ended Saturday fell to its lowest level since the second week of this year, the American Iron and Steel Institute said Yesterday.

title: Brooklyn G.O.P. Leader, A Reagan Backer, Tells Of Snubs by Ford Camp
description: George L. Clark Jr., the Brooklyn (Breezy leader, plans to be fishing at IBreezy Point today when President Ford (makes three campaign stops in Brooklyn, the President's first campaigning in New York State.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Soybean Prices Fall, Depressing Grains After Leslie Report
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 11 (AP)Soybean futures declined the permissible limit for one session today and generally triggered price declines for nearly all of the major commodities on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: A Chance To See Hunting Dogs at Work
description: Owners of versatile hunting dogs will converge at Calverton, L.I., this Saturday and Sunday to take part in a clinic and field test designed to show them what may be expected of their animals in the field.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of today's baseball playoff games will be given over WQXR, on its news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: 2 Hunters Killed in Accident
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Oct. 11 (AP)Two Canandaigua men were killed over the weekend in separate hunting accidents near here, sheriff deputies in Ontario County reported. One of the hunters, Timothy Murphy, 16 years old, was shot in the head Sunday afternoon while hunting with three companions in the Town of Gorham. The other, Ernest Forbes, 25, was fatally shot in the neck while hunting in the Town of Hopewell.

title: DOW DROPS BY 11.56 TO 940.82, LOWEST SINCE JAN. 16 CLOSE
description: The stock market, beset by the twin worries of a slowing economic recovery and accelerating inflation, posted a broad decline yesterday in slower trading.

title: Anniversaries
description: KAPLANHerb, Happy Anniversary darling, Thank you for 30 Wonderful years. YOUR OWN EVY

title: Mao's Widow, 3 Shanghai Radicals Reported Held for Plotting Coup
description: PEKING, Tuesday, Oct. 12Chinese citizens are being told that the widow of Chairman Mao Tsetung and the three leading radicals from Shanghai have been purged from their positions, according to information separately reaching three embassies in Peking.

title: Companies List Their Earnings Results
description: For periods ended Sept. 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indicates stock Is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) over the counter.

title: FRENCH NOW FAVOR IMPROVED CONTROL OF NUCLEAR SPREAD
description: PARIS, Oct. 11France announced major changes today in its attitude toward the export of nuclear facilities for peaceful purposes, indicating a new willingness to cooperate with the United States in seeking to prevent the use of such equipment for the making of atomic weapons.

title: Egypt Dooms Man in Bomb Trial
description: CAIRO, Oct. 11 (Reuters)A military court today sentenced one man to death and another to 25 years at hard labor for planting bombs in a city center office complex in August, the Middle East News Agency reported. Fourteen people were injured in the explosions.

title: To Northwest, Race for Presidency Seems Far Off and Disappointing
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 10The distinctive quality of the Presidential campaign here is its remoteness. Neither major candidate commands a personal following of any magnitude and the only consistent feeling the campaign has inspired so far is one of disappointment.

title: PERSONAL RUMORS NEGATED BY CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11Unsubstantiated rumors about Jimmy Carter's personal life became a major topic of discussion today in political and journalistic circles around the country.

title: Mystery Disease III
description: The year 1976 will undoubtedly go into the records as a vintage year for mysterious diseases.

title: Blacks Urged to Form Local Groups to Fight Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11A Justice Department official is urging black citizens in crimeridden neighborhoods in inner cities to start their own community crime commissions in an effort to spearhead a grassroots campaign against violence.

title: Former Canadian Judge Dies
description: MAPLE RIDGE, Canada, Oct. 12 (AP)A former Justice of the Exchequer Court, Thomas Grantham Norris, whose investigations led to the expulsion of Hal Banks as president of the Seafarers International Union in 1963 after allegations of corruption, died Saturday at the age of 83.

title: Article 2  No Title
Katt Is Given Task of Stopping Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 11The National League playoff series switched today to the banks of the Ohio, where it will be resumed tomorrow afternoon with 37yearold Jim Kaat of the Philadelphia Phillies standing on the mound between the Cincinnati Reds and their fourth pennant in seven years.

title: U.S. Says Waldheim Is Yielding to Pressure on Jobs in U.N. Secretariat
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 11The United States criticized Secretary General Kurt Waldheim today for yielding to pressures from governments seeking United Nations lobs for unqualified candidates.

title: CHARLES HASTINGS DEAD; INVENTOR AND ENGINEER
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., Oct. 11 CAP)Charles Edwin Hastings, 62 years old, an inventor of precision instruments, former government research engineer and president and cofounder of the Teledyne HastingsRaydist Company of Hampton, Va., died of a stroke here yseterday.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, OCTOBER 12, 1976

title: Article 1  No Title
TV: Plaintiffs and Defendants
description: Peter is in his early 40's, a moderately successful lawyer with a sensible wife preoccupied with her teaching, a 16yearold son who infuriates him by not fully appreciating the films of Jean Renoir, and a young, emotionally unbalanced mistress he is trying to dump as delicately as possible. Peter plays squash with younger men to prove the continuing comfort of his own youthfulness. He listens to the shabby affairs of his clients with a kind of objective disgust. Peter is bored and afraid. He is the typical Simon Gray hero, played by Alan Bates, the quintessential Simon Gray actor.

title: DELIBERATIONS DUE ON KALLINGER CASE
description: HACKENSACK, Oct. 11When the jury begins deliberations in the Joseph Kallinger murder case tomorrow, it will have psychiatric tesitmony to consider that varies greatly from the psychiatric testimony studied last year by a Pennsylvania jury that convicted the Philadelphia cobbler of robbery.

title: Sports Illustrated Sets Special Issue
description: Sports Illustrated, the athletic entry from Time Inc. is planning the first special issue in its 22year history. Expected to be out Feb. 21, it will be a history of the year in sports in pictures and will cover the sports year ending after the Super Bowl rather than the calendar year.

title: Article 4  No Title
NBC Sets Up 4 Interviews With John W. Dean 3d This Week
description: NBC News has scheduled a set of four exclusive interviews this week with John Dean 3d, former counsel to President Nixon and a principal witness in the Watergate trials, to discuss his newly published book, Blind Ambition: The White House Years.

title: Market Place
description: Investors bet on the future. Thus, when a company with a reasonably good record suddenly sends up a shower of sparks, it commands attention in Wail Street.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey offered some campaign advice to his long time protg, Senator Walter F. Mondale, during the Democratic VicePresidential nominee's visit yesterday to the bedside of his fellow Minnesota Senator at Sloan Kettering Hospital in New York. Senator Mondale was allowed 15 minutes, even though the cancersurgery patient was not supposed to be receiving visitors. He said that Senator Humphrey looked very, very good and was anxious to get back on the campaign trail. The advice was offered on how Senator Mondal should answer President Ford's debate statement concerning the autonomy of Poland and other countries from the Soviet Union.

title: Universal Leaf Rebuffs Congoleum
description: The board of directors of the Universal Leaf Tobacco Company, meeting yesterday in Richmond, unanimously rejected an offer by the Congoleum Corporation to purchase the company. On Friday, Congoleum proposed a cash purchase of the common shares at $32.50 each and the preferred shares at $138. The transaction was valued at $153 million. Gordon L. Grenshaw, president of Universal Leaf, said then that the Congoleum offer did not appear to be in the best interests of his company.

title: Rams' Poor Play Helps the 49ers To a 160 Victory
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct, 11An amazing performance by the San Francisco 49er defense, which held the Los Angeles R??ns scoreless at home for the first time in 27 years, produced an upset 1??0 victory tonight, which put the ?? in first place in the National Football Conference's Western Division.

title: Chutist Drowns in First Jump
description: CANTON, Ohio, Oct. 11 (AP)Susan Sweda of West Alles, Wis., making her first parachute jump, missed the landing area yesterday and drowned in 30 feet of water in a rock quarry near here, sheriff's deputies said. Roger Conley, the jump master, told the police that Miss Sweda, who was 27 years old, made no attempt to open her flotation gear when she began drifting toward the water.

title: Linda Hopkins of Bessie and Me Right in Character
description: I'm not disciplined, really, on stage. I could be if I have to, but I don't find it necessary. I do play around with this show. People can come back and see something different. And they do come back.

title: Panel Opposes Sports Wagering
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11 (AP)States could not be competitive with illegal bookies if wagering on sports events were legalized, says the National Gambling Commission.

title: Falcons Oust Campbell and Name Peppler Coach
description: It doesn't rain but it pours.

title: Fire Kills 3 Migrant Workers
description: MEADOW, N. C., Oct. 11 (UPI)A fire that swept through a house last night claimed the lives of three migrant workers who had moved in last week. Gerald Coley, Johnston County coroner, said they had been tentatively identified as Rebecca Bettel, 46 years old, of Florida, Kendry Taylor, 35, of New York and Clarence Pettiway, 44, of Beaufort.

title: Blacks Insist on Share Of Canal Boom in South
description: EPES, Ala.The black man will never amount to anything as long as he continues to sop his bread in the white man's leftover gravy, said Frank L. Cook, a wiry farmer. The black man must make his own gravy.

title: Advertising
description: Things are getting nuts, said Faith Popcorn speaking about the world in which we live. The changes are so fast it's beginning to freak me out, pesonally.

title: Around the Nation
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Oct. 11 (UPI)Racial violence that left two persons dead and 12 injured at the Nevada Maximum Security Prison yesterday spread briefly today to the Medium Security Prison.

description: The Metropolitan Opera returned in splendor last night, opening its 92d season with Il Trovatore,. celebrated people in the audience and the kind of glamour that occasionally attends culture in New York.

title: 10 Guerrillas and 10 Civilians Are Killed in Rhodesia Fighting
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Oct. 11 (AP)Ten black guerrillas and 10 civilians have been killed in an upsurge in fighting in Rhodesia, the government reported today.

title: Deaths
description: AGSARVehan, on Oct. 10, 1976. Beloved mother of Sara Chemenian and George Agsar, dear grandmother of Arlene Viafora, Dorothy Chemenian and Ell Assaf. Visiting Wednesday, 7 to 9 P.M., at Edward D. Jamie Funeral Chapel, 14126 Northern Blvd., Flushing. Funeral Thursday, 10 A.M., at the Armenian Church of the Holy Martyrs.

title: Sketches of the 4 Shanghai Radic als Reportedly Seized by Peking
description: Following are sketches of the four Shanghai radicals reported arrested for plotting a coup in China.

title: JULIUS EASTMAN SINGS, PLAYS PIANO AT ENVIRON

title: U.S. Women Maintain Lead in Trot Series
description: YONKERS. Oct. 11A woman won last night's fourth race at Yonkers Raceway. The Italian and American women's driver championship, which is being held at five tracks, came to Yonkers tonight and when the fourth race ended, the point standings remained almost the same.

title: New U.S. Rules Forcing New York Relief Costs Up

title: Manufacturers Hanover Branch Finding Rumania a Willing Host
description: The Rumanian Government officials were unusually cordial during the banquet held three years ago for their American guests, but the visiting bankers from Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company did not realize how friendly they really were. When the chairman of the foreign trade bank leaned over to William G. Blake, a senior vice president, and asked if he'd ever thought of opening a branch in Rumania, Mr. Blake replied, You mean a representative office, don't you?

title: Mao's Widow, 3 Shanghai Radicals Reported Held for Plotting a Coup
description: PEKING, Tuesday, Oct. 12The widow of Chairman Mao Tsetung and three other radicals have been arrested and charged with plotting a coup, according to mounting evidence in Peking.

title: Carter Marches, Daley Rules and Confusion Reigns

title: 5 Children Die in Fire
description: MONROE, Ga., Oct. 11 (UPI)Four girls and a boy were killed in an early morning house fire today. State officials were investigating arson as the possible cause. The parents, Mr. and Mrs. James E. Thomas. escaped. The dead Thomas children were identified as Jeanette, 18 years old; Cynthia, 15; Steven, 12; Karen, 9, and Allison, 5.

title: Marconi's Widow Dies, 95
description: ROME, Oct. 12 (AP)Beatrix O'Brien, the divorced wife of Guglielmo Marconi, the developer of wireless telegraphy, died yesterday at the age of 95. The two were married in 1905 and divorced in 1924. Marconi died in 1937.

title: New California Law Irks Businesses
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 11California bankers and businessmen are confused and, in some cases, angered by a tough new law that will prohibit California businesses from acting as intermediaries in the economic boycott of Israel.

title: World News Briefs
description: UMTATA, South Africa. Oct. 11 (AP)Two black actors, John Kani and Winston Ntshona, have been arrested by the security police in the Transkei Homeland. the region's Minister of Justice, George Matanzima, said today.

Stone appointed a young Justice Department lawyer named J. Edgar Hoover to clean up an agency riddled with corruption and to get it out of the business of investigating people's political views.

title: Fashion, Straight From the Shoulder
description: Necklines continue to plunge for evening, and some rise high, mandarinstyle. To make rules in fashion these days is risky, and uniforms are out.

Washington Unable to Spend Funds As Rapidly as It Planned This Year
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 11The Government has found itself unable to spend money this year as rapidly as it had planned, and many economists are beginning to think that this shortfall in Federal spending is one of the main reasons why the economic recovery shows signs of weakening.

title: The Ecstasy of Delta Blues
description: Mississippi Delt blues is musical language involving sophisticated rhythrhic concepts, a flexible but very deliberate treatment of pitch, and a definite harmonic and timbral esthetic that dictates what sort of chord combinations and colors are and are not apropos. Imitators may master one or more aspects of the vocabulary, but they do not seem to be able to speak the language idiomatically.

title: Gavazzeni Leads Vital Trovatore
description: It's still one of the glamorous musical events, especially when things went as well as they did last night. The Metropolitan Opera opened its season with its handsome production of Verdi's perennial favorite, II Trovatore. This is Attilio Colonnello's 1969 setting, with its Gaudi baroque, colorful costumes, and evocations of a vanished Spain; and it is Nathaniel Merrill's skillful production, where every mood rings true, where masses of choristers are splendidly deployed and where all is pointed at the denouement.

title: Ellis Struggles, Cheats,
description: Dock Ellis, the man famous for complaining about his manager last year, did nothing but complain about himself last night. He even called himself a cheater.

description: You don't wear a Gres outfit to Gres fashion show.

title: Retired Civil Judge Loses in Bid For High Court Hearing on Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 (AP) A retired New Ynrk City Civil Court judge. Fred G. Morin, today lost his bid for Supreme Court hearing on his civil rights suit. against several officials and The Daily News.

title: Flu Program in the New York Area Not Affected by Pittsburgh Deaths
description: New York City health officials pressed ahead with the first day of the mass swine flu immunization program yesterday despite reports during the day that three elderly persons had died in Pittsburgh after receiving their flu vaccinations.

title: Owner Seeking A Way to Save Gershwin Home
description: When George Gershwin's family moved to 242 Snediker Avenue, just before the turn of the century, East New York was a suburb. Today it is a slum and the neat, solidlooking house in Brooklyn is surrounded by charred ruins of burntout buildings. At night, junkies, seeking shelter in abondoned houses, often set the buildintts on fire.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12For the second straight year, the Consumer Product Safety Commission will not be publishing a list of unsafe toys, much to the disappointment of several members of the commission's board of independent consumer advisers.

title: ECONOMIC ADVISER DOUBTS CARTER AIM ON CUT IN INFLATION
description: Prof. Lawrence R. Klein, Jimmy Carter's principal economic adviser, said last night that Mr. Carter's goal of lowering inflation to 4 percent by 1980 was not realistic and that Carter economics would actually increase inflation temporarily.

description: HONG KONG, Oct. 12Prime Minister Hua Xuofeng has been appointed Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party, succeeding Mao Tsetung, an official Chinese spokesman in Peking confirmed tonight, as reports continued to spread that four senior leftist leaders had been arrested.

The Americans, who clash with Mexico in Pueblo on Friday, are undefeated and in better shape than in the previous two games in which they tied Canada and Mexico in the homeandaway series.

description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Oct. 16 (Reuters)  The Government has announced measures to discourage foreign students from marrying New Zealanders as a way of obtaining permanent residence here.

Horan, has singled out the case of a 31yearold Queens woman who, together with her five children and paramour, has managed to collect $88,268.17 in benefits over the last five and onehalf years, including nearly $18,000 last year alone.

title: 10 Held as Illegal Aliens
description: Ten migrant laborers were arrested as illegal aliens on a farm in Elk Township. Agents of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service and the local police made the arrests at A.M. at Shover's Farm. Authorities said they believed the men, between 19 and 45 years of age, had been in the United States since last March after having sneaked across the Rio Grande from Mexico. Thee, apparently moved to Florida and than found work in New Jersey.

J., Oct. 12 (AP)A student at the Sussex County VocationalTechnical High School was killed and five other persons, including four occupants Gf her car, were hcspitalized yesterday in headon crash on White Lake Road, the plice said. Laura A. McConnell, 17 years eld of Sparta was killed in the collision of her car with a jeeptype vehicle driven by Dennis Filipkowski, 28 of Oak Ridge. Mr. Filipkowski and the the four occupants of Miss McConnell's car were hospitalized.

Walt Disney Productions bought the rights to Pooh and the other characters from the books the late A. A. Milne wrote about his little son's toys. PitneyBowes said it expected the special charge for previously discontinued operations to exceed the quarterly earnings the company would otherwise report.

title: 25.9% RATE INCREASE SOUGHT BY BLUE CROSS
description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Greater New York is seeking to raise hospitalization premiums by an average of 25.9 percent for four million of its policyholders in New York City, on Long Island and in 10 other downstate counties. The increase, if granted, would take effect on Jan. 1 and would bring the monthly cost of basic familygroup coverage to $38.20 from the current rate of $29.52, for 21 full days and 180 half days of coverage. The same plan cost $11.32 a month in premiums in 1968, and jumped to $15.80 a month in 1969, when, the state allowed a 43 percent increase in Blue Cross rates. The increase just requested would be the sixth since 1971.

title: Tennessee School Boycott Ends
description: JASPER, Tenn., Oct 12 (AP)Glasses were back in session today after a threeWeek parents boycott that closed four Marion County schools and kept 2,000 students home. Parents began the boycott Sept. 21 to protest overcrowding in the schools. used mostly by youngsters from Jasper. They agreed to let their children return to school after county officials approved a compromise plan for a new I high school in Jasper.
