description: Football

title: The VicePresidential Debate
description: In the unprecedented television debate Friday night between Democratic and Republican VicePresidential candidates, Senator Walter F. Mondale summed up in phrase the Democratic case against the Ford Administration: Above all, we want a change in philosophy and direction.

title: C.W. Post Defeats Kings Point For 10th Straight Triumph, 160
description: KINGS POINT, LI., Oct. 16C. W. Post, ranked first in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Diviion III poll and in the Lambert Bowl, ruined the homecoming of the United States Merchant Marine Academy here today by handing the Mariners a 160 defeat before a crowd of 5.700.

title: N.A.S.L. Sets Bigger Slate, Other Shifts
description: The North American Soccer League will play more regularseason games next year, enlarge its playoffs, import top referees and have rosters of 16 players, six of whom must be American or Canadian citizens. The league

title: 71 Pacer Winner at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. .J., Oct. 16Windshield Wiper, the 3yearold son of Meadow Skipper who has been chasing Keystone Ore all year, finally caught him today and passed him about 50 yards from the wire to capture the $44,300 James B. Dancer Memorial Pace.

title: Canadiens Overpower Rangers
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 16Coach John Ferguson is waiting patiently for his young Ranger players to develop, but tonight the inexperienced New York defense lost its grip on the Montreal. Canadiens and lost the game, 74, in the Forum before 16,647 persons.

title: The Dangerous Smith Strategy
description: appears that the head of Rhodesia's white minority wernment has carefully constructed a strategy to be put into effect if there should be a breakdown in the forthcoming conference with black leaders in Geneva, now delayed a few days, and that the United States figures heavily in that strategy.

title: The Family Levy Discovers America
description: The first culture shock for a family of Americans landing at Kennedy Airport after living nine years in Europe is one of wonder at how many people speak English here. The second, after an hour or two on the ground, is that so many people don't.

title: PEOPLE
description: People who ride the parlor cars on such Long Island Rail Road trains as the Gardiner's Bay Express, the East Ender, the Montauk Special and the Cannonball may want to partake of a reminiscent toast in farewell to Walter McNamara. As director of the Long Island's special services department, Mr. McNamara was the man who revived the railroad's parlorcar fleet, and now he has gone into retirement after a 33year career in railroading, 21 of them with the L.I.R.R. When Mr. McNamara joined the company in 1955, only two parlor cars were in operation. At his retirement there were 21. People like to enjoy themselves when they're heading for a rest or are on their way to work, he said. They like having a livingroom atmosphere or semiprivate or even private rooms for themsehes. Give them topnotch service, make drinks available and everybody is happy. Mr. McNamara will be spending his retirement at his homes in Hallandale, Fla., and Montauk.

title: Knicks Lose, 122119; Layton Stars at Guard
description: The Knicks were beaten, 122119, by the Boston Celtics after a fiveminute overtime last night in the second game of a National Basketball Association preseason doubleheader at Madison Square Garden. But in defeat New York may have found a backcourt man in Dennis Layton, who was not expected to make the team when training camp opened almost a mpnth ago.

title: Buckley Accuses His Foe Of the Big Lie
description: Senator James L. Buckley accused Daniel P. Moynihan yesterday of using the big lie technique of Josef Goebbels, Adolf Hitler's Chief propagandist, when he described the Senator as a radical of the right.

title: TV VIEW
description: The reason for Visions, a weekly series of original dramas written specifically for television, was first glimpsed about six years ago, when the British Broadcasting Corporation's The Forsyte Saga captured international attention and opened a market in this country, particularly on public TV, for quality imports. A few brave souls, or perhaps incurable innocents, at the Ford Foundation and the National Endowment for the Arts wondered why American television seemed incapable of moducing work on a similar level. Recommendations were sought from professionals in the field, papers were submitted, conferences were held and an extensive new puhlieTV project was announced with appropriate headlines In the press. The resulting series, postponed several times already, will begin on the Public Broadcasting Service this Thursday at 9 P.M. Visions is a fascinating, sometimes irritating, often brilliant accomplishment. Unfortunately, it is already doomed to a limited run of 24 productions.

title: BEAME AIDE RETIRES DURING LEASE INQUIRY
description: Mayor Beame yesterday announced the retirement for health reasons of Ira Duchan, the Commissioner of Real Estate, who, a high administration official disclosed, is under investigation by the city On matters relating to leases awarded by the Real Estate Department as part of New York's daycare programs.

title: In the World of Ocean Racin
description: THE Tempest wasn't in the teapot, the teapot was in the Tempest. It was affixed to the bow of Eric Ridder's 80foot ketch, an everpresent reminder of his energetic wife, Tee.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: HONG KONGIt is difficult to find many pessimists these days in the financial and business community of this throbbing city, which is both a barometer of economic activity in the industrialized world and the main door for China's commercial dealings with the west.

title: Index
description: International

title: Dog Hero of Year to Be Honored for Rescue Feat
description: Zorro, a German shepherd who saved his master's life when he pulled him out of a whirlpool, is the dog hero of the year. As a result of the act, Zorro will be honored at a dinner, sponsored by the Quaker Oats COMpany, in Atlanta on Wednesday night and will have the KenL Ration gold medal draped around his neck. There is also a goldplated collar and leash and a year's supply of dog food waiting for the shepherd. For his owners, Mr. and Mrs. Mark A. Cooper of Orangevale, Calif., there is a $1,000 United States savings bond.

title: I'm Radcliffe! Fly Me!
description: The editor who is responsible for the outrageous title of this otherwise splendid book should be spanked. To play on the mindless advertising campaign of the world's most insensitive. Floridabased airline is to turn off the natural readership for a serious and thoughtful study of the distaff Ivy League colleges. Those who might be gulledas was obviously intendedinto buying the book as the latest female porno novel, will probably demand refunds. In both cases, a disservice has been rendered.

title: The Consumer And Economics
description: TRENTON

title: The Great American Chewing Gum Book
description: What a damned shamel I was predisposed to this book and its subject as soon as I read the title, and I remain disposed towards it generally even though Robert Hendrickson refused to give me any help.

title: Summit Proposes, Oxford Disposes
description: BY definition, and also by the triumphant experience of 65 years, the Concise Oxford Dictionary sets the standard for the King's English, the Queen's English and even commoner varkqies.

title: Boy Scouts A Formula For Survival
description: THE Boy Scouts, an organization as intrinsically American as mom and apple pie, are feeling the general economic pinch and, as a result, not only have their membership rolls dropped but many Scout councils have also been plunged deeply into debt.

title: GARDENING
description: THERE are many places around New Jersey's homes and gardens for shrubs that stay small. For example, take heathers, which are familiar to everyone but not used much in gardens, although collecting and growing a variety of heathers and the closely related heaths make a wonderful hobby.

title: Livingston Wins Again
description: Bob Brower, Livingston's superb tailback, broke away for two touchdowns in the fourth quarter yesterday and gave his unbeaten team a 2414 victory over stubborn Parsippany in Parsippany.

title: Harriet B. Erskine Becomes the Bride. Of Charles Williams
description: The Greenville Community Reformed Church in Scarsdale, N. Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Harriet Beebe Erskine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. L. Gillespie Erskine Jr. of Scarsdale, to Charles Garrett Williams, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Stark Williams of Durham, N. H.

title: Vietnam Names Heros
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 16 (Reuters)The National Assembly of Vietnam has conferred the title of Hero of the Vietnam People's Armed Forces on 97 units and 20 individuals for their outstanding exploits during the recent war, the Vietnam news agency reported here.

title: Prisoners in Ontario Jail Hold 7 People Hostage; Ouicker Trials a Demand
description: THUNDER BAY, Ontario, Oct. 16 (Reuters)At least four inmates, some of them armed with knives, seized seven hostages at the district jail here late tonight. orison officials said.

title: DINING OUT
description: THIS is Mimmo's No. 3, now five months old. Mimmo may be trying to establish a restaurant empire on the South Shore, but if this latest venture is any indication, it is time for him to stop. Since fewer than a third of the dishes we ordered on a recent evening were pore than merely edible, I cannot recommend the new Mimmo's.

title: Shaw Estate's Literary Adviser Quits Over Dispute With Agents
description: Dan H. Laurence, literary adviser to the George Bernard Shaw estate, and for the last 17 years editor of Shaw's Collected Letters, has resigned both positions after what he termed unresolvable differences with the estate and Shaw's literary agents.

title: Murray Hill Offices Will Be Converted to Apartments
description: A 61yearold office building in Murray Hill, lost to its owners through foreclosure after standing largely vacant for several years, is about to be recycled into a luxury apartment house, the latest in a rapid series of conversions spurred by new city taxincentive program.

title: Blue Goose
description: HALTOM CITY, Tex., Oct. 16 (AP)Blue Goose was dead and Dirty Bird was in critical condition today after an argument between the two Citizens Band radio operators led to a shootout, the police said.

title: Taxi Union Lists Contract Demands
description: Officers of the New York taxi drivers union told fleet owners last week that the drivers would expect higher wages and improved fringe benefits in a new contract to supplant the threeyear agreement that expires Nov. 16.

title: Out of Left Field
description: One of the hired yoyos who gibbers to us through the cavities in our teeth during televised baseball games was going on a week or so ago about this and that and any other thing he could dream up to make us believe he was more important than what we were watching, when it suddenly occurred to him to say: I'll tell you, the team I wouldn't want to meet up with in a dark alley is those Pirates. They're mean.

title: N.F.L. Standings
A Voice for The Blood Recipients
description: AS the mother of two hemophiliac sons and a third who died of the disease, Theresa Dowd knri...; the fear of getting the wrong type of blood or blood with the hepatitis virus. Joseph, who is 17 years old and a freshman at Princeton University, must transfuse himself about every other day, and the refrigerator in his dormitory room is stocked with bags 1;)f blood. Timothy, 14, a student at the Human Resources School for the Handicapped in Albertson, must receive transfusions almost as often.

title: Headliners
description: Nobel Laureates

title: Notes: The Naughty Maggot And the Lecherous Ass
description: Peter Maxwell Davies is dauntlessly inventive British composer who was most recently represented in this city when Pierre Boulez and the New York Philharmonic played the American premiere of his Stone Litany last March. Ten years ago Davies founded a chamber music group with the characteristically flamboyant title of The Fires of London, and on Oct. 27 and Nov. 3 this ensemble, now on its first North American tour, will appear at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: FISHING
description: FISHING along the New Jersey shore should be good this week, but it's a mixed bag. Stripedbass fishing came to life last week off Sandy Hook and should do nothing but improve. Weakfish and bluefish are running from Monmouth Beach to Seaside Park, excellent weakfish action is reported from Brigantine to Ocean City and seabass, porgies and blackfish are providing good catches along offshore rock piles and reefs.

title: A. D. Barnes Fiance Of Ruth Schneider
description: Mrs. Robert J. Schneider of Wellesley, Mass., has announced the engagement of her daughter. Ruth Mary Schneider, to Arthur Dale Barnes, a teacher of English at Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge. The wedding is planned for Dec. 19 in Washington, where the future bride is on the staff of Representative David R. Obey of Wisconsin.

title: Late Rally Overwhelms Plainfield
description: Thomas Jefferson of Elizabeth came up with two touchdowns in the last quarter to stun powerful Plainfield, 2420, yesterday in Plainfield. It left each team with a 3] record.

title: Ford Plays Defense
description: Gerald Ford's personal and political finances during the latter days of his Congressional career have been declared faultless after an investigation by the Watergate special prosecutor, thus relieving Mr. Ford of a campaign burden he could not dispel himself. Nevertheless, in a week when morality and the quality of leadership were the subjects that dominated political discussion, the President remained largely on the defensive.

title: Heads Rolling in the Board Room
description: Since last November, in a sometimes bloody, sometimes bloodless tide, heads have rolled in the topmanagement suites of 20 of America's bestknown companies.

title: Engagements
description: PattersonEtra

title: Margot Pyne Is Married In Southport
description: Margaret Franchot Pyne, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Grafton Howland Pyne Jr. of Southport, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Maxwell Rolston Marston 3d. The Rev. Ray H. Averett Jr. performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Walden Pell 2d, the bride's cousin, who had performed her parents wedding ceremony. .

title: At Hampshire the Players Are in Charge
description: I am responding to Marion Lane Rogers's excellent article of Sept. 12 on this page entitled Put the Players in Charge.

title: King Bids High for NortonForeman Bout
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Oct. 16Ken Norton has been guaranteed a minimum of $1.1 million to fight George Foriman later this year, Don King, the boxing promoter, announced today.

title: How to Get in The Swim, Afloat
description: As I walked up the gangplank, I kept telling myself how much I was looking forward to spending my days curled up in a deck chair reading my way through a half dozen or more books, lifting my head now and then to watch as the whitecaps of the northern waters slowly gave way to the blue stillness of the southern seas, taking time out only for meals and an occasional stroll around the deck.

title: To Jerusalem and Back
description: The best living American novelftt is also a man of brains. Veteran reader, seasoned talker, Saul Bellow handles ideas with the same juggling ease that he tells stories. Over the years he has shown a gift for the bravado of polemic, also an endearing weakness for the heartcatching phrase. All this represents a notable change from that tradition of 20thcentury American writersintuitive artists, redskin magicians of literaturewho behaved as if intellectual work were a sin against the creative spirit.

title: TWO LARGE CONCERNS RETURN TO NEW YORK
description: Two major paper companies that moved their New York offices to suburban locations now have moved them back because they discovered that the city fits their requirements better.

title: 3 Still Tied At 136 in Texas Open
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 16 (UPI)Bobby Cole of South Africa, Don Iverson and John Harriswithout swinging a golf clubretained today their tie for the secondround lead in the $125,000 Texas open golf tournament.

title: WelfareWhere It Goes
description: TRENTON

title: Paid, Not Voluntary
description: WASHINGTONA few days ago, a Denver grand jury indicted Timothy Redfearn on charges of burglary in the second degree.

title: Michael Garfinkle to Wed Melanie Gordon in Winter
description: The engagement of Melanie Beth Gordon to Michael Bennett Garfinkle has been announcd by Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Gordon of Baldwin Harbor, L.I., parents of the bridetobe. Her fiance is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Stuart Garfinkle of Rockville, Md.

title: Why Should Schools Be the Sacrificial Lamb?
description: OUR children are the future of our nation. What our children become, so becomes our nation. It is plain common sense to give our children the best education possible so that they can develop into productive responsible citizens contributing economically, socially and politically to our democratic society.

title: A Minority Report on Porgy
description: HAROLD C. SCHONBERG

title: Notes: A New Way To Ship a Car South
description: Starting next month, vacationers in The New York metropolitan area will have a new way of getting their cars to Florida, one that does not involve wing the vehicles themselves, letting a friend or driveaway firm do the work or going by AutoTrain. They will be able to ship their vehicles piggyback on the same kind of trailer trucks used to transport new cars from. Detroit Manufacturers to dealers throughout the country.

title: BUTZ POLICY SCORED BY BLACK EDUCATORS
description: HUNTSVILLE, Ala.The heads of several black landgrant colleges contend that the Agriculture Department must share responsibility for the low number of blacks in the field of agriculture because it has underfinanced the nation's 16 black landgrant colleges.

title: Met Injects New Cast Members Into Puccini's Il Trittico
description: The fifth repertory production to be introduced by the Metropolitan Opera in as many evenings during its opening week this season was Puccini's II Trittico, given on Friday night. In its complete form it was new last season and, despite debatable features, was worth holding over.

title: STAMPS
description: Arecently rediscovered religious painting, done in 1776 and thus a natural choice for this year, and another dip into the vintage Americana of the simpler mid19th century scene, make up the two stamps of the 1976 Christmas issuean issue that heralds great change for collectors of plate blocks.

title: Computers and Cooperation of Law Enforcement Agencies Help in Record Collection of Parking Fines
description: As most drivers will do, Gerry Russo gambled on being no more than a minute, so just after noon on a recent Saturday he stopped his battered blue Duster behind a doubleparked panel truck near Lexington Avenue and 88th Street, hopped out, walked over to a rack of newspapers and plunked down exact change.

title: Hockey AnnouncersCool It!
description: the shootout has begun. the wily veterans and class players, along with a flock of rookies with great futures, have taken the ice. Hockey is upon us once again. Indeed, before the season ends early in April, the home screen will have been inundated with 53 televised Islander and Ranger games, including one this Friday between the Islanders and the Detroit Red Wings followed by another on Saturday between the Islanders and the Toronto Maple Leafs (both events will be broadcast locally by Channel 9, beginning at 8 P.M.). This is not to mention a 13week series of National Hockey League games beginning in January and the postseason Stanley Cup Playoff games that could conceivably extend play into June.

title: Paris Regime Is Infuriated by Report Calling French Gap Between Rich and Poor Greatest in the West
description: PARIS, Oct. 14 The author of a report on income distribution in Western nations that has infuriated the French Government says he sees no reason to change the figures that were published or the conclusion that was reached.

title: Holtzman Not Upset by Idleness; Says He'll Pitch When Called
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 16The case of the missing lefthanded pitcher, Ken Holtzman, might be baffling to followers of the Yankees but it's not baffling to Billy Martin or Holtzman himself.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Several thousand people, many of them policemen, attended funeral services yesterday morning for Police Officer Arthur Dematte at St. Augustus Roman Catholic Church in Larchmont, N. Y. Officer Dematte was shot to death last Tuesday night by one of two men he had stopped for questioning in the parking lot of a Larchmont shopping center. Ballistics tests Friday showed that he had been killed with his own gun, apparently during a struggle with one of the men. A suspect; who was wounded in the incident, is in custody. A second man is being sought.

title: James R. Lamb, Attorney, Weds Brigid Shanley
description: Brigid Shanley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Michael Shanley of Bernardsville, N.J., was married there yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Perpetual Help to James Raymond Lamb, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond James Lamb of Ridgewood, N.J.

title: Alabama Tops Tennessee in Final Period
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 16 (AP)Jack O'Rear scored on a 15yard run and set up the winning touchdown with two 15yard scampers today as Alabama downed Tennessee, 2013, in a nationally televised Southeastern Conference football game.

title: The Decisions
description: J. I. CASE V. BORAX (1964)Private suits encouraged as a necessary supplement to Securities and Exchange Commission enforcement.

title: Memorial Services
description: VAILJanet Bentz Dreving. Friends are cordially invited to attend a memorial service of music at the Cathedral of 51. John The Divine, 11 A.M., Saturday, October 30th. Contributions lo the Jane: Vail Memorial Center, will be ?? by

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: AS summer recedes over the horizon of time, the pictures you never got around to taking still pop up, like slides, in your memory. I was in the middle of something urgent the other day and I couldn't get the Caribbean Ferry off the shortrange radarscope that was turning around in my mind; sometimes that scope fails to pick up the business at hand but it is uncanny how it sees things at the periphery.

title: Hungary 20 years later
description: BUDAPESTThe passage from America back to Hungary is bittersweet. Yesterday's fugitive and, in relative terms, today's millionaire is surrounded with affection, and there isn't an old acquaintance who would have forgotten the days when we were young and hopeful together. There are vanillascented visits to aunts who have become grandmothers, and my children are surprised to discover that they resemble people whose language they don't speak. And the squeaky old tram takes me to the cemetery to visit beloved uncles my children didn't have the good fortune to know.

title: Thai Government Holds at Least 200 Leftists, Including Intellectuals
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 16Thailand's military junta said tonight that it was holding at least 200 leftist leaders, including a number of leading intellectuals, writers and politicians.

title: Wayne J. Shilkret
description: NATHAN MILSTEINThe violinist will play Brahms's Concerto with the New York Philharmonic at the reopening of Fisher Hall Tuesday night.

title: To Willis, With Respect and Admiration
description: Qn Thursday night, Willis Reed's jersey No. 19 will he retired during a pregair.e ceremony at Madison Square The gesture is entirely appropriate. No r:tiler Kraic has been honored similarly.

title: State Is Losing Role
description: MANUFACTURING which once dominated the economy of New Jersey, has declined sharply in the last three decades, with the drop accelerating in recent years. According to figures compiled by the state's Department of Labor and Industry, more than 170,000 manufacturing jobs have been lost in New Jersey over the last six years; as a result, the state has turned from an economy based on manufacturing to a serviceoriented one.

title: SHOP TALK
description: OFTEN, said Bob Martin, who owns the Sugar Pine Country Store in Morristown, strollers are drawn to his shop by the enticing smell of apple candles, raspberry soap and watermelon kisses. Once inside the shop, with its roughhewn walls and hooked rugs, they find there is as much to look at as there is to smell.

title: F14 FUNDS APPROVED, WITH MANY UNAWARE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16 Without the knowledge of most of its members, Congress has approved a $15 million down payment on a $2 billion program to develop and build a new, more powerful jet engine for the Navy's troubled F14 interceptor plane.

title: Death Games
description: Pornographic brutality dominates this distasteful tale of carnage, corruption and colonialism in Indochina, starring young, beautiful, demented Elspeth Waterhouse, who pursues her impeccably detached tycoon of a father from Bangkok to Vientiane to Saigon, hungering after his recognition and

title: Tilden and Tennis: The Lonely Ruler
description: Playing for himself, for his country, for posterity. Big Bill Tilden was invincible. No man ever bestrode his sport as Tildendid for those years. It was not just that he could not be beaten, it was nearly as if he had invented the sport he conquered.

title: Peasant And Pleasant
description: At a dinner party in New Orleans, a department store buyer was being harangued by a guest on the absurdity of the peasant look in Paris. Nothing to do with life today . . . who wants to dress up like an East European . . . nobody could wear . . . and what did the buyer, a fashion authority, think about all the fuss?

title: Moynihan Is Still Trying to Patch Things Up With Blacks, Liberals
description: Barely two weeks before the election, Daniel P. Moynihan is still mending fences with two of the more important elements of the New York State Democratic Partyblack and liberal Democratic officials who still

title: Guess Who's Not Coming to Lunch

description: Radio

title: Massachusetts Editor Retires
description: GARDNER, Mass., Oct. 16 (AP)Alfred J. Abbott, who went to work for The Gardner News as a parttime copyboy 48 years ago, has retired as its editor. The newspaper announced today that E. Curtiss Pierson, who has been with The News for about a year, would be the new editor.

title: ARAFAT AND ASSAD, YIELDING TO SAUDIS, AGREE TO CEASEFIRE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 16The mountain front between the Syrian Army and the Palestinian guerrillas fell silent early today after three days of savage fighting as both sides bowed to a Saudi Arabian request for a ceasefire.

title: Pitt Beats Miami, 3619.
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 16Tony. Dorsett ran for 227 yards and scored three touchdowns today and became the second player in major college football history to carry for more than 5,000 yards in his career. This performance by the East's leading candidate for the Heisman Trophy enabled Pittsburgh's undefeated team to beat Miami of Florida, 3619, for the Panthers sixth victory.

title: The Blood Banks
description: THE Island's major blood banks have joined together in an effort to guarantee an adequate supply of blood at all times, to develop a uniform system for receiving, storing and transfusing blood, and to provide a forum for discussions among physicians, consumers, technicians and donors.

description: Fiction

title: Adultery Law, Favoring Men, Issue in Spain
description: ZARAGOZA, Spain, Oct. 14 The only alternative for me is reconciliation, said Maria Inmaculada Benito with a sad look In her dark eyes. How can I reconcile with a husband who has just tried to put me in jail for five years?

title: DINING OUT
description: NOTHING is worse than being shown up by the competition. The New Yorker is not really competition, but the magazine does work the same side of the street now and then, and recently, when it came up with a New Jersey restaurant hitherto unknown in these panswell, it hurt.

title: Beame Aide Retires
description: The retirement for health reasons of Ira Duchan, Commissioner of Real Es. tate, who reportedly is under investigation for leasing practices, was announced by Mayor Beame. Page 38.

title: Paradise Lost
description: EAST FORT Is a beautiful tract of land, all 111 acres of it. Oaks and maples grow on the property. Foxes and racoons scurry about, and birds of many varieties nest in the dense foliage.

title: Michigan Notches No. 6, Downing Northwestern
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Oct. 16 (AP)Rob Lytle smashed for 172 yards and two tuochdowns and topranked Michigan Routed Northwestern, 387, today in Big Ten Conference game.

title: Council of Negro Women Wins Whitney M. Young Jr. Award;
description: The New York Urban League has announced that the National Council of Negro Women will receive the league's 1976 Whitney M. Young Jr. Memorial Award. The announcement was made by George M. Brooker, board chairman and Mrs. Cyrus R. Vance, president of the league.

title: Goodman: A Glimmer of Hope
description: Landlords and tenants are preparing for Armageddon in Albany on the issue of rent controls, scheduled to expire next June. This year's confrontation promises to be the most intense ever, with both landlords and tenants caught between rising costs and decreasing real income, and with state and city treasuries depleted. The future of the middle class in our city and perhaps the very future of our city itself are at stake.

title: Article 19  No Title
Giants
description: BLOOMINGTON. Minn.. Oct. 16Playing in the shadow of Fran Tarkenton and the Purple People Eaters in the proximity of Minneapolis and St. Paul, which is pretty close to obscurity anyway, Chuck Foreman is trying harder.

title: Book Finds Boss
description: William M. (Boss) Tweed, for a century the leading symbol of urban corruption, did not rule New York City government; was the victim of illegal procedures at his trial; made important contributions to the city's growth, often showing more vision than the reformers; was persecuted to divert attention from much greater Republican corruption in Washington because he was a champion of immigrants; and may have been the victim of greedy contractors who looted the city treasury, rather than their master.

title: Provinces Had Doubts Epidemic Threatened
description: OTTAWAWeeks before the deaths of a number of elderly persons after receiving inoculations against swine flu briefly derailed the mass immunization program in the United States, Canadian health authorities had already decided against wholesale vaccination against the disease until the threat of an epidemic became clearer on their side of the border. The

description: F. O. Matthiessen's Oxford Book of American Verse dates from 1950 (Korea, KaiserFrazer, the crinoline revival, the yaya sound); so a quartercentury later we have a new model. That's not as fast as Detroit changes models, but at ten million cars a year Detroit can exhaust its market pretty fast. Not even an Oxford Book sells at that rate.

Agatha Christie that rarest of the rare, was able to create excitement even after the curtain fell on her own life.

Tastefully installed in an immaculate museum environment, where all evidence of the workaday life of the artist is removed in favor of a pure, disinterested view of the art objects he has created, such

title: FOES OF MRS. GANDHI STAGE OPEN PROTEST
description: NEV., DELHI, Oct. 16Several hundred ?? of Prime Minister Indira ?? including members of Parliament and fanner judges, held a protest meeting today against the Government's proposed changes in the Constitution.

description: Penalties for excess bed capacity by hospitals throughout New York State have enabled Medicaid and Blue Cross programs to avoid spending $6.5 million over the last two years.

title: Trying to Salvage Alcoholics'
description: WHEN I was little and saw my father drunk he was a split personalityI never laiew how to handle him, said Joe, a husky 16yearold. I could love my father one day, but when he was drinking and I heard the fightingtheir bedroom was next to mineI'd cry. I was afraid of him then.

title: Nancy A. Hussey Married To Raymond G. Schuville
description: Nancy Ann Hussey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Hussey of Lloyd Harbor. Huntington, L. I., was married yesterday morning to Raymond G. Schuville, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Schuville of Farrell, Pa.

description: The engagement of Helene Edelsberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Edelsberg of New York, to Robert S. Krauss, son of Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Krauss of Elmont, LI., has been announced by the future bride's parents. The wedding is planned for Nov. 6.

title: Tax Rebates: A Proposal
description: THERE has been much controversy about how rebates to lo:al property taxpayers will be made. Some have proposed mailing the money directly to taxpayers at a cost of $400,000 a year.

title: Brooklyn Tech Shuts Out Jefferson
description: Brooklyn Tech scored two secondperiod touchdowns and stifled Jefferson's offense, shutting out the defending Rublic Schools Athletic League champion, 130, yesterday at Jeffs Orange Wave Stadium. Tech drove 95 yards for its first touchdown in 15 plays as Howard Lewis plunged over from a yard out. John Guercio, the Engineers ,quarterback, trying to sneak for a first down later in the quarter, wound up with.a 23yard score.

title: Memorial for Debs Off Union Sq. Draws 300 Old Socialists
description: They came to Roosevelt Auditorium at 100 East 17th Street yesterday afternoon about 300 men and women, longtime Socialists  and for three hours they heard tributes paid to the memory of Eugene V. Debs and Meyer London, founders of the Socialist Party.

description: Syria's attempt to crush Palestinian resistance to the Syrian plan for ending the 18month civil war in Lebanon has produced savage new fighting between the erstwhile allies.

description: NEW HAVEN, Oct 16Yale unleashed three speedy running backsJohn Pagliaro, Mike Southworth and Rick Angelonein the Bowl this afternoon, and the Elis overwhelmed injuryplagued Columbia, 376, before 14,035 fans.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ADAM'S RIBSpencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn played married, but battling, lawyers in George Cukor's comedy, today through Saturday the Regency. In a more somber mood, they also teamed in Cukor's Keeper of the Flame, a melodrama which shares the bill.

title: Lovers and Tyrants
description: A few years ago, Francine du Plessix Gray's Divine Disobedience surveyed radical and libertarian stirrings in the Catholic Church subsequent to Vatican II. Ivan Illich, the Bishop of Cuernavaca, and the Berrigan brothers were among the clerical freedom fighters profiled in this highly intelligent work of personal and investigative reportage. Herself committed to the goal of liberation, Mrs. Gray remained ironically aware of elements of the quixotic and contradictory in the various attempts her book depicted to make it new within the confines of one of the most hidebound institutions on earth. And a chief irony was, of course, that some of her subjects originally must have been drawn to the church precisely because its mantle of authority was so confidently worn, and they had only gone into revolt when a measure of that confident authority was surrendered, voluntarily or not, the famous Council.

title: Hood's 12Meter Independence Being Tank Tested
description: Tank tests. Design secrets. Boats under wraps. It's not exactly trickortreat, but the season for 12Meter racing is in the wind. And the effects of rule changes and new methods of tank testing are beginning to surface. Of the two new United States Twelves for the 1977 defense of the America's Cup, Independence, designed and skippered by Ted Hood, being tank tested in the Atlantic Ocean off Marblehead, Mass. The otherthe Olin Stephens design called Enterpriseis under construction at Minneford's Yard in City Island with completion scheduled for Dec. 1.

title: White Plains Defeats New Rochelle by 206
description: Sparked by an outstanding defensive performance, White Plains remained undefeated with a 206 victory over New Rochelle yesterday. Coach Brant Wintersteen's Tigers have won all four games this season and will meet unbeaten Roosevelt in two weeks, White Plains is idle next weekend.

title: The Dole Approach
description: WASHINGTONIn a florid introduction of Senator Robert J. Dole in Richmond the other day, Gov. Mills Godwin of Virginia may have said it all as far as VicePresidential candidates are concerned. It's no small undertaking for a man to undertake what he's undertaking, Governor Godwin declared.

title: Victoria Merritt Tilney Married To Chips Chapman Page on L.I.

I., to Chips Chapman Page, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leslie M. Page of Forest Hills, Queens. The Rev. Earle Pratt performed the ceremony at TrinitySt. John's Episcopal Church. A reception was held at the Tilnev home.

title: A Joffrey Trio In Fanfarita, Arpino Work
description: Fanfarita, as this column noted eight years ago, is not the name of somebody's little Mexican granddaughter. It is the title of a short, snappy Spanishtinted pas de trois by Gerald Arpino.

title: 15 Die in Transkei Bus Accident
description: UMTATA, Transkei, Oct. 16 (UPI)A crowded bus overturned yesterday near an African village, killing 15 persons and Injuring 66, the Umtata police said today. They said that the accident had occurred at Mantlaneni township, about 62 miles cast of Umtata, capital of Transkt.

title: Spain's King Back From Trip
description: MADRID. Oct. 16 (AP) King Juan Carlcs of Spain and his wife, Queen Sofia, returned home today from visits to Colombia, Venezuela and the Dominican Republic. The focus of the trip was five days in Colombia, where the royal couple celebrated Columbus Day.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: 4. Slower production rates means fewer workers are needed; declines in unemployment rates were suddenly reversed in August. A slight decline in September is considered insignificant.

title: A History of Christianity
description: You can find the Lord's Prayer carved on a pinhead or can fail to fit the letters of one of its words on a billboard. It's all a matter of scale and perspective. So you can write the whole history of Christianity in one sentencerve heard both Jesus freaks and atheists do so to their own satisfactionor you can fill a library with books about any of its epochs. The debate over whether one can represent Christianity in only 556 pages becomes pedantic and frivolous in the face of the fact that Paul Johnson has successfully done so.

description: Horse Show Calendar

title: Clement B. Wood 3d And Lisa R. Wolfson Plan a March Bridal
description: The engagement of Lisa Reinherz Wolfson to Clement Biddle Wood 3d, son of Mrs. Daggett Harvey of Chicago. formerly of New York. r nd Mr. Wood Jr. of Paris and Spetsai, Greece, has heen announced by the future bride's parents. Mr. and Mrs. Richard F. Wolfson of Coral Gables, Fla. The couple plan to he married next March.

title: Spitz: Return to Free Market
description: Construction of new apartment houses in New York City is at the lowest level since 1932, the depth of the depression, and existing units available for rental purposes are steadily deteriorating. In consequence, it is urgent that the New York State Legislature, when it convenes in January, adopt a fresh comprehensive approach toward housing in the Metropolitan area.

title: The. Blood And Bombast Of Tamburlaine
description: LONDON winburne called Christopher Marlowe the father of English tragedy, status that presumably explains why he, and not Shakespeare, was the author chosen to baptize the most important auditorium in the new National Theater complex and potentially the most exciting one the nation itself possesses. Not all the Olivier Theater's gadgetry is yet working. Scenery cannot be whisked into the flies, or plunged into the basement, at the shove of button. But the circular surface of the stage is there, and so are the seats that rise above it in crescent, to form an intimate amphitheater. Intimate, and yet adaptable, and splendidly suited to the fourhour orgy of conquest, plunder and atrocity that is Marlowe's Tamburlaine the Great.

title: Scrapbook. The Day the Stadium Opened
description: The Sports Complex won, the Giants lost and the fans were early. Jim Robinson (85), above, was lifted into the air after scoring first Giant touchdown in new stadium. Sonny Werblin, below center; former Governor Cahill, left, and Alfred C. Linkletter, vice chairman of the Sports and Exposition Authority, representing Governor Byrne, were honored for their part in making the Meadowlands dream come true.

title: Hester Eggert Engaged to Charles Weeden
description: The engagement of Hester Harrington Eggert to Charles D. Weeden has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Robinson Eggert Jr. of Cambridge, Mass., and Seawall, Me., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Dr. and Mrs. William F. Weeden of Oakland, Calif. A spring wedding is planned.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: With the Presidential election only a few weeks away, the numismatic spotlight is again focused on one of the hobby's many fascinating branchesthe collecting of political campaign medals, buttons, tokens, badges and other official election paraphernalia. This specialty always attracts extra attention in national election years, as well as during offyear elections, because the various collectibles are more, readily available then. But it grips the fulltime, everyyear attention of thousands of collectors because they arenot satisfied merely to acquire and own a collection. They are students, probing into and becoming knowledgeable about all the major and minor political parties, candidates and campaigns.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Explicit Violence Overwhelms Every Other Value On the Screen

title: Three Hours For Lunch
description: During the quarter of a century between the two Great Wars, Very Important People enthroned Christopher Morley as America's leading man of letters; nor did he refuse the crown. He loved books, including good books. He was so prolific that by the mid1930's, 175 pages were required simply to list his printed works. In

title: They Now Wonder What Can Be Salvaged
description: SALISBURY, RhodesiaFor the whites In Rhodesia, the stake in the conflict over how much longer they will exercise full rule over the country's blacks is, in its simplest terms, how much, if anything, they can salvage from a way of life that they know has no match or comfort anywhere in the world. The stake will be on the table next week in Geneva, when a conference on the transition to black rule is due to open.

title: Nathalie Kusnetz Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Milton Kusnetz of Flushing, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nathalie Kusnetz, to Lee R. Hillman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Hillman of Winchester, Mass. The future bride is an enterostomal, or intestinal, therapist at the Lahey Clinic in Boston. Her fianc is a structural engineer with Stone & Webster in Boston.

title: UTAH GROUP STAGES RALLY AGAINST SMUT
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Oct. 16In the face of recent reports of liberalized morals in Utah, more than 9,000 people nearly filled the Salt Palace Arena this morning for a wellpublicized rally against pornography.

title: WalkieTalkie Banned, Then Allowed
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 16After a protest by the Cincinnati Reds, the Yankees were prevented by Commissioner Bowie Kuhn from using walkietalkie information from a radiobooth spotter to position their outfielders during today's 5.1 loss in the World Series opener.

title: FOOD
description: LITTLE Chief Farm Stands in Riverhead and Aquebogue have it, the Green Thumb in Water Mill has it, Horley's in Centerport has it, Van Sise Farms in Woodbury is trying to stock it, but at most of the other farm stands and markets about the Island, they never heard of it. It is spaghetti squash.

title: Miss Hay's Dances Use Signals
description: The central problem for choreographers maturing in the 1960's was learning how to move wthout slavishly imitating their predecessors. For some modern dancers it meant almost the total abnegation of movement. Others relied on random activity, still others on the hypnotic effect of repetetive phrases, while another group sought solutions in everyday movement or sportsrelated gesture.

title: Umberto Agnelli's Fiat: More Trucks
description: Fiat, the big Italian automobile company, will adopt a strategy of building up its nonautomobile business to bring about a profit recovery in the next five years, according to Umberto Agnelli, (above) who has just returned to the company as executive vice chairman.

title: Now, Closer U.S. Relations With China Perhaps
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.The fall of Chiang Ching and her three Shanghai associates removes the most'poisonous elements in Peking affecting SinoAmerican relations. This does not guarantee a quick agreement on normalization and the question of Taiwan, but it removes the primary obstacle to Chinese compromise.

title: U.S.SOVIET TEAM STARTS STUDY OF OCEAN CURRENTS
description: BOSTON, Oct. 16 (Reuters)The United States and the Soviet Union began's. joint study today of the currents, weather and geochemistry of the North Atlantic here. The venture, called Polymode, is the first cooperative analysis of an ocean by the two powers.

title: Helene Atlas to Be Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Atlas of Sealord, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Helene Michele Atlas, to Paul Franklin Poatin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Alvin Polatin of Riverdale, the Bronx.

description: Mini Kim, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Harry HiSoo Kim of Jackson Heights, Queens, was married yesterday morning to John Emery Plum. son of Dr. and Mrs. Stephen Haines Malcolm Plum of Morristown, N. J.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: I have a small bedroom with wall to wall carpeting. After several months of use the carpet began to stretch and ripple in various places. I was advised that cleaning might shrink the carpet, but I tried this and it did not work. The ripples are now quite evident and I am now told that it is too late to do anything about them. Have you any suggestions as to how this can be corrected?V.C., New York City

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Congress has passed and sent to President Ford a broad revision of the rational copyright law, intended to Lake into account technological :flanges in information storage, reLrieval and distribution since 1909, the last time the law was revised. The law also extends the expiration date of copyrights to more nearly conform with general practice elsewhere in the world, clearing the way for full United States membership in the 65nation Bern Union, the most important international copyright agreement in existence.

title: Bruce Blair Will Marry Victoria Jackson Oct. 30
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles Probyn Jackson of Ridgewood, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Victoria Andrea Bain Jackson, to Bruce Norman Blair, son of Mr. and Mrs. G. Norman Blair of Larchmont, N.Y. The wedding is planned for Oct. 30.

title: Mondale and Dole Campaign Again After Claiming a Victory in Debate
description: Senators Walter F. Mondale and Robert J. Dole resumed their campaigns for the Vice Presidency yesterday, each claiming victory in their rather acrimonious debate Friday night, but each a bit annoyed that he had left out certain noints.

title: Youths Protest at Transkei Holiday
description: JOHANNESBURG, Oct. 16 (Reuters)Gangs of youths shouted abuse at participants in the Transkei's independence czlebrations in Cape Town today.

title: The Mondale Manner
description: When a contest was held aboard Walter F. Mondale's chartered jet to give his campaign plane a suitable namehis running mate's identical aircraft had been christened Peanut Ithe suggestions that trickled into a manila envelope taped to a bulkhead were much the same. We Try Harder, was one, and Why Not the Second Best? was another; Peanut Vendor was a third, and there was also The Second Coming. What almost all the appellants reflected was the nature of Mr. Mondale's present undertaking. The senior Senator from Minnesota is working very hard for a post that has only one prescribed function, one that is mostly becoming, and one real purpose: to wait, trying not to look hopeful.

title: Music: National in New Works
description: The National Symphony Orchestra of Washington and its music director, Antal Dorati, must have had the feeling that the Big Apple was in serious need of some new music. That, at least, might explain their bringing three new pieces to play in their concert at Carnegie Hall on Friday night.

title: 2 Soviet Astronauts Are Told to Return to Earth After Failure of Soyuz to Dock With Orbiting Station
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 16Two Soviet astronauts were ordered to abort their mission in space today and return to earth after an unsuccessful attempt to dock their Soyuz 23 spacecraft with the orbiting station Salyut 5.

title: Coping With the Depression of Age
description: HELEN THOMAS was depressed. Twice widowed, she had moved from the Island to a Florida condominium with her third husband. But she was not happy about the move and several months later she left her husband in Florida and returned to Nassau County to live with her son and daughterinlaw

title: The Moon Lamp
description: When Gene Linguist inherits a Revolutionary farmhouse in New Hampshire, he and wife Winnie flee the provincial confines of a Chicago suburb and attempt to go native in the heart of New England. While the raeal natives favor Mobile homes and tickytacky ranch houses, the Linguist's place is traditional to a fault, overflowing with museum pieces rescued from barn and attic, religiously restored, and prompting someone to wonder at their

title: Foreign Policy Questions
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 16 (AP)  Mr. Carter was asked what he would do an Eastern European country were to revolt against Soviet domination question that Mr. Ford sidestepped at televised news conference Thursday.

title: The Girls Who Would Be Nadia
description: FOUR years ago, Olga Korbut of the Soviet Union caused a boom in Long Island gymnastics, Nadia Comenicl of Rumania, her successor in the spotlight, also replaced her as the model for the bumper crop of gymnasts that the boom produced. Many of them have been working well enough and hard enough to dominate the New York State championships in recent years.

title: Heritage Hills of Westchester Classic Townhouses
description: New York's largest and successful national awardwinning adult* condominium opens its next phase with newt 2 and 3 bedroom townhouses.

description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 16 (AP) The driver of a gasoline tanker died today when his truck collided with a car, overturned, and burst into flames.

title: Patricia Barba Jersey Bride Of Maj. Martin Chobrda, Army
description: Christ the King Raman Catholic Church in New Vernon. N.J., was the setting yesterday for the marriage of Patricia Barba and Maj. Martin Chobrda, U.S.A., who is stationed at the Picatinny Arsenal in Dover, N.J. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. John F, Corr and the Rev. James L. Fallon.

title: PALESTINIANS LOSE STATURE IN THE U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 16 From its peak of spectacular prominence at the United Nations two years ago, the Palestine Liberation Organization has plunged in stature in world councils.

title: Byrne Runs to a Meet Mark
description: Kevin Byrne, New Jersey's leading distance runner, continued yesterday to use New York terrain as a proving ground. The Paramus Catholic senior won his third major cross country race of the season at Van Cortlandt Park when he set a meet record in the St. John's University event.

title: Hua Wins Most Of Mao's Power
description: Mao Tsetung's extraordinary power, which became the object of a struggle among other Chinese leaders even before his death, has now been conferred at least in part and at least temporarilyon Hua Kuofeng, who had been Prime Minister. He has now also been elevated to the chairmanship of the Communist Party, a post previously held only by Mao, and his principal rivals are apparently under arrest.

title: Law in Jersey Threatens Parents Of Truants With Jail Sentences
description: VENTNOR, N.J., Oct. 16 (AP)Truants here could find their parents making up for their lost class timein jail.

description: Too many leaders?

title: New York State Panel Decries the Inequities in Taylor Law Penalties1
description: New York State's Public Employment Relations Board handed down a stiff penalty last week for last fall's illegal strike by New York City teachers. At the same time, however, it expressed concern that the law did not provide a standard of evenhandedness in the imposition of loss of dues checkoff.

title: Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 16  They kept asking Sparky Anderson, the manager of the Cincinnati Reds, why he and his players seemed so cool after winning the first game of the World Seriessomething they had failed to do in their three previous Series since 1970.

description: Mass Market Paperbacks

title: By IVAN DOIG
description: It is a year now since the Environmental Protection Agency treated Americans to glimpses of its municipal profiles and in the process managed to miff nearly everyone except people who live in Portland, Ore. The E.P.A.'s, Quality of Life study was done by the Midwest Research Institute under a grant from the E.P.A. The project seemed straightforward enoughmerely sets of statistics that ranked metropolitan areas according to the condition of their environment, their social, economic and political wellbeing and levels of health care and education. But when the overall livability rankings of America's 65 largest cities were released to the media, howls went up from municipalities aggrieved about their low ratings. An E.P.A. spokesman inirriedly issued regrets.

title: For Arab Princess, Education Is Taste Of Forbidden Fruit
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 16Once upon time in a faraway Islamic kingdom there lived a middleaged prince whose 18yearold daughter yearned to taste fruit long forbidden to females of the realmnamely, a college education.

title: College Results
Suffern Loses But Not Nyack
description: The defending champion, Suffern, took its second straight defeat in Rockland publicschool football yesterday, losing to Ramapo, 1312. Meanwhile, Nyack tightened its hold on first place with a 203 victory over Pearl River.

description: EAST ORANGE

title: 2 Kickers Set Marks With 65, 69 Yarders
description: Two placekickers from Texas set colegiate fildgoal records in football games 300 miles apart yesterday.

title: Crowds in Shanghai Assail Mao's Widow
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 16Large dancing crowds carried effigies of Chiang Ching, Mao Tsetung's widow, through the streets of Shanghai today amid indications that China's new authorities were preparing a campaign to discredit the socalled leftist leaders.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: After spending parts of two years as a fundraising salesman, Mike Battle is able to spend a good part of this year as the starting fullback at Beach Channel High, the newest member of the Public Schools Athletic League.

title: GARDENING
description: CHRYSANTHEMUMS and the fall season go hand in hand. They flower naturally at this time of year, and their warm colors blend well with the bright fall colors of field and garden. Gardeners have come to rely on them to keep their gardens going after summer annuals have faded away. And usually they survive the early frosts before finally succumbing to a hard freeze.

title: 5 New Rules
description: These are the five major new rules in effect this season:

title: Farmingdale Upset, 2
description: East Meadow turned in what will probably be the most stunning upset of the Nassau County football season when it registered a decisive, 218 victory yesterday over a previously undefeated Farmingdale team that has been consistently at or near the top of the state rankings in recent years:

title: BRIDGE
description: If every expert who played a hand brilliantly took the trouble to write up his effort in a scrapbook, the biggest book in the world would surely belong to Alvin Roth. This durable New York expert has been winning titles for almost 40 years, and his brilliance and enthusiasm continue to be extraordinary. Almost every week he is competing in a tournament somewhere, usually in the metropolitan area. In winning the Open Pairs at the last New York tournament, he played a deal that would be a good candidate for the best hand of 1976. Shrewd cardplacing generated an imaginative play and led to an unusual ending.

title: Red Smith
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 16Living baseball history was writ in itsybitsy characters in hundreds of scorebooks this crisp and sunny afternoon when, for the first time since Cadet Abner Doubleday put Farmer Phinney's cow pasture to unnatural use, two 10man teams met in competition for the championship of the universe. The time was 1:26 P.M.

title: In Washington, a Fear of 1918 Repeating Itself
description: A frightening sequence of events last Week, in all likelihood coincidental, created further controversy over the national campaign to immunize the populace against swine flu. in several states, elderly people had died within hours, or a very few days, after receiving the flu vaccine. It seemed probable that neither the vaccine nor those who administered it were to blame. But again the mass immunization program had been delayed, again the decision to go ahead with it gravely questioned.

title: Deaths
description: CARD OF THANKS We greatfully acknowledge the outpouring of expressions of sympathy and regret upon the passing of our boloved Husband and Father, JOSEPH BELSKY. Our sorrow has been eased by the knowledge that so very many have expressed their love, respect and appreciation for the contributions to humanity made by him during his lifetime. That knowledge has made our loss more bearable. with pride and affection for the thousands whom he has aided.

title: President Asserts Carter Will Say Anything Anywhere
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Oct. 16 President Ford, riding a whistlestopping campaign train 220 miles through downstate Illinois, said today that Jimmy Carter will say anything anywhere to be President of the United States and added, He shouldn't be President.

title: 20 and Out, A New Battle For the Police
description: THERE is considerable disparity between privateindustry wage scales and those of the public employees. title: FISHING
description: ALTHOUGH it's a mixed bag, fishing should be good around the Island this week. Offshore, bluefish and weakfish offer the best action, with the stripedbass fishing improving daily. Seabath are still plentiful on the wrecks, rocks and reefs. And inshore, black fithing is good to excellent along the rocky points and rock bottoms of the North Shore and in the South Shore bays.

Separatist movements in Nepal, Kashmir and Bengal becomeat some time in the future  pawns in a game among China, Russia and India. The chessboard is the mountainous border country between the People's Republic and Kash

title: ZERO GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16United States Government analysts predict that Rhodesia's economy will experience zero growth this year, despite a good harvest and the opening of several new nickel  and gold mines.

title: Alcohol: New War, Old Enemy
description: AFTER years of admittedly little more than lip service toward creating an effective program of trying to control alcoholism, the state's Department of Health has activated a new Division of Alcoholism. However, department officials said they were still unsure just what changes would be made in the old program.

title: He Leads them to Shelters
description: LOS ANGELESIn parting a doctor from his money, Leverage Funding Systems, an Oaklandbased investment company, might be said to be the expert. The company was set up In 1970 by Peter Traynor and has specialized in such tax shelters as movie and real estate syndications, with insurance sales as a sideline and emphasis on the medical profession as the source of investment money.

title: Jets Go After No. 2 Tomorrow Night
description: While still savoring his first regularseason victory as the New York Jets head coach last Sunday, Lou Holtz said this week, I sure hope my second victory is not as hard to come by as my first.

title: The American Child Vs. French Cuisine
description: Americans who travel in France with offspring in towand more and more of them seem to be doing just thathave a problem that arises every day about noon and again around 7 in the evening. The parents, not unreasonably, want to luxuriate and make their way through some memorable meals. The children's culinary requests, on the other hand, tend to be simple and American, a little too simple and American for a serious French restaurant to cope with. And even the more adventurous young eaters the ones who like pdt because it reminds them of liverwurst and who dive into ratatouilleget a bit bored and balky during a two or threehour meal.

Cummings performed the ceremony in Emmanuel Episcopal Church in Springdale, Conn. Both families live in Stamford, Conn.

description: BURBANK, Calif.The headquarters of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation here has been like a vast bunker under siege for much of the last seven years, but the people inside are starting to look out these days and think maybe the worst is over.

It was Canterbury's second triumph in three outings. Portsmouth is 22.

title: A Diva Adopts New York City

In last Monday's performance of Verdi's II Trovatore, the Italian soprano sang at the first Metropolitan Opera opening night of her career, and she is under contract to the company for about 40 more performances from now through the national tour in the spring. In addition to singing all the Trovatores scheduled for this season, she will be heard in two new productions, Puccini's La Boheme and Meyerbeer's Le Prophete.

title: Homeowner's Guide To Insulation: Part II
description: The easiest place to install insulation in any house that is already built is on an unfinished attic floorthat is, an attic that has no flooring (or perhaps just a few boards) to that the ceiling beams are still exposed. Insulation can then be put down by simply laying the material between the beams or joists (in the case of blankets or batts), or pouring it between them (in the case of loose fill which comes in bags).

title: Long Branch Prevails, 220
description: Long Branch stopped Asbury Park's highpowered offense yesterday and emerged from the battle of unbeaten teams with a 220 victory in Long Branch. Tim Wilson paced the Long Branch attack by running 2 yards for one touchdown and passing for two others. He hit Monte Robinson for 10 yards and Merlin Austin for 22 yards. Asbury Park finished with only 50 rushing yards.

title: Egyptologists Trade Notes On Ramses II
description: CAIRO, Oct. 16 Ramses II, the Pharaoh whose mummy is now in Paris for treatment of a fungus, was particular during his lifetime over how his public perceived him, a conference here has been told.

title: Fewer Britons Are Emigrating
description: LONDON, Oct. 16 (Reuters)Fewer people are emigrating from Britain, according to statistics published today, but they still outnumber immigrants .coming to live here. The Office of Population Censuses and Surveys said that emigration In the first quarter of this year was the lowest since quarterly records began 10 years ago. An estimated 43,100 people left Britain, while 37,200 new immigrants ???ived.

title: On the Nature of Presidential Leadership
description: WASHINGTONIn a Baltimore suburb, a civil engineer named Adam Moore was saying that imaginative and even drastic initiatives were needed to deal with the problem of unemployment; no problem was more pressing, he said. It was Jimmy Carter and not President Ford, Mr. Moore recognized, who was promising energetic measures to roll back unemployment. Still, Mr. Moore was planning to vote for the President. Why? I think what happens in our country is not really controlled by the President, he replied. It's controlled by Congress.

title: What's Doing in BOSTON
description: COMPATIBILITYArchitecturally, if not always socially and politically, the past, present and future get along happily together in Boston. Faneuil Hall and the Old State House, both already three score years old when stormy preRevolution meetings descended upon them, stand serene in the shadow of the brutalist new City Hall. Nearby, Quincy Market has been restored, and the redevelopment of the adjoining harborside moves ahead unperturbed by the multilane Fitzgerald Expressway that cuts a noisy overhead swath. On Back Bay's Copley Square, Richardson's Romanesque Library (1877) and McKim's renaissancestyle Public Library (1895) throw proud reflections on the glass walls of the 60story Hancock Tower. Bonwit Teller on Berkeley Street sells high fashion in an 1862 landmark, the former Museum of Natural History. She is an old city constantly renewed, David McCord, the Boston poetwriter, has said of his favorite town, but she has never had her face lifted. . . . She is part of America, and the spiritual home of many who have never seen her rising from the sea.. . . Rising from the sea? Exactly. More than half of today's downtown. Boston is madeland. Back Bay was really a bay and not section when on April 18, 1775. British troops departed by sea from the lower end of Boston Common for Lexington and Con

title: HEALTH CARE COST $12 BILLION IN TAXES

title: PEOPLE
description: A rare Stradivarius violin that figured prominently in a bizarre and frightening episode in the lives of Dr. and Mrs. Frederick Apfelbaum of Kenilworth will be sold at auction Oct. 29 at the Sotheby Parke Bernet galleries in New York. In 1974, the Apfelbaums were brutalized and threatened with death by intruders; in order to save their lives, Dr. Apfelbaum turned over to the thieves his precious Mackenzie Stadivarius, which aates to 1685. The Strad, one of about 600 known to exist, was recovered last summer, but apparently its lustre has dimmed in the eyes of the Apfelbaums because of the unpleasant memories associated with it. Strads usually command $100,000 or more.

title: The Master Builder

Beyond the alternative earnestness and foolishness, the high the tall ships and the dow of commercial exploitation, we have experienced a surprising intellectual and esthetic coming of age. There is a new and quite complex and erudite awareness of where this country stands in culture and time, of its relationships to European precedents and models and its singular contributions to civilization's continuities. And the process not ending with the Bicentennial year.

title: CHESS

Chess nomenclature, developed historically and often haphazardly, labels 1 PQ4, PQ4; 2 PQB4, PxP the Queen's Gambit and yet there is no way white can be prevented from retaking the sacrificed pawn.

title: Autumn Sunlight
description: Autumn sunlight may he no different from spring sunlight, except that days now are getting shorter instead of longer. But when a sunny day follows a day or two of autumn murk and rain with a touch of autumn chill, it is like a blessing and a promise fulfilled, The dire threats to the earth's atmosphere are no less real, but they have been postponed a little longer. The sun mankind has known all his generations still is there, and we survive in its radiance. This we know again when sunlight clarifies the day.

If the matter had been left unresolved, it would have cast a distorting shadow over the election.

title: Book Ends

Matthiessen. In addition to laying laurel wreaths on the chosen poets, the N.O.B.A.V., as we'll familiarize it, can also bring criticism down upon the head of its editor for his omissions. The man behind the new collection is Richard Eumann, who wrote a muchhonored biography of James Joyce, among other books. The Michiganborn critic has been for several years Goldsmith's professor of English literature at Oxford, but we caught him recently during one of his annual visits to this country. But in practice this is not so easy. If the distribution is an unlikely one the declarer may not think of it in the heat of battle, and if he does he may not exert himself to play for a long shot.

title: Thousands Seek a Pot of Gold, Not at the End of a Rainbow, but Underfoot
description: MELROSE, Conn., Oct. 16  Sitting on the hood of her car. Barbara Falconer explained that for her eighth wedding anniversary, her husband had given her a safe. I always wanted my own safe, she said, and she had good reason. She has found, by her own estimation, about 30,000 coins, many of which she put in a hank but some she stored in shoe boxes.

title: Developing SelfHelp
description: The Nobel Prizewinning economist Wassily Leontief has a message of hope for the world's poor countriesalong with a pointed challenge. His forecast is that with the proper political selfdiscipline and economic effort, they may be able to reduce by 50 percent the income gap that separates them from the developed countries by the year 2000. This is the conclusion of study for the United Nations made by an international team of economists under Mr. Leontief's leadership.

The completed dish will he set before an appreciative Hyman Berman, Adela's husband, who is a housepainter. Hyman does not earn a good living but he is valued by his family and friends for his sense of humor; what Hyman doesn't give in money, he gives in laughs.

title: Old Game of Politics
description: It's an old if disreputable custom for officials who are running for elective office to take whatever action they can to please real or fancied blocs of voters just before Election Dayand incumbent Presidents are, unfortunately, no exception to the rule. It is difficult believe, despite the denials, that President Ford was not acting according to this ancient and ugly tradition in taking two steps last week obviously timed for maximum political effect.

Stock Race Rained Out

Oct. 17 (AP)The World Service Life 300 stock car race was postponed for the second time today after efforts to dry the 1.5mile Charlotte Motor Speedway were thwarted by unceasingrain. title: Rohmer's 'The Marquise of O ....' A Witty, Joyous and Beautiful Film
description: "The Marquise of O. . . ." (Die Marquise von O. . . .), Eric Rohmer's German-language screen version of Heinrich von Kleist's 19th-century short story, should be to the new film season what Ingmar Bergman's "The Magic Flute" was to the last. It's a dazzling testament to the civilizing effects of several different arts, witty, joyous and so beautiful to look at that it must seem initially suspect to those of us who have begun to respond to spray-painted subway graffiti as the fine art of our time.The film was shown twice last night at Alice Tully Hall to end this year's New York Film Festival. It will open its commercial engagement Sunday at the 68th Street Playhouse.Kleist died early, a suicide at the age of 34, in 1811, leaving a small body of work that is little known in this country, aside from "Michael Kolhass." His play, "The Prince of Homburg," will have its American premiere tomorrow night at Brooklyn's Chelsea Theater Center."The Marquise of O. . . ." which was awarded the Special Jury Prize at the Cannes Film Festival this year, was mostly patronized by critics there as being, in the words of one reporter, "simply likable." This, I suppose, is probably the way someone might have described "Cosi fan tutte" had it had the odd fortune to have its premiere at a music festival along with 199 other operas.The association to "Cosi" is not accidental, although "The Marquise of O. . . ." hasn't a bar of music in it. It's a comedy of manners (early 19th century), precisely observed, romantic in mood and put into perspective by the disciplined intelligence of Mr. Rohmer, who follows the Kleist German text as if it were a screenplay.As he was in the films constituting his "Six Moral Tales"including "My Night at Maud's," "Claire's Knee" and "Chloe in the Afternoon"Mr. Rohmer continues to be fascinated by characters ensnared by moral principles that, as often as not, are at complete variance to their passions. The crucial issue is the reconciliation of passion with principle, the space between the two being the arena where the comedy is played.I've not read the Kleist story, but if Mr. Rohmer has followed it as faithfully as he reports, it would seem that one of the reasons "The Marquise of O. . . ." is so successful is that the French director shares with Kleist an appreciation for a most benign sort of irony.The time is the late 18th century and the setting a small garrison town in northern Italy where the Marquise of O (Edith Clever), a beautiful, virtuous young widow lives with her two small children in the fortress where her father is the commandant. The night the Russians take the town, the highly principled marquise is saved from a brutal rape by a handsome, courtly Russian officer, the count (Bruno Ganz), who, as it turns out, is just as highly principled as the marquise. Almost, that is.A month or so later, the marquise suspects she may be pregnant, but the idea is so absurd she and her mother laugh at the idea. A few more days pass. The marquise becomes worried. She swears to her mother that she has a clear conscience, but also asks her mother to bring a midwife to examine her. Sniffs her mother, "A clear conscience and a midwife?"What is apparent to the audience from the start is that the count, who had so honorably saved the marquise from rape by fellows of lesser rank and station, had himself, that same evening, taken advantage of her after she'd been put to sleep with some poppy-seed tea.Without acknowledging his slip from grace, the count almost immediately has sought to marry the marquise, but the marquise had vowed on the death of her husband never to remarry. She dismisses him. The count suffers. The marquise suffers.The pregnancy continues. The marquise's father and mother, scandalized, banish their wayward daughter to her country estate, where she plans to live in seclusion. After a while, though, she publishes a public notice to the effect that "the Marquise of O. . . ., having become pregnant without her knowing how," will marry the father "for family reasons, if he will present himself."Though "The Marquise of O. . . ." has the shape of a fairy tale, Mr. Rohmer treats his characters with compassion for the predicaments that, to them, are profoundly seriousand to us profoundly absurd. He never mocks attitudes and choices. He illuminates them by accepting that vanished society on its own terms, and by evoking it in a production of breathtaking images that recall how the world looked to Jacques Louis David, whose "Madame Recamier" seems to have been the principal inspiration for Nestor Almendros, Mr. Rohmer's cameraman.The German actorsnone of whom I've seen beforeperform with the kind of grace I associate with stylish Restoration comedy, though the comedy here is of an entirely different sensibility. It's not brittle or bitchy. Characters don't talk from the head but from the heart, and one of the things that makes "The Marquise of O. . . ." much more than simply likable is our awareness that their feelings are earnestlypossibly fatallysincere.

Their varying nature has been more than ever apparent.

title: Their Bomb Kills 3 I.R.A. Men
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 17 (AP)Three members of the Irish Republican Army were killed last night when explosives they were placing at a Belfast gasstorage tank blew up prematurely, the I.R.A. announced today. An I.R.A. statement said, in part: The intended operation was against a British Army bil let in the gasworks complex and was designed to avoid injury to the civilian population in the surrounding ares.

title: Cox Is Named Head Of Ad Review Unit
description: Kenneth A. Cox, a former commissioner of the Federal Communications Commission, has been named chairman of the National Advertising Review Board, the advertising industry's selfregulating organization. effective immediately.

title: Roosevelt Raceway Opens 48Night Meeting Tonight
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Oct. 17The opening of a 48night harnessracing meeting tomorrow at Roosevelt Raceway will be highlighted by the finale of a fivetrack competition between Italian and American women drivers.

title: Outdoor Entertainers Warm Up the Chill Streets of Parisi
description: PARIS, Oct. 17With the chill of autumn, the performers in Paris theaters, concert halls and cabarets are playing to full houses again, profitably and warmly.

title: Browne Sings At Palladium; Show Uneven
description: Jackson Browne's late show at the Palladium Saturday night (yesterday morning, actually, since it began at 1;50 A.M. and ended at 4:05) was a strange affair. It began more or less like Jackson Browne concerts of the pastslow, careful and a bit plodding. But then it found a groove, spacey and detached but a groove nonetheless. Then it built to a fevered climax in which Mr. Browne seemed almost uninvolved. And then it petered out in a bleary improvised extension of a Dave Van Ronk song about cocaine.

title: Joffrey Ballet Revives Astarte, Olympics,
description: Astarte was the most successful single ballet that the Joffrey Ballet ever presented. It attracted coverage from national news weeklies, captured a newly aware public's imagination and caused a hum of excitement each time it was performed in the late 60's. It was the now look and sound, but Saturday evening, when it was revived, it looked and sounded like a period piece. The ballet hasn't changed but the world has, and perhaps the piece ought to be called Astarte1967 to put thing:: in proper perspective.

title: 3 Oversized Field Goals Bloom On Texas Spreads in One Day
description: Tony Franklin, a 19yearold Texas A. & M. sophomore, kicked the longest field goal in the I08year history of football Saturday. He booted the ball 64 yards from placement in the first quarter against Baylor, at 2:20 P.M., C.D.T., in College Station, Tex. His record lasted about 20 minutes.

title: Advertising
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Oct. 16One of the primary concerns of the people attending the annual meeting of the Association of National Advertisers that ended here today is finding alternatives to television whose soaring costs have caused havoc with their advertising budgets.

title: Alioto Suit Resumes Today
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 17 (UPI)An eightyearold dispute between the nowdefunct Look magazine and Joseph L. Alioto. former San Francisco Mayor, goes to trial in Federal Court tomorrow for the third time. Mr. Alioto has sued the publishers of Look for $12.5 million over an article published Sept. 23, 1969, in which he was linked to the Mafia. He denied any association with criminals.

title: Reviving the Urban Park
