description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 18 (AP) Jody Powell, Jimmy Carter's press secretary, says that Reg Murphy, editorpublisher of The San Francisco Examiner, has been given credentials to cover the Democratic Presidential campaign.

title: Early Election Called in Quebec
description: QUEBEC CITY, Oct 18 (Reuters)Premier Robert Bourassa tonight dissolved the provincial legislature an dcalled general elections for Nov. 15, two years ahead of schedule. Mr. Bourassa, in a television announcement, said he wanted a new mandate before entering into discussions with Canada's other provinces and the Federal Government on a new Canadian Constitution.

title: Card of Thanks
description: BELSKYJoseph. We gratefully acknowledge the outpouring of expressions of sympathy and regret upon the passing of our beloved husband and father, Joseph Belsky, Our sorrow has been eased by the knowledge that so very many have expressed their love, respect and appreciation for the contributions to humanity made by him during his lifetime. That knowledge has made our loss more bearable, with pride and affection for the thousands whom he hag aided.

title: Administration Blocks Move by H.E.W. Officials to Take Racial Census of 16,000 Public School Systems
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Administration has blocked a move by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to take a census of 16,000 of the nation's public school systems to determine the composition of school; by race, sex and other factors.

title: Kraftco Links Poor Translations In Currencies to 18.4% Profit Dip
description: The Krafico Corporation, the world's largest processor of dairy and packaged foods yesterday attributed an 18.4 percent drop in thirdquarter earnings to an adverse effect of foreign currency translations.

title: HOSPITAL AFFILIATION STIRS RELBIOUS ISSUE
description: A move by the Beame administration to give a multimilliondollar affiliation contract to a Roman Catholic hospital instead of a Jewish medical college in the Bronx produced a confrontation yesterday marked by ethnic and religious charges.

title: 9 INDICTMENTS MADE ON MEDICAID ABUSES
description: District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan yesterday announced the indictment of nine defendants, iricluding four chiropractors and the owner of one of the largest diagnostic laboratories in New York City, on charges ranging from grand larceny to the falsification of business records in connection with New York's Medicaid nroeram.

title: Transcendental Meditation Session Proving Popular at United Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 19The delegates slipped out of the General Assembly. Almost furtively, they ducked into an unmarked conference room down the hall.

title: The U.N. Today
New Jersey Briefs
description: Parole applications by Thomas Whelan, a former Jersey City Mayor and Thomas Flaherty, a former Council President of that city, vere denied yesterday by the United States Parole Commission. Both Mr. Whelan, 54 years old, and Mr. Flaherty, 48, began serving 15year terms for bribery and extortion in October 1971 at the Federal Penitentiary at Lewisburg, Pa.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: Bread Price Up in Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 19 (Reuters)The price of bread rose by 25 percent today following a government decision to increase the minimum guaranteed prices paid to producers for some agricultural products. The rise in bread prices followed an increase of 30 per cent In the minimum guaranteed price for flour. Pork went up by about 15 per cent.

title: City Opera Reopens After Strike With Spirited Smiles and Humor
description: Buoyed by the end of a threeweek strike and the high spirits of La Belle Helen? the New York City Opera reopened last night in a spirit offor the most partgood humor.

title: Gilbert Ryle, British Philosopher Of Mind, Dead in Yorkshire at 76
description: LONDON, Oct. 19Gilbert Ryle, whose philosophy of mind, as it came to be called, has been a central issue in philosophy for more than 25 years, died on Oct. 6 in Yorkshire, where he was on vacation. He was 76 years old.

title: Dean's Book Says Nixon Proposed Tax Inquiry Of Scanlan's Magazine
description: An attempt by former Presient Richard M. Nixon to have the Internal Revenue Service investigate a magazine that had angered'him is reported by John W. Dean in his new book Blind Ambition.

title: BOND PRICES FALL; NEW ISSUES SLOW
description: The credit markets slumped yesterday as bond prices dropped sharpiy and new issuescarrying higher yieldsgenerally failed to sell quickly after being offered to investors. The setback, dealers reported, was caused by this week's heavy volume of new issues coupled with an upward revision in the market's current view of the Federal Reserve's likely target for shortterm Interest rates. In this heavy atmosphere, a new Bell System bond issue was marketed at a yield of 8.25 percent, up from 8 percent in the preceding such sale a month ago. The $175million issue brought to market yesterday was less than a quarter sold at the end of the day.

title: BANK ROLE IS STUDIED IN NEW YORK'S CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether several major commercial banks in early 1975 deliberately forced New York City to raise money so the hanks could cash in their own city securities.

title: QUARTER NET UP 44% FOR TIMES COMPANY
description: The New York Times Company reported yesterday that its consolidated net income for the three months ended Sept. 30 rose by 44 percent on revenues that set a record of $108 million.

title: Telephone Company Is Giving Scores
description: The New York Telephone Company will provide inningbyinning scores of the World Series games to fans calling 9991313. The scores will be updated after each half inning, and final scores will be carried for several hours after the end of each game.

title: Police Sergeants Delegates Back New Pact With New York City
description: Delegates of the Sergeants Benevolent Association yesterday overwhelmingly approved a new contract with New York City that contains significant concessions on their part and no gains for their union.

title: Los Angeles Car Habit is Difficult to Break
description: LOS ANGELESTo get people out of their cars in an effort to cut down on pollution and traffic jams, state officials here recently turned over one lane in each direction of California's busiest freeway to buses and car pools. Reaction among city residents, known for their almost singular devotion to their cars, was fierce and predictable.

title: Outside Looking In
description: PARISFor reasons known best to astrology, a practice much venerated in the Orient, October seems a particularly significant month for the Chinese People's Republic. on Oct. 23, 1961, Chou Enlai abruptly quit a Soviet party congress he was attending in Moscow and flew back to Peking, heralding the break between those Communist capitals.

title: Killer of Policemen Allowed to Plead to Lesser Charge, Avoiding Death
description: Upon the recommendation of the Manhattan District Attorney, Justice Burton B. Roberts of State Supreme Court allowed a man to plead guilty yesterday to a lesser charge in the murder of two New York City policemen rather than face the death penalty if convicted.

title: Cosmos Name Ticket Manager
description: Dieter Sayle, the former assistant ticket manager of the New York Mets, has been named ticket manager of the New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League. Sayle, 35 years old, has been connected with professional sports for nine years.

title: HONDAILLE SEEKING FORT WORTH STEEL
description: Houdaille Industries announced in Buffalo yesterday that it was offering to buy all the outstanding common shares of the Fort Worth Steel and Machinery Company at a cash price of $19 a share. Houdaille said that all shares tendered until 5 P.M. Dallas time and 6 P.M. New York time on Nov. 1 would be purchased. If all of the 969,335 outstanding shares are tendered, Houdaille would expend $18.9 million.

title: Shining the Apple
description: Most New Yorkers would immediately point the finger of blame at the Department of Sanitation, a notoriously inefficient operation whose performance hasn't been improved any by recent austerity cutbacks in personnel. But that's only a piece of the problem.

title: Reporter's Notebook, Ford Resembles Carter at Times
description: PLAINS, Ga.In some dimlyremembered hotel room not long ago, Johnny Carson the latenight television host, was heard delivering a memorable assessment of the CarterFord contest as a choice between fear of the unknown and fear of the known. That may have stretched the point but, for someone who paid a 10day call on the Carter campaign after 18 months of close observation of the President, it did not seem wide of the mark.

title: WINE TALK
description: MARGAUX, France, Oct. 17  The trees still are dark green in the Mdoc but, down the symetrical rows of vines, the grape leaves are red, gold, rust and bronze. A sharp wind cuts in from the Atlantic, driving clouds and rainstorms eastward to the Massif Central.

title: Lebanese Fight on as Truce Nears
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 19Lebanese Christian and Moslem militia forces shelled each other's residential quarters here today as the Arab leaders plan for a ceasefire in Lebanon beginning Thursday was welcomed by the few politicians who made statements.

title: ThirdGame Box Score
description: CINCINNATI (N.)

title: IRAN PLANNING TO BUY A STAKE OF 25.01% IN GERMANY'S KRUPP
description: ESSEN, West Germany, Oct. 19 (Reuters)Iran is to buy a stake of just over 25 percent in the huge West German steel and engineering Krupp concern, the company said here today.

title: W.H.A. Racers Oust Browitt
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Oct. 19 (UPI)James Browitt, president and general manager of the Indianapolis Racers, has been dismissed, officials of the World Hockey Association team confirmed today No replacement was announced.

title: Syntex Assails F.D.A. Over Report Of Concern's AntiArthritis Drug
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Oct. 19  The Syntex Corporation has asserted that a press release issued last Thursday by the Food and Drug Administration con the company's antiarthritis drug, Naprosyn, was an outrageous breach of duo process and the F. D. A.'s ethical responsibilities.

title: Best Friend Opens at Lyceum
Reds Defeat Yanks, 62, for Third Viatory And Seek a World Series Sweep Tonight
description: The Cincinnati Reds, determined to show the baseball world they are the modern equivalent of the old Yankees, defeated the new Yankees, 62, last night at Yankee Stadium and took a commanding lead of three games to none in the World Series.

title: New Books Today
description: Among Those Present: A Reporter's View of Twentyfive Years in Washington, by Nancy Dickerson (Random House, $8.95).

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: City Hall is an Enigma to Students From Soviet
description: A group of touring Soviet graduate students went to City Hall to meet Mayor Beame yesterday, but wound up listening to a lecture on garbage and being besieged by more than 1,000 angry women demanding more money for the city's schools. The Russians were slightly bewildered.

title: GAP. GROWTH RATE SLOWS TO 4% LEVEL; HOUSING STARTS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Commerce Department reported today that the broadest gauge of United States economic performance slowed its rate of growth to 4 percent in the third quarter; The report seemed certain to lead to an intensified political debate during the final two weeks of the Presidential campaign.

title: Raclette: First You Build a Roaring Fire
description: When we recall our first encounter with the good things of the Swiss tableit was at least a couple of decades agoour mind fairly aches and reeks with nostalgia and pleasure. We remember our first sampling of deepfried fresh perch and truite au bleu, the perch and the trout taken from the thencrystalclear waters of Lac Leman for as the Englishspeaking would have It. Lake Geneva).

title: Talk of the Series
description: When they played the first World Series game in the new Yankee Stadiumthis was back in 1923, not last night in the even newer stadium John McGraw was reigning in the visitors dugout, Miller Huggins was running the home dugout, and a concert baritone named Graham McNamee was sitting in the open seats saying into a pieshaped microphone, Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen of the radio audience.

title: Night for All From Fisher Hall to Yankee Stadium
description: New York is a city of Somebodies and namedropping is a local industry. But last night, a great one for taxi drivers, the town outdid itself, conveying resident and visiting celebrities to the Yankee Stadium and to Lincoln Center. in the Bronx highlands, the Somebodies shivered, either from the action or the weather, at the World Series. Downtown, the Somebodies sat prominently and starchily in formal dress for the acoustical opener at newly rebuilt Fisher Hall.

title: About Real Estate
description: It was in 1968 that the International Business Machines Corporation set up shop in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. That was the period when the BedfordStuyvesant Restoration Corporation was getting into operation with the strong support of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy.

title: George L. Zevnik, Vice President Of Guardian Life, is Dead at 56
description: George L. Zevnik, a vice president of the Guardian Life Insurance Company, died Monday at his home in Nyack, N.Y. He was 56 years old.

title: Two Marines and Navy Clerk Held In Robbery of Aircraft Carrier
description: NORFOLK, Va., Oct. 18 (AP)Two Marines and one Navy man have been arrested in connection with the $80,000 robbery of the aircraft carrier Forrestal last month, the Navy said today.

title: Life Imprisonment is Asked In Trial of Two Palestinians
description: ISTANBUL, Oct. 19 (Reuters)Te prosecution today demanded life imprisonment, and not the death penalty as expected, for two Palestinians accused of murdering four El Al airline passengers in a guerrilla attack here last August.

title: Lebanese Battle As Truce Nears
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 19Lebanese Christian and Moslem militia forces shelled each other's residential quarters here today as the Arab leaders plan for a ceasefire in Lebanon beginning Thursday was welcomed by the few politicians who made statements.

title: Dr. S. Morris Kupchan, Researcher In Cancer, Won Guenther Award
description: Dr. S. Morris Kupchan, a University of Virginia faculty member and prominent cancer researcher best known for his work with plantderived drugs, died yesterday in Boston, Mass. He was 53 years old.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Church Council Studies Demand For Ouster on Nazi Crime Charge
description: Heads of churches that belong to the National Council of Churches met in emergency session yesterday to consider demands that a council board member be dismissed because of charges that he is a Nazi war criminal.

title: Harvard Researcher Tells Medical Aides That Reducing Tension Will Help Combat Disease
description: MIAMI BEACH, Oct. 19A Harvard public health researcher told his colleagues today that their newest and probably most difficult challenge in reducing the incidence of disease in this country is finding better ways to help families combat stress.

title: Philanthropist Devoted to Sound And a Perfectionist Acoustician
description: When Avery Fisher, the highfidelity manufacturer, gave $10 million to Philharmonic Hall in September 1973, the auditorium was renamed in his honor. At the time, be had no idea that half of the bequestplus an unspecified additional amountwould be used to rebuild the hall's interior. Now the work has been completed, and Avery Fisher Hall is in every sense properly named. Some of the money for the reconstruction of the lobby and backstage areas came from the Charles A. Dana and William Randolph Hearst Foundation. But the bulk of the $6.4 million total is from Mr. Fisher and he says, the expenditure will not lessen the impact of his original bequest for the maintenance of the hall and for the annual Avery Fisher Awards for promising young musicians. The income from a fully rented hall will more than make up for the money I gave for the reconstruction, he said yesterday.

title: Djibouti Independence Vote Set
description: PARIS, Oct. 19 (AP)Olivier Stirn, Secretary of State for Overseas Territories, announced today that the Afars and Issas Territory around the port of Djibouti will vote in a referendum next spring on whether to become independent.

title: With Erving Still Absent, CBS Cancels Nets on TV
description: The continued absence of Julius Erving from the New York Nets has caused CBS to cancel the telecast of the Nets opening game against the Golden State Warriors at Oakland on Friday night. The game, scheduled to start at 11:45 o'clock, Eastern daylight time, was to have been the first of 40 National Basketball Association games CBS planned to televise this season.

title: Musicians Ratify a 3Year Contract
description: Union musicians last night ratified a threeyear contract with the New York Philharmonic, permitting the orchestra to open its 135th subscription season at the reconstructed Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Giants Demote Hughes in Changes
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Oct. 19The National Football League trading deadline passed today and Pat Hughes thinks he got a bad deal.

title: A Panamanian Freighter, Loaded With Marijuana, Is Towed to Miami Base
description: MIAMI, Oct. 19  A Panamanian freighter, loaded with more than 80 tons of marijuana was towed 500 miles into the Coast Guard base here today.

title: OTB is Adding Glamour At New Broadway Office
description: A lush, carpeted offtrack betting parlor will open in four months at 42d Street and Broadway with the expectation that it will increase the handle and improve OTB's image.

title: Bold Forbes Takes Dash In His Return to Racing
description: Bold Forbes, the Kentucky Derby and Belmont Stakes winner, who had been sidelined for four months with a leg injury, yesterday stirred a crowd of 11,672 with an impressive triumph in his comeback effort at Belmont Park at the race track

title: Trot Driver Dies After Spill
description: MAYWOOD, III., Oct. 19 (AP)Eddie Lutes, 40 years old, a wellknown harness racing driver from Batavia, Ill., died yesterday, one week after suffering injuries in a spill at Maywood Park. Lutes was hospitalized after the accident in the seventh race at Maywood. Survivors include his widow and two children.

title: Carey Asks Lefkowitz to Quit Suit Seeking to Block Offshore Drilling
description: Governor Carey has asked Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz to end New York State's participation in a suit seeking to bar drilling for oil on the Atlantic coastal shelf.

title: Professional Football
description: Professional Football

title: Court Calls for New Balloting in Assembly Primary in Queens
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Queens yesterday ordered a rerun of a closely contested Democratic Assembly primary election in which the incumbent, Joseph P. Lisa, lost by fewer than 100 votes.

title: 50 Black Residents Complain To Sutton About Rising Crime
description: When black residents of the St. Nicholas Housing Project went to Borough President Percy E. Sutton's political club in Harlem on Monday night to complain that nothing was being done about rising crime in their community, Mr. Sutton gave them the same advice he said he had just given to a white group with similar complaints: Fight.

title: Disaster Area in Minnesota
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Minn., Oct. 19 (UPI) The Itasca County Board of Commissioners voted today to declare the county a disaster area because of economic losses resulting from the ban on hunting and fishing.

title: Notes on People
description: Walter J. Leonard, assistant to the president of Harvard University since 1971, will accept the challenge and become president of Nashville's financially ailing. Fisk University. The 46yearold graduate of Morehouse College in Atlanta is also a Harvard Law School graduate and has been in charge of Harvard's affirmative action program for employment.

title: Just Like Old Times, Mrs. Abzug is on Stump Again  But for Carter
description: By all outward appearances, it was no more and no less than Bella Abzug on the stump again in the nowfamiliar style arms flailing, her message barked over a bullhorn, a special grin for truck drivers and police officers.

title: Imperato Named to Succeed Bellin
description: Mayor Beanie announced the appointmerit of Dr. Pascal James lmperato yesterday as New York Citys Commissioner of Health effective Jan. I. Whether Dr. Imperato will also succeed the current Health Commissioner, Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, as chairman of the hoard of the troubled Health and Hospitals Corporation is still a question.

title: The Limits of Beame's Authority
description: With the disclosure that Mayor Beame is actively seeking the ouster of Dr. John L. S. Holloman as president of New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation, the already tense relations between City Hall and the city's big quasi independent agencies come under fresh strains. For Mr. Beame, a move to exercise control over management of the sprawling municipalhospital system marks a major shift of policy. At the same time, it is not entirely clear what the Mayor's legal authority is in this area.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Cunard Steam Ship Company announced in London yesterday that it reached an outofcourt settlement of a dispute that was holding up its proposed acquisition of the 12 remaining refrigerated cargo vessels of the financially troubled Maritime Fruit Company, an IsraeliAmerican shipping concern.

title: Moscow Jews Say They Were Beaten After a Visa SitIn
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19A dozen Jewish dissidents said tonight that they had been taken to a forest outside Moscow and beaten by plainclothesmen after a twoday sitin at an administrative building of the Supreme Soviet. Their injuries were mostly bruises, although one man suffered a broken nose and another a black eye.

title: Latest Blows for Jets: 3 Top Runners Injured
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Oct. 19It may not seem possible, but the Jets running game is in worse shape today than was last night, when the New Yorkers were routed, 417, by the New England Patriots.

title: Moynihan Urges Manufacturers That Are Planning to Leave State of New York to Postpone Moves
description: BUFFALO. Oct. 19Daniel P. Moynihan, DemocraticLiberal candidate for United States Senator from New York, called on manufacturers who are planning to move from the state to postpone those plans for six months to give a new Democratic administration a chance to show them that it will not be necessary.

title: The Senate Races I
description: The Senate of the 95th Congress will be missing a few of the best known figures of the 94th by the resignations notably, of Senators Mansfield of Montana, Scott of Pennsylvania, Symington of Missouri, Hart of Michigan and Pastore of Rhode Island. But for partisan division and overall ideology, it promises to differ little from its predecessor.

title: China's Leftists Are Now Called TapitalistRoaders
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 19China's new authorities today stepped up their evidently wellorganized campaign against Mao Tsetung's widow, Chiang Ching, and three other senior leftists with an editorial attacking those who engage in conspiracies and attempt to usurp party and state power.

title: How Lefty Gomez Talked to the Ball
description: While George Steinbrenner, the Yankees dynamic owner, was ordering Mickey Rivers to start hitting and baseball's warmblooded commissioner, Bowie Kuhn, was awaiting National Broadcasting Company's permission to order the World Series resumed, Lefty Gomez was holding court in a hotel lobby. on second thought, maybe holding court isn't perfectly accurate, because Vernon Louis Gomez isn't as regal as all that. Though he was a prince of pitchers when he was helping the Yankees win all those championships in the 1930'sin five World Series over eight years he never lost a decisionhe did not take himself seriously, and nothing changed when he was stuffed and mounted in the Hall of Fame. in this season of wintry night games, people seek the sunshine of his company, as the Dodgers new manager, Tommy Lasorda, sought him out on this occasion.

title: Market Place
description: Once a company finds that the price of its stock has slipped below the minimum level for margin purchasesgenerally $5 a shareit may be tempted to ask shareholders for permission to split the stock in reverse.

title: YankeesReds Scoring
description: N.Y. Cin. SECOND INNING

title: New Fisher Hall Opens on an Acoustical High Note
description: The new Avery Fisher Hall, which has sprung from the skeleton of the old one after some five months of furious reconstruction, officially opened last night with a Pension Fund Concert of the New York Philharmonic, conducted by Pierre Boulez.

title: Liberals in Canada Lose ByElections; French is an Issue
description: OTTAWA. Oct. 19The governing Liberal Party has been jolted by sharp defeats in two byelections apparently mainly as a result of its controversial language and economic policies.

title: McKay Gives Bucs Old College Try
description: TAMPA, Flay, Oct. 19On most Sunday afternoons in other years, John McKay watched a professional football game with his wife and two sons and laughed at the holding penalties that were called and not called by National Football League officials.

title: Carter, in New York, Seeking Traditional Party Vote
description: Campaigning in an area that is often taken for granted by Democrats, Jimmy Carter pleaded for support in Harlem last night to start a week of three appearances in New York City to shore up traditional Democratic strength among blacks, Roman Catholics and Jews.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Limits of Beame's Authority
description: With the disclosure that Mayor Beanie is actively seeking the ouster of Dr. John L. S. Holloman as president of New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation, the already tense relations between City Hall and the city's big quasiindependent agencies come News under fresh strains. For Mr. Analysis Became, a move to exercise control over management of the sprawling municipalhospital system marks a major shift of policy. At the same time, it is not entirely clear what the Mayor's legal authority is in this area.

title: Mystery Illness In Parts Plant Puzzles a Town
description: KITTANNING, Pa., Oct. 18When the first breeze of autumn has turned summer's lush greenery to brown, yellow and red, it is natural to think of gremlins, goblins and ghosts here in the rolling hills of western Pennsylvania.

title: Fisher Hall is Alive With Grace
description: This time they did it right. The new Avery Fisher Hallnew from top to button, new in structure, shape and style, literally suspended from new roof trusses within the shell of the existing building is as good to look at as it is to listen to. Acoustics have been its continuing problem since it was built in 1962, and acoustical evaluations will determine its success. But architecture and acoustics are virtually inseparable in this case, and the new hall is a lovely place to be.

title: Rep. Holtzman Asks Levi For Inquiry on Testimony By Ford at 73 Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)7Representative Elizabeth Holtzman, Democrat of Brooklyn, asked Attorney General Edward H. Levi today to order the Watergate special prosecutor to investigate whether President Ford lied during hear ines confirming him as Vice President.

title: McCarron Hurt at Bowie
description: BOWIE, Md., Oct, 19 (AP)Chris McCarron, America's jockey champion, reinjured his left shoulder today when his mount, Fairly Rough, dropped, his head in the starting gate of the feature race at Bowie Race Course.

title: Pastorini in Accident
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 19 (UPI)Dan Pastorini, Houston Oilers quarterback, was hospitalized today for observation of minor injuries suffered when his camper ran off a street at 4 A.M. and crashed into several trees.

title: Campaign 76: Barren and Petty
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Oct. 19The Presidential candidates, complained Senator George McGovern of South Dakota last week, have spent far too much of their time on demagoguery, brainwashing, cardiac lusts, the wit and wisdom of Earl Butz and freedom in Poland. The 1972 Democratic Presidential nominee said he doubted that he had ever seen an emptier campaign, a pettier campaign.

title: In Memoriam
description: BARTLETTElla Hornert. The dead are like the stars by day, withdrawn Horn mortal eyes, but not extinct. Ihey bold their way in envy through the sky Cherished memories.

title: Moscow Jews Say They Were Beaten After a Visa SitIn
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19A dozen Jewish dissidents said tonight that they had been taken to a forest outside Moscow and beaten by plainclothesmen after a twoday sitin at an administrative building of the Supreme Soviet. Their injuries were mostly bruises, although one man suffered a broken nose and another a black eye.

title: U.S, CONCERNS ANGRY AT BOYCOTT REPORT
description: A number of American companies that do business with Arab nation, voiced strong indignation yesterday after finding their names on a list of concerns asked by Arab states to comply with a boycott of Israel.

title: D. M. Cohen, Accountant, Marries Smadar Karni
description: Smadar Karni, daughter of Col. Nachman Karni, Israeli Defense Forces, retired, and Mrs. Karni, of Tel Aviv, was married yesterday afternoon to David M. Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Denis Cohen of Glasgow, Scotland.

title: Ogden H. Hammond, Financier, Dies in Winchester Va., at Age 64
description: Ogden H. Hammond, a financier and brother of Representative Millicent H. Fenwick, Republican of Bernardsville, N. J., died yesterday in the Shawnee Springs Nursing Home, Winchester, Va., after short illness. He was 64 years old and had homes in Winchester and England.

title: India Delays Trial of Socialist
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 19 (Reuters)Proceedings against George Fernandes, the Socialist Party leader, and 21 others were adjourned for a week today after defense lawyers asked for the hearing to be moved to a larger room. The defendants are accused of conspiring to overawe the Government by criminal force, of using explosives to sabotage rail and road links and of damaging government buildins.

title: The Riyadh Pact
description: Fierce warfare continued in Beirut yesterday, many hours after the signing in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, of a new peace plan for Lebanon. The continued bloodshed in the Lebanese capital underlined the difficulties the backers of the ceasefire effort will have in implementing the pact. Too many lives have been lost and too many sacrifices have been made by all sides in this complex strife for the contending parties to have any mutual trust. And all sides, of course, remember vividly how many earlier peace accords turned out to be illusory.

title: Even the Restaurateur Was Awed By Her Little Dinner for TwentyOne
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y.As a youngster growing up in Amstetten, Austria, Monika Pacher remembers her mother busy.in the family kitchen with schnitzel or nockerlin, telling her firmly: The only way to learn is to do. You may have a disaster or two, do not mind.

title: U. N. ARMS EMBARGO ON PRETORIA VETOED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 19Britain, France and the United States today vetoed a resolution in the Security Council that would have imposed an embargo on arms shipments to South Africa in an effort to force the Government there to relinquish control of SouthWest Africa and accede to free elections in that territory.

title: Doctors Strike Just One of Crises Facing Colombian Chief
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Oct. 18President Alfonso Lpez Michelsen of Colombia facing a combination of problems that would be called a national crisis in most countries, but are regarded here as the habitual level of conflict and insecurity.

title: New Fisher Hall Opens on an Acoustical High Note
description: The new Avery Fisher Hall, which has sprung from the skeleton of the old one after some five months of furious reconstruction, officially opened last night with a Pension Fund Concert of the New York Philharmonic, conducted by Pierre Boulez.

title: Civil Service Settlement Imposed
description: NEW, CITY, N.Y., Oct. 19The Rock, land Cpurgy Legislature imposed a settlement in a 10month old contract dispute tonight by granting 3.5 petcent pay increase to 1,750 Civil Service employees in a oneyear:contract. Bernard Fallon, chairman of the County Legislature, said new negotiations for the 1977 contract would begin as soon as a challenge to representation by the Civil Service Employees Union, has petitioned for decertification of the Civil Service Employees Association unit, which now represents county employees.

title: State to Build HighRise Center in Downtown Trenton
description: TRENTON. Oct. 19Plans for a $15 million highrise building n nowntown Trenton that would house offices.of the state court system, the Attorney General's office and eventually the criminal justice division, were announced today by Governor Byrne just before he left for a week in Japan.

title: Couple Ordered Held for Murder InBeating Death of Daughter, 4
description: CLEVELAND. TENN., Oct. 19 (AP)Ronald and Wanda Maddux today were ordered held for grand jury action on charges of firstdegree murder in the heating death of Mrs. Maddux's 4yearold daughter, Melisha Morgana Gibson.

title: Advertising
description: Slowly and it is hoped, surely the Advertising Research Foundation IS moving ahead with its plans for Project Payout.

title: 3 New Heroes Help Reds Keep Sweeping Along
description: The Cincinnati Reds, standing on the threshold of a sweep over the New York Yankees, counted their blessings and saluted their bench last night and decided that neither New York rain nor gloom of night figured to prevent them from completing the job in the 73d World Series.

title: Judge Disqualifies Himself In 2d CarterArtis Trial For Murder in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct. 19Passaic County Judge William J. Marchese disqualified himself today from presiding at the second murder trial of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis.

title: Lindbergh Memorial Fund Begun By Doolittle and Neil Armsrtong
description: Two pilots of note, Gen. James NI. Doolittle and Neil A. Armstrong, announced yesterday plans to honor one of the most (celebrated aviators with the establishment of the Charles A. Lindbergh Memoscientists, Fund to support the work of young scientists, explorers and conservationists.

title: Navajo Film Lacks Thrust
description: "Dineh: the People," which opened a five-day run yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art, is an earnest, artless documentary about the plight of approximately 5,000 Navajo Indians who face eviction from their Arizona lands as a result of pressures the film makers identify with large coal and oil interests."Dineh," which is what the Navajos call themselves, was directed by Steven Hornick and Jonathan Reinis, who lived with the Navajos for almost a year recording tribal meetings, interviews with tribal leaders and legal representatives, the members of one Indian family as well as with representatives of the Federal Bureau of Indian Affairs.Though hugely sympathetic to the Navajo cause, the film never takes on a life of its own. It seldom discovers its subject but, instead, has the appearance of recording only authorized moments. This has the unfortunate effect of diminishing and trivializing a problem that is urgent and real.

title: GO ING OUTGuide
description: ARTIST WITH FEELINGS Ben Shahn, the artist, came to the United States from Lithuania in 1906 during the turnofthecentury waves of migration from Eastern Europe. His paintings, drawings, prints and photographs were always vehicles for the ideas of the social realist. Drawings on Sacco and Vanzetti (two immigrant anarchists executed in 1927 by Massachuetts), for example, displayed the style with which he subsequently became identified.

title: Does It Really Matter?
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The real scandal of this election so far is the indifference and even cynicism of so many of the American people. on the 200th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence, when there has been so much talk about the glories of the democratic process and the endless struggles for universal sufferage, less than half of the eligible voters are expected to go to the polls on Nov. 2, and the rest are asking: Does it really matter?

title: Amex Prepares Booklet On Options Tax Planning
description: The 1976 Tax Reform Act has had an impact on other investment strategies, including option trading. The American Stock Exchange has tried to make it easier for traders to work out the new regulations with a new booklet called Tax Planning for Listed Options.

title: News Summary
description: A triple veto in the U.N. Security Council by Britain, France and the United States blocked a resolution that would have embargoed arms shipments to South Africa in an efrprt to make that country yield control of SouthWest Africa. The three nations Maintained that adoption of the resolution:could upset Secretary of State Kissinger'S efforts to induce South Africa to accept terms kir a conference on the territory, which the U.N. calls Namibia. Voting for the embargo were the Soviet Union, China, Sweden and the seven sponsors of theres:Jution: Guyana, Benin (formerly Da homey). Libya, Pakistan, Parmma. Rumania and Tanzania, Japan and Italy abstained. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: Move for a Hospital Affiliation in the Bronx Brings Religious Charges
description: A move by the Beame administration to give a multimilliondollar affiliation contract to a Roman Catholic hospital instead of a Jewish medical college in the Bronx produced a confrontation yesterday marked by ethnic and religiods charges.

title: Personal Finance: New Tax Laws Spawning Mianicipal Bond Funds
description: Thanks to the recent changes in the tax laws, municipal bond funds are coming up like mushrooms after a spring rain. They are a new form of investment, calculated to make it easier for small investors to reach for the taxexempt features of bonds issued by state and local governments.

title: DISCREPANCY CITED AT BRONFMAN TRIAL
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 19Defense attorneys in the Bronfman kidnapping trial continued their efforts today to undermine the credibility of Federal Bureau of Investigation agents who have been among the first prosecution witnesses.

title: Eleanor Clay Ford, Edsel's Widow, Dies; Detroit Art Patron
description: Eleanor Clay Ford, the widow of Edsel B. Ford and the mother of Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the board of the Ford Motor Company, died yesterday at Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit, A resident of Grosse Point Shores, Mich., an affluent. Detroit suburb, she was 80 years old.

title: Technology: Satellite Allows 2Way Educational Broadcasts
description: Twoway educational broadcasting via communications satellites in space, between widely scattered classrooms on Earth, took a long step forward this week.

title: About Education
description: Vocational educators whose work has taken on new visibility in light of widespread unemployment, are coming under new pressures from the Federal Government to eliminate alleged sexism in their curriculums, recruiting and counseling.

title: Running Quarterbacks: How They Hurt the Defense
description: Steve Grogan, a big, rugged 23yearold from the plains of Kansas, showed a national television audience on Monday night what a quarterback who cares to run can do to defenses. Grogan, who stands 6 feet 4 inches and weighs 205 pounds, destrayed the Jets in the Patriots 417 victory, as he rushed for 103 yards and scored two touchdown: (He has six for the season, which puts him up with league leaders.)

title: Power Commission Drops Referral on Natural Gas Case
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Federal Power Commission said that it would not refer a natural gas case involving the Gulf Oil Corporation and the Texas Eastern Transmission Corporation to the Justice Department because the department had already requested and received the materials in the case.

title: Events Today
description: POOR MURDERER, a Play by Pavel Keret. Olmsted by Herbert archer. Starring Laurence Luddribliti, Marla Schell, Kevin McCarthy, Ruth Heed and Larry Gates. At His Ethel Berryman's Theater, 243 West 47th Street, at 6:45.

title: Carey Calls a Fare Rise In New York Unthinkable And Scores Management
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that a New York City transit fare increase of 10 or 15 cents was unthinkable and warned the Transit Authority management that it could be replaced if it was unable to maintain the price of a ride at 50 cents.

title: Queens District Attorney to Widen Inquiry Into Hare Krishna Society
description: The Queens District Attorney's office said yesterday that it would broaden its investigation of the Hare Krishna religious movement to include the movement's finances.

title: Body of Argentine is Found
description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 19 (Reuters)The bulletriddled body of Tulio Oneto, an Argentine exchange broker kidnapped by, Marxist guerrillas four months ago, was found today in a western suburb, the police said. The guerrilla group said he had been killed because his family refused to pay a $2 million ransom.

title: 2 Nations Report AntiCastro Exiles Have Plotted Many Terrorist Acts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19Venezuelan and United States authorities reported today that a group of antiCastro Cuban exiles had recently plotted a vast numol terrorist actions in the hemisphere using connections with topranking Venezuelan Government figures to protect themselves.

title: Gross Will e Paroled on Dec. 10
description: Nelson G. Gross, former Republican state chairman, will he released from Federal prison after serving just over six months of what originally had been a twoyear sentence for campaignfinancing abuses.

title: Deaths
description: SIMONOFFFannie, unveiling, will be held October 24th at 1:30 P. M. at Mt. Carmel Cemetery, plot 9, section 2.

title: Ford, Receiving Award, Criticizes Carter for Urging Cuts in Defense
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19President Ford criticized Jimmy Carter today for saying that the defense budget should be cut in favor of welfare programs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The economists of the two ?restdential candidates are agreed on the broad policy that should be followed by the Federal Government: Federal spending should be controlled; capital investment should be strongly encouraged, and the Federal budget should be brought into balance by 1980.

title: Martin, Asked to Spell Holtzman, is Angered
description: When Manager Billy Martin first got back to his office in the Yankee dressing room after last night's 62 loss to the Cincinnati Reds, he was seething. At the formal postgame news conference moments before, he had said.

title: Bread, Potato Prices Up
description: Elinor Guggenheimer, the city's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs said yesterday that the prices of certain items in the city's weekly market basket had not dropped as expected.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: David G. Trager, the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, has warned employers that they face charges of obstructing justice and contempt of court if they seek to influence employees not to serve on Federal juries. Mr. Trager said his office would investigate and take appropriate action against any employer who made false statements to the court to have an employee excused, or who dismissed an employee because of jury duty.

title: Fare Scare
description: David L. Yuilich, chairman of the deficitridden Metropolitan Transportation Authority, has come full circle.

title: Head of Jersey Senate Denies Guilt
description: NEWARK, Oct. 19Matthew Feldman, President of the New Jersey State Senate, who became Acting Governor of the state at noon today with Governor Byrne's departure for Japan, pleaded not guilty here this morning to Federal charges that he had bribed a restaurant chain to obtain business for his family's liquordistribution company.

title: INTERNATIONALPRER STAYING IN NEW YORK
description: The International Paper Company, the world's largest maker of forest products announced yesterday a major expansion in New York City that will add 40 percent more space to its headquarters offices here and many more employees to its local work force of 1,500.

title: Romein New York: Couture for Charity
description: The grapes glistened on the verdant green table linen. Diana Vreeland, everybody's fashion heroine, received an award. Princess Irene Galitzine, the Rome couturier, presented her collection for the first time in years in New York.

title: Instructions for Preparing Raclette
description: Here are several methods for preparing raclette: WOOD FIRE: Prepare a modestsize wood fire of considerable intensity and let it burn down to flames and hot coals. Place the half or quarter wheel of cheese on small, elevated platform so that a cut side is close to and facing the heat. As the cheese is melted and hot on the surface, scrape it onto a plate. Repeat until all appetites are satisfied.

title: ExBennington Chief Joins Drew U; Which Has Reflective Atmosphere
description: MADISON, Oct. 19Gail Thain Parker, the former president of Bennington College, who has joined the staff of Drew University here as a parttime faculty adviser, said today that the mood on the campus was calm and reflective, in contrast to her former surroundings.

title: Kissinger Denies Israel is Burden
description: Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, taking issue with a statement by Gen. George S. Brown. Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said last night that Israel was not a military burden for the United States but rather a staunch bastion of democracy and not a liability.

title: Campaign 76: Barren and Petty
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Oct. 19The Presidential candidates, complained Senator George McGovern of South Dakota last week, have spent far too much of their time on demagoguery, brainwashing, cardiac lusts, the wit News and wisdom of Earl Butz and freedom in Poland. The 1972 Analysis Democratic Presidential nominee said he doubted that he had ever seen an emptier campaign, pettier campaign.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold Prices Tuesday. London: Morning fixing $115.60, down $0.60; afternoon fixing $115.40., down 0.60.

title: Soybeans Climb Sharply On Substantial Demand For Meal, Up $4 a Ton
description: Soybean futures prices advanced sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The November contract, which closed at 56.24 a bushel, was as high as $6.25, compared with its Monday close of $6.06.

title: Lithuanian Architects Displaying Innovative Designin Vilna Suburb
description: VILNA, U.S.S.R.From a distance, the highrise towers of Lazdynai seem to float above the surrounding pine forests. Up close, they turn into traditional Soviet prefabricated apartment buildings.

title: Stadium Suites Keep Rich in Style
description: In most of Yankee Stadium last night, it threatened to become so cold that vendors almost had to chip off a layer of ice to dispense their beer.

title: Bridge:
description: Tournament directors have few opportunities to play but plenty of opportunities to observe highlevel performers. As a result, their masterpoint totals do not reflect their ability and it may take them a long time to reach the rank of life master. A case in point is Mike Linah, one of the most experienced directors in the New York metropolitan area, who recently achieved life master status. He may soon be lost to the New York scene, for he is contemplating relocating in California where he played the diagramed deal.

title: 12 Lost, 3 Are Rescued From Ship Off Canada
description: HALIFAX, Canada, Oct. 19 (AP)Twelve crewmembers were lost and presumed dead and three others were rescued today after they abandoned a small Dutch freighter sinking in rough seas off Newfoundland, the Canadian Search and Rescue Center said.

title: Nobel Sweep
description: A historic first was registered this week when the Nobel Prize Committee announced its 1976 awards chemistry and physics. Taken with last week's designation of the laureates in economics and medicine, the latest awards completed a clean sweep for Americans, the first time all of the Nobel Prize winners in the sciences were individuals born and educated one country. it is an impressive and deserved tribute to the quality of American research since World War II.

title: Abrams Backs Bouza, Calls Him Outstanding As a Police Commander
description: Robert Abrams, the Borough President of the Bronx, said yesterday that Assistant Chief Anthony V. Bouza should be kept on as police commander in the Bronx and should not be made a scapegoat in a controversy with other high police officials.

title: World Series Schedule
description: Yankees vs. Cincinnati Oct. 16Cincinnati 5, Yankees 1. Oct. 17Cincinnati 4, Yankees 3. Oct. 19Cincinnati 6, Yankees 2.

title: TV: Madama Butterfly in a Superb Production
description: WNET/13's grabbag Great Performances seriesstuffed with drama, music and dancecontinues this evening at 9 with a selection from its Fine Music Specials category. it is Puccini's Madama Butterfly, featuring a remarkable collection of musical talents: Mirella Freni as Butterfly, Placido Domingo as Pinkerton, Christa Ludwig as Suzuki and Robert Kerns as Sharplessall wrapped in the lush orchestral sounds of the Vienna Philharmonic, conducted by Herbert von Karajan.

title: PLEA OF NOT GUILTY ENTERED BY FELNIAN
description: NEWARK, Oct. 19Matthew Feldman, President of the State Senate, who became Acting Governor of New Jersey at noon today with Governor Byrne's departure for Japan, pleaded not guilty here this morning to Federal charges that he had bribed a restaurant chain to obtain business for his family's liquordistribution company.

title: Cynthia Gregory to Dance Again; Rejoins American Ballet Theater
description: Cynthia Gregory, who announced last December that she was retiring from dancing when she resigned as a principal dancer from American Ballet Theater, has rejoined the company.

title: Orr's Knee Examined; Will Need 5Day Layoff
description: TORONTO, Oct. 19 (AP)Bobby Orr will need a layoff of five days to week to rest his tender left knee but will not require another operation, Al Eagleson, agent for the Chicago Black Hawks depensernan, said tonight. He said Orr was examined for 11/2 hours tonight by Dr. John Palmer, a Toronto surgeon, who said following that Orr had abused the knee by playing too much.

title: Virginia, a State With Many Changes, is Still Expected to Return Byrd to the Senate
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 19Tomorrow marks the 10th anniversary of the death of Senator Harry F. Byrd Sr., the conservative Virginia Democrat whose gentlemanly political juggernaut maintained the status quo in the Old Dominion for more than three decades.

title: Vikings, 49ers in Trade
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Oct. 19 (AP)The Minnesota Vikings announced today they have traded a wide receiver, Jim Lash, to San Francisco for a running back, Sammy Johnson. The National Football League Vikings also announced they have signed a rookie running back, Ron Groce, as a free agent. Groce was cut prior to the season opener.

title: Gimbel is Aiming for Profits With Changes
description: Gimbel Brothers, one of New York's oldest retailers and the only one with two major Manhattan stores, is striving to end its sevenyear earnings drought with a return to profitability next year.

title: Night for All From Fisher Hall to Yankee Stadium
description: Night for All From Fisher Hall to Yankee Stadium

title: Technology
description: Satellite now permits twoway educational broadcasting between widely separated classrooms. Page 63.

title: Pension Official Named
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)The Labor Department annouced today that appointment of William J. Chadwick as administrator of pension and welfare benefit programs. He had been special assistant to Jpames D. Hutchinson, who resigned as administrator in August.

title: Islanders Scoring
description: Islanders Scoring

title: 2 OREGON DISTRICTS SHUT DOWN SCHOOLS
description: EAGLE POINT, Ore. Oct. 19The sign read, Have a Nice Xmas Vacation. It's all you're going to get. Courtesy of a few No Votes

title: Mississippi Low, Problems High
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 19To make baker's yeast, a sideline at its famous brewery, AnheuserBusch Inc. ships in huge quantities of molasses.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Oct. 19State Democratic leaders seemed relieved today when Governor Byrne departed at noon for Tokyo, where he will attempt to persuade Japanese car manufacturers to open plants in New Jersey.

title: Buckley Cites Senate Work on Aid In Westchester and Rockland Tour
description: Senator James L. Buckley made a 120mile campaign swing through the Hudson Valley end Westchester County today, combining the job of winning votes with the pleasure of a ride in the country to visit old friends.

title: New Accord on Lebanon Illustrates Expanding Power of Saudi Arabia
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Oct. 19A flurry of public smiles, a spate of private jawboning, a few announcements physically, the meeting of a handful of Arab leaders in the remote Saudi Arabian capital, Riyadh, was modest compared to larger conclaves of Arab kings and presidents in past years at worldier cities. But when the Riyadh gathering ended last night, its austere proceedings had richly demonstarated how vast an influence Saudi Arabia has come to wield in interArab affairsan influence that stems from mixture of Saudi oil, aid, prudence and ambitioncombined with a propitious set of circumstances elsewhere in the Arab world.

title: End of Public Events Unit Backed
description: A New York City Council committee voted yesterday to abolish by legislation the Department of Civic Affairs and Public. Events, an act already accomplished by a mayoral executive order that transferred the agency's functions to Mayor Beame's office.

title: About New York
description: The streets leading to the library in the slum are lined with broken glass and empty buildings with charred window hollows that suggest a jacko'lantern mockery of the people still coming for the books.

title: Moscow Jews Say They Were Beaten After a Visa SitIn
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19A dozen Jewish Presidents said tonight that they had been taken to a forest outside Moscow and beaten by plainclothesmen after a twoday sitin at an administrative building of the Supreme Soviet. Their injuries were mostly bruises, although one man suffered a broken nose and another a black eye.

title: A Fiery Moon Spectacle in 1178, Described in Contemporary Report, Linked to Crater
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Oct. 19On the evening of June 18, 1178, according to a contemporary account, a flaming torch sprang up from the moon, spewing out, over a considerable distance, fire, hot coals, and sparks.

title: Continental Pilot Strike Set
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 19 (UPI)Continental Airlines pilots will go on strike Saturday if they cannot reach agreement with management on a new contract. The Airline Pilots Association, representing the 1,100 Continental pilots, announced the 12:01 A.M. strike deadline yesterday. No bargaining talks have been scheduled. A company spokesman said that the main issue in the dispute was a demand that Continental hire 21 percent more pilots.

title: RACIAL SURVEY IS HALTED IN COAST SCHOOL DISTRICT
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 19A racial survey of district students, aimed at preparing for courtordered integration, has, been halted because the survey may be an invasion of privacy.

title: Armco Steel Profit Dips 1.3%
description: The nation's third and fourth largest sellers of steel reported yesterday opposite results for the third Quarter.

title: PENTAGON IS ACCUSED OF ANTIISRAEL STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19  The Air Force's top Middle East intelligence expert today assailed Gen. George S. Brown's comments on Israel's being an American burden as dangerously irresponsible and said they were indicative of a growing tilt against Israel in the Defense Department.

title: PANEL QUESTIONS DECISION TO ADD TO WAR STOCKPILE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI)A Congressional panel called today for an investigation of the Adrninistration's deciion to increase significantly the nation's stockpile of strategic war materials at a cost of up to $6.5 billion.

title: World News Briefs
description: The dethroned king of Sikkim husband of the former Hope Cooke, was found unconscious in his Himalayan palace early yesterday local time and was flown to Calcutta where physicians said he was suffering from an overdose of barbiturates, Dr. William T. Foley, a professor of clinical medicine at Corneli University and physician to the family, reported here last night.

title: Ohio to Vote on Charter Changes That Could Alter Power Utilities
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio Oct. 19Four proposed constitutional amendments that could significantly change the operation of electric and naturalgas power utilities, in this state and elsewhere have been, placed on the November ballot.

title: Buckley Tells F.C.C. That 5 Upstate PBS Stations Reneged on His Ad
description: Senator James L. Buckley, ConservativeRepublican of New York, has filed formal complaint with the Federal Communications Commission against five public television stations in New York State, charging them with reneging on their promise to carry his fiveminute political spot.

title: U. N. ARMS EMBARGO ON PRETORIA VETOED
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Oct. 19Britain, France and the United States today vetoed a resolution in the Security Council that would have imposed an embargo on arms shipments to South Africa in an effort to force the Government there to relinquish control of SouthWest Africa and accede to free electrons in that territory.

title: Series Action Light at Corner Bars
description: It's been a long time since a baseball fanatic had to go to the corner bar to watch the World Series on television, but some people still don't have TV sets of their own, and at least one Yankee fan found himself last night without the price of a beer.

title: Wind Suppresses a Fire
description: LINDEN, N.J. Oct. 19 (UPI)Fire officials say a strong wind prevented a holocaust when a fuel truck overturned and caught fire near two oil refineries. The fire engulfed 500 feet of grassland along the highway this afternoon, but wind gusts of 25 miles an hour blew the flames away from the direction of the Citgo Oil Company and the British Petroleum Company refineries. The refineries are adjacent to the hikhway.

title: Trade Center Dry Run Whets Crowd'Ire
description: Water, in a steady rainfall, pelted the marble floor of a passageway in the World Trade Center for three hours yesterday, preventing thousands of people from entering or leaving by major exit at the North Tower of the 107story twintower complex.

title: SovietHungarian Maneuvers On
description: BUDAPEST, Oct. 19 (AP)The Hungarian Army yesterday began Joint maneuvers with Soviet troops stationed in Hungary in accordance with the annual training program, the Hungarian press agency reported today.

title: High Official's Arrest Shakes Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 16The arrest of Asher Yadlin, a high Israeli official, on suspicion of bribery and fraud, has embarrassed and shaken Israel's ruling Labor Party and has led to speculation that the scandal could widen to include illegal campaign contributions.

title: Broader Cooperation Envisaged
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Oct. 19 (AP)The announcement of the Krupp transaction here said that said both sides now envisaged a dramatic increase in the involvement of Krupp in the myriad industrial projects arising from Iran's extensive economic development gram.

title: CARTER VOWS TO END BOYCOTT OF ISRAEL
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Oct. 19Jimmy Carter began the final two weeks of his campaign today by blaming President Ford for the continued existence of the Arab boycott of companies doing business with Israel, and without saying how he intended to do so, vowing to put an end to it if he is elected.

title: Carter Turns to New York Studio To Tape His Remaining TV Spots
description: For the second time in less than week, Jimmy Carter's campaign for the Presidency paused yesterday evening to enable the candidate to stop by a groundfloor apartment on an unfashionable, even seedy, block off Tenth Avenue in Manhattan.

title: Something for Everybody, but Modern is Rising
description: HIGH POINT, N. C.The country's furniture manufacturers have once again made certain there is something for everybody in their offerings of styles that date back to Magna Carta and up to Milan Modern.

title: September Housing Starts Are Highest in 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)  The number of new housing units started in September reached the highest level in two and a half years, the Government reported today.

title: Dollar DeclinesAbroad On Expectation of Rise In West German Rates
description: LONDON, Oct 19 (AP)The dollar lost ground on most European currency markets today amid expectations that the weekend realignment of joint float currencies would give West German authorities leeway to raise domestic interest rates without putting pressure on the currencv relationships.

title: Southern Jews, and Baptists, and Jimmy Carter
description: Jimmy Carter has been caught in a nexus of changing images among Jews, Roman Catholics, white Southern Baptists and blacks about themselves, each other, and about the South. Stereotypes crumble slowly, however, and when religion and race are involved we are all prisoners of our emotions and history.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI)  The Environmental, Protection Agency said today that it would crack down on pasticides containing fluorocarbon gases, but had made on firm decision on whether to phase out the gas from the remaining consumer aerosol products.

title: Discounts for Elderly Gain Despite Mixed Response
description: Discounts for the elderlyon everything from utility bills (Philadelphia) to icecream cones (San Francisco)have become so widespread that a metropolitan area without at least some of them probably does not exist.

title: Islanders Rout Canucks, 6 to 1; Stay Unbeaten
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 19With Bob Nystrom and J. P. Parise scoring two goals each, the unbeaten Islanders stopped the Vancouver Canucks, 61, tonight at Nassau Coliseum. The triumph was their fifth in six contests, bringing their record to 5.01 wonlosttied. it also ended a twoyear jinx the Canucks had held over them during which they hadn't won here in six games against Vancouver.

title: News Summary
description: A triple veto in the U.N. Security Council by Britain, France and the United States blocked a resolution that would have embargoed arms shipments to South Africa in an effort to make that country yield control of SouthWest Africa. The three nations maintained that adoption of the resolution could upset Secretary of State Kissinger's efforts to induce South Africa to accept terms for a conference on the territory which the U.N. calls Namibia. Voting for the embargo were the Soviet Union, China, Sweden and the seven sponsors of the resolution: Guyana, Benin (formerly Dahomey), Libya, Pakistan, Panama, Rumania and Tanzania, Japan and Maly abstained. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: Books of the Times
description: No, John W. Dean 3d is not the most appealing person in the world, and yes, the subject of Watergate is getting a little tedious. So one feels not a little antsy as one begins reading Blind Ambition: The White House Years and watches Mr. Dean undertake the bynowfamiliar confessional routine of explaining how he got his job in the Nixon White Housewhich was of course to be John D. Ehrlichman's successor as legal counsel to the President and how heunsuccessfully resisted his first assignmentwhich was to get the owners of the erstwhile muckraking magazine Scanlan's Monthly for a derogatory article they ran in 1970 on Vice President Spiro T. Agnew. But one's restlessness does not last long. Before you know it, you are turning the pages of Mr. Dean's book as if you were reading about Watergate for the very first time. And by the time you have finished, you are convinced that no previous book about the scandalnot even those by Bob Woodward and Carl Bernsteinhas begun to tell the inside story as this one does.

title: KENNECOTT AND OTHERS JOIN IN COPPER PRICE CUTS
description: The nation's largest copper producer and other companies in the field anflounced price reductions yesterday.

title: People and Business
description: Professor Charles Issawi of Princeton University charged yesterday that the United States had failed the lamentably in solving its energy problems since the 1973 Arab oil embargo. The Dodge professor of Near Eastern studies at Princeton said that the Presider and the Congress seemed to have read the fable of the tor??ise and the hare and got it backwards.

title: C.N.P. GROWTH RATE SLOWS TO 4% LEVEL; HOUSING STARTS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Commerce Department reported today that the broadest gauge of United States economic performance slowed its rate of growth to 4 percent in the third quarter. The report seemed certain to lead to an intensified political debate during the final two weeks of the Presidential campaign.

title: Chase Manhattan Net Up 15.7%; Continental Illinois Rises by 11.5%
description: The Chase Manhattan Corporation, the nation's third largest bank holding company, reported yesterday a 15.7 percent increase in thirdquarter operating earnings over the severely depressed yearearlier quarter.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Questions about the safety of sacchait rin, the artificial sweetener, have still not been resolved more than four years after the United States Food and Drug Administration allowed its continued use on a supposedly temporary basis.

title: Jeff Beck Appears With Jan Hammer Group
description: Jeff Beck's recent record, Wired, was a particularly fascinating example of jazzrock and the reason was the delicate tension between the jazz and rock elements in the music. on Monday night at the Palladium, Mr. Beck appeared in concert with the Jan Hammer Group, and the results weren't so striking. There were shortrange and longerrange reasons for that.

title: Pregnant Woman Gets Jail Term For Scalding Murder of Daughter
description: MAYVILLE, N. Y., Oct. 19 (AP)Gloria D. McNeely, eight months pregnant, was sentenced yesterday to 15 years to life in prison for scalding her 2yearold daughter to death.

title: STOCKS UP ON GAIN IN HOUSING STARTS
description: A Government report showing a pickup in housing starts in September transformed a losing market session into a winner yesterday as measured by the Dow Jones industrial average. The bluechip Dow whose components represent the steadiest sector of the market rose 3.41 points to 949.97.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Today

title: Newark Seeks to Make Airport The Center of a Transit Network
description: NEWARK, Oct. 19 (UPI)Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson is pushing a plan to make Newark International Airport the center of a transit network connecting much of northern New Jersey.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's DaughterinLawStarts Magazine in Positive Vein
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 19Prime Minister Indira Gand??'s 20yearold daughterinlaw has begun publishing a monthly magazine dedicated to describing the dynamics of a changing India in a positive, confident way.

title: Miss Walters Named Moderator of Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)Barbara Walters, who is coanchor of ABC Evening News, will moderate the final Presidential campaign debate between President Ford and Jimmy Carter, the League of Women voters announced today.

title: Boulez and His Orchestra Express Pleasure at the New Sound of Music in Hall
description: Fourteen years and more than $28 million later, the New York Philharmonic finally has found an acoustically hospitable home. That, at any rate, was the general reaction last night of musicians and assorted notables to the first public concert in the newly remodeled Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, Oct 19, 1976

title: Japanese Crime Rate Rises
description: TOKYO, Oct. 19 (Reuters)The Japanese Justice Ministry announced today that the nation's crime rate rose last year, with murder and robbery up by 10 percent and a marked increase in bribetaking by civil servants.

title: Henry Niehous Dead in Ohio; Father of Kidnapping Victim
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Oct 20 (AP)Henry Niehous, father of a kidnapped Ohio businessman, William F. Niehous, has died of leukemia at the age of 77.

title: The Reds Designated Drama
description: When The Cincinnati Reds were struggling to win their World Series scenario with the Boston Red Sox last year, Sparky Anderson's then 13yearold son, Albert, proved that he had inherited dugout wisdom.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Oct. 20 The State Director of Consumer Protection, Virgin'a Long, said today that she would check into complaints that procasino forcas were using false and misleading radio advertising in their campaign to win public acceptance of gambling casinos for Atlantic City.

title: School Integration Plan Ordered
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 20 (AP)A Federal judge ordered the Board of Education today to submit a plan for full integration of Buffalo schools by Jan. 5. The school board has asked the court for permission to delay handing in a plan until Jan. 15, but Judge John T. Curtin ordered the plan turned in by Jan. 5. School officials, acting under the judge's Oders, implemented a beginning or partial integration plan when the school year began in September.

title: Barbara Adams in Song Recital With Walter Hilse at the Piano
description: The singer accompanied the pianist in Barbara Adam's song recital Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. it was really nobody's fault. Her partner, Walter Hilse, is quite simply a far more accomplished artistan alert, imaginative pianist, as well as director of music at St. Luke's Lutheran Church, where Miss Adams is also soloist.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI)The Postal Service is preparing for an extraordinary crush of Christmas package mail if negotiations remain dead locked in a fiveweek regional United Parcel Service strike, an official said today.

title: British Aides Worried Over Rhodesian Conference
description: GENEVA, Oct. 20Although British officials initially expressed optimism that the conference on Rhodesia opening here next week would set up an interim biracial government leading to black majority rule, they are now stressing what appear to be irreconcilable differences between the white and black sides, coupled with dissent among black leaders.

title: Altering Exclusive Image, More Says Come Right In
description: One night, at a social gathering, a man approached Norman J. Block, chairman of the board of Dunhill Tailors, and asked with some hesitancy if he might discuss business.

title: Heinz and Green in a Close Race For Senate Seat in Pennsylvania
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 20 Republican Representative H. John Heinz 3d, the 39yearold millionaire heir to the Pittsburgh pickle and ketchup fortune, came down with a bad cold yesterday. So did Democratic Representative William J. Green, also 39, who is the heir to a powerful family political organization in Philadelphia.

title: Fire Kills 2 New Haven Children In Apartment Without Electricity
description: A New Haven family whose two children died in a fire this week had previously had their electric service cut off for nonpayment, a United Illuminating Company spokesman confirmed yesterday.

title: Rye Ousts Teacher As a Proselytizer For Religious Sect
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y., Oct. 20 A 35yearold Rye high school art teacher who belongs to a fundamentalist religious sect known as the Julius Movement was dismissed after being found guilty of using school facilities to convert students to the movement.

title: Panel's Proposal To Rozelle Puts Stress on Safety.
description: A dramatic and farreaching proposal for improving officiating and safety in professional football was presented to Commissioner Pete Rozelle of the National League last spring by a blueribbon committee consisting of Paul Brown, Don Shula, Tex Schramm and Al Davis. it has not been implemented but this season's continuing storms about officiating add injuries (especial, ly to quarterbacks) have underlined the pertinence of the suggestions presumably still under consideration.

title: The Senate RacesII
description: Yesterday we commented on the Senate races in New England and the Middle Atlantic states, except for New York, Connecticut and New Jersey, which will be treated in subsequent editorials. Today, we take a look at some of the more interesting and closefought contests other regions of the country, while noting that Democrats Humphrey of Minnesota, Proxmire of Wisconsin and Jackson of Washingtonall outstanding Senators who have many times proven their value to the nationare virtually certain to be reelected.

title: Diagnostic XRay Examination Called No Ground for Abortion
description: The American College of Radiology, concerned about a purported overreaction to the hazards of radiation to the unborn child, said yesterday that an abortion was not justified simply because a woman had received a diagnostic Xray examination In early pregnancy.

title: 112,420 Pounds of Sugar Candies With Banned Red Dye Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration today announced the recall of thousands of pounds of candy made with Red No dye after it was banned Feb. 12.

title: New York State Insurers Reluctant To Write New Automobile Policies
description: Some of the largest auto insurers have stopped writing policies in New York State, and others are now accepting only a small fraction of applicants despite higher rates that state officials approved to encourage the companies to take on new business.

title: American Airlines Unit to Acquire Some Assets of the Howard Corp.
description: The Republic of Texas Corporation and American Airlines announced yesterday that they had reached an understanding on the general terms of a purchase by an American Airlines subsidiary of certain assets of Republic's trusteed affiliate the Howard Corporation, for $60 million. The purchase has been under discussion since last April. The understanding stipulates that the American Airlines subsidiary would buy Howard's oil and gas properties, the common stock of Round Rock Lime Company, three shopping centers in Dallas and Midland, Tex., and in Shreveport, La., and about six acres of real estate in downtown Dallas.

title: 4,000 THAIS ARRESTED SINCE MILITARY COUP
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 20Thailand's military rulers disclosed today that more than 4,000 people had been arrested since the coup of Oct. 6 on suspicion of being Communist subversives. Nearly twothirds of them are still in custody, a spokesman for the junta said. that those appearing on them need have no fear.

title: Defender of Health Care for Poor
description: In the darkpaneled office at 125 Worth Street that is his as president of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation, Dr. John Lawrence Sullivan Holloman Jr. has put up on The walls quotations from John F. Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. MarMan tin Luther King Jr. But the saying that is in the most prominent in Dr. HolNews loman's office is on his desk, embossed on the back desk, embossed on the back of his nameplate. it says: Health Care Is Right.

title: Arm Cast is Removed From Padres Jones
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 20. (AP)Randy Jones of the, Padres had the cast removed from his pitching rm today, zinc the orthopedic surgeon, Dr: Robert Kertan. expressed cautious optimism.

title: Halsey D. Josephson, 70, Author Of Seven Books on Life Insurance
description: Halsey D. Josephson, a retired lifeinsurance agent and author of seven books on life insurance, died yesterday at New York University Medical Center. He was 70 years old and lived at 165 East 72d Street.

title: Carole Farley Has Debut as Helene
description: When Offenbach's frothy La Belle Helene was chosen to reopen the City Opera, Julius Rudel, the director, was pleased, because he felt it would strike a note of happiness after the bitterness engendered by the threeweek labor dispute.

title: Parents Back Christian Schools As Alternative
description: BRADFORD, Ohio  For 16yearold Janice Marie Whisner, a born again Christian, education isn't what it used to be. Withdrawn from the public schools of Darke County several years ago by her parents, she has since been attending private Christian school where each day begins with prayer, devotion and the pledge of allegiance, where subjects are taught from a biblical perspective and chapel is held for at least a halfhour each Wednesday.

title: ACCOUNTING BOARD ASSAILS CRITICISM OF ITS RULEMAKING
description: The growing dispute between the accounting profession and Congress over who should set the rules by which American industry computes its financial results is already becoming strained.

title: Buckley, Campaigning in Heavily Republican Area, Labels Moynihan Undiluted Liberal
description: WATERTOWN, N.Y., Oct. 20  Lithited States Senator James L. Buckley, continuing his attacks on Daniel P. Moynihan while campaigning in the state's heavily Republican north country today, insisted that there was little difference between his opponent and the undiluted liberals Mr. Moynihan had defeated in the Democratic primary.

title: Poverty Dominates Rhodesia Capital's Black Township
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Oct. 18 Highfield is to Salisbury as Soweto is to Johannesburg. it is where the men and women that keep Salisbury prosperous and looking sleek have to go to sleep and live the nonworking part of their waking hours. They are not allowed to do so in areas like Salisbury, set apart for Europeansa southern African term for whites.

title: PRESIDENT SAYS U.S, WOULD NOT TOLERATE NEW ARAB OIL CUTOFF
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20  President Ford said today that he would not tolerate another Arab oil embargo, but added that because of his Administration's Middle East policies, the chances for another embargo are virtually nil.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: BRETAGNE (Dafra). Dakar Nov. 3, Freetown 6 and Monrovia 8; sails from Fulton St., Brooklyn.

title: LARRY S. PROVO DIES; WAS RAILROAD CHIEF
description: Larry S. Provo, a railroad executive, died of cancer Tuesday at Northwestern Memorial Hospital in Chicago. He was 49 years old and lived in Northfield, Ill.

title: Arafat Meets Assad in Damascus; Move Bolsters CeaseFire Outlook
