description: ERSKINE CALDWELL had come up from his home in Florida for a short stay in the North. He looked lean, spare, his countenance weatherbeaten, and he said that he is well after a couple of bouts with illnesssections of his lungs had to be removedthough he is not quite ready for a 100yard dash or sawing wood.

title: Parents Scour New York City For Daughter
description: Leigh Anderson, 19 years old, is missing. But the New York City police will not search for her because she is over 18 and the Federal Bureau of Investigation cannot help because there is no evidence of kidnappingno ransom note, for instance.

title: Jets and Giants to Find Respectability (in Foes)
description: The Colts and Steelers, who can be described as fairly respectable football teams, will be playing locally on Sunday as heavy favorites, Baltimore against the Jets at Shea Stadium and Pittsburgh against the Giants in the Meadowlands. The Giantsgame is sold out and will be televised here by Channel 4 starting at 1 P. M. Channel 2 will televise doubleheader, Minnesota at Philadelphia at 1 P.M. followed by Chicago at Dallas, 4 P.M. The Monday night game has potential merit, St. Louis at Washington, Channel 7, 9 P.M. A preview of all games follows, with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHAT IF THERE WERE a compelling reason to salvage the Titanic from the ocean floor where she sank in 1912? What if a bunch of crazy kids were to build a homemade nuclear bomb? These are the questions toyed with by two apocalyptic thrillers that ought at least to serve to pass a boring day or a sleepless night. In Raise the Titanic! Clive Cussler premises that something extremely valuable was stored in a vault of the ship when she went downspecifically, the world's only known supply of an element called byzanium, which is key to the United States's ultrasecret Sicilian Project. (Don't think Mafia; think chess.)

title: Power Failure in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, Oct. 21 (UPI)The industrial island city of Singapore was crippled by a twoandahalfhour power failure this afternoon. A public utilities board spokesman blamed a technical fault. The failure, from 4 P.M. to 6:30 P.M., caused traffic jams and reportedly left hundreds of workers trapped in elevators.

title: Racing Career Ended For Foolish Pleasure
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 21 (AP)Foolish Pleasure, the winner of the 1975 Kentucky Derby, has run his last race. John L. Greer of Knoxville, who owns the horse, said today that Foolish Pleasure would be shipped from New York to Lexington, Ky., next week.

title: Schedule for Flu Shots
description: Free inoculations of the swine flu vaccine will continue today in Morris Passaic, Sussex and Warren Counties.

title: Rep. Moss Says Mrs. Dole Violates Nonpartisan Nature of Her Pest
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21 (UPI)Federal trade commissioner, Elizabeth Dole wife or the Republican VicePresidential candidate, has violated the nonpartisan nature of her post by campaigning for the Republicans, the chairman of the House subcommittee that oversees regulatory agencies charged today.

title: Court Orders Moynihan Removed as the Liberal Party's Senate Nominee
description: ALBANY, Oct. 21A State Supreme Court justice, declaring that the political process by which Daniel P. Moynihan obtained the Liberal Party's nomination for United States Senator from New York was illegal, ordered the State Board of Elections today to remove Mr. Moynihan as the candidate of the Liberal Party in the Nov. 2 election.

title: John Cage, Elfin Enigma, at 64
description: I F HISTORIANS using their infallible rearview mirrors, someday decide that Western music lost its bearings in the middle decades of the 20th century, John Cage will probably be accounted as one of the strange forces that put the compass out of whack. For the elfin composerand the 64yearold Mr. Cage can still be so describedset out many years ago to write music that went nowhere in any traditional developmental sense. And that seems to be what he is still up to.

title: How Consumer Can Pick Car From Confusing Array
McDonald's Agrees to Buy 29 Units From Licensee
description: The McDonald's Corporation announced an agreement in principle to acquire 29 McDonald's restaurants and related real estate interests from a holder of multiple licenses.

title: Mayor Gibson Endorses Casinos To Raise Atlantic City Revenues
description: NEWARK Oct. 21Mr.yor Kenneth A. Gibson today endorsed cas'no gambling in Atlantic City on the ground that it would produce revenue and jobs for that financially ailing resort community.

title: Other Office Vandalized
description: The windows of Jimmy Carter's campaign headquarters in Queens were smashed early yesterday, and an anonymous caller to The Associated Press said the vandalism was the work of a militant Jewish youth group called Save Our Israel Land. Carter favors an Israeli retreat to the 1967 borders, which would surely lead to Israel's extermination, the caller said.

title: Open Interest
description: (In bushels, ODD omitted) Wed.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Women's lobby groups urged the Senate Judiciary Committee to kill a bill that would rescind New Jersey's approval of the Federal Equal Rights Amendment. The measure was introduced by Senator Thomas G. Dunn Democrat of Union, who was not at a hearing at which his bill was attacked. The bill was not released from the committee because of a lack of support.

title: World News Briefs
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 21. (AP)Sixtyseven Indian journalists sent Prime Minister Indira Gandhi a letter today protesting Gov errment action against the Indian Ex.1 press and other newspapers.

title: News Summary
description: A revolt by Chinese leftists was shattered by the Central Committee of the Communist Party under the leadership of. Hua Kuofeng, the Chinese press agency announced. The announcement also confirmed that Mr. Hua had suchceeded Mao Tsetung as chairman of the party. The report said that Mao's widow was among the leaders of the revolt. [Page A1, Columns 12.]

title: Around the Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 21Thirty one persons, including three officials of the largest waterfront union here, were charged by a Federal grand jury today with conspiring to embezzle or steal $923,780 from a union welfare fund.

title: Car Cannibals of Queens: A Continuing Drama
description: On a quiet street in Corona, Queens, the removal of a parked automobile yesterday brought to an end another vignette in a continuing street drama.

title: Buckley Aides Express Concern At Moynihan Conservative Iniage
description: Senator James L. Buckley appears to be campaigning under the assumption that some of the state's voters see him and his opponent, Daniel P. Moynihan as two peas in the same pod.

title: Ford and Carter Forces Dispute G.O.P. Ad Showing Playboy Cover
description: The Ford and Carter camps traded charges yesterday over an advertisement by President Ford's campaign committee displaying the cover of this month's Playboy magazine, which contains the much publicized interview with Jimmy Carter and last week's Newsweek with its cover article about Mr. Ford.

title: LAST DEBATE TONIGHT FOR FORD AND CARTER
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Oct. 21Presldent Ford and Jimmy Carter will meet here tomorrow night in a historically rich and tranquil setting for their final preelection confrontation before a mass television audience.

title: Harvard, Lauded by Princeton Coach, Fears Tiger Defense
description: A year ago Harvard was slightly derailed en route to the Ivy League championship by an unheralded Princeton team. The situation is similar this season, and Joe Restic, the Crimson coach, regards it with some trepidation. People have been Roundup saying, Poor Princeton,' Restic said yesterday. What do they mean? They beat us last year and have the same league record now.

title: Congress: New York
description: The focus of the election campaign in the New York metropolitan areabeyond the Presidential racehas been on the Senate contest between Daniel Patrick Moynihan Democrat, and James L. Buckley, incumbent candidate of the Republican and Conservative Parties.

title: President Ford speaking at Alfred E. Smith dinner at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel last night. The host for evening, Terence Cardinal Cooke, is at left.
description: In a rare appearance before the same audience, President Ford and Jimmy Carter last night vied for the support of Roman Catholic voters in New York State with speeches at one of the most prominent Catholic forums in the nation the Alfred E. Smith Memorial Dinner.

title: America in the Victorian Age
description: This illuminating and invigorating collection of essays by 10 distinguished scholars traces the rise, supremacy and decline of what have been called Victorian values in American life. A hundred years ago these values dominated our social, political and economic institutions. They set the nation's cultural tone, and they abided well into this century.

title: Golf
description: $125,000 SOUTHERN OPEN

title: MCI to Continue Efforts to Offer Phone Service
description: The MCI Communications Corporation said yesterday that it intended to press its claim for the right to offer a lowercost longdistance phone service in competition with the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: Marathon Men and Women on Their Marks
description: The new sensation is running. Not just jogging. But running. Running for miles and for hours until you experience physical strain, then feel your body settle into a routine and then finally, the third wind of heightened senses, a spiritual elation, the new high of running. More and more metropolitan New Yorkers are doing it though this weekend the big experience will be vicariousat least on Sunday as about 1,900 men and 100 women sprint off on the city's first fiveborough marathon.

title: FORD ORDERS PLANES TO MEET NOISE RULES
description: President Ford yesterday ordered that 1,550 jet airliners that do not meet current noise standards be muffled or replaced in a program that would start Jan. 1, and be completed over the next eight ears.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Thursday.

title: Legitimacy in Peking
description: Enough evidence has accumulated to suggest that a relatively moderate segment of the Chinese leadership under Hua Kuofeng, has consolidated power in Peking by imprisoning or otherwise removing from the contest the radical left leaders, notably Mao's widow, Chiang Ching Great masses of people have been brought out into the street to celebrate Mr. Hua's triumph. Peking's official news agency has even transmitted a statement that Chairman Mao taught us never to take pity on evil snakes  who show their poisonous fangs or who have chanted into beautiful women.

title: Jazz: Return Of Saxophonist Packs Club
description: Dexter Gordon, the most gifted and influential tenor saxophonist to emerge from the modern jazz movement of the 1940's, played his first American engagement in four years at Storyville on Wednesday and Thursday. Mr. Gordon who settled in Copenhagen some years ago when the popularity of jazz was perhaps at its lowest ebb here, seemed surprised that the club was packed and the listeners almost aggressively adoring.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: Birmingham 8, Houston 5. Indianapolis 4, San Diego 4 (overtime). Quebec 4, Calgary 2.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: ABRAHAM GOLDMAN DIES; EXPOLICE OFFICIAL WAS 83
description: Abraham Goldman, a former deputy chief police inspector in New York City died Tuesday at Northern Virginia Doctors Hospital in Arlington, Va. He was 83 years old and lived in Alexandria, Va.

title: Reds Triumph, 72, and Complete 4Game Series Sweep of Yankees
description: History and the Cincinnati Reds proved too strong a combination for the New York Yankees to overcome last night as the Reds won the World Series by completing a fourgame sweep.

title: Carter and Ford in a Tight Race In Midwest, With Ohio Key State
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 21Warren Smith a mildmannered man who wears glasses and a nondescript mustache, may well be the most important man in Jimmy Carter's Presidential campaign between now and Election Day.

title: End of Series Gets Kuhn Off Hook
description: Looking like something that had been in the water for days and days, the Yankees went down for the fourth time last night. Unable to win a game in their 30th World Series they went out with a whimper as the Cincinnati Reds became the first National League team in 54 years to defend the North American baseball championship successfully. It was the second time in their last three World Series that the Yankees had lost four straight games, but they did accomplish one thing. By making a fifth game unnecessary they got baseball's pliable commissioner Sports out of a mess of his own making. He had of offended everybody but the National Broadcasting Company by letting the network The Times schedule the fifth game for 6 P.M. today just ahead of the debate between Gerald Ford and Jimmy Carter.

title: WarnerLambert Ordered To Sell Parke Davis Units
description: After consideration of a final proposal the Federal Trade Commission ordered the WarnerLambert Company partially to divest itself of Parke Davis & Company, its drug manufacturing division.

title: Ford Sees Westway Start in Year
description: President Ford gave another major boost to the controversial $1.4 billion Westway highway project last night saying that he expected early Federal approval would allow the start of construction in about a year.

title: TOP WEEKEND FILMS
description: 11 A.M. (5) The Hard Way (1943). Ida Lupino Joan Leslie, Dennis Morgan. Up the theater ladder. Engrossing.

title: T.E. Has 19.1% Earnings Gain; 3d Quarter Net Is $114.3 Million
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation, which operates the nation's largest independent telephone system yesterday reported a 19.1 percent increase in thirdquarter earnings.

title: U.S. and Japan Again Face Growing Economic Tensions
description: TOKYO, Oct. 21After five years of generally harmonious economic relations, some highlevel tension has been building up this year between the United States and Japan over a number of economic issuesparticularly over the rising volume of this country's exports to various American markets. However important the issues are seen elsewhere, they are viewed rather calmly here among private businessmen and government officials of both countries.

title: How to Get There
description: Take the Long island Expressway to exit 41 North. Follow Route 106 about four miles to Route 25A. Take a right turn and follow 25A four more miles to Cold Spring Harbor.

title: MORE FEDERAL FUNDS SOUGHT BY 14 STATES
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 21Fourteen states of the Great Lakes region and the Northeast declared a united effort today to stem the flow of Federal resources from the deteriorating North to the economically improving South and West.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Cannon Mills Company announced yesterday that its Oct. 5 special meeting of stockholders would be reconvened on Nov. 1 for a new vote on the proposed purchase of 362,800 Cannon Mills common shares from Gulf & Western Industries.

title: Boycott Baloney
description: Good for the television networks that they refused to be conned by the White House into airing Gerald Ford's news conference this week as if it were a solemn and privileged function of the Presidency. Coming only six days after a previous news conference, just two weeks before the election, and with no indication of noncampaign news developments, Mr. Ford's appearance before the press was patently political, a campaign event staged in the White House.

title: Catholics Weigh Proposals to Alter Policies of Church
description: DETROIT, Oct. 21An assembly of delegates chosen by this nation's Roman Catholics convened here today to consider a number of proposals that could alter traditional church attitudes on such major issues as birth control, divorce and the role of women in the church.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.6 billion tonmiles, 3.9 percent above the corresponding week last year. Carloadings in the same period totaled 485,345 cars, 1 percent above last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc. reported intercity truck tonnage was 6 percent above last year.

title: Places to Go North of Tappan Zee This Weekend
description: The scenic homelands of Dutch set ties on both sides of the Hudson River north of New York City will come to life this weekend with a craft show demonstrations of such activities as quilting and cheesemaking and a tour of houses the settlers once lived in.

title: Talk of the Series
description: Even before they won the World Series last night, the Cincinnati Reds had established theinselyees themselves as a rare sports teama team that Manager Sparky Anderson wanted to prove was no fluke, and one of the greatest of all time.

title: Israel Confirms Lebanon Aid
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 21Members of the Christian Phalangist militia who have been fighting in southern Lebanon were trained in Israeli military camps and have been equipped with Americanmade Sherman tanks as well as with mortars, artillery, automatic weapons and uniforms it may now be disclosed from Israel.

title: School Results
description: FOOTBALL

title: THOMAS C. MAYERS
description: Thomas Chauncey Mayers, a Manhattan lawyer who traveled widely as a student of comparative languages, died Oct. 14 while visiting Damascus, Syria. He was 47 years old.

title: WILLIAM E. MURRAY
description: William E. Murray, a retired regional director of Caltex Petroleum Corporation's Asian operations, died Wednesday at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Pelham Manor, N.Y. He leaves his wife, the former Helen Brazee; two sons. William and Stephen; a sister Marjorie Lansing, and six grandchildren.

title: Thinking Big With Watercolors
description: DEPENDABLE is not an adjective that artists covet, but it happens to fit Charles Burchfield made watercolors for half a century and very rarely tume dout a bad one. Not only was he remarkably consistent, but he also worked or a scale more usually met with in oils, He thought big, and he worked big. Anyone who thinks of watercolor as a medium most notable for its fugitive and insubstantial quality has to think again after seeing a show of Burchfield's watercolors.

title: Woman Held in Wildwood Slaying
description: WILDWOOD, N. 3., Oct. 22 (UPI)  A woman was charged with murder today in the fatal shooting of a man in an argument. The woman. Pinky Gales, ??? years old, of Wildwood, was held on bail of $150,000 in the slaying of Derek Jones, 20. also of Wildwood, who was stot in his home Wednesday and died on route to Burdette Tomlin Hospital.

title: The Brief Death of Mr. Forman
description: In the one year since he died, the police say, James Forman made at least $300,000, which was probably more than what he earned in the 31 years that he lived.

title: Battle For the Undecideds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21In his classic sociological studies of how and when voters make up their minds in Presidential elections, the late Paul Felix Lazarsfeld of Columbia University reached one or two conclusions that may be relevant to the last days of the present campaign.

title: Wheat Futures Prices Fall, but Soybeans Show a Rise
description: Wheat futures fell, while soybean contracts rose yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade in quiet trading dominated by speculators.

title: Executive Star System?
description: Does a star system lie ahead for young executives?

title: Bruins and Hawks Agree To Stop Orr Litigation
description: TORONTO, Oct. 21 (AP)The National Hockey League said tonight that the Boston Bruins and the Chicago Black Hawks had agreed to terminate litigation in the dispute over Bobby Orr.

title: U.S. Will Not Recognize Transkei After Its Independence Next Week
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 21The Ford Administration has decided against extending diplomatic recognition to the Transkei when the South African homeland of two million blacks becomes officially independent of South Africa next Tuesday a State Department spokesman said today.

title: Rhodesian Says Black Demands Imperil Geneva Talks
description: GENEVA, Oct. 21Prime Minister Ian ??? Smith of Rhodesia arrived in Geneva today and said that new demands by African nationalists seriously threatened the coming conference designed to set up a temporary biracial government in Rhodesia that would lead the way to black maruarity rule.

title: A Store With No Secrets
description: Fabrications must be doing something right. Women (and men) who look as if they wouldn't be caught dead behind a sewing machine can be seen milling around the bolts of yard goods in this unusual fabric store. They snap up the batiks for pillow covers and the English chintzes for curtains. They shop at Fabrications for the highstyle goods usually found only behind the closed doors of a decorator showroom. They also shop at Fabrications for the prices.

title: Ford Meets Hungarian Americans On 20th Anniversary of Uprising
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 21 (Reuters)President Ford greeted a dozen Hungarian Americans today on the 20th anniversary of the abortive Hungarian revolution and told them, I join you in the wish for freedom.

title: Future Passport Tours
description: Tomorrow: The Philadelphia Museum of Art and Colonial houses in Fairmount Park, Philadelphia. 8 A.M.6:30 P.M. Fee, $37 a person. Departs from West Side Y.M.C.A. 5 West 63d Street.

title: Bench and Reds' Pitchers Redeemed in Victory
description: After the Yankees went down in flames last night, George Steinbrenner and Billy Martin felt proud but Thurman Munson felt belittled by Sparky Anderson's remark that other catchers should not be compared to Johnny Bench to avoid embrassing them.

title: New Bronx Hospital To Open by Monday
description: After months of infighting over fiscal and medical questions, the State Health Department said yesterday that it would issue an operating certificate for North Central Bronx Hospital today.

title: EARLY GAINS SHOWN IN CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets, which through the first three days this week had their sharpest decline since May, rose moderately yesterday morning and then settled back to wait for the week's Federal Reserve figures. When the money supply showed

title: Villard Houses Hotel Plan Clears Last City Hurdle Board of Estimate's Vote
description: Final city approval for a 51story luxury hotel to be built behind the landmark Villard Houses on Madison Avenue was voted unanimously yesterday by the Board of Estimate.

title: Carter Ahead in Delaware
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Oct. 21 (AP) Jimmy Carter has a slight lead on President Ford among Delaware voters, according to a poll by The Wilmington News Journal.

title: Uranium Enrichment Associates Restudies Plan for Alabama Unit
description: Uranium Enrichment Associates, an industrial consortium with advanced plans for the nation's first privately owned nuclear fuel enrichment plant at Dothan Ala said that it had begun a reappraisal. of the project because Congress had failed to pass enabling legislation.

title: The Economic Scene
description: After five years of generally harmonious relations, Thomas E. Mullaney reports, tensions over economic matters are again building between the United States and Japan. Page D3.

title: Half of 1970 Carter Contributions Came From Small, Potent Group
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 21A relatively small group of powerful Georgiansincluding bankers, business executives, contractors and lawyersgave Jimmy Carter half the money he collected in his 1970 gubernatorial campaign here, according to an analysis of Mr. Carter's records by The New York Times.

title: CEASEFIRE TAKING EFFECT IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 21The first formal ceasefire in Lebanon in seven months began at 6 A.M. today, and most of the fighting stopped shortly thereafter.

title: Miss Fromholtz Ousts Mrs. King From $200,000 Tourney on Coast
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. Oct. 21Scratch Billie Jean King from the comeback stakes. The sixtime Wimbledon and fourtime Forest Hills champion Was beaten for the second time in a fortnight by Dianne Fromholtz of Australia and has now all but decided to throw in the sponge.

title: MONEYSUPPLY RISE REMAINS MODERATE
description: The nation's money supply continued to expand at moderate rates in recent weeks, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday.

title: Bowie Admissions Unit Is Under Investigation
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 21 (AP)The Prince Georges County state attorney's office said today it was investigating charges that admissions personnel at Bowie Race Course skimmed money from the track's gate receipts.

title: High School in Leonia Boycotted by Students Over Delay in Building
description: LEONIA, NJ., Oct. 21Most of Leonia High School's 630 students walked out of school this morning to protest what they called a curtailment of their education and other problems stemming from a delay in opening a new $4 million high school.

title: Charge of U.S. Link to Sabotage of Cuban Plane Hurts Ties With Guyana
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 21State Department officials said today that there had been a sharp deterioration in relations with Guyana as a result of a charge by that country's Prime Minister that the United States was ultimately responsible for the crash Oct. 6 of, a sabotaged Cuban airliner.

title: White on White Louise Nevelson's Gift to the Universe
description: If you want stained glass windows, I'll just paint them black, darling, Louise Nevelson, the sculptor told Dr. Ralp Edward Peterson, pastor of St. Peter's Church.

title: Reserve Reports
description: DAILY AVERAGES

title: Surveys in Indiana. Indicate Lugar Leads Hartke in Race for Senate
description: ELKHART, Ind., Oct.21It is an axiom of Indiana politics that Vance Hartke can never be counted out of a race until all the votes are in.

title: The Pop Life
description: IT MIGHT SEEM ODD to combine reviews of the latest records by Earth, Wind and Fire, the O'Jays and Abba. The first two groups are leading black acts. The third is an almost defiantly white, Swedish quartet that proffers the flossiest non imaginabl.

title: How to Get There
description: To get to Bear Mountain State Park, take the George Washington Bridge to the Palisades Interstate Parkway, which leads to the park.

title: After a Famine, a Movie Feast
description: THIS year may well go down in movie history as the year of the bomb. Just try to look back without a wince on the embarrassing likes of such relentlessly hyped lavishly budgeted, artistically sterile films as The Missouri Breaks, Won Ton Ton, the Dog who Saved Hollywood, The Blue Bird, Mother, Jugs and Speed, Harry and Walter Go to New York, Gable and Lombard, W. C. Fields and Me, Baffalo Bill and the Indians, Midway, Swashbuckler and The Duchess and the Dirtwater Fox. Not to mention such current muddles as A Matter of Time and Alex and the Gypsy.

title: M.T.A. Head More Optimistic About Preserving 50Cent Fare
description: David L. Yunich, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority gave a much more optimistic report yesterday on preserving the 50cent transit fare and said he would not be bullied cut of office by Ctwernor Carey.

title: OUTLAYS QUESTIONED BY CITY COUNCILMEN
description: The Finance Committee of the New York City Council, in an angry mood mf used yesterday for the second time to approve millions of dollars in lumpsum appropriations in the capital budget because members were unable to determine how the money would be spent and why it was needed.

title: A Mistrial Declared In Reporter Slaying; Wide Publicity Cited
description: PHOENIX, Oct. 21 (AP)A mistrial was declared today in the trial of John Harvey Adamson, who is accused of murdering Don Bolles, a newsman. The judge Frederic Heineman, said in Superior Court that pretrial publicity made it impossible to select a fair jury now.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: There are railroad buffs of various kinds, and some of the most devoted belong to the Bay Ridge Model Railroad Club. In particular, they are devoted to the 0gauge railroad in their club at 28 Marine Avenue and 93d Street in Brooklyn. There is also a trolley line and a narrowgauge railroad there, and everything runs over a layout that is 60 by 30 feet with a signaling system that can control up to eight trains at a time. Beginning tonight, and for the next three weekends, you may visit the club and see it all. The hours are 8 P.M. to 10:30 P.M. tonight and for the next two Fridays, and 2 P.M. to 6 P.M. on Saturdays and Sundays. Admission is 50 cents for adults and 25 cents for children, and the club is only a few blocks from the 95th Street station on the BMT.

title: STUDENTS IN LEONIA WALK OUT OF CLASS
description: LEONIA, Oct. 21Most of Leonia High School's 630 students walked out of school this morning to protest what they called a curtailment of their education and other problems stemming from a delay in opening a new $4 million high school.

title: Award Brings U.S. a Sweep of Honors
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 21Saul Bellow won the Nobel Prize for Literature today giving Americans a clean sweep of all five Nobel Prizes awarded this year.

title: Management: Salary Disclosures on Rise
description: At the Graphic Controls Corporation in Buffalo, two dozen top executives know exactly what their colleagues are paid.

title: New Plays Bring New Theatergoers To Playhouse in Huntington
description: When Jay Broad's new play, White Pelicans, as translated by Jean Pierre Aumont, opens in Paris this season the billboard should read: Direct from Huntington, L.I. The play is also on Joseph Papp's schedule. If the work is produced in New York, the line can be changed to: Direct from Huntington by way of Paris.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Golden State Warriors, at Oakland Calif. (RadioWMCA, WGBB, 11:25 P.M.)

title: Carey Is Host to Jimmy Carter's Son on Tour Upstate
description: ELMIRA, N.Y., Oct. 21  Governor Carey, working hard to bring some life to Jimmy Carter's Presidential campaign in upstate New York, played host today to the Democratic candidate's son Chip on a fourcounty swing that combined campaigning for the ticket with some political homework for the Governor himself.

title: Events and Openings
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln CE ??? Verdi's Aida, 8.

title: Harlequin Novels: A Romance Between Stories and Readers
description: Eight months pregnant, with a baby crying in the background and dinner on the stove, a 26yearold housewife from Belle, W. Va., reflected recently on diaphanous gowns and castles in Scotland and underwater archeological expeditions in Greece and darkeyed men driving sports cars who called their lovers cara mia.

title: New York State Holding Hearing On Impact of Research on Genes
description: The public debate over whether a new form of genetic research poses a health or ecological hazard focused on New York Stare yesterday as a score of scientists, Federal health officials and environmental activists testified at a public hearing at the State Attorney General's office in Manhattan.

title: Novelist Deals With Jews in America
description: If Saul Bellow didn't exist, someone exactly like him would have had to have been invented, just after the Second World War, by New York intellectuals, in a backroom at Partisan Review. Everybody wrote essays and book reviews, but a novelist was needed very special sort of novelist, a highbrow with muscles, to tell the story of the Jewish romance with America. Nathanael West was dead, Henry Roth was silent, Daniel Fuchs did screenplays, Irwin Shaw and Herman Wouk were middlebrows short stories by Delmore Schwartz and Isaac Rosenfeld were not enough, and Norman Mailer was, clearly not to be trusted.

title: Mayor Sues Airline Over Lost Inaugural
description: The Mayor of Riverdale said yesterday that he was suing an airline that had bumped him off a plane, forcing him to miss the biggest day in his lifeinauguration as Mayor of the Morris County town. The Mayor, Howard Card, who was elected to the parttime post last November, filed a $25 000 damage suit against KLM Royal Dutch Airlines in Federal Court. Newark, because he could not get home in time for his inauguration on Jan.3

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP; REAL WAGES DECLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 21The rise in consumer prices slowed slightly in September but the typical worker continued to lose real purchasing power, the Labor Department reported today.

title: M.A.C., P.B.A. and Phone Calls Part of Beame's Long, Busy Day
description: The Mayor's car phone was on the blink yesterday morning, so he had his driver pull up in front of Vince's Deli on Clove Street on Staten Island popped out of the small, light blue Chrysler and trotted across the street to make a call from the drugstore.

title: Reds Triumph, 72, and Complete 4Game Series Sweep of Yankees
description: History and the Cincinnati Reds proved to be too strong a combination for the Yankees to overcome last night as the Reds won the World Series by completing a fourgame sweep.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: FOR A BRIEF period in the midiSOO's Cold Spring Harbor on Long Island's North Shore was a prosperous whaling village. The erns and inns were brimming with saitos, the street markets overflowed with produce from faraway ports, the captains built comfortable homes hard by the harbor, and the babble of foreign tongues could be heard along the main thoroughfare, then called Bedlam Street.

title: Music: Bach Cantatas and Arias
description: The Bach Aria Group, a durable organization to say the least, opened its 197677 season of three concerts at Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night with most of its regular members on hand and a couple of guests. Louis Lane appeared as guest conductor and Thomas Nyfenger, flutist, substituted for Samuel Baron.

title: Memorial Seruiress
description: VAILJanet Bentz Droving. Friends are cordially Invited to attend a memorial service of music at the Princeton University Chanel 10 A.M., Saturday October 23. Contributions to the Janet Vail Memorial Center will be welcomed by Juanita Vail Kusner RD 5 box 298, East Stroudsburg, Pa. 18301.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
description: (millions of dollars)

title: Award Brings U.S. a Sweep of Honors
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 21Saul Bellow won the Nobel Prize for Literature today giving Americans a clean sweep of all five Nobel Prizes awarded this year.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M.
