title: Parties Differ on Forecasts For Changes in House Seats
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Oct. 22If it is an evennumbered year, it must be Robert J. Cornell running against Harold V. Froehlich for the House of Representatives here in northeast Wisconsin and Abner J. lsdikva and Samuel H. Young running against each other in the northern suburbs of Chicago.

title: FISHING
description: IT'S certainly an ill wind that keeps fishermen from some of the hest action of the year. Fishing is good to excellent now all around the Islandif the brisk autumn breezes will subside long enough for boats to get out.

title: Traveling Through Scandinavia The Way the Scandinavians Do
description: The sauna was hot and the beer was frosty cold in the gloaming of a white summer night, the ship's bleached decks were brighter than the congested discotheque that blasted away inside until 3 A.M. The stately 500footlong Svea Corona, bound from Helsinki to Stockholm, sliced effortlessly through the placid Baltic waters as a light crosswind fluttered the blue and white Finnish flag on her stern.

title: Sailor in 31Footer Fails to Send Word
description: HILLSDALE, N.J., Oct. 23Robert Gainer, 23 years old, of Hillsdale, who set out Oct. 2 in a 31foot sailboat for a nonstop aroundthe world voyage, has been unheard from since Oct. 13, his sponsor reports.

title: What's Doing in KYOTO
description: CULTURAL CAPITALThe Japanese think of Tokyo as the head, Kyoto the heart of Japan. As the country's capital for more than a thousana years, Kyoto nurtured Japan's religions, and traditions the Noh theater, the tea ceremony, geisha entertainment. And its surrounding hills and distant mountains inspired painters and poets. No other Japanese city has as many surviving lanamarks more than one fifth of the country's totaland they draw 20 million visitors a year trom the rest of Japan.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Articles such as Ari L. Goldman's [A Plant That Suffolk Farmers Don't Dig, Sept. 12] on opposition to nuclear power plants on Long Island, tend to emphasize questions of nuclear safety while skipping over some questions of economics. But your article does lend support to the fact that Lilco, so sure of its permission to build nuclear plants that it orders parts and prepares its sites to the tune of millions of dollars even before hearings are under way, is about to pull off one of the grandest economic and financial debauches ever.

title: Ireland's Abbey Theater Tries to Live Up to Legend
description: DUBLIN The Abbey Theater is not what it used to be. But then, to use an Irishism, it never was. The Abbey, which next month makes its first visit to New York in 38 years, has always shown such singular capacity not to be what it used to be that the reality of what it used to he tends to be somewhat blurred. It is more simple, perhaps, to say what it isa national theater with a remarkable reputation to which, according to some of its critics, it unerringly fails to live.

title: Neighborhood Esprit a Casualty of Sprawl
description: DUMONT, N. J.Butch Johnson says that when he was growing up, his neighbors were just as likely to answer Fleetwood as Dumont if someone asked them where they lived.

title: Robert Sim Emslie, Planner. Holly Hillyer Have Bridal
description: Holly Hillyer and Robert Sim Emslie were married at noon yesterday in the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany by the rector, the Rev. Ernest Hunt.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Curious man, David Storey. Author of Home, The Changing Room, The Contractor and now The Farm, he is a playwright who thrives on evasion, on the gesture that begun but never finished, on the spoken revelation that blurts its way through half a sentence and then aborts.

title: JAMES E. KLUG
description: James E. Klug, a former staff vice president of PrenticeHall Inc., died Thursday of a heart ailment at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 400 East 59th Street.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: THE exceptionally wet weather that has ruined so many weekends for Long Island residents in the last month or so has predictably also led to an increasing number of complaints about damp basements and requests for information about what can be done about them.

title: Book Ends
description: Steinbeck. If this should be my last book, John Steinbeck wrote in a euphoric moment to Joseph Bryan III, this is what I would want it to be. He was referring to his retelling of the King Arthur stories by Sir Thomas Malory. Steinbeck never lived to complete the project, but he did leave some manuscriptthe only unpublished Steinbeck remaining, his widow, Elaine Steinbeck, saidwhich his friend Chase Horton has edited into the book entitled The Acts of King Arthur and His Noble Knights, reviewed on page 31.

title: Route of Today's Marathon and Where to View
description: The 26mile 385yard race will begin at the toll plaza on the Staten Island side of the VerrazanoNarrows Bridge. The first mile across the bridge will be uphill, with runners already cautioned about expansion joints on the bridge. These joints, or fingers, are about one yard wide and have a tendency to expand in warmer weather, thus creating problems for any runner who catches a foot in the joint. For many competitors, the view of the Manhattan skyline at the start will be unmatched. Best Viewing Area on the bridge.

title: The Mars Attack
description: Thirtyeight years ago this week, Howard E. Koch frightened a good segment of America. His radio script dramatizing the H.G. Wells fantasy, The War of the Worlds, led thousands of people to believe that an interplanetary conflict had started in Grovers Mill, N.J., with invading Martians spreading wide death in New Jersey and New York.

title: 2 Are Charged in Shooting Death Of Sister of Financier in Maine
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 23 (UPI)Two men were arrested today and charged with the shooting death of Anne Payson Holt, 79 years old, who was killed in the bedroom of her home at Falmouth two and a halfk weeks ago.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in the Arts and Leisure Section.

title: South West African Conference, Long Quiet, Erupts Into Militancy
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Oct. 22A racial insult by a white delegate to the constitutional conference for an independent SouthWest Africa has galvanized the tranquil proceedings into mood approaching militancy.

title: Do We Really Need the Debates?
description: The 1976 Presidential debates nave come to an end, and not a moment too soon. Here's hoping that all concernedthe parties, potential sponsors, academics, the press and television, the people themselveswill give some serious thought to whether these flashy confrontations should regularly become the main events of Presidential elections.

title: Toward a New Technological Spurt
description: THE ISLAND is suffering from an ailment that has been affecting all of the United States for a number of years  a sudden slowdown in technological innovation. This decline in technological growth has brought a concomitant decline in economic growthand with it have occurred the high inflation and unemployment rates with which we have struggled for the last several years.

title: Great Contractor First in Gold Cup
description: When they Vote for Horse of the year, it's doubtful if Great Contractor's name will appear on many of the ballots.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Rose Associates, a real estate concern, will shortly make a move of its own. it has sublet 14,000 square feet of space in the building at 522 Fifth Avenue, at 44th Street, for a little more than five years at an aggregate rent of more than $400,000. The company will move its offices to the new space in November, leaving behind smaller quarters at 529 Fifth Avenue.

title: Not Guilty
description: It was one of those bizarre coincidences that make living in this best of all possible worlds the decidedly queer game that it is. At noon, the mailman brought my Sept. 19 issue of The Times Book Review, with a Book Ends column under the best seller list titled Money Talkin it I learned that David Madden, the author of Bijou, one of the books I admire most in the world, made about $15,000 in cash as a result of his labors on that book, or about $2,500 for each of the six years he worked on it. At three, Jane Heller of the New American Library, my paperback publisher, called to tell me that my novel, Salem's Lot, was going to reach number one on The Times paperback best seller list the following weekSept. 26.

title: Conference of Catholics Supports Resolution on Ordaining Women
description: DETROIT, Oct 23Roman Catholics from a broad spectrum of the church ended a threeday conference today on liberty and justice that has profound implications for pastoral theology and the way the church will govern itself in the future.

title: Jockey Club Gold Cup Chart
description: Jockey Club Gold Cup Chart

title: A NEW LOOK COMES TO MEXICAN MOVIES
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 23Having long exercised strict censorship over movies shown here, the Mexican Government has now nationalized the country's film industry and has unexpectedly begun producing movies dealing openly with such previouslytaboo subjects as sex, violence and politics.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Battle With a King Mackerel
description: HARKERS ISLAND, N. C.The pink balloon that served as a float to hold the live pinfish bait near the surface of the water bobbed violently and then disappeared.

title: Lean, mean Gene
description: One morning in late September, Eugene McCarthy, independent candidate and chief litigant for President of the United States, found himself sitting one plane seat behind that other complainant for highest office, Lester Maddox. I happened to be on the same flight, a short hop to Atlanta, as a oneman press corps. McCarthy was sitting next to me, and his tennis partner, Mark Plotkin, was across the aisle, as advance man. The two of them were on a Southern swing to Hattiesburg, Miss., and Winter Park, Fla., to pick up the student vote and two bie lecture fees.

title: For Book Research,
description: MODERN geopoliticscombined with the longago perspicacity of a Long Island womanwas the ill wind that blew Everett S. Allen a great deal of good when he set out to do research on the Island for his new book, A Wind to Shake the World, the story of the 1938 hurricane.

title: VolareBestSeller
description: DETROITOfficials of the Chrysler Corporation are gloating these days over the success of their compact Plymouth Volare and Dodge Aspen wagons, introduced last November.

title: Sergiu Luca Plays Works From Bach
description: Bach left only two authentic violin concertos in manuscript, but musicologists have long been aware that at least a pair of his keyboard concertos are actually transcriptions of works he originally wrote for string instruments. With this in mind, Sergiu Luca performed not only the canonical two violin concertos in A minor (S. 1041) and E (S. 1042) on Friday night at the Metropolitan Museum, but also his own violin arrangements of Bach's harpsichord concertos in D minor (S. 1052) and F minor (S. 1056).

title: Citzens Union Gives Its Preferred Rating To 100 in New York City Political Races
description: The Citizens Union announced yesterday that it had given its preferred rating to about 100 candidates involved in 127 contests in New York City for the State Senate and Assembly, for judgeships and for a City Council post in Manhattan.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THERE is a season for everything, for growing up, for going out and for coming in. For me, this has always been a coming down season.

title: Philadelphians in Awe of The Man
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 23Thoroughly unfamiliar with the terrain, he moved his car slowly to the rear entrance of the Spectrum, looking for an attendant to guide him to the players parking area. The directions were brief, but as he was pulling away he noticed the attendant staring into the car at hima deep, searching stare of the kind usually reserved for persons of rare celebrityand he paused.

title: TV VIEW
description: At this stage of its development, American television's contempt for its raw materials must be interpreted as contempt for its audience and, indeed, for the medium itself. The industry's dirty little secret is that many of the key executives responsible for content make a point of not watching their product beyond the launching stage. They are too busy, evidently, making noble speeches designed to generate and protect booming profits. Meantime, the general programing process, in its reckless rush toward the ?? and the violent, becomes incredibly cheapening to all concerned. Two neat illustrations are currently at hand one  NBC's Captains and the Kings  involving a productio that has made the schedule to the beguiling accompaniment of solid ratings and flattering reviews; the other  a project tentatively titled Say it Ain't So, Joe,  which has run into difficulties that are probably temporary, because the writer of a book dealing with the subject (the 1919 Chicago Black Sox baseball scandal) has decided that there's a time when you finally have to say stop.

title: says John Leonard in The N.Y. Times
description: A remarkable book has been quietly published. It is one of the best I've read in years. it is fierce intelligence, all sinew, prowling among the emotions As an account of growing up female and ChineseAmerican in California, in a laundry of course, it is antinostalgic it burns the fat right out of the mind. As a dreamof the female avengerit is dizzying, elemental, a poem turned into a sword  it reimagines the [preMao Chinese] past with such dark beauty, such precision and anger that you feel you have saddled the Tao dragon and see all through the fiery eye of God.

title: Filomena Morelli Wed To Thomas W. Soyster
description: The First Presbyterian Church in Englewood, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Filomena Maria Morelli, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Joseph Morelli of Tenafly, N.J., to Thomas William Soyster, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stuart Soyster, also of Tenafly.

title: Best Seller List
description: Boked on reports Irons more than 250 booksstores throughout the United States. Weeks are not necessarily corrcutive.

title: The pastor who said no to Hitler
description: The recent racial uprisings in South Africa give added power to the message of Eberhard Bethge's Bonhoeffer: Exile and Martyr.

title: A Funny Thing About Comedy
description: Many years ago  some people think it was just before the SpanishAmerican WarI lay on my back in a boxing ring in Cleveland, stared up foggily at some hulk who had just creamed me and thought to myself, This is no way to make a living, my boy. So I've been a comedian ever since, although Crosby has his own opinion on the subject.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Opinion polls show Governor Byrne to be so low that even the Boston Strangler would be a viable opponent. And I think it's a bum rap.

title: In Summary
description: New York City's long argument with its police officers has been tentatively settled by a compromise al. lowing the police a victory, at least in principle, on the question of back pay and giving them what their leaden consider an improved work schedule. The city achieved its major goal of preventing an increase in costs.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: DANCE VIEW
description: The question of why there are so few great, even good, choreographers in ballet has never received a single answer. One of the most frequentlyvoiced hypotheses is that the esjidring young choreographer never has the opportunity to gain experience in the same way as his or her counterpart in literature and the other arts.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: TOKYOWhen the United States decreed immediately after World War II that it would take only 15 Japanese yen to buy one dollar, it quickly became obvious that someone had erred. The yen was overvalued and the 15to1 rate had a very brief lifespan.

title: Proposal Offered to End Impasse On Deferral of Teachers Wages
description: A desperation plan to end the current impasse over a wagedeferral agreement for New York City teachers has been proposed hp Dr. Bernard R. Grifford, the deputy school chancellor, in a move to forestall a feared state or city attempt to take away $45 million from the pay package won by the teachers last rear.

title: John Shear Jr., Aide With Morgan Bank, Weds Sally Schwep
description: Sally Ann Schwep and John Knox Shear jr. were married yesterday by the Rev. Harry E. Chase in the chapel of the Presbyterian Church in Tenafly, N.J. A reception was given at the Englewood Field Club.

title: The Last of the Debates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23  The last FordCarter debate was an improvement on the first two which is no great compliment, but it came closer to dealing with important public issues, it gave the nation the best rather than the worst side of the candidates, and I think it clarified the issues for decision on Election Day.

title: Veterans Day
description: Tomorrow is the Federal observance of Veterans Day, and post offices and all Federal offices will be closed. City and state offices will remain open, however, because New York State observes the original Veterans Day, Nov. 11.

title: The Time Of Miracles
description: It takes vision to see the human face of God. it also takes courage.

title: Headliners
description: The winners for the three remaining Nobel prizes have been announced. All are American citizens, giving Amer icans a sweep (with the exception of the Peace Prize, whicl nobody won) of this year's awards. The winners were.

title: The Mind Field
description: Laughs come easy nowadays to those who never believed in the human potential movement. Most students of higher consciousness have either become zombies in some corporate growth enterprise or themselves joined the ranks of the disillusioned. As with American political radicalism, it is extremely difficult to maintain a responsible, forward course. Teachers, like Robert Ornstein, who pointed out the limits of the Western mind, have been outflanked by cultists of all stripes, united only by their mindlessness. It is thus understandable why The Mind Field is inspired by utter dismay.

title: The House That Paley BuiltAnd Keeps
description: There are a lot of rules you come to ?? in as you go through life in ?? The believability factor is a very, very important factor. And ?? a very fine line, too. if you go over that line you get in trouble.

title: ENCOUNTER
description: We were all ready to forgive the bowman, all but the children. The sight of the dead deer had put on their lips those elementary questions for which we had no acceptable answers. Why did he kill it? asked Michael. He was only 6, and of the three, the most confused by the experience. Why such a small one? Andrea, my 11yearold, asked, as if to suggest that the small and helpless should by nature's law enjoy immunity from pain and death. Thii was when we were leaving, the memory of the kill still occupying their thoughts.

title: New & Novel
description: The protagonist of this engrossing novel is Evelyn Girard, a reporter for a New York magazine whose personality is dissolving in a solution of alcohol and pills. Why? Linda Crawford offers a selection of possible causesguilt, repression, fearbut makes no pat diagnosis. What she depicts, through an unfolding sequence of horrors, is how it feels to be Evelyn Girard. The continuity for Evelyn's horror story is supplied by her appetite for punishment. When drunk, she picks up men from whom she Is lucky to escape with her skin intact. A lesbian, she has a longterm love affair with a woman who is also a heavy drinker. This is not the ideal environment for abstinence, which the reporter tries during a hopeful interlude with Alcoholics Anonymous.

title: Penn State Triumphs, 330, Behind Passing of Fusina
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Oct. 23 (AP)Chuck Fusina riddled the West Virginia secondary for 261 passing yards and two touchdowns today as surging Penn State defeated the Mountaineers for the 18th straight time, 330.

title: Red Smith
description: After 1,940 games during the season and eight more in the playoffs, the World Series was mercifully short. Not short and sweet. Not especially enjoyable. Not at all comfortable for players or customers.

title: MISCELLANEOUS
description: ALBERTSON  Exhibition of Depression glass, sponsored by the Long Island Depresslon Glass Society; through October, Shelter Rock Public Library, 165 Searingtown Rd. For hours, call CH 8.7363.

title: Harvard Beats Princeton, 2044, Tying for Ivy Lead
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Oct. 23Harvard's football forces climbed to the top of the Ivy League today by beating Princeton, 2014, in the 69th game of the 99yearold series. The Crimson is tied with Brown and Yale, both future opponents, for the league lead with a 31 wonlost record while Princeton dropped to 22.

title: CAMPAIGN FUND BALANCE ISSUED TO 2 CANDIDATES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 (UPI)President Ford has $8.3 million and Jimmy Carter has $5.7 million to spend on lastminute campaigning, the Federal Election Commission reported today.

title: Spain Lifts a Ban On News Reports About ExColony
description: MADRID, Oct. 23The Government this week lifted a 6yearold news blackout on its obscure former colony of Equatorial Guinea, stirring a political controversy within Spain itself.

title: 4 MinorParty Candidates Listed On the Ballot in New York State
description: Four and possibly five minorparty candidates for President, together with their running mates for Vice President, will be on the ballot in New York State on Nov. 2, along with President Ford and Jimmy Carter.

title: P. I. Sheehan Fiance Of Medora Dashiell
description: Medora Byrn Dashiell, teacher at the Garrison Forest School in Maryland, and Peter John Sheehan, chairman of the English department at the school, will be married Dec. 18.

title: Elizabeth D. Roten Bride of John C. Rudolf
description: Elizabeth Dickenson Roten, company manager of the Off Off Broadway theater company. Theater of the Open Eye. was married yesterday morning to John Curtis Rudolf,.. stockbroker with Oppenheimer Company. Tie Rev. Reid F. Isaac performed the ceremcnv in the Episcopal Church of the Holy Trinity.

title: Maria Shrady Wed to Consul
description: The Roman Catholic Church of Notre Dame in Easton, Crum., was the setting at noon yesterday for the marriage of Maria Theresia Shrady ta Bernd von Waldow a consul with the west German Consulate General in New York.

title: The good news:
description: The Hudson has been making remarkable progress in ridding itself of the traditional pollutants along its 315mile length. This view endorsed even by the people whose very livelihood depends upon the river's wellbeingthe 70 or so commercial fishermen who put out their nets mainly in Haverstraw Bay. Until PCB's forced a ban most commercial fishing last February, they were making ample catches of striped bass. perch and eels.

title: Madison and Hillsborough Stopped
description: Madison and Hillsborough reached the end of long success streaks yesterday. Summit came up with a 2115 victory to stop the Madison Borough streak at 19 in Madison and to raise its record to 401. Ron Paxson threw for two touchdowns to Tim Odell, plays that covered 31 and 36 yards. Mike Horn's 24yard run in the third quarter provided the winning points.

title: China's New Leadership Is Early Mao And Late Chou
description: HONG KONGWhen Hua KuoFeng, China's new leader, made his first publicly reported speech last year, called for a regular annual rectification or cleanup unsatisfactory local party workers. They were tough words from a man who was just emerging from obscurity as provincial party administrator.

title: THEATER
description: BRIDGEIIAMPTONArthur Miller's The Crucible, presented by the Spindrift Players; today 2 P.M. and Monday 8:30 P.M.; Bridgehampton Community House, Montauk Hwy. Tickets $3.50, students $2. 5370391.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Meanwhile, he receives a ?? every month representing his interest payment

title: Where Do the Reds and Yankees Go From Here?
description: I certainly hope we all stay fogether, Joe Morgan was saying as the Cincinnati Reds added to their glamorous past and turned to their uncertain future. But if somebody played out their option, I couldn't nut any blame on them.

title: Is mammography safe? Yes, no and maybe
description: Within days after Betty Ford and Happy Rockefeller underwent surgery for breast cancerand talked frankly about their experiencesthousands of women throughout the country flocked to cancerscreening centers and physicians offices for the Xray examination known as mammography. The 27 breast cancer detection clinics sponsored by the National Cancer Institute and the American Cancer Society reported a four to tenfold increase in requests for mammography in New York City, the Guttman Institute, a clinic that offers free breast examinations, suddenly found itself deluged with three times the number of requests it had received during the same period the year before.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: There were at one time the makings of a modem morality play in the fact that while Andrew Wyeth is the toast of the town at the Metropolitan Muscuni, the new paintings of Malcolm Morley are on view at the Clocktower, 108 Leonard Street.

title: Dispute Between Agencies Marks Investigation of Medicaid Mills
description: The state's efforts to crack down on New York's City's shared health facilities generally known as Medicaid millshave antagonized the city's Department of Health, which says that the efforts interfere with and duplicate its own investigation.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: As a step toward improving the entire system of gathering social statistics for the United States, the national census will now take place every five years, rather than every ten. The first such middecade census will occur in 1985, as provided by legislation signed by President Ford last week.

title: Jazz: Mannered
description: Nancy Wilson is a singer who likes to take her time, and on Friday evening sh seemed to want to turn Carnegie Hall into her living room. Almost every song was prefaced by a lengthy dissertationone took more than seven minuteson her marriage, her child, and various other personal concerns.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: Susan Gabbert Plans Bridal to John Olsan, Consultant on Health
description: Mr. and Mrs. William M. Gabbert of Owensboro, Kv. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Rebecca Gabbart, to John H. Oisan. He is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Edwin S. Olsen of Rcchester. where his father is a specialist in internal medicine.

title: Carteret Victor, 1514
description: Carteret stopped two late threats by Woodbridge inside the Carteret 10yard line and emerged with a 1514 victory in the battle of unbeaten Central Jersey nowers yesterday in Carteret.

title: Nets Defense Credited With First Victory
description: PORTLAND, Oct. 23Though the New York Nets will have to forget how easily they scored with Julius Erving on their side, they have not forgotten the fiercesome zone press that keeps producing victories for them in close games.

title: SOVIET'S GROWING TRADE IS STRESSED IN U.S. STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 (UPI)  The Soviet Union has become so linked with the West through business ventures that a return to Soviet economic and political isolationism appears unlikely, a Congressional report said today.

title: Dorsett Breaks Rushing Mark; Rutgers Trounces Columbia
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 23 A New Jersey football team won at Giants Stadium today. Thank goodness for Rutgers.

title: Laos after the takeover
description: VIENTIANE, Laos  For centuries, Laotians by the tens of thousands had gathered each June on the sprawling That Luang parade grounds on the outskirts of this city to celebrate a glorious rite of spring. They danced, drank, shot off fireworks displays and prayed for rain to help the rice crop. This year, however, the new Communist rulers banned the festival. They said it was a waste of time and energy that ought to be devoted toward building the new Laos.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: I get so much condensation on my windows when it gets cold outside that I have to take a towel and wipe them off each morning. Also, the paint is off near the glass around all the windows. I have combination storm and screen windows which are wood, but I still get some condensation even when the inserts are in. My neighbors don't seem to have this trouble, but they have aluminum windows. Do you have a solution for my problem?Mrs. J.J.W., Agawam, Mass.

title: Dyson Withdraws His Comment About Duryea's Truthfulness
description: ALBANY, Oct. 22 (AP)  The State Commerce Commissioner, John Dyson, retreated today from his description of the Assembly minority leader, Perry B. Duryea, as a liar. But a spokesman said that Mr. Dyson stood by other comments he had made about Mr. Duryea, including one that the Republican legislative leader was a cheapshot artist.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A regional office of the State Division of Human Rights has ruled that probable cause exists to rule that City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin has discriminated against one of his accountants, Lee Robin, because of her sex, a spokesman for Mr. Goldin confirmed. The spokesman said that Mr. Goldin, denying the charges, had rejected the preliminary finding and an accompanying proposed settlement giving the accountant a promotion, a raise and retroactive pay in rejecting the proposed settlement, the spokesman said, Mr. Goldin insured that the matter would be aired at a formal public hearing by the state agency. Neither officials of the state agency nor Mrs. Robin could he reached by telephone for comment.

title: Recruiters Rub Hands Over Vigorito and Tice
description: Torn Vigorito describes college recruiting as a big business where everybody is out to get the best merchandise. Mike Tice admits that he wants to be approached openly as a player, but I'd do anything to get the inside track to a top player if I were a coach.

title: BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: How the Presidential candidates view the taxation of corporate dividends and capital gains is crucially important to investors. With this in mind, a group of mutual fund management companies headed by the Dreyfus Corporation recently posed some questions to President Ford and Jimmy Carter and got some answers, which are being sent to fund shareholders.

title: Richard Wagner in Bayreuth
description: Wagner is back, no doubt about it. After a generation of skulking around in the darkness that followed the twilight of the Nazi gods, the magician of Bayreuth has returned for an encore, taking his bows before audiences that have been newly persuaded that his operas are beneficently timeless masterworks, not intrinsically evil creations of a protofascistic mind. The restoration to full respectability, which has been taking place gradually over the last couple of decades, reached full circle this year with the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the staging of his Der Ring des Nibelungen at Bayreuth, that remarkably resilient Wagnerian festival whose history Hans Mayer recounts so absorbingly in Richard Wagner in Bayreuth.

title: Quick! Who Wrote Cabaret? (It Wasn't Harold Prince)
description: Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart wrote Rodgers and Hart shows. Rodgers and Oscar Hammerstein II wrote Rodgers and Hammerstein shows. Betty Comden and Adolph Green wrote Comden and Green shows.

title: Handguns vs. A Police State
description: IN response to Mr. Del Tufo, I am compelled by the evidence to disagree with his observations and projections. He casually projects a society somewhere in the murky future where irate husbands will no longer disembowel faithless wives or their lovers, or will do so in lesser numbers, because of the absence of handguns. it the Prosecutors of this state had their way, according to Mr. Del Tufo, we would have a police state. Since only lawenforcement personnel would have handguns, who would these offiers have the necessity and justification to shoot intentionally, not to mention those who may be shot accidentally? if Mr. Del Tufo can make such a demand on the citizen, I demand a quid pro quo from those who are to prottct me, even from their own guns.

title: Davidson's Five Scores Fuel Romp by Bayside
description: The cries of the Far Rockaway fans for Defense, Defense fell on deaf ears on the field for the second straight week yesterday as a strong Bayside eleven, led by Chy Davidson's five touchdowns, smothered the home team, 506. Last week Adams trounced the Seahorses, 468.

title: Joseph Newman, Accountant, Marries Patrice Tomasetti
description: Patrice romasetti, daughtor of Mr. and Mrs. Dominick G. Tomasetti of Bayside, Queens, was married there yesterday afternoon to Joseph T. Newman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph G. Newman of Bellerose, L. I.

title: SPORTS
description: UNIONDALEN.B.A. Basketball: N.Y. Nets vs. Washington, Wednesday, $5.50 to $8.50; Hockey: Islanders vs. St. Louis, Thursday, $7 to $11; N.B.A. 133sketball N.Y. Nets vs. Indiana, Friday, $5.50 to $8.50; all at 8 P.M., Nassau Coliseum. 7949100.

title: Viardo Recital Put Off
description: Vladimir Viardo's recital in Carnegie Hall, scheduled for next Tuesday, has been indefinitely postponed, according to an announcement by Hurolc Concerts. The Soviet pianist was unable to come to America because of illness. Refunds are available from the Carnegie Hall box office, 154 West 57th Street.

title: Dance Notation Steps Into A New Era
description: Plcture Leonard Bernstein rehearsing Beethoven's Fifth Symphony. There are no music stands; no music scores. Instead, Bernstein teaches each instrumentalist his or her part by picking up and playing each instrument or by humming usages. slowly he works through the strings, the brass and the tympanists.

title: BRIDGE
description: Bridge experts like a Shakespearean monarch enjoy postmortems. They like to sit upon the ground and tell sad stories of the death of kings. Or aces. One of the strange things about the diagramed deal played a few years ago in A French tournament is that when it vars over both sides felt they had a sad story to tell. Another phenomenon is that NorthSouth are quite likely to bid and make a slam when missing three aces. And a third is that a bad trump break works to the declarer's advantage.

title: EMIL E. FRIED
description: Dr. Emil E. Fried, a general practitioner in Queens since 1946 and a director of the Boulevard Hospital in Astoria, died Saturday of a heart ailment at University Hospital in Manhattan. He was 62 years old and lived in the Holliswood section of Queens and in Woodstock, N.Y.

title: miss Lewis And Lawyer Are Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Leigh of New York and Oyster Bay, L.I., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Leigh's daughter, Prudence Ellen Lewis to Carlile BoltonSmith Jr. son of Mr. and Mrs. BoltonSmith of Georgetown, Washington. Miss Lewis also is a daughter of Wolfram Lewis of Santa Fe, N.M., a retired financial consultant. A January wedding is planned.

title: The private general's public story
description: The dining room in the Knesset, Israel's Parliament, is more than a place for legislators to eat. it is a combination political clubhouse, family parlor and highspeed rumor mill. Politicians. Parliament members, journalists and other hangerson spend long afternoons there hopping from one whiteclothed table to another, sipping tea in glasses, drinking borscht and constructing intrigues. The atmosphere is so convivial that even a foreigner can invite himself to sit down with a Cabinet minister for an impromptu chat. An exception to the rule, in my many visits to that relaxed room, was Moshe Dayan. He often sat apart, either alone at a table staring out through the big windows at the Jerusalem skyline, or surrounded by his own close aides. Even in that casual setting, there was something special about the man that set him apart, a kind of steely magnetic field around him that made others keep their distance unless they had a specific piece of business to raise with him.

title: Notes: The Right To Sue as a Group
description: A judge's ruling in a $1.5 million lawsuit involving allegations by vacationers about conditions at a resort in Jamaica may have a significant impact on future litigation concerning the travel industry.

title: After a Slow Start, 52
description: TORONTO, Oct. 23Just when it appeared that the Islanders excursion into the Northern states and Canada would become more scenic than productive, the New York hockey club threw off its lethargic ways and defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs, 52, tonight at Maple Leaf Gardens.

title: HOME CLINIC.
description: THE long stretch of rainy weather that has inundated many parts of New Jersey since Labor Day has resulted in a number of letters from people complaining about an alltoofamiliar problem wet basements.

title: The 1976 War Diary Of a Fictitious jet
description: July 17 They told Rivers to go and me. He came to camp full of pep and full of hope, but when they put his body up on the rack, and plugged in all the computer plugs, the lights all flashed and the horns played Taps for Rivers. Did not pass the physical. Not that he has any legitimate gripes. Heck, he's played up here for nine years, which is twice the average.

title: 4, Italian journalist, Back From Shanghai, Describes Antileftist Poster Campaign in China's Largest City
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 23When the first wall posters attacking the four senior leftists appeared in Shanghai a week ago, the situation in the city was tense and many people seemed to hold back to see which way the campaign would develop, an Italian journalist who just returned from there reported today.

title: Susan Smirnoff is Engaged to Scott Charles
description: Barbara Smirnoff of Fairfield, Conn., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Susan Sandford Smirnoff. to Scott Paul Charles of Washington, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lall Charles, of Stamford. Conn. Plans have been made for a wedding on Nov. 28.

title: Anglers Awaiting Annual Fall Run
description: IT'S certainly an ill wind that would keep fishermen from some of the best action of the year. Fishing is generally good all along the New jersey coast now. if only the brisk autumn breezes will subside long enough for boats to get out and the surf to settle.

title: Home Style
description: At the end of this month Betty Carmer, 72, will move from Octagon House in Irvington, N.Y., where she has lived for 30 years. it is time. Last month her husband, 82yearold Carl Carmer, died. On Oct. 3 there was an auction of most of the furnishings of the house.

title: What's Ahead for The Glorious Sound Of Carnegie Hall
description: For more than a decade, Carnegie Hall has been the happy beneficiary of Avery Fisher Hall's woes. Concertgoers have resisted the environment of concrete city preferring the quietif crampedelegance of the older concert hall. Performers have complained that they could hear neither themselves nor each other on Fisher's stage and opted for the intimacy and traditional feel of Carnegie. The plague of poor acoustics was discussed by New Yorkers who had never set foot in Lincoln Center. Come hear the glorious sound of Carnegie Hall was the triumphant logo affixed to Carnegie promotional material and advertising by a management that knew how to exploit a good thing.

title: The DeJunked Lunch
description: MARGARET STOECKERT refuses to take no for an answer. Told that the budget is too tight, the enrollment too small, the facilities inadequate, she still contends that school lunches that do not rely on prepackaged convenience and junk foods can be provided.

title: Letters: An Ordeal On the Hellas Express
description: To the Editor. In response to James A. Clark's article, All the World's a Train (Travel Section, Oct.3), I propose a necessary addendum to the If You Go box on the Hellas Express: Female passengers without a male escort travel at their own risk, especially if blonde.

description: Periodic cleaning and maintenance with a suitable wax or polish is essential to the care of all interior furniturefrom hand finished pieces made of the finest woods to inexpensive, mass produced furniture that is covered with wood or plastic veneer.

description: GENEVA, Oct.23The United States weighing steps to thwart a possible deadlock at the meeting designed to set up a biracial temporary government in Rhodesia, according to diplomatic sources.

title: Coast Researchers Find Opiate in Pituitary Gland Stronger Than Morphine
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 23 (UPI)Researchers at the University of California here have discovered a natural substance In the pituitary gland that they report acts as a pain killer far more potent than morphine.

title: Pekingese Chosen Best At Queensboro's Show
description: The team of Mrs. Walter M. Jeffords Jr. and Michael Wolf have had some great Pekingese over the years. Their current star is Ch. Yang Kee Bernard and the 4yearold is keeping up the winning tradition of the kennel. Yesterday, at the 53d show of the Queensboro Kennel Club in the State Armory in Jamaica, the fawn, handled by Wolf, led a parade of 1,095 in capturing the silverware for the 10th time.

title: State's Economic Recovery Off
description: L IKE thousand, of Jets, schoolchildren, the state's economy has just received one of those misnamed Progress reports. As parents knostv, a progress report is really a report on the lack of progress and a writing I., get jtanpmg.

title: With Russians in Mind
description: Good politics sometimes makes for had policies, especially bad foreign policies. Perhaps candidates cannot be expected to do other than trade slogans, myths and images for the news media, appeal to hairychested chauvinism and to ethnic blocs and pressure groups. if you are fashionably cynical, you say it really does not matter but out there is a real world with real problems, that bear only the faintest resemblance to the cardboard props in our political games.

Unfortunately, such adequate safeguards do not now exist.

description: NEW HYDE PARK FOR the second time in two years, Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center has proposed an affiliation with a college to form a medical school.

description: The New York City Opera has always been in trouble when it tries to take on the big things of the repertory, and Friday night's premiere of Wagner's Der Fliegende Hollnder was no exception. As they say, you can't blame a guy for trying; but why even think of ??naking the attempt when the odds are against you?

description: AN acrosstheboard challenge to Nassau Count's taxassessment ?? by owners of industrial and commercial property has officials talking in apocalyptic terms about the county's financial future.

title: The Wind That Shook the island
description: WHAT you have to remember first is that nobody expected anything to happen. Consider what it was like on that Wednesday if you were driving the length of Long Island, say from Times Square, starting at 3 in the afternoon, to the ocean's edge, Southold.

description: NORMAN, Okla., Oct. 23 (AP) Terry Miller rushed for 159 yards and Charlie Weatherbie, a senior quarback, came off the bench to direct three secondhalf scores as Oklahoma State upset Oklahoma, 3124, today.

description: Gerald Ford and Jimmy Carter entering the last full week of th Presidential campaign, with Mr. Carte believed still ahead and with bot men perhaps as relieved as the elector ate that the end is near: They he, their final debate Friday night am managed to survive without disaste and with their candidacies intact.

description: BOMBAY, Oct. 23 (Reuters)The flight recorder of an Indian airliner that crashed here 11 days ago killing all 95 people aboard has been found in a fisherman's catch, the Indian news agency Samachar reported.

description: A 19yearold youth was shot and killed and two other persons were v..ounded when a gunman walked into the lobby of a Chinatown movie theater last night and opened fire.

title: In Summary
description: Gerald Ford, who has used incumbency as an important asset in the latter days of the Presidential campaign, found his occupancy of the White House posing political liabilities for him last week in ways he could not control.

title: PEOPLE
description: For a long time I wondered what made certain events in American life different from all others. So begins Jack Ludwig's The Great American Spectaculars, an examination of the Kentucky Derby, the Indianapolis 500, the Democratic end Republican nominating conventions, the Rose Bowl game and the Mardi Gras. The new book (Doubleday, $7.95) is the sixth by the author, who is a professor of English at the State University Center at Stony Brook.

description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: A poet's prose
description: New to the city, addicted to nighthawk strolls, you go round the block through a downtown wasteland and come suddenly, no notice, upon a civic Restoration  several blocks minus shlock and signs, wherein wood, brick and stone seem their honest selves again, architectural lines are clear, and an air of unobtrusive selfrespect prevails. Pausing, doping things out, wary and curious, you feel vaguely cleansed. It's this kind of experience that reading Richard Wilbur's prose pieces, as he calls Them, brings to mind.

title: Travel for the Pregnant: When, Whereand Whether
description: Before she was born, our daughter had flown 15,000 miles. My husband felt her kick inside me for the first time as we stood on the Mount of Olives, watching sunset fire the gold and silver domes of Jerusalem. Six months pregnant, I had left the security and comfort of our Manhattan apartment, with obstetrician and maternity hospital just minutes away, to go touring in Israel and Iran.

title: Yale Wins, 217, as Ground Game Proves Too Powerful for Penn
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 23If pitching is 90 percent of baseball, then ball control holds the same importance for football. it was this factor that Yale used this sunny afternoon in Franklin Field to defeat Penn, 217, in an Ivy League football game.

title: Social Announcements
description: Social Announcements

title: With the vices of the genre
description: The Southdadgummithas struck again, marring what might have been an excellent first novel. A Piece of My Heart shows obvious promise, but it also exhibits all the characteristic vices of Southern fiction. Those vices, in my view, are so numerous that there would not be space to list them all, but it won't hurt to tick off a few, starting with portentousness.

title: Bogus Transistors for Defense
description: After receiving a Government warning to watch for counterfeit semiconductors earlier this year, engineers at the space division of the Rockwell International Corporation in Downey, Calif., undertook some random testing of their transistor inventory. To their amazement, tests on 11 transistors of one type turned up 11 fakes.

title: Paper Back Talk
description: Queen. Tomorrow morning Rosemary Rogers will be arriving in Charleston, W. Va., from St. Louis for a daylong whirl through the local radio and TV stations, newsrooms  and bookstores. it will be her 13th stop on a 20city coasttocoast tour, the first time she's ever left home to meet her public. if what's happened in other cities is repeated in Charleston, she'll find stores jammed with women snatching copies of her latest novel, Wicked Loving Lies, out of still unpacked cartons, thrusting them at her for her signature. Women who have seen her face on TV or in the papers will dash up to her on the street crying, You're Rosemary Rogers, aren't you? I just love your books!

title: Jump on the Begonia Band Wagon
description: ALL kinds of begonias are available now and an increasing number of hobbyists are intrigued with this magnificent group of plants. Begonias have a great variety of growth habits, an almost endless number of leaf shapes and sizes, numerous leaf colors and color patterns and many types of flowers and flower clusters. The best part the plants are easy to raise.

title: MEETINGS & TALKS
description: EAST ISLIPCommemorating United Nations Day with tour guides from the United Nations; Wednesday 7:30 to 9:30 P.M.; public library, 381 Montauk Hwy. Free EAST MEADOW  Assertivenesstraining workshop, sponsored by the Workshop for Broadening Horizons: Tuesday, 10 A.M. to 3 P.M.; Suburban Park Jewish Center, 400 Old Westbury Rd. Admission $17. 7961944.

title: TUNA FLEETS RUSH TO GET YELLOWFINS
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 23Nearly a hundred sleek clippers of the American tuna fleet, scattered across the Far Pacific and along the African coast, are racing to fill their cargo holds during a 10day reprieve from a Government order that would have halted all fishing for prized yellowfin ??

title: More and More Adults Seek Moreand DifferentEducation
description: While enrollment of fulltime college students is declining across the country, tbe number of students in continuing education courses is rising, and the courses themselves are proliferating. The boom, experts in the field say, is moving adult education from stepchild in the educational family to full membership.

title: Westchester at War A Bicentennial Tour
description: In the fall of 1776 the area, to the north of New York City was a battlefield. General Washington had managed to extricate his troops from Manhattan, but he was hard pressed by Sir William Howe, the British commander, and hurriedly set up a new defense line at White Plains. There and in nearby communities, Bicentennial wanderers can follow the trail of the Continentals and redcoats who fought amid the colors of autumn 200 years ago. They can explore a number of battle sites, Colonial houses and old estates that are interwoven with the chronicles of the Revolutionary War, and attend special events scheduled for fall, Christmas and the New Year.

title: Columbia Graduate Student Ready for 4th New York City Marathon
description: Michael Konig is Columbia University's reallife marathon man. Once a week for the last four years, he has stepped out of his West 114th Street apartment. jogged the halfblock to Riverside Drivel and made a right turn north.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: MOSES HERZOG has just emerged a hero in Leonia. Herzog may be remembered as the eponymous antihero of Saul Bellow's novel, Herzog, who wanders through the hook thinking that, if he's out of his mind, it's all right with him. A good man and a scholar, he cannot bring himself to do much more than write letters.

title: THE MAYOR'S STAFF IS BUSY AND GROWING
description: When Mayor Beame took office nearly three years ago, one of his first steps was the dismantling of the strong, oftenabrasive City Hall staff that his predecessor, John V. Lindsay, had assembled to try to get control of the sprawling municipal bureaucracy.

title: British Scientist Rethinks a View Of Atomic Trend
description: LONDON, Oct. 23A prominent British nuclear physicist took a new look at the mass of laboratories, factories and eerie, concreteclad reactors that he had helped build over a 30year career and warned that all was not well in there.

title: JoEllen Maraventano Wed
description: St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Manhasset, L.I., was the setting at noon yesterday for the marriage of JoEllen Maraventano, daughter of Mrs. Salvator G. Maraventano of Port Washington, L.I., and the late Dr. Maraventano, to Richard Allen Goldman. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard Daniel Goldman of Richmond. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Leo J. Daly.

description: The New York Times/Fred R. Conrad

title: Michigan Defeats Indiana; Passer Stars in 350 Rout
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Oct. 23 (AP)Mchigan's Rob Lytle rushed for 175 and scored one touchdown and Rick Leach passed for 103 yards and two a touchdowns as the topranked Wolverines walloped Indiana 350 in a Big Ten game.

title: On the Trail of Navajo Rugs
description: An old Navajo legend says Spider Woman taught Navajo women how to weave. The warp sticks were sun rays. Like the Navajo people, the legend appears charmingly naive at first glance. Look deeper.

title: Striking Down of Rozelle Rule Allows Freedom to Arrange New Reserve Pact
description: At the National Multiple Sclerosis Society dinner here last Thursday night, the honored guest was Pete Rozelle and the main speaker Art Buchwald in a satirical rundown of the football commissioner's achievements. Buchwald said, among many other things, that Rozelle had transformed antitrust litigation from a cottage industry into something of real essence, that the American Bar Association rather than the Multiple Sclerosis Society should be giving the dinner, and that Rozelle's wonlost record in the courts was 035.

title: Mary enslaver of women
description: Marina Warner was raised saying the rosary, and she means to make up for all that. With encyclopedic thoroughness she exposes all the Virgin's claims. The cult of Mary has been a curse to mankind. it has misrepresented the Gospel, perverted the Church and embittered men. Nothing in it is salvageable. Was Mary's breast bared for nursing in early paintings? That was to keep woman enslaved to her biology. Were her breasts covered? That showed a fear or sex and the body.

title: Court Urges Agency to Consolidate All Child SexAbuse Cases
description: ?? Supreme Court Justice, ?? Kooper has urged that the New ??City Child Protection Service ?? all cases of sexual abuse ??not only those involving ?? by a parent or guardian.

title: COUNT DE VOGUE DIES; WAR HERO RAN MOET
description: Count RobertJean de Vogue, a hero of the Resistance who became managing director of Moet & Chandon, the largest champagne concern in France, and a leader in the international wine trade for 40 years, has died at his home in Paris at the age of 80.

title: Elizabeth H. Jessup Married
description: Elizabeth Harding Jessup, daughter of Mrs. Price Jessup of Washington and the late Philip S. Jessup, was married yesterday afternoon in Washington to Malcolm Smith Jr. of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Smith of Greenwich, Conn. The ceremony was performed in St. Albans Chapel at the Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul (National Cathedral) by the Rev. William Sharpe. He was assisted by the Rev. J. Paschall Davis, uncle of the bridegroom.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Specialists in old commemorative medalets, tokens and other items of exonumia can always find an item in their collection that not only reflects history but also relates to current happenings. That, of course, is one of the many pleasures of being an exonumist. With the national excitement generated by the World Series still running high, a collector could hardly own a more appropriate item than a medalet commemorating baseball's early days.

title: C.W. Post Center Ragtime Bonanza
description: GREENVALE AGROUP of leading ragtime pianistsdescribed as the greatest collection of such specialists to perform in one evening since Mite Bernard won the National Ragtime Piano contest at Tammany Hall on Jan. 23, 1900will be heard next Saturday evening at the C. W. Post Center of Long Island University.

title: Long Career in Dog World Ends Poignantly for Murr
description: It was a poignant moment at Vineland last Sunday when 82yearold Louis Murr stood in the middle of the ring ruling on the working group at South Jersey's silver anniversary fixture. For it ended a career in the dogshow world that began 56 years ago for the stocky little man.

title: A Phonographic Safari to Paris, Bayreuth and Milan
description: The opera season may only be slightly over a month old, but several notable events have already taken place and the record companies have been quick to commemorate them. Simultaneously with the La Scala performances of Verdi's Macbeth in Washington, Deutsche Grammophon has issued its recording of the opera starring many of the same singers, while London Records took due note of Georg Solti's appearances with the Paris Opra by releasing the conductor's own version of that French classic Carmen. Looking back a bit further to last summer, the Bayreuth centennial has provided a focus for a number of fascinating historical reis??

title: Tax Relief Sought
description: AHUGE amount of taxexempt property in two of New Jersey's largest cities is placing a heavy burden on taxpaying homeowners and businesses, who must take up the slack for the freeriders. Officials in these cities are seeking some sort of state compensation that will ease the burden and, by doing so. encourage the property owner not to pull up stakes and move to the suburbs.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may he obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: Women Designing for Women Highly Individual Approaches
description: While the 1960's will go down in fashion history as the time of the Pop explosion when, in retrospect, most women looked terrible, the 1970's will be known as the time when women put their stamp on the clothes that were wornas designers as well as consumers.

title: SHOP TALK
description: THE shops of summer are not all seasonal ventures. And the shopkeepers who operate beyond Labor Day often find that the exodus of the summer people gives impetus to a new spirit of creativity and productivity. Such is the case, at least, with a fascinating leather emporium called Wholly Cow, at 85 Main Street, Southampton.

title: Corrections
description: An article in The Review of Oct. 10 stated that the Christian Social Union in West Germany allegedly had received $122 million from the Lockheed Corporation. The amount said to be involved was $12 million.

description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 23 Although Leamon Hall broke the Army record for pass completions in a season by connecting on 16 aerials, the Cadets were no match for the relentless, timeconsuming ground attack of Boston College today at Michid Stadium and were ground down, 2710, before a Homecoming Day crowd of 33,008.

title: Dr. Marie Britz Wed To Dr. Robert J. Masi

description: PARIS Oct. 23Officials of the United Educational, ?? and Culorganization ?? this week that ?? had been completed under United States leadership to move toward Israel to full status as a member ??ntry.

title: Needed and recommended light verse
description: Cynthia Macdonald can, and does, begin her poems with lines like these: It was lucky he was so big or he would have had more trouble/with the black iron skillet he wore suspended from a chain around/ his neck. Even so it tired him. And from there she continues down the pages, through outlandish fantasias and outrageous puns, all in a cool, elegant, sardonic, poised, irreverent skein of artifice, which can be, and often is, hilarious.

title: Connecticut Assembly Candidates Overshadowed by National Races
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 18 Like leaves stirred by an autumn breeze, Connect?? 389 candidtes for the General Asse mbly are distict, and yet only half perceive in the conditions created by the Presidential and Congressional politicking in Connecticut.

title: This Week in Shorts

On Tuesday night at 7:35 in Madison Square Garden, the Knicks play host to the Buffalo Braves and on Saturday night at 8 P.M. the New Orleans Jazz plays here. The Nets opponents in Nassau Coliseum are the Washington Bullets on Wednesday night and the Indiana Pacers Friday night. Both games start at 8:05.

description: Within one plant, Hammond maps are researched, drawn by expert cartographers and printed on automated highspeed color presses.

description: THE Fall Flower Show at Planting Fields Arboretum signals the end of the outdor gardening season. if killing frost hasn't struck before the show, it will soon after. Thus flowering will end for the season, and the leaves will soon fall as nature settles in for her winter of rest.

title: Bad News for the Giants Steelers Are Sharp Now
description: Sunday after Sunday, defeat after defeat. the team maintained its composure. Next week, the players figured, things would be better and there was still plenty of time left in the ?? Football ??.

title: OUSTED EDITOR IN MEXICO FACES HEARING TOMORROW
description: MEXICO CITY. Oct. 23The ousted editor of Excelsior, the Mexican daily, Julio Scherer Garcia, has been ordered to appear before tie Mexko City Attorney General's office to answer charges that he embezzled Sc50,000 from the newspaper.

description: Shipping/Mails

title: For Whose Welfare?
description: I started for me when I couldn't find a job and I had to apply for welfare. I viewed this magnificent building and it indeed looked like a place where people would get help. I was living in a furnished room in New Hyde Park and I had previously applied for Supplemental Security Income for a disability that I had. I had been refused by Social Security. Then I was given $230 on the first of the month, but for the next three months I was denied aid. Finally I came into a rare exception in the Social Services Department, a friendly social worker.

title: Greeley, Finally Scored On, Defeats Port Chester, 2013
description: Horace Greeley, undefeated but no longer unscored upon, defeated Port Chester, 2013, yesterday.

title: Two novels
description: Dan Jenkins and Edwin Shrake are both firstrate sports writers capable of excellent work. As such, they are entitled to boot one every now and then in Limo, their first collaboration on a novel, Jenkins and Shrake have committed the literary equivalent of the passed ball. They put together a roman a clef and then dropped the clef in this hip, satirical novel about the television business it is easy enough to tell Roone Arledge from Gloria Steinem  they both wear tinted glasses but Gloria is the one with long hair. It's just that I can't imagine who would want to bother.

title: Jersey Road Authority Refuses To Appoint Choice of Governor
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J., Oct. 22 (AP)Contrary to the wishes of Gov. Brendan T. Byrne, the New Jersey Highway Authority has refused, at least for now, to appoint William F. Smith of South Orange as its. executive director.

title: Bar Ruling Affirms Ban on Advertising by Lawyers
description: Eighteenthcentury European bankers and doctors carried cards engraved with classical and allegorical scenes. Nineteenthcentury tradesmen preferred ornate illustrations on their cards, which doubled as advertisements. Manhattan lawyers, who have always been a bit skittish about advertising their services, may use nothing more elaborate than simple white cards.

title: East Orange Pulls Upset On Fluke Play

description: It started six years ago as a cozy little run in the park, an autumn exercise for marathoners in the aftermath of the annual spring rites in Boston.

title: Ford Motor to Lay Off 10,000 Because of a Shortage of Parts
description: DETROIT, Oct. 23 (AP)  The Ford Motor Company has announced that it will lay off up to 10,000 auto workers by next week because of parts shortages.

title: Koch, Cindy Nelson To Be Honored at Ski Ball
description: Bill Koch and Cindy Nelson, medal winners in the 1976 Winter Olympics at Innsbruck, Austria, will be among the skiers to be honored at the 10th annual Ski Ball to be held by the New York Committee for the United States Ski Team Fund in the Pierre Hotel's Grand Ballroom on Thursday night, Nov. 4.

title: Central Islip Wins, 386
description: ?? Tice, quarterback, ran for three ?? as unbeaten Central Islip trounced Smithtown East, 386, in an A.A.?? football game yesterday. The victory was the fifth of the season, four in league play, for the Musketeers, who now have a 12game winning streak.

title: Richard Leibert, Chief Organist At Music Hall 193271, Dies at 73
description: Richard Leibert, chief organist of the Radio City Music Hall from its opening in 1932 until his retirement five years ago, died Friday at Lee Memorial Hospital in Fort Myers, Fla. He was 73 years old and had lived in Cape Coral, Fla., since 1971.

title: Cynthia Chase to Be a Bride
description: Cynthia Chase, a doctoral candidate in comparative literature at Yale University, and Jonathan Dwight Culler, University Lecturer at Oxford University and a fellow and tutor at Brasenose College there, plan to be married Dec. 27.

title: Odds on Carter Stay Same, Despite Debate
description: LONDON, Oct. 23 (UPI)  The third and final debate between President Ford and limy Carter was not likely to change the betting odds on the election, a bookmaker said today.

title: Letters
description: The title for Ted Morgan's story on Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman  MHz recycles our garbage(Oct. 3) exhibits the most common mistake of my algebra students. MHz is equivalent to MHII. With parentheses, (MH) would have been correct. (OK)2?

title: An Athletic Service Corps to Spur Physical Fitness
description: America has its Peace Corps and VISTA, its National Endowment for the Arts and Humanities, its Corporation for Public Broadcasting. Why not an Athletic Service Corps?

title: GARDENING
description: AS autumn progresses, gardening activities in New Jersey begin to shift toward the indoors of course, many of the pesky plant pests that we have been trying to put to rout all summer also welcome the change to a nice warm place, and so it's important to be constantly on the alert for signs of trouble. Prevention is far better than cure.

title: Silurians to Salute Smith
description: Red Smith, Pulitzer Prize winner and sports columnist of The New York Times, will receive the Society of Silurians 25year news achievement award tomorrow night at the society's annual dinner the Riverboat. Fifth Avenue and 34th Street.

title: JUBILANT MILLIONS PARADING IN CHINA IN PURGE OF LEFTISTS
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 23Millions of peo, ple paraded through the streets of Peking, Shanghai, Tientsin and Canton for the third day today to celebrate the downfall of the four senior leftists, in what the Chinese press described as a jubilant mood.

title: Belmont Racing
description: Saturday, Oct. 23, 48th and final day. Weather clear, track fast.  1970 by Triangle Publications Inc. (The Daily Racinc Form)

title: Elizabeth Wallace Mills Is Bride of Navy Officer
description: Elizabeth Wallace Mills and Lieut. Comdr. Beryl Grant Mcore 2d of the Navy were married yesterday in Yardley, Pa. where the Rev. Edward B. Gammons porformed the ceremony in St Androw's Episcopal Church.

title: Baseball Country: A Land of Change and Deja Vu
description: Baseball is a country all to itself. It is an old country, like Ruritania, northwest of Bohemia and its seacoast. Steam locomotives puff across trestles and through tunnels. it is a wrongendofthetelescope country, like the landscape people build for model trains, miniature with distance and old age.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE Knife and Fork Inn is, literally and figuratively, an Atlantic City landmark, The distinctive white building, set at one of the city's major intersections, is a familiar sight to anyone who visits the resort, and the restaurant's reputation for good food is as solid as the building.

title: Michael D. Schmitz To Wed Miss Mehlich
description: Cheryl Astrid Mehlich, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William O. Mehlich of Scarsdale, N.Y., and Michael David Schmitz a lawyer with the Chicago firm of Walsh, Case & Coale, plan to be married in January.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: If filmmakers want to change the world, they have to change filmmaking.

title: For young readers
description: Jay Williams's story tells of the advance of barbaric horsemen. skulls dangling from their saddles, on the peaceful city of Wu. The Mandarin, Jade Tiger, and all his councillors pray to the Great Cloud Dragon to save them. Next day, a squat, paunchy, bearded man introduces himself as a dragon to poor Han, the orphaned gatesweeper. Han takes this unlikely dragon to the skeptical Mandarin, whereupon the old man offers to save the city. Give me something to eat and something to drink and speak to me politely. That is the only way to get a dragon to help you. Piffle and polite! Jade Tiger scoffs, dismissing the old man, Only cheerful Han trusts the venerable stranger and proffers his own rice and wine. The old man metamorphoses into a stunning dragon and defeats the ferocious horsemen, while Wu's leaders cringe under their beds. The grateful people of Wu reward the joyous Han with gold pieces and the title The Honorable Defender of the City.

title: FILMS
description: BRIGHTWATERSAntonioni's BlowUp, starring David Hemmings; Friday 7:30 P.M.; public library. 1 South Country Rd.

title: Fashion
description: There is a new shop in town with all the flavor of a French boutique, and it's on Madison Avenue instead of the Left Bank. The name is Dianne B. It's the brainchild of Dianne Schools, an energetic young woman with flair, taste and a preference for individuallooking clothes.

title: A Festival of New Music in Boston
description: Of the many dividends to accrue from the American Bicentennial, perhaps one of the more unusual is the forthcoming ISCM (International Society of Contemporary Music) World Music Days, to be held in Boston beginning today and continuing through Oct. 30. World Music Days is the imposing name of the international festival of new music which has been held annually in different major music capitals of the world for the last fiveandahalf decades. This year will mark the first time that this most important event in the field of contemporary music will be held in the United States. The Festival in Boston will be supported primarily by grants from the National Endowment of the Arts and the Fromm Music Foundation, as well as smaller matching grants from a host of other foundations and private sourcesmuch of this support primed to the Bicentennial and the historical uniqueness of the occasion.

title: CONSUMERS SUPPORT POSITIONS OF CARTER
description: Early last August, at a meeting of Ralph Nader's Public Citizen Forum, Jimmy Carter said of Mr. Nader, I hope to challenge him in the future for the role of top consumer advocate.

title: Hearings Scheduled By the City Council
description: The following public hearings will be held by New York City Council committees this week.

title: Putting: Hammond on the Map
description: MAPLEWOOD THE small, rather plain industrial building ort a slope on Valley Street, a building served by little elevator Rept busy shuttling to and from the three floors, hardly looks imposing enough to put this Essex County community on the map in fact, it's even inconspicuous in Maplewood.

title: Slinging Some Old Mud
description: OLD BETHPAGE ON the platform draped with a 26star flag outside John Noon's stagecoach inn here, a redwhiskered, frockcoated, silkhatted young Whig is haranguing the crowd.

title: ART VIEW
description: The Alexander Calder exhibition that Jean Lipman and her staff have organized at the Whitney Museum of American Art under the title of Calder's Universe is so much fun, so easily seduces the eye and so shamelessly charms the mind, that it is just possible, I think, for the casual or inattentive visitor to miss something important the fact that Calder is a major figure in the history of modernist sculpture.

title: Crime Reporter, in New Book, Contends Hauptman Was Not Guilty
description: Drawing in part on hitherto unavailable law enforcement documents, a longtime crime reporter contends that Bruno Richard Hauptmann was innocent of the 1932 kidnappingmurder of Charles A. Lindbergh Jr. Hauptmann was electrocuted on Aoril 3, 1936.

title: Boy, 17, Killed by Train
description: A 17yearold boy was struck by a Conrail train and killed in the Bronx Friday night, the police reported. The police did not immediately identify the youth, who was pronounced dead on the scene. The youth was struck by the train about 7:30 p.m. on the Penn Cntral setthbound tracks at 178 th Street and Park Avenue.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 (AP)The Air Line Pilots Association struck Continental Airlines early today.

title: FOR THE HUDSON, B NEWS AND GOOD
description: Luke Hart, manager of the two General Electric capacitor factories at Hudson Falls and Fort Edward, N.Y., holds up a small vial filled with a brilliantly dear, slightly viscous liquid.

title: Peter Hazzard, Conductor,Weds Katharine Beers
description: Katharine Sabine Beers, daughter of Elizabeth Beers of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L.I., and the late Nathan T. Beers, was married yesterday afternoon in Brookline, Mass., to Peter Peabody Hazzard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Hazzard Jr, of Boston and Annisquam, Mass.

title: Luxury Buildings Cutting Frills
description: Residents of Manhattan's luxury apartment buildings, long accustomed to the best in service and amenities, are learning to make do with lessfewer maintenance employees, longer waits for repairs and a general belttightening as building owners and co. operative boards of directors strive to cut costs.

title: Buckley Concerned By Voters Apathy In Senatorial Race
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y., Oct. 23Senator James L. Buckley preached his political gospel at a dozen stops during an intensive tour of Northern Westchester today while wondering just how many voters that gospel or any political doctrine would bring to the polls this year.

title: And Helped by the Brain Drain
description: PARISIt is a cause for much satisfaction that all the Nobel Prizes awardcd this yeartotaling seven recipients in economics, physics, medidile, chemistry and literaturewere given to Americans. There is no Peace Prize for 1976although, strangely enough, with the Lebanese conflict tapering off, it may be the first in many years without a major war.

title: Bill Berei positions his Austrian troops
description: Added Mr. Lochet: It is sometimes very hard to put a large battle in such a small space.

title: Van Winkle Offers Tips On Winterizing Methods
description: Atuumn. For some boatmen, it's the best time of year. But when the first frost leaves a deep chill, yards fill up quickly. The tendency is to see the boat hauled and then rush indoors, folgettin git until springnot hard to do when your fingers are stiffiening from the cold. But a little time spent now ?? save you a lot of money and aggravation in the spring.

title: Ford Signs Immigration Bill Aiding Residents of Western Hemisphere
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23Just before midnight last Wednesday night, President Ford signed without fanfare a bill effecting the most sweeping changes in the nation's immigration laws since 1965.

title: National Committee, Cast in a New Role, Hopes to Get 5 Times as Much as in Any Other Year
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 The Democratic National Committee, cast in a new political role by the Federal Election Campaign Act, expects to raise five times as much money in 1976 as in any previous Presidential year.

title: W. L. Irwin to Wed Ann Brewster
description: Ann Blair Brewster, an associate with the Simpson Thacher & Bartlett law firm, and William Langer Irwin, a senior accountant with Price Waterhouse & Company, plan to be married next May.

title: Food: A guide to storing wine under less than ideal conditions
description: Falling in love with wine and living in New York can he peculiarly frustrating. The possibilities and the limitations, intertwined as they are, nudge trauma.

title: A Fight for Arts and a Nice Place to Live
description: FREEPORT TO Hale Smith, culture is no pieinthesky idea that flourishes in an intellectual hothouse. Rather, Mr. Smith, a composer whose works have been perrormed by the New York Philharmonic and the American and Cleveland Symphony Orchestras, is convinced that there is a very practical value to art"and he's willing to take practical steps to save it when it's threatened.

title: HEADS OF JEWISH GROUPS CRITICIZE GENERAL BROWN
description: Leaders of major Jewish secular and religious organizations in America sharply criticized Gen. George S. Brown, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, yesterday for his recent assertion that Israel was a military burden to the United States.

title: Keeping an Eye On the Government
description: TRENTON ACOUPLE of times a month, a middleaged housewife from Ewing Township and a young student from the Princeton Theological Seminary settle down on the ninth floor of a bank building here for some light reading. They peruse old campaign contribution reports from candidates for the State Legislature, trying to find out who supports candidates and why.

title: The Presidential Choice
description: In this 200th year of American independence, it will be the supreme irony if proportionately fewer eligible voters cast their ballots on Nov. 2 than in any previous Presidential election of the past halfcentury. if we American:, don't care enough about our own democracy to participate in it, we deserve to lose itand lose we will.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: United Press International

title: Science
description: With the American sweep of the Nobel Prizes in science this year, the creation recently of the first functional artificial gene by Massachusetts scientists and the landings of two Viking craft on Mars last summer, it would appear that American leadership in science and technology was never more secure.

title: FOR CHILDREN
description: BETHPAGE"The Happiness Man, a Halloween musical; Saturday 2:30 P.M.; public library, 47 Powell Ave. Free.

title: Man Rents Hall to Talk Divorce, Divorcing Himself From $100,000
description: David L Levine's latest divorce cost him $60,000. Yesterday he lost $100,000 just talking about it.

title: Unemployed in Hartford Are Hired By City to Pay Off Property Taxes
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 23 (AP)Carmela Arcovito paid most of her property taxes this year by keeping the city's books and organizing trips for the elderly. She was one of 100 unemployed or lowincome residents who joined the nation's first workfortaxes program.

description: The body of a 66yearold woman who had been dead for several days was found yesterday at the bottom of an elevator shaft in a building at 119 Audubon Avenue.

description: With more than half the property in Hardenburgh, N.Y., tax exempt because vast tracts are owned by religious and educational groupsincluding those of Zen Buddhists, Tibetan monks and conservationiststhe 236 taxpaying residents revolted.

title: DINING OUT
description: WINDMILLS, once a fixture on the Island's landscape, are now mostly preserved as relics or designed as restaurants. There is a windmill on the Jericho Turnpike in Huntington that Chinese restaurants have been calling home for several years. The latest is Hsu's Dynasty, open since July.

title: Trumbull Wins From Staples
description: The defending state champion, Staples, tossed a scare into No. 1ranked Trumbull, but the Eagles came away with their sixth straight victory by 76 in Westport yesterday.

description: TRENTON AT AN age when most persons would be glad just to be alive and despite a professional. career that has spanned more than 50 years, Dr. A. James Fessler refuses to quit.
