That is an area that Israel wants to keep free of Palestinian guerrillas.

title: $10 Million Set For Developing Games Athletes
description: The United States Olympic Committee will spend more than $10 million in sports development for the 1980 Moscow Olympics, a commitment unparalleled in American amateur athletics.

title: Income After Sale of Plants Lifts Con Ed's 3d Quarter Profit by 7.8%
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York yesterday reported that its earnings rose 7.8 percent in the third quarter to $98.3 million, Analysts attributed the increase to income on the proceeds of two power plants to the Power Authority or the State of New York.

title: Playboy Says Ford Didn't Refuse Interview and Offered Short Ones
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 26 (AP)President Ford never refused an indepth interview with Playboy magazine as he had contended and the White House twice offered to set up shorter ones, an editor for the magazine said today.

title: Professional Football
Meadowlands
description: Meadowlands

title: Pregnant Students
description: To save the $1.5 million a year it costs to operate the city's five special high schools for pregnant students, a decision was taken in February to close them. Then the bureaucracy went to work.

title: Hartwick, Adelphi Show Littlein Showdown
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Oct 26Hartwick and Adelphi, ranked 1, 2 in New York and in the top 10 nationally, played to a scoreless tie in soccer today before a capacity crowd at Adelphi.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's biggest team contest begins in the New York area next week. it is the Grand National Teams, which last season attracted an entry of 6.975 teams from all parts of North America.

title: A Rousing Show by Saint Laurent
description: PARIS, Oct. 26The models in their black velvet lacedfront bodices and flouncy skirts kicked up their heels, the bride came out doing the cancan, the audience stood up and clapped to keep the rhythm. it was the rousing end to Yves Saint Laurent's astonishing marathon fashion show, which ran more than two hours, spoiled everybody's plans for lunch and included 281 styles, each cne of more than passing interest.

title: Italians Amplify Looting Charges Against Sindona
description: The Italian Government filed detailed new charges yesterday in its long battle to extradite Michele Sindona, the Italian banker, to stand trial at home on accusations that he looted two Italian banks of $225 million.

title: BELATED GREETINGS SENT TO PEKING BY ALBANIANS
description: VIENNA, Oct. 26 (Reuters)The Albanian Communist leader, Enver Hoxha, sent belated congratulations today to the new Chinese party chairman, Hua Kuofeng, and said their countries should struggle together against the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: BRITISH COURT HEARS PRIVATE EYE CASE
description: LONDON, Oct. 26One of Britain's more interesting legal battlesinteresting nor only because of the issues but also the personalities involvedreturned to the High Court here today.

title: New York's Law On Death Penalty Is Found Invalid
description: A State Supreme Court justice ruled yesterday that New York State's death penalty law was unconstitutional, in the first legal test of the law since a landmark decision by the United States Supreme Court last summer.

title: The New York Times/Paul Hosefros
description: The New York Times/Paul Hosefros

title: German Doctors Challenge Olympic Ban on Steroids
description: BONN, West Germany, Oct. 26 (AP)A group of West German sports doctors is challenging the Olympic ban on anabolic steroids, contending the muscle pills are harmless to physically mature athletes if dosages are carefully controlled.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Music

title: DR.CHARLESRAGANJR., ARTHRITIS SPECIALIST
description: Dr. Charles A. Ragan Jr., former chairman of the department of medicine at Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons and a specialist in arthritis, died at his Bronxvville home yesterday. He was 65 years old.

title: 5 Held in Truck Driver's Death
description: WOODSTOCK, III., Oct. 26 (AP)Five young men who, the police said, threw rocks from their speeding van, causing the death of a truck driver, were charged with murder today. Gary Lee Campbell, 19 years old; Joseph Shine, 18, and his brother, John, 20; James Glasder, 18, and Daniel Craig, 20, were held on $500,000 bond each. David Klawes, 26, was killed Oct. 19 when a rock crashed through the windshield of his truck, the police said.

title: STEEL OUTPUT UP IN WEEK TO 2.35 MILLION TON
description: Steel production for the week ended Oct. 23 edged ahead by 0.3 percent to 2.35 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Murdoch, Hickey: 2 Each
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 26The Rangers power play, the most effective in the league accounted for three goals tonight as New York returned to 500 hockey with a 52 victory over a sluggish Cleveland Baron team.

title: Crostini di Tartufi
description: 3 tablespbons olive oil

title: WINE TALK
description: BORDEAUX, France, Oct. 22Change comes very slowly to this dignified old city. True, there now are motels on the outskirts and even a plasticlooking Frantel Hotel in a redeveloped area near the center of town.

title: Callaghan for Cuts Abroad, Not at Home
description: Callaghan for Cuts Abroad, Not at Home

title: Baseball Girds for Expansion and FreeAgent Picks
description: The World Series between the Yankees and the Cincinnati Reds represented the last games among baseball players until next March, but baseball officials are deeply involved in games of their own.

title: The Hair Factor
description: PARISDuring the decidedly mediocre political campaign that is now winding up in the United States, practically every aspect of the candidates their views, habits and personalities has been discussed except the length of their hair. We know something about Jimmy Carter's suppressed libido and also something about the kind of moral outlook tolerated in Jerry Ford's family.

title: MCA Offer for Sea World Is Called Inadequate
description: Sea World said in San Diego yesterday that the offer of the MCA Corporation to pay $22 a share for the 1.7 million shares of Sea World stock outstanding was totally inadequate. A spokesman for Sea World said its directors would meet Saturday to review the offer and its decision would be conveyed to shareholders no later than Nov. 5.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Roosevelt
description: RESULTS

title: Pasta With White Truffles
description: To each pound of hot, drained, fresh. ly cooked pasta add six tablespoons of butter at room temperature and two chopped white truffles. Toss with Parmesan cheese, added to taste.

title: Charles W. Richard, 68, Dies; Was Former Coach in Alabama
description: CULLMAN. Ala., Oct. 26 (AP)Charles W. Richard, 68 years old, a threesport coach at St. Bernard College, died here today from emphysema.

title: Former High Cuban Aide Who Broke With Castro Shot to Death in San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Oct. 26 (AP)Aldo Vera Serafin, a Cuban exile who was once a top police official of the Government of Prime Minister Fidel Castro but later split with him, was shot to death last night as he walked along a street in a San Juan suburb, the police reported today.

title: Voscow Adds Urals Party Aide to the Kremlin's Leadership Group
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 26The policymaking Central Committee of the Soviet Communist Party wound up a twoday session today with some personnel changes that left the senior leadership ranks intact.

title: PAPER ASSERTS WIFE REWORDED MAO DATA
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 26Shortly after Mao Tsetung died last month, his widow, Chiang Ching, took out several of Mao's documents from the Communist Party's special archives and reworded them, a Hong Kong newspaper said today.

title: Israel is Emphasizing a Visit By the French Socialist Leader
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 26With an eye on bettering its eroded relations with France, Israel today extended red carpet treatment to the French Socialist leader, Francois Mitterrand.

title: DOLE, AT OHIO RALLY, MODIFIES HIS STAND ON DEMOCRAT WARS
description: TROY, Ohio, Oct. 26Senator Robert J. Dole, the Republican VicePresidential candidate, withdrew today his contention that World War II and the Vietnam conflict were Democrat wars, but he contended that American weakness contributed to one and American indecision led to the other.

title: U.N. ASSEMBLY VOTES A REBUFF OF TRANSKEI
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 26The General Assembly, demonstrating disapproval of the policy of apartheid practiced by South Africa, called today on member governments to prohibit all contacts with the Transkei, the firstof the South African black hornelands to secure independence.

title: SAUDI'S PRICE STAND ON OIL HELPS SPUR 10,14 CLIMB BY DOW
description: The Dow Jones industrial average spurted more than 10 points yesterday, with bluechip, glamour and specialsituation issues leading the way.

title: Appeals Court Rules Nixon Tapes Can le Copied, Sold or Broadcast
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The United States Court of Appeals here ruled today by vote of 2 to 1 that the White House tape recordings that were used as evidence in the Watergate coverup trial may be reproduced, broadcast, and sold to the public in records as soon as a suitable plan for distributing the tapes is developed.

title: French Seize 10 in $8 Million Theft
description: PARIS, Oct. 26Striking before dawn here and in other French cities, policemen today rounded up 10 men on suspicion of being members of the gang that tunneled into a bank vault on the Riviera in July and escapedwith $8 million in money and jewelry.

title: Innocents to Close Saturday
description: The Innocents, the revival of the 1950 William Archibald play, based on The Turn of the Screw by Henry James, will end its Broadway run at the Morosco Theater on Saturday.

title: Hunger
description: WASHINGTONA moderately successful grain harvest this fall may lull world leaders into a false sense of security over the world food situation. Few realize that even this year's promising crop will do little to rebuild depleted grain reserves.

title: News Summary
description: The Cairo meeting of Arab leaders produced no accord on the makeup of an expanded peacekeeping force for Lebanon, but their closing statements seemed to imply that Syria would dominate it. This was in spite of objections by Iraq, Libya and the Palestine Liberation Organization to Syria's role with 23,000 of its soldiers in the country. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: DOROTHY MAY TRAVIS
description: NORWAY, Me., Oct. 26Dorothy May Travis, founder and first president of the Princeton, N.J., branch of the Colony of the Oranges, died Friday in the Stephens Memorial Hospital here of a gunshot wound inflicted by her husband, Edward P. Travis. She was 76 years old.

title: Technology: Protectionof Grains From Plague in Poorer Nations
description: For nations with rapidly increasing populations, a problem almost as vital as increasing fordgrain yields is protecting the grain, once harvested, from such plagues as insects.

title: A WEEKLONG SLIDE IN BOND PRICES ENDS
description: The credit market's steep weeklong slide was halted yesterday, bond prices rose moderately and investor demand for some new issues became noticeably stronger. Mississippi sold $63 million of taxexempt bonds that were priced to yieia Toughly a quarterpoint more than they would have last week, and almost 90 percent of the bonds were quickly bought by investors. The Marathon Oil Company's $400 million of notes and debentures scheduled for sale today appeared largely spoken for, but a new issue of mediumgrade utility bonds sold more slowly.

title: Deaths
Citing Failure to Follow Directives, Anker Ousts Harlem School Board
description: Charging that central Harlem's Community School Board 5 has repeatedly and consistently demonstrated its unwillingness or inability to comply with its duties under law and applicable directives, School Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday suspended all eight members of the board and said he would name trustees to run the district's 23 schools.

title: Personal Finance: Controversy Besets Graduated Mortgage Plan
description: The United States Department of Housing and Urban Development will begin processing applications for the Ford Administration's widely heralded graduated mortgage payment plan nest Mondaythe day before the electionbut it is difficult to find a hanker who believes the program will provide much immediate help to home buyers.

title: U. N. ASSEMBLY VOTES A REBUFF OF TRANSKEI
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 26The General Assembly, demonstrating disapproval of the policy of apartheid practiced by South Africa, called today on member governments to prohibit all contacts with the Transkei, the first of the South African black homelands to secure independence.

title: In the House of Picasso, Symphonic Portraits Rest
description: Jacqueline nearly perished alter Picasso died in 1973, reports the the photographer David Douglas Duncan, an old friend of the late artist and his widow. For nearly two years she languished in total seclusion at NotreDame de Vie [Picasso's studiohome on the Riviera], with monthly visits to the Chateau de Vauvenargues [the mountain estate where the artist is buried.]

title: About Real Estate
description: If happy customers are the best salesmen, the former Detecto Scales building in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn has two in David Rochlitz and Jerry Neuhaus.

title: Aid for Buyer Available For Picking Best Brand
description: Confronted with a store full of stereo systems, a lineup of washing machines or a showroom full of cars, today's consumer may feel like a child who has lost his mother's shopping list on the way to the corner grocery.

title: Student Fined in Dole Incident
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Oct. 26 (AP)A University of Vermont student has been fined $100 for throwing a crushed paper cup at Senator Robert J. Dole, the Republican VicePresidential nominee. The fine was ordered yesterday in Vermont District Court for Brian F. McNelis, 23 years old, of Providence, R. I. He did not contest a disorderly conduct charge filed after the incident on Oct. 2 at the university's, Oktoberfest, where Mr. Dole was campaigning.

title: DOLE, AT OHIO RALLY, MODIFIES HIS STAND ON DEMOCRAT WARS
description: TROY, Ohio, Oct. 26Senator Robert J. Dole, the Republican VicePresidential candidate, withdrew today his contention that World War II and the Vietnam conflict were Democrat wars, but he contended that American weakness contributed to one and American indecision led to the other.

title: Radio
TV: A Not So Amazing Grace
description: As a rather elaborate anthology, Amazing GraceAmerica in Song is neither amazing nor particularly graceful. Produced and directed by Allan Miller for WNET/13, the 90minute program to be shown at 9 tonight is a collection in search of a point. At the outset, John Steinbeck is quoted to the effect that you can learn more about people by listening to their songs than anything else. But Amazing Grace attempts to do too much, winds up doing too little and we learn less about people than about a variety of tunes.

title: About Education
description: One of the main elements in the debate over whether schools are better or worse than they used to be has been the decline in the scores of collegebound high school students on the Scholastic Aptitude Test.

title: At Cairo Talk, Arab Tradition and Some Confusion
description: CAIRO, Oct. 26As the President of Lebanon, Elias Sarkis, arrived at the Cairo airport for the conference of Arab leaders, the commander of the Egyptian honor guard gave the order to shoulder arms instead of the proper command to come to attention.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Bridgeport and Hartford now share the No. 1 spot for population in Connecticut, according to official estimates released by the state's Health Department.

title: Fate Hands a Judge His Landlord's Case
description: A turn of the wheel that assigns judges came up with the name of Chief Judge Jacob Mishler to hear a case in which a tenants association is suing the landlord of Birchwood Towers, a Queens luxury apartment house, to prevent him from raising rents up to 20 percent. The Federal Government, which allowed the landlord to bypass city regulations to gain the rent increase, also was named a defendant.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Furs That Are BigNot Just in Price
description: The timing was perfect. Just as the weather got good and nippy this week, Bonwit Teller invited 200 of its customers to view a lavish fur collection from Grosvenor, a Canadian house based in Montreal.

title: FREE PRESS AN ISSUE AT UNESCO MEETING
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Oct. 27The most contentious issue looming for the UNESCO conference that began here yesterday centers largely on political perceptions of what constitutes a free press.

title: FORD SEEKING TO CUT LINKS TO WATERGATE
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Oct. 27President Ford, who described himself here today as a longdistance runner, has begun trying to sprint vigorously away from the lingering specter of Richard M. Nixon and the Watergate scandals.

title: Treasury to Raise $2 Billion as it Refunds $4 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27In a financing that appeared to be aimed more at banks than at individual investors, the Treasury announced today that it would raise about $2 billion of new cash as it refunds $4 billion of notes scheduled to mature on Nov. 16.

title: Dr. William Sparks, 72, CoInventor Of Butyl Rubber, is Dead in Florida
description: Dr. William J. Sparks coinventor of synthetic butyl rubber and one of the world's most distinguished chemists, died last Saturday after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived in Coral Gables, Fla.

title: U.S. Spending in 9 Months of 1976 $11.4 Billion Less Than Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The Government spent $7.6 billion less in the JulySeptember quarter than it expected to as recently as July, and for the first nine months of the year spent $11.4 billion less than it estimated in January, according to official figures released today.

title: Geneticists Spur Chemical Action In Living Cells
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Two scientific teams reported today experiments in which they each switched on a chemical process in living cells by giving the cells an artificial genetic message prepared in the laboratory.

title: CARTER PLEDGES AID AL GARMENT CENTER
description: Speaking to probably the largest crowd of his long campaign for the Presidency, Ian exuberant Jimmy Carter told a garment center rally yesterday that New York is a city with a great life and great future and pledged that I'm going to do everything I can for you when I'm I elected.

title: Giants Plays To. Be Called On Sidelines
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Oct. 27Craig Morton, who was happy to finally get my own team when he came to the Giants two years ago, lost his team to the sidelines today.

title: Ailing NamathUnlikely To Play Against Bills
description: In a move that perhaps meant nothing more serious than a BandAid covering a scrape, the Jets signed a journeyman quarterback yesterday because of the likelihood that Joe Namath would be unable to play on Sunday.

title: Juan Carlos, Visiting Paris, Pushes Effort by Spain to Refurbish Image
description: MADRID, Oct. 27The threeday state visit that King Juan Carlos is paying to France beginning today marks another advance in Spain's effort to regain international respectability in the wake of the death of Generalissimo Francisco Franco 11 months ago.

title: Nassau BOCES Teachers Back
description: HICKSVILLE, Oct. 27 (AP)Teachers at 17 special Nassau County schools returned to work after a tentative contract agreement was reached early today between the Central Council of Teachers and the Nassau County Board of Cooperative Educational Services (BOCES). The proposed settlement is subject to ratification by the teachers and the board.

title: NEW GALLUP POLL FINDS RISE IN VOTER INTEREST
description: The Gallup Poll announced yesterday that earlier estimates of a record low turnout for the Presidential election may have to be revised because a new survey showed that voter interest has increased sharply in the final stages of the 1976 campaign.

title: No Spanish Air Force Officers Suspended in Lockheed Scandal
description: MADRID, Oct. 27 (Reuters)The Spanish Government has suspended an air force general and colonel from active Service in connection with alleged bribery of Spanish officials by the Lockheed AirCraft Corporation.

title: Treasury Issue Dwarfs 1776 Bonds
description: The Treasury's $6 billion offering announced yesterday afternoon was a quantum jump from the first bond sale by the United States of America, a financing that was begun by the Continental Congress 200 years ago in October 1776.

title: Death Penalty: A Dying Law
description: Eddie Lee Mays was put to death by electrocution in the New York State prison at Ossining on the night of Aug. 15, 1963. Convicted of killing a woman patron of a Bronx bar that he had held up, he was the 614th person to die in the Sing Sing chair since 1891. By 1963, electrocutions were News fairly rare in New York Analysis State, but Mr. Mays's death went largely unnoticed. Since then, the state's electric chair has been moved to the Greenhaven Correctional Facility, and it has been idle.

title: A PROPOSAL BY FORD ON NUCLEAR CURBS IS EXPECTED TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27President Ford is expected to announce tomorrow a comprehensive United States plan to combat the spread of nuclear weapons. The plan appears to contemplate a multimillion dollar Government program to test the commercial use of plutonium, the raw material of nuclear weapons.

title: Arizona Polls Show a Democrat Leading Steiger in Senate Race
description: PHOENIX, Oct. 27Representative Sam Steiger is the best standup comedian in the business, but we don't need a comedian in the United States Senate, Dennis DeConcini, a Democrat, said recently.

title: Soybean Futures Prices Rise in Heavy Trading Volume
description: In trading marked by wide price swings and heavy volume, soybeans yesterday gained 220 cents a bushel, the November contract ending at $6.73.

title: BOND PRICES CLIMB; U.S. SETS FINANCING
description: Bond dealers and investors, awaiting word most of yesterday on the Treasury Department's financing plans, bid up prices in the corporate and Government sectors yesterday and then marked them up a bit more in the late afternoon after the Treasury announced plans to raise $2 billion in Credit new cash next week as it Markets refunds $4 billion in notes in a threepart financing. The $2 billion scheduled to be raised was viewed by some Government market specialists as being at the low end of most estimates made before the Treasury's official announcement. Prior to the announcement, prices of outstanding Government intermediate coupons had registered gains of  to  a point in mostly quiet, professional trading.

title: MILDRED M. MANHEIMER
description: Mildred Morrison Manheimer, a retired high school teacher, died yesterday at New York Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived at 240 Central Park South.

title: Legion Says Kissinger Pledged Priority on Missing in Action
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has pledged that the United States will ask Hanoi to give an accounting of Americans missing in action before it discusses diplomatic recognition of Vietnam, the American Legion said today.

title: Maj. Gen. Jack W. Heard, 89, Dies; Was a Pioneer in Military Aviation
description: Maj. Gen. Jack Whitehead Heard, retired, who was commander of the Fifth Armored Division at the outbreak of World War II, a longtime cavalry officer and a selftaught military pilot, died Monday at Brooke Army Medical Center in San Antonio. He was 89 years old.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Wednesday.

title: Judicial Choices: Manhattan and the Bronx
description: In New York's five boroughs, no fewer than 77 candidates are running for 34 places on the bench. Two new Surrogates, 9 Supreme Court judgeships and 23 Civil Court judgeships are on the ballot.

title: A PROPOSAL BY FORD ON NUCLEAR CURBS IS EXPECTED TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27President Ford is expected to announce tomorrow a comprehensive United States plan to combat the spread of nuclear weapons. The plan appears to contemplate a multimillion dollar Government program to test the commercial use of plutonium, the raw material of nuclear weapons.

title: Hazel M. Kory Dies in Vermont; Specialist in Home Economics
description: Hazel M. kory, former head of Brooklyn College's department of home economics. and consumer studies, died Tuesday at her summer home in Salisbury, Vt. She was 67 and lived at 1153 East. 26th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Aqueduct Racing

title: In 23d District, Candidates Are Cast From Same Mold
description: The Democrat went to St. Paul's and Yale. The Republican is Deerfield and Harvard.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: Proceeds of Port Authority Sale Of Bonds to Aid Trade Center
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said that th eproceeds from a $50 million consolidated bond sale would be used to finance completion of the World Trade Center. Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the authority, said the issue was awarded to a syndicate managed by Bache Halsey Stuart, with Drexel Burnham and Company, Reynolds Securities and Paine, Webber, Jackson and Curtis as comanagers.

title: BUCKLEY IS ASSAILED ON AID TO EDUCATION
description: Daniel P. Moyruham charged yesterday that Senator James L. Buckley had tried, through votes against Federal aidtoeducation programs, to see to it that New York State's schools and colleges obtained even less Federal support than they now receive.

title: 154 IN CONGRESS CONDEMN JAILINGS IN SOUTH KOREA
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27A letter of protest from 154 Senators and Representatives, addressed to President Park Chung Hee of South Korea and expressing profound distress over his arbitrary action in jailing political critics, was made public today.

title: American String Quartet Sets Series at Mannes
description: The American String Quartet, which is in its second year in residence at the Mannes College of Music, will present four concerts at the college at 157 East 74th Street. They will be given on Tuesday nights, Nov. 23, Jan. 18, March 29 and May 17.

title: GIFTS IN CONGRESS RACES LISTED BY COMMON CAUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Special interest groups contributed nearly $5 million to Senate and House candidates in Sepitember. A study by Common Cause, the public affairs lobbying group, of reports filed with the Federal Election Commission showed that labor unions gave $1.7 million in the month, business and corporate committees $1.5 million and medical and health groups $870,000.

title: Warning on Marketing
description: As the first speaker in the fall Key Issues Lecture Series at New York University's College of Business and Public Administration, Philip Kotler, professor of marketing at Northwestern University, warned cases of overmarketing excesses are beginning to show.

title: Times to Test Magazine
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday that its magazine group was planning market tests later this year of a new magazine called Us to be published every other week, A limited investment of $300,000 has been appropriated to determine its feasibility, the company said.

title: Strike Forces Closed in 2 Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)The head of the Department of Justice's criminal division announced today that he is closing organized crime strike forces in St. Louis and New Orleans because of their reduced work loads.

title: Suit Over Pothole Pays $408,000
description: A 29yearold Brooklyn woman has been awarded $408,000 for injuries she suffered when she fell, in a pothole in 1969. A lawyer for the woman, Judy Lynn Stern, she had falen in the hole in front of a building then under construction and as a result had had her right knee joint fused, leaving her with a prematurely stiff leg. The defendants in the suit were the Lefrak Real Estate Company, which owned the building involved; the City of New York; Con Edison, and several construction companies.

title: Bufalino, Chieftain In Mafia, Arrested In an Extortion Plot
description: Russell A. Bufalino, the reputed Mafia chief of northeastern Pennsylvania, was arrested yesterday in an alleged extortion scheme to use physical violence and threats to collect a $25,000 debt.

title: PETER V, RITNER, 49, DEAD AFTER PLUNGE
description: Peter V. Ritner, a writer and former editor widely respected for his intellectual gifts, died yesterday in a plunge from a window of his eighthfloor apartment at 340 Riverside Drive. He was 49 years old. The police said that his death was an apparent suicide and that he had previously attempted to take his life.

title: Carolyn Leigh's Lyrics of Life Capture Beat of the Ballroom
description: The Ballroom, a cheerful restaurantcabaret in SoHo, is putting Broadway's composers and lyricists in the spotlight as performers of their own material in common with earlier composerlyricist series at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., the shows are entertaining for the audience and challenging for the sometimes stagestruck writers. One sure result is that they will have greater sympathy for their professional interpreters.

title: RUNNING IS DEBATED AS BENEFIT TO HEART
description: The nature of the benefits that can accrue from a regular program of jogging, running six miles or more or running the marathon distance of 26 miles, 385 yards was debated at a scientific conference here yesterday in the wake of New York City's first marathon race last Sunday.

title: On the 7th Day, the EnvoyWrites
description: The diplomat is a writer the writer is a diplomat.

title: Sextuplets Born in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Oct. 27 (UPI)An Iranian mother has given birth to the first sextuplets reported in the country, but only four of them were strong enough to survive, officials at Mesagehieh Hospital here said today. The officials said the babies had been born two and a half months prematurely. The survivors, girls, were said to be responding in incubators.

title: Duke Aide in New Post
description: DURHAM, N.C., Oct. 27 (AP) Tom Butters resigned today as associate athletic director to become assistant to Duke's chancellor, A. Kenneth Pye.

title: Chinese Chief Accuses Chiang Ching
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 27Hua Kuofeng, the new leader of China, reportedly told a critical meeting of the Communist Party Politburo earlier this month that Mao Tsetung's widow, Chiang Ching, had tried to increase her power by a series of unauthorized actions, including an extraordinary weeklong interview with an American woman scholar in 1972.

title: Prices Rising 5c on Some Chocolate Bars
description: Less than a decade ago, a candyloving child on a tight allowance could budget a nickel for a daily chocolate bar. But those days have gone as the price of chocolate has steadily risen. Yesterday, the Hershey Foods Corpora. tion and M & M/Mars announced new prices that raise the cost of chocolate bars by 5 cents.

title: Nyquist Seeks to Bar Statewide Management Study of School System
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27The New York State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, has recommended that the Board of Regents reject a request by the State Commerce Commissioner, John S. Dyson, for an independent management study of the state's education system.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: Ferry Captain Held Almost Drunk
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 27 (AP)The captain of a Mississippi River ferry packed with early morning commuters was almost legally drunk when his craft crashed with a tanker, killing an estimated 100 people, the New Orleans coroner said today.

title: Panama Canal Talks Halted by U.S. Court
description: ANCON, Canal Zone, Oct. 27, (AP) Judge Guthrie F. Crowe of the United States District Court issued an order today temporarily restraining the United States Government from further negotiations with Panama for a new Panama Canal treaty.

title: Washington GJ Business: Debate on Deregulation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The political issue of deregulation erupted more than a year ago when President Ford began attacking selected parts of the Government he headed and introduced legislation to reduce Federal economic control over airlines, trucks and railroads.

title: Reagan Bars Aiding Ford in 3 Key States
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California, has refused a request by President Ford's top election strategist to campaign on the President's behalf in three key states in the final days of the Presidential race, Ford aides said today.

title: Tuscaloosa Takes Open Jumper Class
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 27The United States Equestrian Team won its first class in five attempts at the Washington International horse show tonight when Tuscaloosa heat 35 rivals in the Internationalopen jumper class.

title: Hospital Agrees to Pay $990,000 To Compensate for Brain Injury
description: Because a 6yearold boy became deafmute and suffered permanent brain damage while a patient three years ago in Roosevelt Hospital, the hospital has agreed to pay $990,000 in compensation to his parents.

title: Police, Assisted by a Spy, Seize 3 and Foil Kennedy SafeCraching
description: Three men who allegedly hoped to use esoteric electronics to outwit Swiss protective devices in a major burglary attempt at Kennedy International Airport wound up seized themselves early yesterday by a 22member police ambush.

title: Two Sentenced in Smuggling
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 27 (AP)Two suburban Philadelphians, both IrishAmericans, were sentenced to a year in jail today for conspiracy to smuggle weapons into Northern Ireland. Neil Byrne, 42 years old of Cheltenham and Daniel Cahalane, 51, of Newtown Square were convicted last month. Their lawyers said they would appeal the sentences.

title: Interpublic Net Up Sharply
description: The Interpublic Group of Companies yesterday reported net income for the third quarter increased to $1.2 million, or 50 cents a share, from $330,000, or 15 cents a share, in 1975. Net income for the nine months reached $6.2 million, or $2.62 a share, compared with $4.3 million, or $1.90 a share, for the comparable period a year ago.

title: High School Newspapers Trying To Survive in Shortage of Funds
description: Crippled by a shortage of funds for printing costs, many student newspapers the who, what, when, where and how of nearly 91 New York City high schools have had to cease or reduce publication temporarily.

title: Chief Bouza: Police Department's Bronx Maverick
description: Morning in the Bronx. Calm at the eye of a storm.

title: S.E.C. ACCUSES GEICO OF COVERING UP LOSS IN 1975 STATEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that the Government Employees Insurance Company manipulated its financial statements to cover up mounting losses during 1975 and that former chairman Norman Gidden sold 15,045 of his 19,042 shares before the reversal in the company fortunes was made public.

title: Arizona Supreme Court Asked To Intervene in the Bolles Case
description: PHOENIX, Oct. 27 (UPI)The Arizona Supreme Court has been asked to intervene in the prosecution of John Harvey Adamson, accused slayer of Don Boles, an investigative reporter.

title: Ervasti's 76 for 152 Wins Medal in NorthSouth Golf
description: PINEHURST, N.C. Oct. 27 (AP)Ed Ervaysti, tied for third going into today's round, carded his second 76 for a 36hole total of 152 to win the qualifying medal by a stroke in the 25th annual North and South Seniors golf championship. Paul Severin of Richmond, a former allAmerica football player at the University of North Carolina, was second at 153 after closing with a 78.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: CARTER PLEDGES AID AT GARMENT CENTER
description: Speaking to probably the largest crowd of his long campaign for the Presidency, an exuberant Jimmy Carter told a Garment District rally yesterday that New York is a city with a great life and a great future and pledged that I'm going to do everything I can for you when I'm elected.

title: Meadowlands Selected As 1977 Site for Cosmos
description: The New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League will play their home games next season at the new 76,000seat stadium at the Meadowlands in East Rutherford, N. J., a spokesman for the team said yesterday. Official announcement of the agreement with the New Jersey Sports Authority will be made today.

title: NBCTV Appoints Fox
description: Irwin (Sonny) Fox, who was host and associate producer of the Wonderama children's program on WNEWTV from 1959 to 1967, was named vice president of children's programs for NBCTV yesterday. He will report to Aaron Cohen, vice president of programs for the East Coast. Among the other children's series he has been associated with are Lets Take a Trip, On Your Mark and most recently Way Out Games, a Saturday morning program on CBSTV that has completed its videotaping for the season.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CDAY The seasonal appearance of the big, beautiful Hudson River sloop Clearwatpr with a special cargo of pumpkins for sale plus an openair concert of Americana tunes is a local tradition, with Halloween moving in and Thanksgiving on the way.

title: Device for Free Phone Calls Seized
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 27 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation raided two apartments here today, confiscating an electronic gadget that could allow free telephone calls to be made to any part of the world. No arrests were made. Information was to be presented to a Federal grand jury. Agents said that the 41evice was used to make more than 40 gills to Athens, Greece, since September.

title: New Securities Chairman Named
description: David W. Hunter, president and chief executive officer of Parker/Hunter Inc., a securities firm, has been nominated as the new chairman of the Securities In. dustry Association, the trade group representing the nation's leading stock brokerage and investment banking firms. He will succeed I. W. Burnham 2d whose one year term is expiring.

title: Urban League's Contest Matches Two Teams Not Exclusively Black
description: Steve Graeff, the white quarterback at predominantly black Norfolk State College has become such a fixture on the football team that Dick Price, the black head coach, no longer reaches for the snappy oneliner when asked about him. Price very often just throws the questioner a wry clich, such as, Some of my best friends are white or I don't care if a kid is black or white or nurnie so long as he has talent.

title: Edward J. Roth, 54, Dies; Was Active in Broadcasting
description: HINGHAM, Mass., Oct. 27 (AP)Edward J. Roth of Hingham, a cable television consultant who served in administrative positions with NBC, Irish and British radio and television organizations, died yesterday at Massachusetts General Hospital. He was 54 years old.

title: Gambling Foes Say Polls Point to No on Casinos
description: TRENTON, Oct. 27Gamblingcasino opponents said today that their public opinion polls indicated that New Jersey voters next Tuesday would turn down a constitutional amendment to allow the casinos in Atlantic City.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: School District In West Harlem Gets 4 Trustees
description: Chancellor Irving Arker announced yesterday the names of four people he has chosen to act as trustees in the troubled Community School District 5 in West Harlem.

title: News Summary
description: A plan against spreading nuclear weapons is scheduled for announcement today by President Ford. it is based on memorandum warning that the spread of facilities to extract plutonium from used reactor fuel even to responsible nations was undesirable, and its spread to unnamed sensitive countries was intolerable. Jimmy Carter and Democrats in Congress have made a political issue of their call for American action in this field. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Daylight Saving Time Ends at 2 A.M. Sunday
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)The country returns to standard time officially at 2 A.M. Sunday, requiring that clocks be turned back one hour.

title: F.C.C. Backs Bid By Buckley to Gain Free Time on PBS
description: The Federal Communications Commission yesterday upheld the contention of Senator James L. Buckley, ConservativeRepublican of New York, that five public television stations in the state have not provided him with adequate free air time, as he had requested under a provision of the Campaign Communications Reform Act of 1971.

title: Resignation of Dodge City Bishop Is Accepted and Successor Named
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 27 (AP)Pope Paul VI has accepted the resignation of the Most Rev. Marion F. Forst, 66 years old, as Bishop of Dodge City, Kan., the Apostolic Delegate to the United States, Archbishop Jean Jadot, announced today.

title: Congressmen Repay Overcharges
description: WASHINGTON. Oct. 27 (UPI)The Department of Justice revealed today that it had investigated travel reimbursement claims of 10 members of The House of Representatives and said that some of them had made restitutions to the Government where appropriate.

title: Mexico Refloats Peso and it Falls 24.9% More to 26.50 to the Dollar
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 27 Following new speculation against the peso, the Mexican Government today refloated the currency and allowed it to drop by a additional 24.9 percent to a record low of 26.50 pesos to the dollar.

title: Loss of California By Carter is Feared By Top Democrats
description: LOSANGELES, Oct. 27Despite both public and private polls showing a dead heat in the nation's largest state, leading California Democrats have almost unanimously concluded that Jimmy Carter likely to lose here on Tuesday.

title: MINER AND EVANS BOW IN CITY OPERA HELENE
description: There was a new conductor, John Miner, for the New York City Opera's performance of Offenbach's La Belle 116lene at the New York State Theater on Tuesday night. And a tenor, Joseph Evans, was making his company debut as Paris But newcomers were not enough to make this version of the old operetta seem worth sitting through. The humorless, graceless English text and campedup production were too much for all involved.

title: Nkomo: Rhodesian Nationalist With Key Stake in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Oct. 27He sits on a sofa in his hotel suite, gently tapping wooden swagger stick against the palm of his hand, welcoming visitors, laughing, embracing friends.

title: Yonkers Signs Pact For Development Of Getty Sq. Mall
description: YONKER.S, Oct. 27A second stage of recovery for Yonkers the development of the downtown Getty Square area, was initiatcd today when the city signed a oneyear development contract with GinsburgTaubman Associates.

title: ExOfficial of Toyota Distributors Admits Taking $94,400 in Payoffs
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 (UPI)A former top official of Toyota Motor Distributors Inc. admitted aking $94,400 in payoffs from persons seeking Toyota dealerships and failing to report the money on his income tax returns.

title: What's the Difference?
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The cynicism that so often accompanies American elections is worse than usual this year. It won't make any difference who wins I refuse to vote for either of themwe have all heard the talk.

title: Retired Hotel Workers Stage Pension Protest
description: Retired hotel employees held a rally at their union's headquarters on West 44th Street yesterday and then some of the elderly group marched to the offices of the Hotel Association of New York City to protest what they called the failure of the hotels to increase their pensions to $80 a month.

title: Music: Johanessen's Quiet Way
description: In an age of superheated viruosos, the American pianist Grant Johannesen goes his quiet way, specializing in the French literature for the piano, playing this music calmly, elegantly, and with extraordinary finish of style. He also avoids the hackneyed items of the repertory, and his program last night at the Lexington Avenue Y.M.Y.W.H.A. was no exception.

title: How the Business World Views Presidential Race
description: What would a victory for Jimmy Carter mean for business and the economy? And what would a Ford victory mean? Much of the business community has decided that a Republican victory would be good news, a Democratic victory bad newsand is quite possible that the markets immediately after next Tuesday's election will reflect that common appraisal of people with money to invest or stocks to sell.

title: Deaths
description: ANDRONOFFMichael T., on Oct. 26, 1976, beloved husband of Riva. Funeral services Private.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: DOLE DENIES TALKING OF DEMOCRAT WARS
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., Oct. 27]]Senator Robert J. Dole, the Republican VicePresidential candidate, insisted today that he had never referred to the four wars in which the United States has been involved in this century as Democrat wars.

title: Soviet Plans to Cut Economic Lag Behind U.S. by 80
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27The Soviet leadership, buoyed by a bumper grain harvest, today announced production goals for 1977. that it hoped would help significant. ly narrow the Soviet Union's economic gap with the United States by the end of the current decade.

title: Nets Set Back Bullets At Coliseum, 96 to 93
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 27The Nets defeated the Washington Bullets, 9693, in their home National Basketball Association opener tonight at the Nassau Coliseum but few appeared to care. The crowd was announced at 5,832, but one of the ushers said he doubted there were 5,000 persons in the building.

title: NEW YORK SEEKING MEDICAID PATIENTS
description: In a move seeking to add millions to the income realized from Federal and state Medicaid funds, the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation is attempting to fill every empty city hospital bed with Medicaid patients, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: 2 Top Colts in Messenger Draw SecondTier Posts
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Oct. 27Stanley Dancer and Billy Haughton, scheduled to drive the highly regarded Keystone Ore and Windshield Wiper, respectively, in next Saturday's rich and prestigious Messenger Stakes at Roosevelt Raceway, had ample reason to fret today over the luck of the draw. The two outstanding reinsmen learned the 3yearold colts they are scheduled to guide in the mile classicit will be worth $161,210had received secondtier positions at the drawing held at the raceway. Joining them in the rear was Warm Breeze, an outsider, with Dick Farrington in the sulky.

title: Theater: Farce
description: Each time a French farce is put on in English it is necessary and very monotonous to point out how difficult it is to do.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 27, 1976

title: Treatment of Tree Diseases Rises, and So Do Fees
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  Business is branching out all over, Bob Rogers shouted, and he may have winced as he said it, but he was too far up a tree for anyone to tell. Isn't that just an awful nun? he added.

title: Chess:
description: Shortly before defecting from the Soviet Union and asking asylum in the Netherlands, Viktor Korchnoi tied for first place with Anthony Miles of England in the 1.B.M. international tournament in Amsterdam. Both players achieved 95 scores in the 16man roundrobin.

title: Jailings in Hearst Case Upheld
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 27 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit has upheld a contempt of court citation ordering two men to jail for refusing to cooperate with a grand jury in Scranton that is investigating the alleged harboring of Patricia Hearst in northeastern Pennsylvania. The court yesterday upheld the order sending Jay Weiner, 22 years old, of Philadelphia, to jail. The court also upheld an order to jail Phillip Shinnick, 33, of Livingston, N. J.

title: Four Rescued in Gulf of Mexico
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Oct. 27 (AP)Four men who had been adrift in lifeboats or almost two days were picked up about 160 miles west of here today, Coast Guard officials said. The captain and three crew men had been adrift since the Noonie G. ???ank in the Gulf of Mexico Monday.

title: Pound at $1.5720; Resignation Rumor On Healey Denied
description: LONDON, Oct. 27 (AP) The British price, 51.5720, in late traing today as price of $1.5720 in late trading today as the Labor Government came under increased leftwing pressure to scrap its antiinflation policies.

title: Plan to Improve Apartment Plazas In Manhattan Assailed at Hearing
description: A City Planning Commission proposal Intended to improve the quality of plazas alongside Manhattan apartment buildings drew criticism yesterday at a public hearing in City Hall.

title: Bridge:
description: District Three of the American Contract Bridge League, which extends from New Jersey through Westchester County and the Hudson Valley to Albany, had a double distinction in last season's Grand National Team contest, one of the four major events in the national calendar, A New JerseyWestchester sextet brought off a series of remarkable victories, upsetting many favored teams, before succumbing to a foursome of international stars in the final. And the district set a national record by attracting an entry of 428 teams.

title: Blacks Accuse British Chairman
description: GENEVA, Oct. 27Two black Rhodesians said today that the conference was in jeopardy because of Britain's refusal to grant concessions to them.

title: Dance: Symbols
description: Obscurity is not usually Eliot Feld's problem. Even at his most oblique, such as in his haunting commedia delarte piece Theater, he usually makes his points with admirable, if at tunes poetically ambiguous clarity. I cannot feel that way about A Poem Forgotten, a work he first created for his earlier company, the American Ballet Company, in 1970.

title: JOHN MAGOVERN JR., 71; EXINSURANCE EXECUTIVE
description: John J. Magovern Jr., who retired in 1972 after serving 10 years as president of the Mutual Benefit Life Insurance Company in Newark, died Tuesday in Overlook Hospital at Summit, N.J. He was 71 years old.

title: 3 in Chowchilla Case Seek To Move KidnappingTrial; News Coverage is Cited
description: MADERA, Calif., Oct. 27 (UPI)Three young men from the San Francisco area, accused of kidnapping 26 children and their driver from a school bus, fought today to get their trial moved out of the rural county where the children live.

title: Notes on People
description: In Santa Fe, N.M., Maureen Stapleton and Kim Stanley, who first met in New York theater circles in the 1940's, are working together for the first time. Miss Stanley, a native of Ruidoso, N.M., is directing Waiting for Godot at the College of Santa Fe. Miss Stapleton, just arrived as this year's artistinresidence at the college, will play Estragan (Gogo) She is one of four women playing roles, but the other lead, Vladimir will be played by a male student, Bill Jones.

title: Dave Anderson
description: When the Nets inducted Nassau Coliseum into the National Basketball Association last night, the concession stands still sold sketches of Julius Erving for 75 cents, a thoughtless reminder that there was no Doctor in the house. The Doctor was in Houston with the Philadelphia 76ers last night and his departure is still being mourned from Montauk to Manhasset and beyond. The Doctor is guilty of malpractice. He showed that at heart he is a mercenary that more money was more important to him than his role as the Nets symbol. But he is not the only perpetrator. The selling of Dr. for $3 million by Roy L. M. (as in Lunch Money) Boe is the most blatant betrayal of a sports franchise's parishioners since Walter O'Malley absconded with the Dodgers from Brooklyn to Los Angeles two decades ago. Larry O'Brien, the commissioner who put two leagues together, was unable to keep two people together. And the Doctor's agent, Irwin Weiner, showed that at heart he has none. Sports of The Times.

title: Police, Aided by a Spy, Seize 3 And Foil Kennedy SafeCracking
description: Three men who allegedly honed to use esoteric electronics to outwit Swiss protective devices in a major burglary attempt at Kennedy International Airport wound up seized themselves early yesterday by a 22member police ambush.

title: Interests Collide Over Puget Sound Fishing
description: PUGET SOUND, Wash., Oct. 27It was wet and cold Monday night aboard the Keta, a 34foot gillnetter fishing boat, as it arrived in Hood Canal, a natural arm of Puget Sound, after a twohour trip from Seattle, 30 miles southeast.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Moscow, in Broadcast to China, Says Kissinger Sows Discord
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 27 (UPI)The Soviet Union, in a radio broadcast beamed to China, has accused Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger of trying to obstruct normalization of SovietChinese relations.

title: Books of The Times
description: If two such welladvised people as Gerald Ford and Jimmy Carter can't agree on the status of the American economy, where are we to turn for enlightenment? I turned to Leonard Silk's The Economistsprofiles of five leading economists, three of them Nobel laureates, by a member of the editorial board of The New York Times my theory being that I'd understand the economy better if I understood what the experts think (Mr. Silk is the coauthor of another recently published book. Ethics and Profits: The Crisis of Confidence in American Business, which he wrote with David Vogel, an assistant professor of business administration at Berkeley. But that tells another story.)

title: VITAMIN C IS CALLED NO RELIEF FOR COLDS
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Researchers who said two years ago that Vitamin C might relieve the common cold now conclude that the drug does not significantly ease symptoms of the sniffles.

title: Control Board Cancels Meeting Amid Indications Fiscal Monitors Are Dissatisfied
description: The Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday abruptly canceled a meeting scheduled for tomorrow amid indications that the state's fiscal monitors remained dissatisfied with budget  balancing proposals from the Transit Authority and the municipal hospital system.

title: Chief Bouza: Police Department's Bronx Maverick
description: Morning in the Bronx. Calm at the eye of a storm.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Confirms Some Died In Protests Over Sterilization Drive
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 27Prime Minister Indira Gandhi disclosed today that some people had been killed in clashes with the police growing out of India's campainn of mass sterilization.

title: FORD SEEKING TO CUT LINKS TO IA ATERGATE
description: VTLLANOVA, Pa., Oct. 27President Ford, who described himself here today as a longdistance runner, has begun trying to sprint vigorously away from the lingering specter of Richard M. Nixon and the Watergate scandals.

title: DONALD R. FRASER
description: Donald R. Fraser, a travel agent with Thomas Cook Inc., who worked in its offices at 25 Tudor City Place, died Tuesday in his apartment at 315 East 68th Street. He was 75 years old.

title: Roosevelt
description: FIRST$7,500, pace, cond., mile.

title: 20 in Italy Suffer Poison's Effect 3 Months After Explosion at Plant
description: MILAN, Italy, Oct. 27 (Reuters)Hospital authorities have confirmed 20 new cases of the skin disease chloracne among people evacuated from nearby Seveso after an explosion at a chemical plant. there months ago released poison gas into the atmosphere.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Franklin Williams Oct. 14 letter about South Africa needs correction. And as a nonracist who has just returned from three weeks in South Africa (my second visit), I would like to make that correction and present additional pertinent information.

title: ExConvict's Publishing House Breaks Out in Prin
description: A division of a New York publishing house headed by a former inmate of New Jersey penal institutions intoduced its first book at Rahway State Prison yesterday.

title: Port Richmond Facing a Key Test In Quest for P.S.A.L. Playoff Spot
description: A football team is growing in the shadow of the Bayonne Bridge on Staten Island and if the Port Richmond Minstrels grow much more, they might find themsekes champions of the Public Schools Athletic League.

title: East Stroudsburg Wins to Little Avail
description: East Stroudsburg's football team was undefeated, untied and uninvited in 1975 when the squad from Pennsylvania's Pocono Mountains did not get a bid to the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Division II championship playoffs. Lehigh, which had a 92 wonlost record, got this region's spot in the playoffs.

title: Cuevas Stops Tsujimoto, Keeps Welterweight Title
description: KANAZAWA Japan, Oct. 27 (AP) Jose Cuevas, the 18yearold World Boxing Association welterweight champion, knocked down Shoji Tsujimoto three times in the sixth round to score a knockout today. The Mexican's first title defense was close through five rounds, although Tsujimoto was cut over the right eye and bled from the nose.

title: News Summary
description: A plan against spreading nuclear weapons is scheduled for announcement today by President Ford. it is based on a memorandum warning that the spread of facilities to extract plutonium from used reactor fuel even to responsible nations was undesirable, and its spread to unnamed sensitive countries was intolerable, Jimmy Carter and Democrats in Congress have made a political issue of their call for American action in this field. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: CONSUMERS DISPLAY DROP IN CONFIDENCE
description: The Conference Board, a nonprofit economic research organization, reported yesterday that consumer confidence fell sharply in October.

title: Arkansas Weighing the Repeal of RighttoWork Law
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  For the one million registered voters of Arkansas, the most exciting contest on the Nov. 2 ballot is not a race for office but a referendum on a contentious issue of American industrial relationsunion security versus right to work.

title: Big Political Scandal Held PossibleStudy Still in Early Stage
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The sweeping investigation of South Korean political influence here is focusing on the possible involvement of 90 members of Congress and could become a major expose of political corruption, senior Government sources said today.

title: DOW ADVANCES 7.98 AS RALLY CONTIMES
description: Stock prices continued to move ahead briskly yesterday, bringing the total advance to more than 18 points in the Dow Jones industrial average in the last two sessions.

title: Tax Syriana in Lebanon
description: CAIRO, Oct. 27The kings, emirs, presidents, foreign ministers and other officials of the 20 Arab nations and the Palestine Liberation Organization who left Cairo today, after the most ambitious and serious attempt of the Arab world to settle the Lebanese civil war, had achieved some of their goals but left others still far from achieved. The conference, which approved the establishment of a 30,000member Arab peacekeeping force in Lebanon, set the stage for peace in Lebanon and the possible restoration of functioning Lebanese government. it has also done much to restore Arab unity.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT BUFFALO

title: Cards Neils Out for Season
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 27 (AP)Steve Neils, middle linebacker for the St. Louis Cardinals was found today to have a broken ankle and will be out for the season. He was hurt in Monday night's loss to the Washington Redskins. Two other middle linebackers, Greg Hartle and Ray White, were previously lost for the season because of knee injuries.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses iisted in order of post positions

title: GROUP SCORES CHARGES PUT BEFORE VOTE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The National Conservative Political Action Committee said today that charges levelled against it and four other conservative groups before the Federal Election Commission were totally false and politically motivated.

title: Market Place
description: The Bendix Corporation's plan to acquire the ExCellO Corporation, announced after the close of trading on Monday, was received with enthusiasm by ExCellO shareholders on Tuesday.

title: Booth Chain Takes Offer by Newhouse
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 27 (UPI)The board of directors of Booth Newspapers Inc. announced today that it had accepted an offer by S. I. Newhouse to buy a controlling interest in Booth for $47 a share.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: The New York Times/Paul Hosefros Sticker bearing prices, inset, was photographed yesterday at Midtown Chevrolet. it was for a 1977 Caprice. General Motors reported income up for the third quarter more than 60 per cent over the same quarter last year.

title: Consumer Group Asks Aid for Carter Slate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)Organized consumer forces are undertaking a lastminute letterwriting campaign for Jimmy Carter.

title: New York State Announces a Weekly Lottery Game
description: The director of New York State's lottery announced yesterday that a new weekly game would begin next month and would operate for five weeks to dispose of the $1.4 million in prize money that the state had been holding from the old weekly Colossus lottery, which was suspended by Governor Carey last year because of mismanagement.

title: 2 Rare Dutch Glasses Loaned to U.S. Broken
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 27 (AP}Two rare Dutch wineglasses on loan to the United States for a Bicentennial exhibition were shattered beyond repair when an employee accidentally knocked over a shelf, officials said.

title: Last Escaped Lion Is Killed in Georgia
description: RINGGOLD, Ga., Oct. 27 (AP)Authorities killed a lioness today about 150 yards from the cage at the private wildlife refuge where six lions escaped two days ago. All have been killed.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Radio
description: 7:308:55 A.M., WNYCFM Concerto in B flat, Vivaldi; Sonatine, Ravel; Violin Sonata No. 4, Handel; Suite Le Pas dacier, Prokofiev; Passacaglia and Fugue in C minor, Bach; Waltz from the Sleeping Beauty, Tchaikovsky. 9:0610, WQXR: Piano Personalities. Virginia Eskin and Daniel Graham. Ballad, Beach; Piano Sonata No. 3, Szymanowski.

title: The U. N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. on the apartheid policies of South Africa.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT DETROIT

title: Former Carpenter Builds a Vizsla Empire
description: I started as a carpenter, said Max Holland, later became a contractorfollowing in my father's footsteps, for he had been a contractor for 25 years and now I've gone to the dogs. That he has and in a big way. Not only is he active with the Vizsla in all three phases of the sport  showing, obedience and field trialsbut he also has a boarding khnnel at Burnt Hills, N. Y., that handles up to 150 dogs and cats.

title: TV: Fine Drama About Lesbians
description: There probably isn't a group in the nation that, at one time or another, couldn't complain about being portrayed offensively on television, but the award for most battered must belong to lesbians. on Policewoman, they have been seen ripping off and murdering the helpless residents of an oldage home. in Born Innocent, they brutally raped hapless Linda Blair in a shower room. They puff cigars. They snarl. They are outrageously distorted.

title: Low Interest Loans to Provide Rural Electricity Will Be Kept
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (UPI)Acting Agriculture Secretary John A. Knebel said today that the Administration was keeping its policy of low interest rates for rural electrification loans to farm CoOperatives.

title: Aspirant for Abel's Post Names New VicePresidential Hopeful
description: Lloyd McBride, a candidate to succeed I. W. Abel as president of the United Steelworkers of America, announced yesterday that Joseph Odorcich of McKeesport, Pa., was joining his ticket as candidate for vice president for administration.

title: American Motors Says Year's Loss Exceeds Forecasts
description: DETROIT, Oct. 27The chairman of the American Motors Corporation, Roy D. Chapin Jr., said today that the company's loss in its recently completed fiscal year would be substantially larger than the estimates that have appeared in the news media.

title: Mobil and Standard of California Report Gains in 3dQuarter Net
description: The Mobil Corporation and the Standard Oil Company of California announced yesterday increases in thirdquarter earnings of 9.1 percent and 8.2 percent respectively, which is in keeping with the general pattern established by earlier industry reports.

title: Prague Hall is Jammed for Benny Goodman Concert
description: PRAGUE, Oct. 27 (AP)It was almost like old times at the Paramount Theater in New York's Times Square when Benny Goodman showed up for a concert in Lucerna Hall.

title: Tax Matter Plagues Brock In Tennessee Senate Race
description: NASHVILLE, Oct. 27With less than a week left before the election, the close race for the United States Senate in Tennessee has developed into something of a wildswinging freeforall.

title: Third Suspect Held in Death
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 27 (AP)Donald C. Billingslea, a third suspect in the shooting death of Anne Payson Holt, 79 years old, of Falmouth, was arraigned in District Court today on a charge of homicide. Deputy Attorney General Richard S. Cohen said that he was being held without bail at an undisclosed site.

title: McCarthy, Riding in Tourist Class, May Spoil Races of Men Up Front
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27This week, Eugene J. McCarthy has been in Ohio, Minnesota, Wisconsin and Pennsylvania and by week's end will have carried his message to Arizona and California.

title: Airline Cancels More Flights
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 (AP)Continental Airlines, with contract talks deadlocked with its striking pilots, has canceled all flights through midnight Sunday, an airlines spokesman says. No new talks were held between striking pilots and Continental negotiators and none had been scheduled as airline officials announced an end to daytoday flight cancellations.

title: Fire Department Plans Inspection Of Social Clubs in the Night Hours
description: In a reaction to the fire that killed 25 persons and injured 24 others in a Bronx social club early last Sunday morning, a Fire Department official said yesterday that 20 men were being assigned to make nighttime inspections of the city's 1,000 social clubs and other public halls.

title: Loss of California By Carter is Feared By Top Democrats
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27Despite both public and private polls showing a dead heat in the nation's largest state, leading California Democrats have almost unanimously concluded that Jimmy Carter is likely to lose here on Tuesday.

title: YUGOSLAVS IRKED AT ROLE AS DEBATE SUBJECT IN U.S.
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 27 (AP)Government newspapers expressed displeasure today that Yugoslavia had become an issue between President Ford and Jimmy Carter in their campaign debate.

title: Absentee Victims
description: Reports are trickling back from Europe that New York voters overseas are outraged at the possibility of losing their votes because of the late arrival of their absentee ballots. Since they are in no way responsible for the mechanics of the election, their indignation is well founded.

title: Colombian Doctors End Strike
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Oct. 27 (Reuters) More than 4,000 doctors of Colombia's Social Security Services returned to work today. They ended a 5Idayold strike protesting their classification as civil servants, which they said deprived them of the right to strike and other benefits. Under the agreement that ended the strike, the doctors clscsriation will be reviewed in March.

title: Freed Actors Resume Fight On Apartheid
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa, Oct. 27John Kani and Winston Ntshona, the South African actors who won the 1974 Antoinette Perry Award, are back in their ghetto outside this city again after having spent 15 days in solitary confinement for performing in their own country one of the two plays in which they gained the American theater's highest honor.

title: Key Election Issue in Chappaqua Entails Proposal for Apartments
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y., Oct. 27The hottest election issue in this affluent Westchester County community is whether to allow 150 lowrise apartments to be built in the town's business district.

title: Oyster Bay Official Makes Guilty Plea On a Lesser Charge
description: Gerard P. Trotta, former Public Works Commissioner of the town of Oyster Bay, L.I., suddenly interrupted his trial on extortion charges yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn and pleaded guilty to a reduced charge of pressing for contributions to the town's Republican committee.

title: G.&W. Increased Earnings 29.5% To $50 Million for Fiscal Quarter
description: Gulf and Western Industries Inc., the broadly diversified industrial company, reported yesterday a profit increase of 29.5 percent for the fourth fiscal quarter. It also achieved earnings exceeding 5200.2 million on sales of $3 billion for the year ended July 31.

title: Harris Poll Finds Shift to Ford Among CollegeEducated Voters
description: The Harris Survey says a poll of 1,503 collegeeducated voters shows a switch in support from Jimmy Carter to President Ford. The poll, reported this week, indicated that voters with at least some higher education now favored Mr. Ford over his Democratic rival by 51 to 38 percent.

title: Mrs. Dole Says She Will Go Back To Her Job No Matter Who Wins
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Oct. 27 (AP)Elizabeth Dole, wife of the Republican VicePresidential candidate, Robert J. Dole, said yesterday that she would remain a political independent and return to her job on the Federal Trade Commission no matter who wins next week's Presidential election.

title: Rangers Get 41 Shots, but Lose by 43
description: All the electricity went out of the New York Ranger power play last night, and the team that shortcircuited it was the Boston Bruins, who beat New York, 43. The victory was the Bruins seventh in their last eight games and another tribute to their superb goaltending, this time in the person of the lithe Gilles Gilbert.

title: Court of Appeals Rejects McCarthy, Upholds Moynihan
description: ALBANY, Oct. 27In a decision that Democratic leaders say will help Jimmy Carter in the Election Day contest for New York State's 41 electoral votes, the State Court of Appeals today disqualified former United States Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota as an independent Presidential candidate in the state election.

title: Advertising
description: SOUTHHAMPTON, Bermuda, Oct. 27 Good magazines for which there is a real consumer need sometimes fail because their managements are specialists not generalists, a leading magazine executive suggested here today.

title: CHINA SETS NEW DATE FOR 5TH 5YEAR PLAN
description: HONG KONG, Oct. 27The new authorities in China intend to begin the fifth fiveyear plan, which was originally scheduled to start last January, in early 1977, diplomatic sources in Peking report.

title: Syria Said to Have the Capability To Enforce Lebanon Peace Alone
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 27Syria is authoritatively reported to have at least 30,000 soldiers in Lebanon now and is in a position to carry out singlehandedly the decisions made last night by Arab kings and presidents at their conference in Cairo.

title: NEW YORK SEEKING MEDICAID PATIENTS
description: In a move seeking to add millions to the income realized from Federal and state Medicaid funds, the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation is attempting to fill every empty city hospital bed with Medicaid patients, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Jennings, Steele Defeat Bairds in Platform Tennis
description: The topseeded team of Chip and Steve Baird lost yesterday in the quarterfinals of the $20,000 Platform Tennis Classic at Burlington House Plaza. They were defeated by Keith Jennings and Chauncey Steele. 62, 64.

title: Milton Bradley Discloses Illegal Payments to Reserve Freight Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27In what appears to be the first disclosure of its kind, the Milton Bradley Company said its management authorized illegal payments to guarantee availability of freight cars in this country, according to a company report made available today at the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: FEDERAL AGENT RECALLS BRONFMAN CONFESSIONS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 27.A Federal agent testified today at the Bronfman kidnapping trial that Dominic P. Byrne, one of the two defendants, confessed to his involvement in the alleged abduction on the day of his arrest.

title: Gustave L. Levy Has a Stroke; Figure in Wall Street and G.O.P.
description: Gustave L. Levy, senior partner of Goldman, Sachs & Company, on Tuesday suffered what a spokesman for the investment firm described yesterday as a mild stroke. Mr. Levy was admitted to Mount Sinai Hospital, where he remained last nieht.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: About 40 offduty Bergen County sheriff's officers demonstrated outside the county courthouseadministration building complex in Hackensack to press demands for restoration of pay parity with county police. A spokesman for the protesters said they would continue their orderly picketing around the complex until Monday and then file an unfair labor practices suit against the county unless its negotiators fulfill a promise made earlier this year to maintain the tradition of equal pay for both groups. Last week, the county granted the police officers a $2,700 pay raise over two years after the sheriff's officers had accepted a factfinder's recommendation of $1,700.

title: Maguire and Sheehan Trade Charges Of Demagoguery in Campaign Debate
description: The rivals for the Seventh Congressional District seat exchanged charges of demagoguery yesterday during a freewheeling debate that typified their race as the liveliest in the state at a time when polls showed general voter apathy.

title: Teamster Pension Loans Linked To Associates of Crime Figures
description: Despite a new Federal law and Government controls, teamster pension fund money was lent to known associates of organized crime figures as recently as last year to finance business operations that are still funneling millions of dollars into the underworld treasury.

title: Rockefeller Goes Out With a Hurrah for Ford
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., Oct. 27Eighteen years ago, an ebullient 50yearold candidate named Nelson A. Rockefeller began electioneering through New York State on his way to becoming Its Governor.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Article 12  No Title

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation said that together with its 24 lending banks it had made effective a restructuring agreement implementing a previously announced plan to provide a sound base for longterm stability and growth.

title: GURNEY NOT GUILTY IN SHAKEDOWN CASE
description: ORLANDO Fla., Oct. 27 (AP)A Federal jury today found former Senator Edward J. Gurney not guilty of a charge of lying to a 1974 grand jury about massive political shakedown scheme.

title: For Ford, From Texasa U.S. Microcosm
description: DALLASTo determine the relative merits of a particular candidate, it essential to consider the electorate involved. in my own state, Texas, there are geographical and social diversities that reflect, in essence, a microcosm of the United States.

title: Old Building in Hoboken is Given New Life
description: HOBOKEN, Oct. 27Two years ago the massive sixstory Keuffel & Esser factory building at Third and Adams Street was a mass of decaying reinforced concrete.

title: Sealing of Adoption Birth Records Called Unconstitutional, Immoral
description: ??? CITY. Oct 27Frur women who had been adopted as children asked Judge Phil'o A. ??? o of Fuperler Court today to Erst in the country to order a basic ??? in th ??? system of nealinn ??? birth ??? cates at the tine r f adoption.

title: 76 Campaign Awards
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Now that the 1980 campaign has begun, it is time to look back on the campaign of 1976 and to hand out the welldeserved prizes. The envelopes, please:

title: TaxCredit Request By Mobil Disclosed By Senator Bayh
description: WASHINGTON,Oct. 27Senator Birch Bayh made public today a Mobil Oil Corporation letter and memorandum that sought to persuade the Treasury to let oil companies take tax credits for the buyback oil they purchase from foreign governments, such as Iran and Saudi Arabia.

title: Woman Gets Job Back In Physical Bias Case
description: RANDOLPH, N.J., Oct. 27 (AP)A librarian assistant who was discharged on her first day at the County College of Morris because she had failed physical examination has been reinstated.

title: People in Sports
description: Bill Arnsparger is working again. Two days after he was dropped as head coach of the New York Giants, Arnsparger became defense coordinator of the Miami Dolphins, the same position he held for four years before taking over the Giants helm in 1974. He will have the title of assistant head coach.

title: A Guide to Ailing Oaks and Ill Elms
description: While the diagnosis and treatment of tree diseases is a complicated matter best left to trained professionals, there are some basic general warning signs that any concerned homeowner can look for in shade trees.

title: Top Players Signed For W.C.T.'s Tour
description: DALLAS, Oct. 27 (UPI)  World Championship Tennis said today it had signed seven of the world's top 10 players, including Bjorn Borg of Sweden, to play on its $2.5 million tour next year. Jimmy Connors was signed earlier this week. Borg, the defending W.C.T. champion, and Wimbledon winner, joined the list today.

title: U.S. ACTS TO BOLSTER AIR UNITS IN EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Reacting to a buildup in Soviet military airpower, the Defense Department announced today a major increase in United States fighter strength in Western Europe, including the first overseas deployment of the new supersonic F15.

title: Events Today
description: THE LAST OF THE VIVA and A CLEARING IN THE JUNGLE, short films by Brian Moser, at Ins Film Forum.

title: The Big Government Issue
description: President Ford and Governor Carter have both campaigned against big Government, against what they perceive as an overgrown, uncoordinated, unresponsive and sometimes impenetrable Federal bureaucracy.

title: 7 Turks Die in Hamburg Fire
